title: Good transportation option
review: I used the BRS SKYTRAIN especially on beak time to avoid delay  Recommended for three persons and below For the cost it’s good transportation option

title: Link to airports
review: Phraya thai link DMK airport n the end to the other airport The stops provide links to other parts of the city No need taxi Use this line saved you a few hundred bahts From DMK use A2 bus transfer to victory monument bts transfer again to phraya thai cost less than 50bahts Pax

title: Fast, clean and air conditioned!!!
review: We found this service fast clean cheap airconditioned and easy to use Service announcements are in both English and Thai

title: Fast and Cheap
review: I used this public transportation while I was on my business trip to attend workshop and city sight seeingIt is really helpful and fast It is easy to read the map as wellvery recommended if you are on budget travelling And it connect to MRT as well but as i know they only have 2 linea for nowSukmuvit Line and Silom Line

title: not bad
review: it was not bad for once or twice to use skytrain it was cheap but crowded i traveled with skytrain any time of day but i couldnt take any sit so i prefer taxi in bangkok

title: Easy to get around
review: The ticket machines are easy to understand and the trains have electronic displays to help you know where you are Cheap reliable safe and fast

title: ride above the city
review: With just 2 lines that intersect at Siam connectivity could get better if skytrain is extended beyond national stadium Being a touristoriented city the skytrain stations should definitely install elevators or escalators as many tourists struggle with their luggage Crossing the road is possible through skytrain stations with their walkways along and against a track Despite the crowds the Thais seem to be polite and orderly as they board and disembark The oneday pass is a steal at 140 baht per person An integrated transport pass would be ideal for tourists

title: Comfortable transportation to/from international airport
review: This is one of my favorable transportation between airport and downtown The first station in downtown is Phayathai Train will run in about every 15 minutes for the normal train which is quite comfortable as of the other sky train Single way tofrom airport is only 45 B maximum variable per the destination The terminal station is at the basement of airport which has convenient store right at the exit of platform Then the traveller could go to upper level by either escalator or elevator  This transportation is also useful not only tofrom airport but it coudl be used for traportation from one area to other if our destination is just close to the station along its rail For instance the first station is Phayathai and the next is Rajchaprarop Phayathai is in close to Siam Square while Rajchaprarop is in watergate area So take one station could go to either area in 15 minutes without stress on the traffic Also the first station of Phayathai is connected to the BTS sky train as well That is easily access to BTS network to down town

title: Informative and memorable
review: Experience was very wellorganized  Peter was professional and accommodating  We appreciated his personal care of us making sure all of our needs were met and that we were at all times comfortable  Thank you for being a super host and guide for the day  We will always cherish our journey to Kanchanaburi and mourn the loss of life at Hellfire Pass and in the building of the bridge

title: Great day at the float Market!
review: Sara our guide made our day beautiful It was an amazing experience that you live once in a time Don't hesitate to taste the Thai foods I recommend it

title: Great Efficient Way to get into Bangkok
review: Best way to get into town is use the Airport Link located down several escalators to level B (assume Basement)  Cost you a few dollars to get to Phaya Thai (last station) which connects to BTS system to get to places like Nana Station (downtown Sukhumvit)  party central

title: Bangkok traveller
review: BTS is easy to get around in Bangkok For THB 140 you get a day ticket and no queing again (which can be annoying at rush hours)

title: Fast
review: When arrived at Airport just go down then buy a ticket Faster and cheaper than taxi Even If you have a huge luggage

title: Excellent
review: To avoid Bkk trafic and notoriois taxis without meters The best cheap fastest way to travel in Bkk Its easy to use Just go to a BTs station now every Bts has ticket countergo to the counter tell the person your desired station he or she will give tickets and bingo enter the station ask any one which way your train will be going and wait

title: Great transportation
review: Great way to get around quickly  Affordable but a little confusing  People were helpful  A little crowded at peak periods

title: very good
review: great to airport to avoid horrible BKK traffic However if you have luggage and are more than one person Taxi may be better depending on time of day

title: Perfect
review: Perfect to explore Bangkok Good connection to all important places to see Quick way from one side to another

title: Great way to get to or from airport
review: Probably the easiest and cheapest way to get to and from the airport It costs around 40 baht and ends or starts in the airport itself It can be a bit crowded and is a long way into the citycenter so if you can make sure to grab a seat

title: fast
review: If you are near the link by all means take it  If not  a taxi is very affordable  The train station is 2 floors below the check in area and closes around 2300

title: awesome way to travel, fast and easy way to get around
review: we could'nt believe how clean the trains were we had to stand because the train was full but that was because it was sunday and the big market was on

title: travel
review: the best way to get around 1k per hour on a bus or some 30k looking down on the traffic  Shame not enough ticket outlets return tickets or easy card based system other wise would be excellent

title: An experience not to be missed
review: I've done this trip 3 times and will do it again at start of July Its unique but try and get the bottom bunk and not a bed too close to the door The door will drive you mad as people come and go half the night I love getting on board at Haulamphong Station (an interesting place) The first time I travelled I had flown all night arrived in BKK in the morning went right to the station and booked my ticket for the night train and then left my luggage at the luggage minding section (down the far right as you walk in the door) then went and explored BKK for the day Got back to the station paid a few baht for a shower and got on the train Slept all the way to Chiang Mai and arrived fresh You can get dinner and a cold beer on the train Fly if you have the cash but train is much better than the bus which I've also done Second time I did the trip with my 2 sons (13 and 14 at the time) they loved it

title: Getting more crowded as time passes by
review: It is still the best way to get around but has become quite crowded at almost all hours of the day  Specially 9'sh am and 6'ish pm  Reminds me of a Japanese bullet train where you have to shoe horned in  Not the best to ride during raid  Brakes are not very good

title: Train
review: Very useful train with metro connection  and ending my trip  by moto taxi and ferry  That is for me the essence of Bangkok

title: Clean and efficient
review: Great and cheap way to get around Bangkok we’ve used it before when in Bangkok and obviously as long as the stations are near to where your going no problem We were out of town in Lat Krabang and linked into the MRT from the Airport train at Makkasan walking to Phetchaburi station As we were only here for one day before flying home we wanted to see the Royal Palace again so it’s the cheapest and easiest way into the city  Photos are of  Sanam Chai station which is the closest MRT to the Palace

title: Cheap, easy to get around
review: I usted the BTS a lot and its easy and cheap to move around People are friendly in case you need help to use the BTS make sure to have coins or go to the service desk to get change

title: A great way to get around
review: Cheap clean safe and efficient A good way to get around Bangkok without wasting hours stuck in a traffic jam

title: QUICK TRAVEL TO THE CITY
review: Excellent travel connection from the Airport to the city Fast and efficient No hussle bussle with the taximen Easy ticketing and you can plan where to get down for your onward journey Very quick and fast means of travel to reach the city from the airport

title: Confusing at first but a breeze once youve done it!
review: Great system no issues Found it to be clean safe and affordable The counter staff were very helpful to get you to your desired destination

title: So easy to use
review: We have always found the skytrain to be a breeze to use It is very easy to work out how to get around and the trains run on a very regular basis When visiting Bangkok it is definitely worth choosing a hotel near a BTS to make getting around efficient and helps to avoid the traffic I wish the public transport in our home town was half as efficient and cost effective

title: Rode the train
review: Its a great trip they make stops and fried doughnuts on the train its awsome scenery is great its cheap just do it

title: Great experience!
review: A great trip to the railway and floating markets Our guide Sara had a wealth of knowledge which she shared she knew every family’s name and kept the whole group together and organised  We were very well looked after and entertained with her humorous character  Transport was all great too  A thoroughly enjoyable trip Thank you

title: very full and crowded
review: It is best to study the map buy a day pass which goes till 12pmthis allows you as many trips as you wont

title: Good value for money - that's all
review: My journey started OK  Though in the middle of the night I woke up as I couldn't breath I was sweating like hell when I realized there was no electricity in the carriage and no air condition or ventilation All windows were locked I went to the train officer who was sleeping in another carriage on the floor and reported it It was so difficult to communicate with him as he barely spoke any English The staff were trying to fix the problem for nearly 2 hours but failed Then finally they transferred me to another carriage where all was OK  The staff were angry to be woken up and asked to fix the problem   The service on the train was good though food was nice and the beds quite comfortable

title: Practical and simple
review: This is a very inexpensive easy and safe way to get to and from the Bangkok airport It cost us 45 Baht each for a ticket to the end terminal and then 100 Baht from there to our hotel near Kao San road Everything took us about 45 minutes

title: Suitable, but not great
review: While I appreciated that the rail connected the airport to the BTS there was not a lot of information easily accessible to foreigners when making that initial transfer There are tourist information booths though and that served to help overcome any issues

title: Quick way to reach city center
review: I have stopped using taxilittle taxing to change stations from airport link to MRT or BTS with heavy luggage else quickest way

title: Easy Peasy
review: Well signed and easy to access via any route on the BTS skytrain Cheap as it only cost us 57 Baht (less than $2 US) from downtown Bangkok Very reliable leaving about every 57 minutes Fast25 minutes from downtown Bangkok Clean and roomy with lots of luggage space Drops you right at the airport When you change ot the Airport line from any other station you have to purchase a round token that goes in the slot to enter You cannot pay a through ticket to the airport except at the beginning of the airport line Security checks occasionally

title: great way to avoid trafic
review: I wish there were more lines highly efficient transportation Access to stations complicated (but not impossible) with cargo or people with disabilities

title: Best way to get round Bangkok
review: Buy a day ticket for about 150 baht and travel all day on the trains Just note that the underground is not on the same deal you need to buy a round disk for each trip on that but it works well

title: Very overchilled
review: Be careful when you were sweating before  The aircon is unnatural adjusted to 17 degrees You feel cold immediately Wear some caps or and shawls

title: Excellent public transit
review: If you've ever lived in New York you'll find the Skytrain a smooth clean and easytounderstand means of getting around a massive city Especially to and from the airport during trafficprone hours it's worth it

title: Easy, cheap, quick and clean
review: Excellent system very efficient Air conditioned carriages English speaking ticket vendors Only downside is that they are still construction much of the network therefore it's limited as to where you can go

title: Quick, clean and wonderful
review: By far the easiest transport system I've ever had to use The station and trains were so lovely clean and fresh smelling that I was really surprised as I'm from London where our public transport is anything but We waited no more than two minutes either end and it cost 37 baht to get from Huai Khwang to Hua Lamphong Wonderful system

title: By far the best way of travelling in Bangkok
review: Forgot taxis uber and Tuk Tuks this is by far the quickes and cheapest way of getting around Bangkok

title: Touring holiday
review: Excellent cheap way to travel around Bangkok  as the roads can be very busy  and comfortable for travelling quickly too

title: merely a modern public transport which is helpful for the tourists
review: not handicapped friendly I hope there will be lift mainly staircase in most station You need to walk a lot

title: Fast convenient and cheap
review: Very handy for geting into the heart of Bangkok for 4070 Baht  You are above the traffic and hence avoid it  Get off at Makkasan for the MRT metro system or Phaya Thai for the BTS skytrain

title: Transportation
review: Fast and cheap way of transportation to or from the airport or city to the Siam shopping centers Very safe too

title: Well worth a half day
review: Trip was absolutely fantastic and the guide suzy was brilliant They managed the time really well and you never felt rushed while also fitting a lot in

title: Good service, very clean,inexpensive, and safe for all passengers.
review: Bright clean carriages with air conditioning regular service fast and efficient  a great way to discover Bangkok The stations are safe for everyone and are well policed Getting around is easy with a travel card and is inexpensive A great way to see Bangkok

title: Excellent value.
review: Even though the MRT in Bangkok is not a huge system like London and other cities there are some great locations to visit  Cheaper and quicker than any tuk tuk or taxi   I recommend you buy a day 3 day or 5 day passes depending on the length of your stay obviously The reason for this is it will save you queueing for tokens during busy periods

title: Best way to get from the airport
review: I brought way too much stuff to use the Airport Link when I initially arrived in Bangkok and on my return home I took a taxi and ended up caught in traffic and dealing with questionable taxi drivers I took a separate flight out of the country while I was there I got to use the link It was definitely a better experience It was a quicker trip and it was a lot cheaper I'm glad that I got to use it on the shorter flights I transferred after a couple of MRT stops from my hotel and purchased a token to get to the airport It is so easy to pop out of the basement and checkin for a flight I highly recommend the Airport Link

title: Traffic Jam?
review: this is the only way around the big mango stops are convenient it is clean fast quick departures not a long wait If you take the Silom Line you connect to all the shopping Malls and you can walk along the sky walk peak hour is OK as well all very well run

title: Easy to use
review: It only takes just a few minutes to understand how the BTS Skytrain operates I would recommend having coins on hand to purchase your tickets although you can pay with bills Traveling by the Skytrain is fun and an easy way to get from one end of town to the other

title: Very good
review: Easy fast and efficient Reasonably priced and good to understand for a tourist Could connect more of the city but I'm used to London

title: Faster, cheaper and easier than a taxi!
review: If you are thinking of taking the Airport Rail Link I say go for it We took a taxi to Bangkok and were stuck in traffic for what felt like hours We decided to to the Airport Rail Link on our way back and found it to be a much more pleasant experience So easy and if you feel unsure of what to do the people at the information booths are very helpful

title: Goes to the "Out of the Way Places"
review: Great for getting out to the suburbs and into the northern part of the city It's actually quite usefuly for going up to JJ Market

title: Easy to get around
review: Very safe as all stations have a guard and easy to read maps

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Best way to avoid traffic even used to get to the crocodile farm went to the end of the line then caught a taxi

title: Easy
review: Best and most convenient way to visit the markets get to experience the train ride into the station as well and Boom our guide was lovely and funny

title: Traffic free travel
review: best way to move around traffic free easy to access and most of the shopping areas have stations only until 12 midnight

title: fast, efficient
review: Clean fast cheap if you compare with a taxi inevitably stuck in traffic Stops are convenient for example the chatuchak market being litterally in front of the station same for siam paragon etc

title: Gets you everywhere
review: you will be squished and it is more expensive than bus transportation but it's least strugglessome if you're new to the city

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Bangkok like any other metropolitan is full of traffic BTS is fastest and cheapest way to travel in bangkok

title: BTS is indispensable with the MRT to minimise all risks raining or not in Bangkok...very reliable absolutely packed.....
review: except rush hours in the morning this is the best public transport available in Bangkok connecting Airport Express and MRTno hesitations

title: preferable alternative during traffic hours
review: The airport rail link is the best option during Bangkok's peak traffic hours  If you choose to take a taxi or car during traffic hours (500 pm to 700 pm) you can spend up to 2 hours on the freeway to get into town  If you take the Airport Rail link it's get you into town in about 20 minutes with good connections to the Metro

title: Good experience
review: Reasonably priced space for luggage and clean A better option for first timers especially in the city as against the other means of transport which require bargaining for a price

title: A really fun and interesting tour
review: This was a really great tour and what made it fun and interesting was our lovely tour guide Tammy who was brilliant Tammy gave us lots of insights in to Thai life along the tour with some history and she kept us all entertained  we laughed a lot For the tour you initially visit the railway market which was a real highlight After driving for just over an hour on the bus we stopped off at a salt farm and then took a train to the train market which was a 30 minute train journey When you board the train it will come from your left (facing the track) and it’s best to get a seat on the left hand side of the train facing forward   The train then passed through the market and you get to see the market from the inside of the train and how close it is to all the shops and people We then had some free time to look around the market when we got off the train to buy some fruits from the stores  it was amazing how some of the stores had goods on the railway line We then saw a train coming down the track into the market and it was amazing to see all the shop keepers closing up and bringing in their goods When the train left the goods all went back out This was a real highlight and we really enjoyed the experience of seeing and being part of this We just can’t believe how close the stalls were to the train   The second part of the trip was the floating market After lunch (which isn’t included in this half day tour) we got in to a small boat and saw lots of floating marketers selling their products on the canal but this part of the tour was a bit too touristy for us with a few hard and pushy sellers It was however fun and interesting to see   The railway market felt a lot more authentic and local A really great trip and good value for money Would definitely recommend

title: Cool travel
review: Train airconditioned spotlessPrompt and well signed once you learn the maps Cheap

title: Convenient and quick!
review: With this rail link you will save time money and stress  You don't need to go outside and find expensive taxy always they ask much more money You will arrive in the town very quick  Be careful when you get out you are going to crash into a wall made of humidity and super hot

title: Clean but not efficient
review: We must have gotten the BTS at the wrong time year They have been having trouble and it continued whilst we were there This only resulted in small wait times longer than what they had been in years gone by  But the cleanliness of it all makes it worth while As does the air con

title: Cheap and easy
review: Used BTS skytrain as often as possible  Easy to use See info desk for change All ticket machines in Thai and English

title: The ultimate transportation in Bangkok
review: This is really the best way of getting around in Bangkok It's both very efficient and comfortable with the air conditioned wagons The price is also very good both single tickets and dayweek tickets It's quite nice to be in the train and look down at the traffic chaos below and be happy that you aren't sitting in those long queues

title: Quick, Easy, Clean
review: I was amazed at how simple the ticketing system platforms and routes were to work out considering I have no idea on how to speak or read Thai The Skytrain was so cleanmuch nicer than the trains in Australia

title: Fast , clean and rapid
review: Interesting experience from the airport to the city center It was a good tour of Bangkok while mixing with Thai people  Easy fast convenient and cheap

title: Boat and train market
review: Brilliant Sara is fab I went along today and really enjoyed it Had such a good day would really recommend this for everyone

title: Bangkok's MRT is super efficient!
review: We've been to Bangkok four times and always us the MRT It's clean and efficient and other than the everpresent video ads quiet

title: good means of transportation
review: good and cheap means of transportation but ticketing machines must be increased as it was to crowded to have a ticket

title: Best way against slow traffic
review: My favorite BTS sky train is for fastest way to get a location in Bangkok I suggest to catch this train Aircon is very strong inside

title: Very efficient and clean
review: Definitely the best way to travel around Bangkok especially if you are able to travel outside the rush hour times Get a BTS card if you are in Bangkok for a few days and need to travel around a lot It'll save you queuing up to buy a ticket each trip

title: Best way to get into Bangkok but directions and ticketing need improvement
review: While the Airport Link is certainly the most desirable way to get into Bangkok it was very hard to figure out what trains were running and when and purchasing ticketstokens was very confusing at the airport More information should be provided for passengers to decide what train to take and how to get tickets It also seems like ticket vending machines would work better than trying to communicate with people whose native language is different Arriving at Makkasan station was also very confusing The signs were really not very clear for tourists I would have expected to see signs guiding us to where we could get a taxi but no such luck We went out one exit and were not able to hail a cab so we ended up walking over to the MRT station which turned out to be easiest way to get to our hotel using the subway However the whole experience was rather difficult and tiring for a couple in their 70’s dragging luggage around

title: Modern Convenience in Bangkok
review: We took the Skytrain to the mall for some shopping  It was easy to navigate and took us there with no problem

title: Best way to roam around
review: Its easy and convenient Stations are very neat and clean Frequency of trains is good that one need not wait for long It goes amidst the skyline of Bangkok Totally enjoyed skytrain ride

title: Just Wonderful!
review: An EastWest rail line located above the city that covers a lot of area  One line is an express line to the airport and the other has multiple stops along the way  Not nearly as crowded as the BST and much better way to the airport than taxi

title: Great way to travel
review: A great way to travel around Bangkok Very easy to use and navigate the BTS systems Highly recommended

title: A great way to get around
review: We stumbled upon Bangkok's public transport system when a taxi we got in to told us we would never get where we were going in time due to traffic he suggested we take public transport and that was the best idea ever  The MRT and BTS are quick clean and efficient with the only down side being they are pretty packed but fear not if you cant fit on you only need to wait 5 min for the next one  Trips are cheap and signage is clear  An excellent transport system

title: Very easy to navigate..
review: On arriving in Bangkok airport this train is very easy to navigate the staff were friendly & helpful and the ticket machines are in English It was 45baht to get off at the last stop it takes about 30mins & they run every 15mins its a great cheap way to get into central Bangkok

title: Great alternative to taxi, but be prepared for walking quite a distance
review: This is probably the cheapest option getting from the airport to downtown Bangkok The connection is at the basement level in the airport and takes around 30 minutes to Makkasan where you can catch a connection to the subway MRT station in Petchaburi Obviously you can continue on as well but I was headed for Sukhumvit so this is where I got off  The ride was quite crowded  was lucky getting on in the airport so I could have a seat and be in control of my suitcase And the connection to the MRT in Makkasan is a really long and warm walk Probably not suited for everyone  but it is there and if you know the route it gets the job done

title: The best way to avoid traffic
review: we already try the skytrain in Singapore and KL so it is the best way to get away from the traffic jam I very envy with Bangkok wich to have a Skytrain in Jakarta

title: Great public transit
review: Trains are frequent air conditioned clean fast  They blithely skipover the traffic below at an average price of about 45 cents per ride  You can load up a "rabbitt" card with say 500 baht and ride fordays on end skipping the lines  The day pass really is only valuable if you really think you're going todo a lot of stops  The system is everexpanding  Be warned it is often very crowded

title: great trip fab skytrain
review: fantastic easy mode of transport to use and last train at 12 30 am but taxis are around after that Easy to navigate around and see and very helpful staff

title: Good based on your needs and location
review: Network isn't bad and trains are air conditioned and in good status Problems are mainly having a separate line for sky train and another for metro you need to buy separate tickets and so if u need to change u pay twice for some destinations Also stations do not reach many important touristic la snarks such as the grand palace and temple of the dawn So a day pass not always very useful ended up cheaper for me to buy individual tickets They also meanly place exchange offices inside the metro so they'd force you to pay 15Baht just to go in and exchange money even if you don't need to use the metro No weekly passes available which is another inconvenience In brief if you are staying near a station and your visit sites are accessed by BTS go for it otherwise Uae tukRula and save yourself the headache

title: clean and easy to use!
review: We used this one two occasions to get around the city  very clean and easy to use Excellent and easy to understand maps displayed everywhere and easy to buy tickets Quick convenient travel

title: A good choice of transportation
review: Depending on where you need to go in the city the BTS is a clean easytonavigate skytrain system that is not very expensive The further you go the more you pay We paid about 30 baht for a distance of 3 stops and about 50 baht for 56 stops

title: All too easy.
review: This is just such a wonderful cheap way of getting to the city and all that is Bangkok all you need to do is ask in English at the terminal

title: Great experience, great English speaking tour guide!
review: Sara (our tour guide) is awesome She was very thorough in her explanation and made sure we were well taken care of throughout the tour The whole experience was made pleasant because of her Thank you so much

title: Sky train
review: I love the sky train it's easy clean & easy to use unlike Londons underground tubes that are very confusing This is one straight line with ac

title: Great way to get around.
review: There are maps inside the stations If you know where (say stop 4) your next stop is 8 get to the booth and some coins and select your destination It will tell you how much Don't try to drive there Tuk Tuks are ok but subject to the same traffic issue and they're noisy Metered cabs are ok but still have the traffic issues Make sure they but the meter up or get out

title: Excellent transportation system
review: Clean efficient and very cool airconditioned carriages  A lot of the entrances to the stations appeared to be steps only but maybe we did not explore enough to see if there was alternative lift or escalator access for the disabled  Ticketing is straightforward select your destination on the map on the ticket machine and pay the appropriate fare Appeared to be two types of ticket machine More commonly coins only with some stations have a solitary machine which accepts notes up to 100 baht Both types of machine give change If you need extra coins for the coin only machine pass a note to the manned ticket booth and they will exchange for cash The manned ticket booths appeared a bit hit and miss as to whether they actually sold you a ticket or just provided change  Queuing system for trains on the platform is very civilised and orderly The trains can be very busy at peak times and maybe necessary to wait for the next train but as you have moved to the front of the queue you'll be guaranteed a space on the next train Announcements on the trains are clear and audible firstly in Thai then English Some of the pronunciations are quite cute Nana is Nanaaaaaah  We only brought single tickets which never cost more than 30 odd baht  person for the distances we travelled as tourists Very cheap when compared to London Underground Only downside that if your route also involved the Metro through ticketing is not available You need to buy separate tickets

title: Great way to beat the BKK traffic
review: I use the BTS always when inBKK   It is quicker during the many periods of high traffic and it's not expensive     It also allows you to avoid the risk of being ripped off by a cab driver   This keeps getting worse

title: Cheap and efficient
review: The train from Bangkok international airport to the city is just perfect Really cheap 35bath (just little more then 1au$)  Use it don't take the cab they are expensive

title: Not timely, did not take responsibility for 2-3 hours delays
review: We bought via 12GO service tickets for 1st class night train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and from Chiang Mai to Bangkok Route to Chiang Mai was on time with relatively new train however full of extra expenses like cold mango juice on welcome water drinks left to your seats as well as dinnerbreakfast Route from Chiang Mai back to Bangkok at 1st class and same price was serviced by train produced in 1996 year by Hyundai Korea in dirty conditions started with 30 delay due to technical problems and rwachex Bangkok with 25hour delay Due to this delay we missed prepaid bys from Bangkok to Koh Chang and neither SRT or 12Go felt guilty and offered us any cost refund To sum up if everything goes OK everyone offer you services with high proces but once you pay and face some difficulties you are left without any support from paid service providers and you have to pay next enourmous amounts to solve to issue youself

title: Seriously the best way to get downtown if not in a group or lugging big bags
review: Seriously the best way to get downtown if not in a group or lugging big bags Fast no jams to contend with and 2 options  really fast express or slower (but still faster than car) commuter (also much cheaper) Once you get off at town stations  buy a BTS or MRT ticket to final destination Easy and Fun

title: Very quick and you don't have to wait long for a train. Nice and cold on the train!
review: The BTS consists of two lines Silon Line and Sukhumvit Line and they connect at Siam (CEN) Very quick way to get around Bangkok but be aware they don't serve all of Bangkok They also connect with the MRT (Metro) and BRT (Buses) Be aware that taxis are cheap in Bangkok although the BTS is the best way to get into the city during busy periods when the streets are grid locked There is a special train from Prayha Thai which goes to the airport although a Taxi from the centre is only 4500 Baht usually

title: Love it
review: Always take the BTS to avoid jams and get to destination on time it is clean and efficient And go to most places too Keep enough coins or buy the package to avoid lining up at the counter unless you need to ask for directions

title: Clean Reliable Transport
review: Regularly travel to Bangkok for business and leisure and when I do I frequently use the Skytrain to get around  I find it a cheap reliable and clean service which is easy to navigate in terms of stations to locations  To be honest a hand full of trips and you have it sorted in terms of understanding the ticketing and network  The ticketing is either machine or service counters where the service staff are very helpful when you're not a local  It does involve steps so be prepared to climb up a couple of flights to reach the train system  not good for handicapped access  Other than that its an excellent clean airconditioned way to get around the city

title: The Skytrain in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain (BTS) makes getting around Bangkok extremely easy The maps at every station are easy to understand and make clear the rates you have to pay depending on where you are going A child could understand how to use it (as long as it can read) The cars are very well air conditioned and comfortable (when they are not full during rush hours) You almost never have to wait for a train more than a few minutes if you just miss one and between the Skytrain and underground you can get all over Bangkok pretty easily I highly recommend using it because the streets are almost always full of traffic and the Skytrain is a faster way to get around

title: Limited destinations and quirky way of buying tickets - but works well
review: I think my title says it all It is efficient if crowded Remember to have coins to buy your ticket or stand in line to get your change Limited destinations but some of the most popular for tourists

title: Enjoy the ride, but do your homework first.
review: I first learned about the bridge when I saw the movie "Bridge on The River Kwai" with my Grandmother as a young girl  I never forgot it  Our GAdventures tour first stopped at the cemetery and museum which was very emotional We took the train to the Kwai Bridge had lunch overlooking the river and had some free time before taking the train across the bridge and on to a pleasant stay at the Kanchanaburi Resort & Spa  If you don't know anything about the prisoners of war who built the railway the brutality they suffered and how many died as a result you must do some research  I also recommend the movie "Railway Man"

title: Sleep while you travel
review: We have used overnight sleeper trains now to multi destinations over a number of years and have found them an excellent way to get from a to b All the destinations I have been on use the best trains which have always been very clean with each bunk having a PowerPoint to charge you phone or other device ( Note we have always traveled 2nd class aircon)

title: 1/2 the time and 1/6th the price of a taxi
review: Faster (max 40min vs around 50 to 100min by taxi) ) & cheaper (max (40THB vs 230 to 350THB by Taxitoll) to get from the airport to the city  the two last stations connect fairly easily to MRT & BTS (but they are not as accessible if you have more than 2 bags)  Always got a seat  Lots of room for luggage  You need to be able to carryroll all luggage yourself

title: Great
review: Easy to use Takes off every 15 minutes Cheap Great way to get to the airport and back Better then the taxi no traffic jams

title: good way to move around in bangkok
review: frequent trips and it covers a wide areas in bangkok a very reliable mode of transportation in bangkok ** but most of the station dont have escalator so if you want to move around with your big luggage probably it is not a good choice for you

title: The Best Way to Get Around Bangkok
review: Clean safe and well air conditioned and very cheap the Skytrain is the number one way to travel in Bangkok Easy to navigate with the only draw back being quite a lot of stairs and walking at some stations Make it your first choice travel option

title: Easy Public Transportation
review: I actually prefer the MRT to the BTS even though it is older A lot of times the MRT is less crowded Waiting on tokens can be the only downside so have correct change ready

title: Ease of Use
review: From the airport with your "lightweight" luggages you can easily avail yourselves of this mode of transport (even if there are a few of you that you would expect a cab to be convenient)  This method of transport is much faster and avoids traffic jams when you arrive in the earlier part of the morning  Look into choosing accommodation near the BTS

title: Expensive crowded better take taxi.
review: So expensive and crowded Take taxi cheaper more comfortable and more convenient Take the bts only when you want to travel far Take taxi if its close

title: Clean and swift
review: Travelled a couple of times during my stay in the city Clean timely with good displays At some places I felt some more display of direction could help I had to ask a few times about the changeovers and nearby places

title: nice and clean
review: does get bissy but cheap get change as you sometimes have to us the auto machines and not the kiosks  have fun and explore

title: Great system
review: Great to use to and from the airport also around the city It's fast and very cheap If you can use it to get to your destination I would in most cases it would be much faster It's clean

title: perfect
review: perfect for getting around very clean  air conditioned cheap ideal for shopping trips to all the big stores walk off walk in and of course quick

title: Easy transportation
review: You can get to many places via BTS Most popular will be the National Stadium Station and Siam Station  MBK SIAM CENTER SIAM PARAGON TERMINAL 21etc A shopping mall on almost every station   All the station requires climbing staircase but most of the stations comes with lift landing and escalator(upward) so Its pretty handicap friendly  Get a Rabbit Card for easy access 100 baht for the card and at least 100 baht of top up value I will recommend 200 top up value for five days trip Card is valid for 5 years

title: A Whole Lot Better Than Walking
review: This puts London to shame clean cool and easy to use  Cheap fares even make your pocket happier Takes you to most places that you’d want to go to

title: Easy way to get into town!
review: Nice way to get into town  I've taken a taxi from the airport a few times and this is faster   I've been taken for a runaround by a few cabs as well  This way you know where you're going and if you have to you can still take a taxi from the closest station

title: Quick, Cheap, Sometimes Crowded
review: The BTS system in Bangkok is an excellent and cheap form of transport that can connect you from northern eastern and southern districts of bangkok to the downtown area  It travels to popular areas for shopping such as MBK Siam Paragon Central World and many others  The cost to ride can run from 25 baht all the way up to 4565 baht going from the furthest south to the furthest northern route  The BTS lines also intersect with many of the MRT (Bangkok's subway system) and even the SRT(airport rail link to suvarnabhumi international airport)  line too  It easy to move closer to most of the locations in bangkok and save on taxituktuk fare or at least cut it by half using the system  Its got AC and is clean  There are helpful station workers who can help you though the signage can be a bit confusing sometimes so their help is sometimes needed They do speak English and a few other languages too  Over all I say the BTS is great and they are continuing to extend the lines and make new connections too

title: Fast and save
review: This is very convenience and cheapest way to get to downtown especially in the rush hour you will not miss your flight

title: Convenient
review: The skytrain was very convenient to use clean and safe  It made getting around the city very easy and fast  It wasn't too crowded either which was nice  Had absolutely no issues here

title: Easy swift transport
review: The sky train may be daunting at first but it's actually really easy to use The thing I loved was that local people queue up to get on the train meaning no pushing or shuving   A great way to get around

title: Fast, busy , reasonably prices and best thing , avoids Bangkok traffic
review: Third time in Bangkok now had never used the sky train Tried it out in July 2018 for the first timevery good avoids the huge amount of traffic and fairly pricedso all round very good experience

title: VERY EASY TO USE
review: This train is super easy to use  super cheap and air conditioned we used this several times on our trip and loved it as we always reached our destination before time and didint have to bother waiting in bangkoks famous traffic    We would  recommend any one in bangkok to use this mode of transport   it reallly could not be more simple to use

title: A great day out at the markets
review: A very enjoyable day out Tour guide was friendly Bit rushed through the train market but relaxing time in the boat market Boat markets are 2 hours from Bangkok

title: Works great to travel around BBK
review: The service can be a little slow between  trains but the AC is a welcome relief and it's very easy to use

title: Get a Day Pass
review: This very popular means of transport in Bangkok is always overcrowded  But looking at the road traffic conditions in this city skytrain is your only choice  Don't hesitate to get a Day Pass for unlimited rides (USD4) to save you time to line up from single tickets We also use it as "access pass" to walk through  stations from one end to another as short cuts

title: Handy, fast, but only if you travel alone and only to some city areas
review: There are 2 kind of trains the red and fast ones stop only at a couple of stations the blues trains are cheaper and stop at every station  To me the blue trains are already fast enough When you have a lot of luggage or if you do not travel alone then a taxi is a better option however a bit slower  If your destination or your point of departure to the airport is near to an Airport Rail Link station these trains can be fast and convenient  However if it is rather far from a station then you need another kind of transport to get there so a taxi from or to the airport will surely be more comfortable equal or so in price and probably if you count it all also faster

title: Don
review: What a fantastic day   We opted for the hotel pickup   We met the tour guide Kiwi who was absolutely outstanding during the whole tour Right on time   She made rhe whole tour fun fun and more fun  Its the best way to do this tour  You get a nice ride thru Bangkok and outside Bangkok to the train and the floating market riding the train  is incredible Watch it youtube before you go  Floating market is fun  All the vendors are nice and not pushy The ride back qas thru coconut farms  Really interesting to see  Driver was awesome Highly recommend this tour  If you are lucky to get Kiwi as a tour guide you'll have an exceptional experience

title: Excellent
review: Very easy and cost effective way to get around the city It is tourist friendly and highlights the stops for attractions throughout the city Fully air conditioned so you aren't left with the same feeling you get on The Tube in London

title: Great expirience with Sara
review: Sara shared with us all the important sites we passed by She also answered all our questions Very good english For people thst travel for the first time in Thailand if you choose this trip make a list of what you would like to buy and ask your tour guide for a resonable price to pay There are no prices exposed and you have to negociate for everything I wanted to buy 10 magnets (fridge magnets) and sellers first price was 4000 bth I negociated to 1000 bth 30 Euro (I still wander if I made the best decision buying from the floating maket) Ovrerall was a great experience

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: If you are going to Bangkok for tourist attractions this is the best way to get around  You need to get a hotel that is close to either the BTS (Sukhumvit or Silom line) MTS or River boat station and you will have never have to deal with traffic  Traffic is bad basically 24 hours a day in the city and its so big you need to find whats best for you  Its easy to figure out and the people at all the different types of transport are very helpful  Buy the all the passes which are about $4 usd instead of buying it per ride to save money  You can get to everything a first time visitor wants to see by using the BTS and maybe a 1015 minutes walk from the stop  It may take a little longer to get to the Wat Pho area but I thought it was better not having to deal with a taxi (which can be known to screw tourists)  Fixed price fixed time no hassle for my visit  Shuts down at midnight though so plan to use über after that

title: A practical mode of travel within Bangkok
review: As in most cities it's just faster to get from point A to point B especially in the rush hours I find the key to making it painless is to study the map for 5 or 10 minutes first to familiarize yourself with the whole system then also see how the machines work as well  If you'll be in Bangkok for a week or more it probably pays to buy the unlimited pass If paying as you go it's wise to get lots of change in the change booth to have so you wont have to wait on the long lines each time  you can go directly to the ticket machines You check the destination and it says how much the fare is then you start by pressing the button corresponding to that amount and put the coins in Not difficult Howard S

title: The ONLY way to get downtown!
review: 45 baht and 30 minutes later you're on Sukhumvit and in the center of all the action Zero hassle full comfort in aircon and the ride is smooth There's no better way to get downtown than the ARL you'd be a fool not to use it

title: A must-do when in Bangkok!
review: 1010 experience Alex was an amazing host so friendly and fun who made the trip A must do when in Bangkok Great value for money

title: Fast service
review: The MRT is fast frequent and inexpensive It runs mostly underground unlike the BTS and has a limited number of stations However it is useful for places outside the BTS line like Hualanpong for visits to China Town etc

title: Good view of BKK
review: its price is much better than taxi spacially when you want to visit chatuchak market It also gives you the best air view of BKK The guards have to take a look at your bag ( it is common through the Bangkok markets too) but that's a duty they didn't search in your bags And after that they do apologize for checking your bag

title: Great transit from airport to downtown
review: The rail link is fast frequent clean and safe  Great way to relax after arriving at the airport  Easy to get tickets and lots of room for luggage

title: Great if you're not too tired when you get to Bangkok
review: We decided to try the airport link instead of getting a taxi from Suvarnabumi Airport Bangkok and we were pleasantly surprised The airport link runs to Phaya Thai where we changed to the Sukhumvit line There wasn't a problem with any of it and within about 45 minutes we arrived at Nana where we got off to go to the nearby hotel If you haven't got too much baggage and aren't too tired after a long flight I would definitely recommend it as it's very cheap and probably quicker than a taxi But we were shattered had two heavy suitcases which we had to lug up and down stairs and it was boiling hot In those circumstances it might be easier to get a taxi

title: Reliable and convenient
review: The train was super comfortable and reliable You can reach to your destination safe and sound The system was well structure and affordable fare

title: A easy way to travel in bangkok
review: You need to have small coins to use the machine to buy tickets The drive is very cheap Thr frequency of the trains is very good

title: So clean compared to Paris!
review: Quite pricey compared to local taxi process but such an experience Everything in English people wait in line amazing fresh smell of lemongrassperfect to avoid the traffic at rush hours

title: Very cheap and convenient but sometimes long queue waiting.
review: It is the best transportation to downtown and to the airport However in the evening if you are going to the airport you might wait a long time to get in They should add more trains and increase the frequency

title: Clean and efficient
review: Very busy system at times but the station is clean and the service efficient Thhere is not much seating available

title: The easiest way to the city
review: It takes only 25 mins to go to city where it connects with the skytrain Especially useful during traffic hours Trains are every 12 minutes

title: Easy!
review: Honestly very easy to use and so handy  Fast clean and takes you to a load of different prices  It was much easier than I expected

title: VERY CONVENIENT
review: Sky Train gets you quickly to many key destinations in Bangkok (including the International Airport) Cars are clean inside and there is an order boarding trains from a platform (great idea) Escalators ahowever are not always conveniently located and you must be prepared to climb the stairs

title: Quick, economical, with good views.
review: We used the skytrain for getting about so this was a logical connection to that for our exit from the city A bit crowded at first but much better views than our drive into the city

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The station was 500 meters from our hotel and we were able to use it for 90% of our transportation needs from sightseeing temples to shopping at the mall and the night market

title: Best way to and from the airport
review: Cheap fast and comfortable compared to taking taxis in the notorious traffic situation  Easy to take from the airport

title: Board the train at Kanchanaburi central station
review: By chance our taxi driver took us to board the train at Kanchanaburi central station The station is not at all busy perhaps 20 or 30 members of the public and 3 or 4 tourists milling around There is a tourist ticket desk located at the entrance to the station staffed by 3 or 4 uniformed SRT staff one staff member per tourist You'll get led to the carriage and your seat with a personal touch they even adjust your ceiling fan The car will eventually be shunted to join the service coming up from Thonburi and then you are off  first stop is the Bridge on the Kwai station where you'll be joined by large crowds of fellow tourists packing into the previously serene carriage The rest of the trip was lovely with some really fantastic views Our taxi driver met us at the end of the line (Nam Tok (waterfall) Station) to take us back to the hotel  the train ride is a bit bumpy and on a hard seat

title: Good for avoiding traffic
review: Good to avoid traffic in Bangkok during rush hour feast to go transfer from MRT it BTS Nice views along the travels Arrive right away to airport no need to travel more or take canvan to airport Arrival area is near to exchange shop convenience

title: Fast way to zip around the city!
review: And connects to BTS sky train so almost all the places you want to visit are doable with MRT and BTS

title: Easy to Use
review: We used the service to get from the airport to Phaya Thai station where we switched to BTS and it was smooth and easy to negotiatebuy tokens

title: It'll get you where you need to be
review: The MRT (Metro) is very clean and efficient and appropriately chilled (okay you could hang meat in there)  And it extends to many areas you can't reach by BTS    Butyou can't see much from underground and the ticketing system is painful particularly at the interchanges with the BTS  Add to that the BTS and MRT don't play well together so be prepared to have to reticket when you connect and allow yourself a few minutes for this process Similar to some major Japanese cities   There are rumours that the systems will be unified under one transit card some time in the future but not yet

title: Used the sky train to get around Bangkok.
review: It's a great and cheap way to get around Bangkok  Stations are situated at all the popular attractions  Also close to the major hotels  Trains can get crowded at peak times but generally very good and clean transport for getting out and about around Bangkok

title: It gives us that are experiencing life in 50’s
review: Useful tips of local behavioural and cultural activities and the do’s and don’t We have plenty of time to experience the style of wet market at the Railway market

title: How well this BTS has been maintained
review: BTS provides a great service taking the tourist to most places of interest quickly and efficiently  Familiarise yourself with the guide map freely available in any station Learn to operate the ticket vending machines and if you are stuck for change go to the 'change' counter at any station and get loads of change  The frequency of the trains is really regular and each station has clearly signposted 4 exits which will get you easily to your destination just so long as you take the right  correct exit  Truly a great service

title: Sky train
review: Clean fast and very cheap alternative to transport in Bangkok Always on time and very easy to find

title: Fast, clean and cheap from the airport to Bangkok Center
review: Normally when we arrive in Bangkok or we have to go to the airport to return home we take a limousine of the hotel This limo cost a 1000 bath one way  So when we arrived in Bangkok in the beginning of november we ordered a limo to take us from the airport to the hotel But when we left Bangkok a week later we took the Airport Train Link to go to the airport This is a very easy and cheap way to travel to the airport  We'll use this way of transport when we come back to Bangkok

title: Great way to travel around Bangkok
review: With BTS it is much easier to travel around Bangkok So I always book a hotel in Bangkok with an BTS station nearby If you plan to travel a lot during a day then a day pass ( I believe it was 130 THB last time) is a good option

title: Good if you have no baggage
review: It is cheap and fast that is true The point is the time you are going to use it and the principal thing  if you have couple of bags with you or even one In last case I wouldn't recommend it as it is very crowded and it might be really challenging trip

title: Best Way To Get Around
review: The BTS SKYTRAINS   are fast and very clean  can be very busy in peak hour but apart from that its the perfect way to get around Bangkok air conditioned  perfect for those hot days

title: Perfect for a solo traveller
review: Cheap avoid traffic jam suit to a solo or couple travellers Convenient connection with MRT and BTS

title: 1 day tour to Kanchanaburi
review: Got a private van for 7 paxs from thai tourism guide Ms Jeerapa was the person I liaise with She was very prompt & friendly with replies This was thd 2nd time I have used their services The driver was Mr Sek a friendly & informative guy The journey from downtown Bangkok to Kanchanaburi took about 25 hrs We visited the ThaiBurma Death Railway & then took a 15 hrs train (without aircon) & packed with people to Cave Krasae There was a statue of Buddha inside the cave Then Mr Sek brought us to a local restaurant for lunch The last program was the War Cemetery & the Death Railway Museum If you are interested in the history of this place you will like it

title: Quick, cheap, efficient means to get from central Bangkok to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: I found I was at the Victory Monument when I had thought the bus from Hua Hin would drop me at the airport  No worries It was easy to catch the train to the airport Fast and frequent Six stops on the way As I only had a small backpack I walked from the Victory Monument to Phayathai Station but I could have taken the BTS   If you are unfamiliar with Thailand there's more than one person or you have a lot of luggage it's easier and not much more expensive just to take a taxi

title: so easy to reach city center
review: great service and all the stuffs are very kind they help me so many times with my crazy luggage lovely people

title: Travel
review: Sky train is very easy get to a station and buy a Rabbit card you can top it up anytime jest scan it when you get on and off simple

title: the best way of getting around a big city
review: a great way of getting around The skytrain is cheap and efficient I got to feel like I was part of the culture

title: Efficient transport to get you away from the traffic!
review: Great way to get around but gets extremely busy in the evenings with long queues  we only used it a couple of times so didn't find out if you could get a "travelcardpass" type thing that you can purchase in advance  am sure you can so would be worthwhile doing this as the ticket machines get so busy

title: So polite and clean
review: You can purchase a ticket from your boarding point to your destination via card dispenser at the station  It's considered impolite to eat during your public travel and also no loud telephone conversations During peak time it's very congested

title: Very convenient to go from down town bj!
review: It took us about 35 minutes to go from national stadium We had to change from the sky train It was a good choice to go to the airport You don't have to worry about the traffic congestion

title: great
review: in few minutes (or more if you want to spend less) it covers the distance between the airport and downtown Very comfortable absolutely silent it looks like to fly

title: Super convenient!!!
review: Best and easiest way to get to and from the airport Saves tons of time because traffic in Bangkok can be as bad as traffic in Los Angeles if not more The journey is about 35 mins depending on which area you are staying in Bangkokand most likely you will have to change trains but it is super convenient and easy to get around I really enjoyed Bangkoks public transportation Nice to use other methods besides a Tuk Tuk Enjoy the ride

title: great way to travel
review: cheap and easy although did have to ask someone if I was on right platform but had no trouble getting around and it's air conditioned

title: Fastest way to reach the center
review: Nice and fast way to reach the center with cheap price   Good to reach the city but still need to take taxi or other transportation to reach ur hotel or the bts  Avoid if u have many many bags Avoid if u r a group since taxi will be cheaper Avoid if ur have children and Special needed member

title: Best transport from Suvarnaphumi to Central Bangkok
review: City Line efficient transport from the airport to central Bangkok Costs a max of 45THB (£090p) to the end of the line goes to Phayatai two stops beyond Makassan cheaper by 5THB per station short of the end Buy a token at the machine and keep to exit at destination Trains run at around 15  min intervals and takes half an hour Can get full as is used as a local line Very clean air conditioned certainly my preferred method of travel into Bangkok Cheaper and quicker than any other way

title: Fun experience
review: A fun experience travelling above Bangkok Added advantage is that you avoid the terible congestion on the roads

title: Clean, safe and easy
review: Bangkok's BTS is an economical and safe way to travel if the network is where you want to go    We used it to get to the weekend Chatuchak Market with one simple train change at Siam Ticket purchase is a little messy  coin only ticket dispenser machinessystem is you get coinage from the manned ticket booth nearby then proceed to the ticket machine to select your destinationfare zone   Master the first trip and you are then home and hosed )

title: One of the main methods of discovering Bangkok
review: Friends of ours who live in Bangkok got us wise on using this Get a Rabbit card charge it and start crossing this great town It's the perfect way to get around Combine this with the express boat at Sathorn Pier and you'll fly to every desired location at half the price and a quarter of the time

title: Fast on time
review: It's nice that trains are on time usually There are times when I am waiting for the MRT and there's massive people there I wish they have better organizing with lines cuz people in Bangkok are soooo not disciplined and some people are just straight up selfish It's clean but it's quite packed during peak hours you should plan your travels if you want to travel during peak hours which are around 6am8am and 5pm9pm sometimes ask other people though because of this reasonI don't really take them anymore wait to long and don't want to catch flu in crowded space

title: Great, but not so well integrated with metro
review: I work in transport and Skytrain is often seen as a revolution in transport for Bangkok since it reduced travel times substantially for those who use it It is anyway expensive for many locals and lacks integration with the metro It should also have better access (via buses or so) with the older area of Bangkok (Rattanakosin)

title: You do this once
review: If you are in the area this one trip you must do once to feel the history and imagine what it must have been like in the WW2 16000 allied prisoners and 90000 locals died in the contruction the railway does not run through the worst parts of contsruction nowadays but a couple of viaducts will give you an idea

title: Best way to go to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Since Suvarnabhumi Airport is located far from city center using ARL is the best way to access the city since it's cheap fast and air conditioned It was also integrated to MRT and BTS station

title: Great transport
review: It was indispensable on our Holliday in Bangkok We quite often found the taxi drivers around the Shukhumvit area to be out to scam tourists (refusing to take you on the meter and demanding 3x the meter rate So the Skytrain came in handy It was easy to understand we'll run with good air conditioning We ended up using the Rabit Card which was cool as we avoided the ticket lines But sometimes found the pricing confusing Also feel that the rabbit card should connect up with other transport services like the metro

title: Good for solo travellers
review: Beats taking a taxi especially if your hotel is not far from a BTS station However the waiting area for the train back to the airport can get uncomfortable on a warm day as it is not air conditioned

title: Excellent Transportation!
review: I took the MRT train from Chinatown to Terminal 21 (the Hua Lamphong MRT station to the Sukhumvit MRT station) on February 2016 It was nice and clean It was easy to use

title: A Good Night Sleep in a Fantastic Atmosphere
review: Best choice of my trip Plenty of space and privacy in 2nd Class AC sleeper fresh linen felt hygienic no safety concerns and a wonderful view from the lower bed (you do not want the upper bed) A comparison for airline travelers Spacewise 2nd Class AC beats a businessclass flatbed in any airline so there is plenty of room to stretch   I took the 2200 train because earlier trains were booked but at hindsight this was a much better choice a) it leaves time for a nice dinner in Bangkok b) beds are already made in sleeper cars c) you arrive around lunchtime with a nice ride into Chiang Mai and you can check into your hotel right away   Food is not the greatest but on par with train food across the world

title: Super convenient and efficient
review: Bangkok's traffic can be very bad Also the rush hour here extends over many hours The BTS sky train is the solution Just stick to it for as many travels as possible and job will be able to predict travel times Even when some place is not directly reachable by the train we took a train to a place close by and then would walktaxituktuk Every time we took a taxi we would immediately regret And not because it was cheaper to take the train  for a family of 4 the train is sometimes more expensive than taxi For one or two people it's cheaper too

title: best way to get around the city
review: very cheap and easy to usejust make sure you have coins to buy tickets from machinesyou will find that easier Upcoming Stations are announced on the train and indicated in the carriagecarriages are airconditioned clean and well maintainedthat all you ask for when travelling

title: Handy but neefs a lot of improvement with customer service
review: The BTS Sky train is a convenient way to get to and from Bangkok International Airport and downtown Bangkok  The SkyTrain is relatively cheap and runs directly from the international terminal into the City and back and it continues all the way up to the university  Beware those of you who have early morning flight to like not flights because it does not upper right after midnight and does not operate until about 6 am in the morning   some of they stop at the station speak broken English and some of them barely speak English at all and there is very limited signage or assistance to help you navigate your way to where you should be going or to which platform you should be on This is the major downfall of the BTS as they customer service needs to be improved dramatically as does the signage

title: Super easy to use
review: We stayed in silom in between sala daeng and chongsi station so we frequented both stops depending on where we were going The bts is pretty easy to use You can exchange your bills for coins at the booth The machine only takes 1510 cents I recommend counting the change you receive because im pretty sure i was shorted about 40 cents once At the ticket buying machine  You press which station you want to go to and the number on the button corresponds to the price of fair When you get your ticket  You insert your ticket into the entrance turnstile and you get your ticket back and when you get off at your stop you insert your ticket at the exit turnstile but this time you don't get it back There is a security presence and they do check your bags quickly It can be confusing on which floor you need to be on but anyone that we asked was willing to help The bts can get packed during rush hour The AC is super refreshing

title: Fast way to the airport
review: Its realy nice beause you will get to the airport in no time you shold still take it if you travel with more then one person it is realy cheap clean and gets you to the airport in notime

title: Easy to get around but doesn't go everywhere!
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to use particularly if you're used to the underground in London It's air conditioned and the routes are simple to follow The only problem is that it's a bit limited in length so it doesn't go everywhere Brilliant at peak traffic times though around 3304pm to get you on the move

title: Good service
review: Cheap and reliable  Stations are clean with air con so you can chill a bit The only thing which annoyed me was security checks everytime I walked in

title: Absolute Highlight
review: Highlight of my trip for sure highly recommended A must do when visiting Bangkok Our guide was incredible and our driver took good care of us on the busy roads Thank you 100100

title: Fast and continent trip
review: A good way to make a fast track trip to your destination to avoid traffic and excessive fare from tuktuk or long way bus trip

title: Nice way to move around town
review: The skytrain is a great way to move around town Many stations connect to the other lines and subway stations You can also reach the bus terminal and the train to the airport It is easy to access many of the malls along the carjammed Sukhumvit Avenue

title: Cheap and Best
review: if you want to travel in Bangkok city take the skytrain and you can travel for cheap and to the destination you want to go just in beginning it will be difficult but you can always ask at the help desk and its all easy

title: Life is easy
review: Because of this train you will save money and traffic and transfer is so easy Thank you for those genus people who study and pushed this project

title: Quick journey to the city
review: If you don't have too many luggages the airport rail will get you to the city Phayathai Station) in 30 to 40 mins depending on the waiting timeThe journey is shorter is you are travelling to Makkasan station which is 58mins walk to the Petchaburi MRT station (one stop to Sukhumvit MRT which intersects with Asoke BTS and where Terminal 21 is located and 4 stops to Silom MRT station where Dusit Thani hotel is) The journey to Phayathai station is 45 Bath

title: Fast and Efficient
review: The airport rail link is a great transport that connects directly from the airport to several stations along the track till Phaya Thai It is fast efficient and economical to travel especially for lone tourist who wants to make it to the Airport avoiding the jams

title: single traveler!
review: it is speedy way to transfer from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok but if you have more than 1 baggage maybe you have problem with movement

title: Easy and comfortable
review: To avoid traffic in Bangkok You take less than hour to go to downtown by BTS rather than 2 hour by bus

title: Very easy to navigate
review: After being on a few different subwaytrain lines in China & Japan this seemed like a breeze The person in the booth selling tickets spoke English (the machine only takes coins) and it was quick

title: Slow with unfriendly ticket saler staff
review: The ticket saler staff at the Suvarnabhumi airport was totally unfriendly like she did not want to work  The express train is actually not that fast because it does not run all the time  Sometimes you could get to the city faster with normal trains (which has many stop) which could depart like 20 minutes before the express ones

title: Best way of transportation in Bangkok
review: System is very quick and affordable execllent conditions and clean staff very respecful and helpful

title: Fast. Cheap. Easy way to get from the airport to Bangkok and vice versa.
review: We travelled most days on the airport skytrain whilst in Bangkok It's fast clean efficient safe and cheap and beats the congestion and pollution of going by road All the signage is in Thai and English It's definitely the way to go

title: Picking up my kid
review: Woke up and was waiting exactly at 6 am from BTS NANA changed the train from PHYA THAI and took AIRPORT LINK to suvarnaphum airport on time for his arrival at 700 am from New York via Mumbai   Very reliable and comfortable Cost be from nana to airport one way was US$ 220 (From phya Thai by airport link to the airport cost is US$ 130)   I could always depending on their services no matter what

title: Be aware of the missing lift
review: It is a fast and efficient way to travel and for a nonThai very affordable If you do travel with luggage it is to be avoided because most stations have NO elevators It is hard to believe that a modern city as Bangkok does not offer handicapped or elder people the chance to travel with the BTS For travelers with luggage it is an immense hassle to drag the luggage up and down especially after a long trip and temperatures rising up to 40 degrees

title: Best way to commute in Bangkok
review: Before planning your trip to BKK make sure your destinations are nearby a BTS Chose a hotel near BTS and most of the "must see" of bangkok are within walking distance from BTS Super clean super safe environment Easiest and quickest way to commute in BKK Make sure you have change before reaching the BTS because you might face a long queue to get change

title: Very convenient
review: Loved how fast and clean the trains are The regular schedule means I don't worry if I miss a train just take the next one

title: Fast and efficient
review: Easy to access with token purchase Very modern clean trains An easy way to navigate and of get around Bangkok

title: Getting into Bangkok fast and easy
review: As you arrive at Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International Airport (BKK) you will be faced with several options of transportation into the city Limo services will start to ask for your business as early as the baggage pickup area and in the Arrival Hall One floor under the arrival hall is the taxi departure line As in most cities you want to make the ride on the taxi meter and do not negotiate a price The basement of the airport holds the best option for getting in the city the Airport Rail Link Take the elevator down and follow the signs    It is expected that you will have luggage to manage but reason needs to come into play One large piece with a carryon and personal bag is about all one adult can manage on the train People in Bangkok have learned to take the Airport Link for normal transportation but understand the purpose is to accommodate airport traffic It can be crowded so try to sit near a door to make getting off easier     The Air link connects with the BTS Skytrain and the MRT subway system Generally you only want to have a carryon bag on these two systems as they are for general population transportation If it is early in the morning or late at night then a larger bag can be taken     Obviously I use the Airport Rail Link often when traveling from the city to the airport A little common sense makes it a very useful tool

title: Fast travel
review: If you don't like to sit in traffic jams you must try the sky train Once you take a few trips you understand the pre pay ticketing system you will explore further destinations It gets busy at peak morning and evening times though the trains just keep comingForget the taxi if you can travel to the destination by train

title: Great day out
review: This tour was great visiting both the train market and floating market in the same day These markets were quite intense but well worth seeing Our tour guide Amie ensured we were safe and well organised taking particular care of my mother who was a little older than the rest of the group

title: Clean, fast & efficient
review: Most tourists travelling to Bangkok have heard of or are familiar with Bangkok's Skytrain  The BTS But if you are not quite so familiar with the MRT  it is definitely worth checking up on Check the route and the stations It can save a lot of time between certain stations ASOK to SILOM for example So fast and not as full as the BTS  outside of rush hour The disadvantages It's a seperate system to the other rail services  the ARL & BTS You need another stored value ticket The stations don't have a direct link or bridge to the shopping malls  unlike the BTS The link between the BTS and the MRT can be a bit awkward I use Phetchaburi Station most of all It links via a walkway to the ARL Station  Makkasan And even with luggage is not too bad (I'm 63) BUT there is a luggage security check at the station entrance Not usually but once in a while I have to open one bag at least So if you plan on being in BKK for a few days it is worth buying a MRT stored value ticket along with your RABBIT card and try the MRT When you return to your home country you can always pas on the MRT ticket to a friend to use if you not planning on a return visit to BKK soon

title: convenience and reasonable rate
review: Fast convenience reasonable rate no jam on time no argument with taxi driver about taxi fare But only for to Suvarnabhumi airport

title: Save money and time
review: This is a lifemoney saver when you arrive at BKK airport for the first time I had no idea how to reach my hotel which was around 30km from the airport and this train helped me reach my hotel in very less amount of money Later I realised that it saved my time as well since roads have heavy traffic near Sukhumvit and other places which were part of the route

title: A good vehicle
review: As same as BTS we can avoid traffic jam by using this vehicle but i think there still have some problem you can see from the news that sometime it doesn't work while people are using it

title: Great way to avoid the traffic
review: Great way to get about Bangkok above the traffic Avoids the use of taxis and the 'meter is broken' and the traffic fumes when using the tuc tuc Very economic compared with these alternatives  both into and out of the airport and around the parts of the city it serves

title: Avoid the terrible traffic
review: I used the BTS several times when I was in Bangkok I found it very convenient Aircondition worked well and there was trains leaving frequently

title: My Salvation for  easy AC travel...:)
review: I have been using the BTS now for about 10 years and find it one of the easiest ways to get around town I normally buy a BTS card and fill it with 200300 bhat which helps eliminate line ups during peak hours

title: Fast and cold
review: Nice way to reach different destination in a fast manner Cold and clean trains Enough seating Reliable Safe

title: A new experience in Bangkok Traffic system
review: it was a city of heavy Traffic Jam motor bike and Tuktuk what a change great job when i drop down at Siam oh what a reverse experience from 2007 Amazing Ther is so many problems but Thailand Economy is Coming u

title: Airport MRT
review: Always very good air conditioned and on time Great connections to airport and other change to BTS

title: People Mover...
