review: When in the downtown area of Bangkok use the Sky Train  It is a fast clean easy way to get around and see the city from a whole new perspective  Between the river and the Sky Train we were able to see most of the main attractions with easea definite recommend

title: Awesome experience
review: Sara (our guide) is amazing We loved the experience She explained everything so well to us and the price is worth it for sure We highly recommended it 😄

title: The best way to tour Bangkok
review: The BTS is the best way to go around Bangkok It's cheap clean air conditioned and tourist friendly Most of the tourist spots go to places can be reached through the BTS You can skip the traffic during rush hour however the train can be crowded

title: Massively better than using the roads
review: A much quicker alternative to the incredibly crowded road system of Bangkok The connection with the MTR statins were not as smooth as they could have been though

title: Good
review: Good to have this experience Suggest not to buy travellers card if you are travelling not frequently

title: Excellent way to get around
review: The trains and subways of Bangkok are amazingly clean comfortable and reliable  They do offer day passes and this is an easy way to discover the layout of the city

title: Easy and traffic free
review: By using BTS to travel around main city of BKK will be a better choice Somehow still need to take note of the timing so that you won't meet humans traffic jam in the cabin It will be best to purchase Rabbit card to travel You won't need to Q to purchase the daily token

title: Functional and cheap
review: If your hotel is near a train station or BTS station this is a great way to get from the airport to central places Having been to BKK many times I wonder why I never tried this before Not slick like HongKong or London's dedicated airport links it's nevertheless reliable and cheap During traffic jams you can look down at the poor people who didn't think of this

title: graeat service
review: Very clear marking in English Very easy to use Very clean and airconditioned not expensjive and very faxt

title: Airport transportation
review: Very easy to use and convenient way to get from airport to our hotel in downtown Bangkok Tickets were easy to purchase and route maps easy to read

title: Quick and cheap
review: Clean neat and modern train Airport  Makassan (near Sukhumvit area) in only 15 minutes An officer will guide you to select reliable taxy without any additional charges and give you a guidance card to report any issues during the visit in Bangkok

title: easy and cheap
review: seamless travel between central Bangkok and the airport Only 40 baht The train is very clean easy to understand what to do and only takes less than 30 minutes

title: recommendable
review: They are punctual they pick you up at the hotel and at the end they leave you at a mall The journey is long first by bus and then by train

title: Nice and clean but busy
review: Convenient way to travel in and around bangkok 2 main lines with an interchange at the siam station May get very crowded especially during the evening afterwork hour rush

title: not as fast as a taxi, but cheaper and easy to use.
review: I bought a single ticket 45 THB I managed to get a "smart pass =octopus or oyster card only when I went to the skytrain There was space people were friendly seats look inward so unable to see the view

title: Great value half day out 🤩
review: We did the trip to the railway & floating markets as a family of 2 adults & 2 teens Easy to find the meeting point warm welcome from our guide Kwan and a very prompt start to the excursion We had a minibus ride of approx 15 hrs to reach the railway market with a stop en route to use the toilet and grab a drink We had approx 1 hour at the railway market (which was plenty) and then a 12hr drive to the floating market We spent approx 15 hrs here inc time for a sit down lunch then 15 hour drive back to the drop off at MBK We all felt this trip was excellent value it was great not having to try and get there ourselves and work things out Kwan showed us a lot of things along the way and kept us all safe for the whole time which meant a lot to us Highly recommend indeed 👍🏼👍🏼⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Smooth
review: Really the easiest way to move on Cheap and fast They are constantly building the track Fortet about taxi if you want to save time and money in Bangkok

title: Easy to use
review: My daughter and I used this to get around most of the time in Bangkok   It is easy to use   The trains are clean and all stops are announced in Thai and English   If your hotel is close to one of the BTS stops especially Silom and Sukhumvit highly recommend taking the airport skytrain to Phaya Thai (last stop just makes it easier) and transferring to the Sukhumvit line

title: Fast
review: This is a cheap and fast way to get to your hotel from the airport just make sure that your hotel is close to this line or to a croosing with the MRT

title: Must do when visiting Bangkok!
review: Riding the train into the railway Market and then watching it leave was a onceinalifetime experience The floating markets were great and I had the best pad Thai ever We weren't going to do a tour at first but then found out that these markets are about 2 hours outside of Bangkok The tour was worth it even just for the transport Our guide Lucky was hilarious  we loved her

title: Not  a   family  tourist  attraction  but  a  commuter  train .
review: It   seems  like  all   the  recent  trips  have  been  more  crowded  with  commuters  and  BTS  cars  can  get  quite  stifling    They  are  running  very  frequent  trains  so  I  don't  think  there  is  much  more  the  system  can  do     However    on  a  recent  trip  I  ran  into  some  1st  time  travelers  with  young  children  who  were  taking  the kids  for  the  SkyTrain  ride   I  don't  think  they  realized  this  is  NOT  really  a  family tourist  attraction  like  the  large  Ferris  wheels  but  a  commuter  train  with  over crowding  They  were  also  giving  one  child  lots  of  caffeine  soda  so  he  was  going  to need  a  restroom  soon  but  there  are  None  on  the  system   just  as  there  are  No  refuse  cans  and  few  escalators   BTS  &  Metro  are  better  cost  wise   & Bangkok  roads  make  LA  look  like  a  lazy  country  town   so   BTS  is   preferred  by  many  workers  I   would  only  take  a  child  on   BTS  however  if  it  was  an  absolute  necessity

title: Fast
review: This is the most fast way between city and airport final station is in downtown crossing other links

title: Sky train
review: Very clean and efficient An excellent method of travelling in Bangkok

title: Life Line for Tourists
review: It will not be incorrect to say that the BTS or the Sky Train as it is popularly known is the life line for tourists The transport system may not be as exhaustive but together with MRT and the Boat Services it serves the purpose fully well Add the Airport City Line to it and you may not need any other form of transport for sightseeing and  or marketing To chose between various tickets for the BTS may be tricky We bought a One Day Pass at the cost of B 140 and travelled as far as to Mo Chit and then back to Nana We again took the Sky Train to Phaya Thai and from there walked to Pratunam On way back we took the ACL to Phaya Thai from Ratchaprarop and then the Sky Train to Nana We still had time in the evening and could go to Saphan Taksin to take a boat ride The whole day ticket would have cost B 150 but we bought two single journeys ticket to and from Tha Tien near Khao San Road at a cost of B 28 Back in Saphan Taksin we took the Sky Train again to Siam for some shopping experience After taking dinner in some place at Chid Lom we boarded the Sky Train again for Nana The total travel on BTS would have cost us something around B 250 but B 140 was all that we paid per person

title: The only way to go when in Bangkok, Thailand
review: We spent everyday moving around this great town on the Sky Train and found it to be clean air conditioned fast and inexpensive  We found directions in English posted every where to all the areas that we wanted to go

title: Fasted way around Bangkok
review: The BTS System is fantastic cheap and easy to use I'd recommend buying a rabbit card and topping it up You can buy one easily at a desk inside the stations Like all big cities the BTS has it's rush hours and can become a bit compact The carriages are all air conditioned and spotlessly clean

title: Everything you want from public transport
review: Sky train allows you to travel even in the gridlock of rush hour It's clean air con modern and reliable what more could you want

title: Bangkok to NongKhai
review: We took the over night train from BK to NongKhai and it was great The train left on time and arrived on time The cabins were new and fresh with a computer to screen and small sink  Also there is a Ist class sleeper waiting room not many know of that is fully ac We would definitely recommend this trip to anybody

title: Fast
review: I already ride this train for 3 times Is fast better than bus because we don't know traffic is unpredictable

title: Easy to use
review: This is really a great way to connect to BKK no need for a Taxiand when in BKK one connects super easy to the other trains in the city

title: Very efficient
review: Best way to get around Super quick clean and cool Staff at stations were helpful and the pricing system is easy to understand

title: Best way to get around Bangkok and other parts
review: I always use the BTS whenever I am in Bangkok It's cheap convenient and saves you a lot of time as Bangkok is notorious for its traffic jam If you couple BTS with MRT you can pretty much cover most of Bangkok by train alone  all you need to know is which station you need to get down One note though  the train starts at 630  and the last one leaves between 2330 and 2350 Fares start at 15 baht for one stop  that's pretty cheap

title: So crowded in the blue line, but waiting too long for the red line train
review: So crowded and poor airconditioning in the blue line  If you choose the red line you have to wait for a long time for the red line train

title: efficient and affordable
review: Great transfer to the airport 9 stops for 45 baht Super class  We stayed at the Eastin Phayathay Hotel and it is right next to the BTSAirlink station Super class

title: Fastest and easiest way to town from airport
review: cheap and fats thats how u can describe the Rail link signs shoe u the way to the basement and u can take either the express or city line  if u are staying in nanasukhumvit area take the train upto Makassan or else to PhayaThai stations cost u max 45Bhat and u reach the town in less than 30 min

title: Vacation
review: It was amazing trip The guide ‘Kwan’ is very kind patient and knowledgeable I would share and recommend with my family and friends about this wonderful trip 😇

title: Train from Nam Tok to Kanachanburi
review: If you have visited Hellfire Pass it is easy to get dropped off at Nam Tok Station to catch the train back to Kanchanaburi The train wanders through farmland along the river and across the famous viaduct  It stops just after crossing the River Kwai bridge and you just jump off  It only costs a few baht to do the trip and is a fantastic experience

title: best option to get to the airport
review: big city mostly have a bad traffic jam and a quite far airport from the city but by this ARL all becomes easier it takes only 20 mins to get to the airport

title: good connection to the market
review: We used skytrain to go from city center Phaya Thai station to Chatuchak market in the north It cost 30 baht per person one way and it was a comfortable journey in an air conditioned train  It is definitely a good way of traveling in Bangkok as you void traffic jams

title: Easy to use
review: The Skytrain system in Bangkok is really easy to use The best way is to get a ticket with a prepaid amount and you use the ticket to get on and of the train Pictures on the ticket machines show you the costs wherever you want to go

title: Easy, Clean, Fast, Cheap, Yay!
review: We're two New Yorkers who take the subway everyday at home and the Skytrain really impressed us So easy to navigate so clean so inexpensive so fast such frequent service Definitely save yourself a few baht and get where you're going easily with the Skytrain We wish it went closer to the river because it's by far the best way to get around town Dropped us off right next to the Jim Thompson house and the Siam shopping centers It took about 3 minutes initially to orient ourselves and voila we were on our way zipping around town like locals Travelers  don't be intimidated it's the way to go

title: Best way to go around in BKK
review: Best way to go around quickly in BKK (AC is very very cold) if you are planning it more than 3 times in the day buy a one day ticket

title: So functional
review: So easy and comfortable overall Much cheaper and probably much quicker than a taxi or usual tuktuk

title: Value added underground tube in Bangkok
review: We recently did our 4th trip to Bangkok in as many years We love Bangkok for its public transport trains Though the major lifeline for us tourists is its BTS skytrain service the MRT is another value addition to reach areas in central Bangkok where there is no BTS We stay at hotels a short walk from MRT Silom (& BTS Saladaeng) and simply love the SilomSukhumvit area With Bangkok's very heavy road traffic the local taxis & tuk tuks overcharging foreign tourists & local buses not very convenient for non Thai speakers hence the importance of this value added skytrain service All instructions are bilingual Thai & English with tourist friendly signs The trains have very good air conditioning so it acts as a dehumidifier There are escalators at many stations too for travellers with bags Can get crowded during peak hours though the crowd discipline is excellent The only negative is the absence of return tickets 1 3 or 7 day passes so beneficial for tourists

title: Great
review: Must visit places in Bangkok entry fee 500 baht its totally worth of money Nb female should cover shoulder and full length bottom for male and female

title: Not enough neat
review: After Singapore and Tokyo let's just say that it felt not good enough even if it was quite good and secure but my standards are higher now

title: Excellent way of getting about
review: If you’re needing to get about Bangkok then I thoroughly recommend to use the BTS skytrain They are clean extremely well airconditioned and very well maintained Every time I use this system the trains are on time with no hic ups or problems I also felt very safe and it’s easy to use with plenty of signposts for easy to understand

title: Easy & affordable
review: Finding the railway at the airport is easy Lots of signs and when you enter the rail area they also have an information desk that can guide you to the area you are going All stops are announced in English too I will defenately use the rail again

title: Quick, easy, convenient
review: If you stay closeby the BTS network in the central area of Bangkok the Airport Rail is the easiest quickest and most convenient way to reach the airport Plus it's clean comfortable and safe It takes you straight fromto the international airport No hassle no traffic jams Small fare ticket Highly recommended

title: Good experience!
review: Good experience Tour operator picked us up at our hotel even if our hotel wasn’t on the list Very accommodating Tour guidé was pleasant Spoke too much but nice Would recommended Lots of driving and traffic Be aware May not have much time for lunch

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: We were only a couple of blocks from the Skytrain and it was easy access and just like riding BART in San Francisco Much better than taking a taxi who are notorious in ripping off tourists

title: Efficient and clean
review: Took this mode of transport almost whole day It was efficient clean An effective way to stroll in Bangkok

title: Fast and affordable.
review: It's easy to buy the tickets The trains arrive on schedules so do take note of the timing for better trip

title: Great Transit
review: This is the fastest and easiest way to go around in Bangkok Ticket price starting from 2050 Baht Please avoid peak time from 79 AM and 58PM at weekday

title: Easy
review: I was bit timid to try to figure out the sky train but I bit the bullet and was so glad to have figured it out Cheap safe ac much faster than tuktuk taxi A

title: Best way to travel in Thailand!
review: The night train is a great experience Better to have the lower bed because they don't turn off the light at night And take some food with you as it is not so good and quite expensive in the train

title: Convenient and Fast
review: I found the BTS to be the most convenient and quickest was to explore BKK   Two main lines easy to navigate   Be sure to get a rabbit card   It's easy to top off as needed    Only problem with the BTS was that it does not run pass midnight  which actually means 11151130 depending on the Station    I found this out the hard way

title: Easy access
review: When flying out from BKK on a night flight I stored my bags at the airport (100 THBpiece) and took the train in to the city where I went shopping Simply and easy access

title: half day rail market and floating market
review: Good day out Loved the train ride and both markets Our guide (Burt) was informative and attentive The rail market was authentic (but also explore the real fish market just behind the track) and the water market is now obviously designed for tourists but it was still an amazing experience and a treat to remember It was also a good way to see some of the country around Bangkok

title: Easy to navigate and learn
review: I was a little nervous to use the BTS when I first arrived in Bangkok   However the process couldn't have been easier  My husband and I took it from the airport to our hotel  We had to make a transfer and the staff at the stations were very helpful and nice  It is also nice that all of the signs are also written in English

title: Gets you where you want
review: The transportation services in Bangkok is actually top notch Especially the BTS Skytrain Takes you easily to most places you wish to visit at very reasonable cost

title: a convenient way to avoid the traffic jams
review: convenient mode of transport if you want to avoid been trapped in the traffic jams on the road but be prepared to climb some staircase coz' not every stations has elevators for both going up and coming down

title: Easy to use
review: Some Skytrain systems can be confusing and hard to find your locationdestination  Bangkok's Skytrain is excellent and easy to use Far more people should shy away from the taxi's and use the skytrain  its great value too and a cool place on a hot day

title: Great way to get around
review: In a city where traffic can regularly seize up at the drop of a hat the BST really is the ideal way to get around Clean air conditioned trains will whisk you around much quicker than road traffic And it is cheap to use

title: Great & safe way to see Bangkok...
review: The Skytrain provides an easy cheap & faster way to move around Bangkok And it is comfortable as well being airconditioned  It is also much safer than taking taxis or tuks tuks besides avoiding the terrible traffic jams   We had experienced one very "worrying" experience taking a taxi late at night in last visit The driver drove us through dark lonely roads & alleys to get to our hotel which was located along the main city centre We thought he had something up in his mind but thank goodness we reached our hotel safely   My advice is Never take taxis or Tuk Tuk late at night for your own safety

title: Quick and efficient way to get to central Bangkok
review: There are two metro lines from the Main international airport (Suvarnabhumi) to central Bangkok In my experience unless you have a lot of luggage  more than one 20Kg case  it is better and cheaper than the Taxi The  two lines from the Aiport are SA Express and SA City line Later makes a lot of stops but will get you there under an hour  More info here httpwwwbangkokmetrocothindexaspxLang=En

title: Cheap, clean, reliable and air con
review: All trains ran on time when we were there Stations are clean and whilst very busy seems to flow very well Trains themselves are clean and air conditioned and cost very little to ride

title: Train Ride in History
review: This was a fascinating journey travelling by steam train in old wooden carriages as we travelled 60 kilometres towards Burma Going through the countryside you could see the original timber sleepers and parts of the original track as laid down by the PoW’s that were under capture by the Japanese You could also appreciate how such a remarkable feat was achieved by the PoWs using primitive tools in such hostile terrain with the track line curvature through the rocks and in places sheer drops to the river

title: Easiest way to get around
review: The BTS Skytrain is superb its fast good connectivity with all the main shopping malls tourist sites and public areas Very well planned clean and works very efficiently The ticketing system is super easy it can get a bit crowded at times but thats a minor negative

title: Skytrain
review: The skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok the best times are off peak for obvious reasons the only thing I find frustrating is the staff are not very friendly so always make sure you have a map of where you want to go

title: Helpful transportation in BKK
review: When you go to BKK BTS will help you a lot just read the direction easy fast and cheap  They reach almost all of the BKK attraction

title: BTS
review: The station maps are easy to find out where u are going Very convenient to get around by bts

title: Used to always use BTS but the MRT is much better
review: Every time we visited Bangkok we would always use the BTS but this time we tried the MRT (Underground) to get so places such as Chatuchak Market and Silom The MRT is less crowded much quicker and is fully airconditioned In the future if we have the choice we will always take the MRT  To be honest the Skytrain still gives you the best views and is the only way to reach Siam and all the shopping centres but its way to over crowded

title: Super easy and quick
review: So easy to use as long as you know where your getting off Even if you dont the staff are a great help if not too busy (rush hour)   Very clean and air conditioned  So much quicker than taxis in the rush hour Bangkok traffic

title: Step back in time
review: This is more than a lovely train ride through beautiful countryside It takes you through the landscape metre by metre in which more than 100000 people lost their lives in the heat and hell of building the railway The rotting original sleepers at the side of the track are a testament to the numbers that fell during it's construction One sleeper for each death over the 400+ miles into Burma You can actually lean out of the train and touch the rocks of the cuttings done by hand by British Dutch & American forces and thousands of asian workers You trundle over the bridges and experience the beauty of the place that saw so much tragedy and inhumanity It is not air conditioned but the windows are open and they bring refreshments round Well worth doing in my opinion

title: Fast, well indicated
review: We got to the Rail link by metro which was really well indicated (from metrostation to Rail Link) It's a short 5 minute walk We got to Suvarnabhumi very fast for only 30 Baht The train was a bit crowdy but that's what happens on a friday night at 7 PM Saves you a bit of cash

title: Great transportation option
review: Between the MRT and BTS most of bkk is within reach One end of the link ends in China town where Wat Timet is This houses one of the largest gold buddhas in the world JJ market is on the other end of the loop for great shopping

title: Bangkok Airport Train
review: It was so convenient after travelling from Melbourne via Singapore to Bangkok to be able to follow the signs to the Airpot Train Station Train arrived shortly afterwards and after security checked the train we boarded without fuss

title: Cheap quick travel to city
review: Buy a token at the airport ticket machine or city terminus for 45baht Six or seven stops and 45 minutes from airport to city terminus and link to skytrain Plenty of room for travellers cases

title: Extremely convenient and easy to ride on.
review: Main mode of transport in Bkk truly amazed but the standard of the trains in terms of speed and accuracy However crowded during peak hours and sometimes might be costly compared to taking metered taxis

title: Exactly what you need in a busy city
review: Cheap quick and reliable The carriages are nice cool and clean We were very impressed and they go to most tourist places just not the area around the grand palace My wife also loved using the ticket machine Added Bonus  It doesn't get 5 just because you can't use notes

title: Great mode of transportation, but wouldn't consider it an "attraction"
review: The skytrain is a great way to get around parts of the city but I wouldn't consider it an "attraction" Before arriving in Bangkok since it was on the "to do" list I thought it might be more of a tourist attraction but it's pretty much like being on the subwaymetro except above ground I rode it twice on our visit to Bangkok and it was quite crowded both times with both locals and tourists We couldn't really get a good view of the city because it was so crowded but it got us to where we needed to go quickly And it is nice and clean

title: Best way to avoid Bangkok traffic
review: If you're staying in Bangkok for several days and plan to use the skytrain to get around it's worth getting a travel card (at one of the manned ticket counters) which you can top up and reuse as needed (don't forget to return at the end of your visit to get your deposit back)

title: Easy and fast
review: Cheap and fast way of transportation through a considerable part of Bangkok Also it is air conditioned

title: Easy and cheap to use
review: We used this service twice while we were in bangkok It is relatively easy to figure out if you know english or Thai You will need an idea of which stop is closest to your destination By far cheaper than a taxi and in some cases quicker depending on time of day The trains are frequent but the chances of getting a seat are limited

title: really decongests city traffic
review: Nothing like this in our City so was more of an attraction and something great to see

title: Convenient to commute in Bangkok city center
review: With traffic congestion in Bangkok MRT is a great way to move around in the city center You can also connect to the BTS sky train which is also convenient

title: Not the best but it's still a good & 'safer' transport alternative in Bangkok. ....
review: In cities like Bangkok where whole day traffic jams traffic noise & traffic pollution are daily mainstays BTS Skytrain certainly gives tourists & local alike a much needed 'better' transport alternative  BTS does not have a very comprehensive network nor is it among the best system in the world but it's good enough to serve it's intended purpose  Much has been echoed by many travellers all over the world regarding safety of taking public transports overseas   We have been to Bangkok many times but have NEVER ever felt safe taking tuktuks or taxis when we are just 2 or less especially at night More so if only 2 of us or just 2 ladies   We take only at night if absolutely no choice but try to schedule our return to hotel before last BTS train service or plan our last shopping area near BTS station  Tuktuk & taxi drivers often take shortcuts through quiet dark lanes at night BTS provides a safer option particularly for night travel besides avoiding jams   Take the BTS whenever possible for your own safety especially at night

title: it gets as crowded as the Tokyo metro at peak time
review: Car traffic in Bangkok is still heavy at most of time of the day taking BTS and metro is wise time & money saving way to get around the city The train gets extremely crowded like the one at the peak time in Tokyo There is rechargable card as well It is conveninent that there are some ATMs shops inside each station

title: Very convenient!
review: Loved the Skytrain I was able to get on a couple of blocks from my hotel and ride into downtown and see all the neat buildings and surrounding area Clean and easy to use

title: Convenient way to get to the city.
review: We caught the train from the airport to Phaya Thai & then a taxi to our hotel which was much cheaper & easier than a taxi the whole way The train was very clean although did get very cramped on one occasion Try to get into the middle of a carriage not near the doorway as people will just keep on cramming in It cost 45 baht one way for the whole trip so was good value

title: The air conditioning hits you
review: It is clean cool cheap and fastwe need to upgrade the London tube system to match this

title: Cheap link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to downtown and BTS
review: Airport Rail Link goes in to both Petchaburi BTS and Phaya Thai BTS stations on the monorail system  Tickets are 45 Baht and it is the fastestcheapest way in to the city if you are on your own

title: Reliable, cheap way of travelling through Bangkok.
review: Very reliable way of travelling through the heart of Bangkok and an easy to understand ticketing system Cheap too Love the fact you can actually see the city as you travel from a loftier perch rather than being underground as in London

title: Very good
review: The BTS is the most affordable way to get around Bangkok This BTS runs most places that any traveler needs to go I've take the BTS and MRT(the BTS connects with the underground mrt line) The BTS goes to the chatachak market Mbk shopping centre which are two top shopping destinations for farangs

title: its easy ...
review: its easy to use and understand to go and beside its always connect or nearby to those shopping mall

title: Fine
review: A bit strange to give a review to a train An over ground railway linking many of the site it is clean efficient cheap and safe

title: Easy, cheap, efficient
review: I will not take taxi tofrom the Suvarnabhumi airport ever again Because this train connection is brilliant It is cheap (40bahtsride = 1€) clean safe and on time Remember that the first train will start operating around 6am so for those flying earlier it is unfortunately nogo For others enjoy the beautiful skyline of Bangkok

title: Mixed feelings
review: Full disclosure  we are a young family traveling with an 11 9 and 2 year old  We took this train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and then back Our way up was in a 2nd class sleeper that was air conditioned there were 4 of us traveling and we basically had our own little room it was pleasant The food lady that came around was rude and the food wasn't very good Aslo the AC was cold take socks and pants The workers come around after the food comes and turn down the berths with fresh clean blankets and pillowcases I really enjoyed this trip   The way back was the seventh circle of hell Non air conditioned 2nd class sleeper The set up is open so we didn't have our own little room We didn't eat on this ride as we brought our own food The toilets were squat potties that empty right onto the tracks The train overheated and broke down for an hour or so about 30 minutes out of Chiang Mai The heat wasn't bad because it was overnight  Overall I would do the trip up again but would never do the trip back

title: most comfortable way
review: The most comfortable way and cheap as well to get to the Bangkok Easy to buy ticket and the train in the evening was half empty So easy to ride even with big backpacks

title: Way to go!
review: Forget taxis dump the Limo leave the bus stop and grab this  40 THB and it is the FASTEST and most comfortable journey into the city (and return) Just brilliant

title: Probably the best way to get from the airport
review: It’s only a quick ride to the airport It takes approximately half an hour for the ride from the airport to its final stopping point which is the Phaya Thai station where you can hop onto the BTS Skytrain For a solo traveller I know that this offers better value to get into Bangkok I am not sure of the taxi prices including possible toll charges so cannot really give an opinion on whether it would be best if you were two or more

title: Clean, fast and efficient
review: Thus is one of the best ways to get around traffic choked Bangkok  The Skytrain service is fast efficient and clean  Trains come regularly and whizz you around the system in minutes  Stations name accessing popular areas especially major department stores a breeze  Buy a ticket and to top it up when you first get to Bangkok and you'll pass through the electronic system quickly  keep your ticket if there is credit on it for your next visit

title: Cheap and fast
review: If you want to avoid the crazy driving of Bangkok taxi drivers and traffic jams the airport express is the way to go You can then either get a taxi to your final destination or transfer to the MRT underground train

title: Great ride
review: Well run clean efficient and low cost Good if you are staying near one of the stops Front carriage locked out which if it had been made available would have eased congestion inside but otherwise well done

title: Convenient Way Into the City
review: The airport rail link is an excellent and fast way to get into the city The train will bring you to the MRT system where you can then get almost anywhere in the city The only issue is that it is a bit confusing on how to get from the Airport Rail Link station to the actual MRT station You will also have to buy a separate ticket to board the MRT

title: THE WAY TO GET AROUND (BUT NOT DURING RUSH HOUR!)
review: Avoid if you can travelling around at 56Pm It is possible but to say "it's a squeeze" is understatement at its best  The system is wonderful The air conditioning is perfect The tracking system inside the cars is brilliant tracking where you are in a clear understandable format I recommend the 'fill up cards" As a senior all your rates are 50% Top up your card anytime it runs out When you tap going through the turnstyles it shows how much is left on the card Be sure to get your deposit back by turning in the card when you've done your last trip Same for the metro

title: Only way to get to and from the airport.
review: It is so much easier than getting stuck in traffic The only downside is if you have multiple bags it can be a bit much to deal with while one bag and a carryon are no problem

title: W
review: We went on sky train and found it good fun when you get to the station there's a map on the wall with a number on it then go to the change counter get the amount the number tells you Go to ticket machine put money in press for ticket job done The rest is just like the underground

title: A great ride
review: This is the easiest way to get around in Bangkok because the traffic is really busy You can jump on the sky train be there quick

title: Quick and easy
review: most easiest way to travel in the city  And it is very panchuall clean and you will be informed vell in advance you arrive the station The only dissapointment  is every information come in Thai language  only But you can manage where to get down  and train time table

title: travel from airport in 40 mins on train
review: great to get around low cost and no stuck in traffic easy to get to shopping malls or visit all the sites in the city

title: Overnight Bangkok to Chaing Mai on Train No. 9
review: This is a very safe comfortable and economical way to travel from Bangkok to Chaing Mai We booked second class sleeper compartments which were clean and spacious Slept great and arrived in Chaing Mai early the next morning refreshed We walked back to check out the first class sleeper and actually preferred the configuration of second class So don't sweat it if you can't get first class which sells out quickly and can be hard to get

title: Conflict
review: Seriously Avoid office rush hours hereeach year it gets worse and worse Conflict may occur because local Thai workers going to and from work cannot get through your luggage bags If you are going to the airport in the Rush hour you may have a serious problem trying to get on with luggage Most Thais now use the airport link to go home or to work

title: A great innovation
review: We loved the skytrain and the way it merges with the skywalk so you can stay above the crowded street and enter directly into buildings such as Malls and  hotels  It is cheap and efficient and easy to find your way round There is also a connection  from the international airport to the city centre and central station

title: One of the best transportation to escape from Bangkok's traffic jam.
review: Comfortable mostly on time Even though it only have two lines but Skytrain connects most of the city's shopping and major attractions Siam station is the most important station You can enjoy shopping at Siam Paragon go to Madame Tussauds Wax Museum at Siam and Hello Kitty Cafe at Siam Square Sukhumvit area is also just a ride away with Skytrain

title: convenient
review: Fast and convenient Large cars with room for luggage Not too many stops along the way Good price Avoids the hassle of taxis and their various charges (meter fee toll fee airport fee) and avoid the unpredictable and often terrible street traffic

title: Best way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok
review: The airport rail link is cheap (45 Baht from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport) air conditioned and efficient  30 minutes travel time and there are 8 stations on the line with the airport station being the eastern end of the line  It connects at Phaya Thai to the rest of the BTS system  There is also a connection with the MTR (the underground railway) at Makkasan which is especially useful  The only down side is that it is very busy and often crowded  so do not count on getting a seat  I always take this train and strongly recommend it  Note that this airport is Suvarnabhumi not Don Meuang although I understand that a line is under construction to Don Meuang also

title: Best way to airport
review: If you ever need to make it to the airport during heavy traffic rush hour try this BTS style train Can ride the express for a slightly more expensive fare or normal train From station near Asoke to airport in just about 1520 minutes(express)

title: Airport - City- hotel
review: Yes the biggest advantage when one travels in Airport Rail Link to city is it helps you to escape the torture of the road traffic & the killer speed that the taxi takes you on occasional free highways The Airport Link ends at Phaya Thai After that one has to change at least 1 3 trains to reach to wherever your hotel is located BKK is a tropical climate Its hot hotter and if one is coming form a long haul flight or a very short flight it will be very difficult Tickets at each station are auto vended The customer officer are well familiar to handle all kinds of queries One should reserve some additional energy to get in and out of trains depending on where your hotel is located and at what time your flight arrives If your flight is arriving between 8 pm  6 am just take the taxi it will be a breeze & you can catch some good lighting of the City and a power nap as well

title: Great for purpose
review: BTS is great for its purpose but doesn’t cover much ground in Bangkok but good for getting to and from the river which is where the transport is for the tourist attractions

title: Convenience in the busy city
review: Highly recommend Expensive but worth the ride Very clean and fast Better than tutuk and get scam

title: Use it
review: 35 Baht from the airport to Makassan and 16 Baht on the metro to our hotel each is way better than the 800 Baht taxi or 1500 Baht limo services

title: FAST WITH OUT TRAFFIC Jam
review: It is very convenient when we  wanna go to  Airports because it was very faster with out Traffic Jam may I suggest

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Train is a bit slowmoving  Otherwise it is well organised  Easy to buy ticket from Ticket booth wait not too long  Using the Ticket machines a bit more tricky due to change required (coins)  Beats the traffic during the rush hour especially town centre where the traffic jam will be horrific during the peak times  Convenient for going to Sukhumivit area where many of the shopping malls are interconnected eg Central Chilom etc One may want to use a combination of taxigrab car and the BTS MRT Offpeak taxigrab car is faster and inexpensive

title: Easy connection
review: Very easy connection between the airport and the city of Bangkok It's cheap and fast no trafficjam

title: Great option
review: Simple to use cheap to ride clean and thorough with a good Air Con system  Yay public transit thats good

title: conforable from airport to bangkok center
review: I think it so conforable I took the Airport link to the hotel at airport link rachaparong just 20min from airport

title: Easy and good way of traveling in Thailand
review: During my many times in Thailand I have been traveling a lot with the Thailand Railways twice to Hua Hin one time to Chiang Mai and one time to Chumphon It's a good and unique way of traveling and exploring I like to travel at daytime to see as most of the country as possible but if your main issue are just transport the nighttrain is a good option The long distance train like the one to Chiang Mai are quite good and take you through a fascinating landscape and the food ok The southern train to Hua Hin and Chumpon is medium but still ok It's a also a cheap way traveling and easy to buy ticket online but make sure you do it directly through Thailand State Railway and not all with the different companies who also want their share of the money

title: Efficient alternative to Thai traffic
review: Bangkok got their skytrain right It’s convenient and easy to use Even for us first timers taking this saves time and it is very efficient

title: Always terrible in rush hour
review: Don't even think to use from 8 am to 10 am as this is a time for Blue Collar to get to work in Bangkok and I used to wait for 2 hrs and 4 trains and I can not go anywhere  or do anything but wait

title: BTS Skytrain
review: The BTS Skytrain is inexpensive and easy to use Daily tickets are good value at 140 baht The Skytrain goes near many areas of interest to visitors

title: Great way to get around
review: Beats getting stuck in traffic I like the BTS better cause you're above ground but this is just as clean and easy to navigate Take public transportation when you can avoid a taxi

title: Avoid traffic jam
review: I try to use BTS as much as possible during our stay in Bangkok to avoid bad traffic jam in city of Bangkok I try to move with in the place where I can access with BTS or MRI

title: Great service
review: This is just the best way to get into town easy and cheap and fast You can get to any place you want  I will never book a car again

title: Easy way of getting around
review: I really enjoyed using the rail link good way of seeing the outer part of Bangkok and being overwhelmed by the skyline buildings (and the contrast with the old and sometimes ramshackled buildings right next to them)    Really easy to use  Work out what station you have to get off in order to get to your hotel  You may then need to utilise a tut tut or taxi to get you from the train station to your hotel   Was much less stressful than being in crazy Bangkok traffic for the whole duration of the journey from the airport to hotel

title: Fastest way around Bangkok!
review: The fastest and cheapest way to get around Bangkok Be warned  rush hour and weekends can get full If you're in Bangkok for 3+ days get a rabbit pass and avoid the lines

title: Good one
review: BTS is the best option if you want to be away from the Bangkok crazy traffic The route is easy to learn and almost stop by at almost all the famous Bangkok spot

title: First time but definitely not the last.
review: If you are not carrying a lot of luggage this is most definitely the way to travel from the airport Very fast and stress free and no KamiKaze taxi drivers I have been coming to Bangkok for years and this was the first time I used this very cheap service It definitely will not be the last

title: It was worth every penny! We highly recommend this tour!
review: We purchased the tour for the Train and the Floating Market I tour guide was Sara she was very understanding from the moment of booking and offering the best option for our pick up  we were staying at an Airbnb so we got picked up at a near hotel She was at a near hotel at 6 am sharp along with our driver Both of them were very organized   Sara offered a tour even when driving through Bangkok and on the way to the market I was not expecting to receive so much information from one tour She answered every question that my husband myself or the rest of our group had She gave us approximate prices when buying things at the markets so the sellers wouldn’t take advantage of the fact that we were tourists At the end of our tour Sara and the driver dropped us off closer to our Airbnb Sara gave us so much information about what places we should visit the next day and tips for transportation and costs   We are so happy to have booked this tour I was going to pay almost double the price on an Airbnb experience and I am happy I went with this instead I feel like I gained a lot of knowledge and would highly recommend for you to book it   Also thanks Sara for taking wonderful pictures of my husband and I We wish you the best

title: Great
review: The ants is really clean and a fast mode of getting around town Can recommend it In traffic a taxi would take an hour whereas the skytrain 10 min tops

title: One of the most convenient and hassle free mode to get you to heart of Bangkok
review: Will people who look for a convenient mode of hassle free transport this is the best option No need to be worried if you over paid the taxi driver no hassle of traffic comfortable air conditioned with relatively low ticket cost enjoy entering the city with fellow travelers from round the globe time just 30 Mins which would pass just like that

title: Excellent
review: Great inexpensive  way to get around Bangkok above the traffic and exhaust fumes and great views too It's easy once you realise there are only a couple of lines so you don't get lost The carriages are clean with aircon

title: Could of spent all day there.
review: We decided to go to this special place to get a better understand of what happened to the POW The museum tells the story of what happened and explains the history   The audio tour works in the museum and on the walk It's also free but bring Id  4k of the track is open to walk on bring could shoes and water  You need at least 4 hours here to walk the length of the track and see the museum

title: Great day visiting the markets
review: We had a great time on this tour visiting both markets Our guide Kay was so friendly and engaging She was very knowledgeable about both the markets and about other places to see in Bangkok too  We had a great time as did our 7 year old daughter  I would highly recommend this tour and definitely ask for Kay

title: Thai night market every wednesday
review: Night market in Thailand is something you must add to your "to do list" in Thailand Here you can buy about everything you dont need and even find something you need  aswell  Atmosphere is fantastic walk arround look bargain eat streetfood (I dont know it all and I dont eat it all) sit down and have something to drink

title: Gets you were you need to go
review: This is absolutely the best way to get around Bangkok and very cheap stops at all the popular venues interesting just to go for a bit of a look around the city

title: Perfect transportation
review: Great sky train clean quiet extremely  useful for normal travelers cheap transportation links all major shopping areas and party districts

title: Fabulous service
review: Excellent rail link from the airport to the city Fast clean and economical Links directly with the BTS which we used to get to our hotel When purchasing tickets a plastic "coin" is issued which you tap this on the way in through the turnstile then insert it on the way out when you exit Fares are based on distance traveled so this system ensures honesty And the "coins" are recycled

title: Cheap and good enough
review: Definitely does not have very high standards but it's cheap and works well so hopefully they finish building the line so that other people can explore more of Thailand on a budget

title: Best way to travel
review: Using MRT and BTS is best way to get around in this city Traffic crazy so get as close as you can with mass transit and walk or take a tuk tuk

title: BTS Skytrain Bangkok
review: If you want to travel quickly round Bangkok use the Skytrain Its cheap and comfortable and the trains run very regular so little waiting  Peak hours its crowded but what big city isn't at that time  Whilst it doesn't go everywhere its great for getting to major shopping and markets

title: Need For More Extensive Service
review: Clean efficient timely Unfortunately the newly completed MRT extensions still don't connect with other "offthebeaten" path places

title: Cheaper than cab
review: I reached airport on 23rd December and if you follow the signs you should be able to locate it  Due to the protest there was traffic jams at city areas  Thus it is more convenient to take the Train  It is cheap and i was able to get seats on the train  You need to know the name of the stations which you are going and may need to transfer at certain stations thus do your homework first or you can ask the helpful staff at the counter for directions

title: Travel with the locals in Bangkok.
review: The Skytrain rapid mass transport system is similar to London's underground except it travels above the main roads of Bangkok The tickets are easy to purchase and are excellent value for money All parts of the city and the airport are accessible At peak times it can be cozy

title: Comfortable clean way to travel around Bangkok
review: We loved riding on the Sky Train It is very clean comfortable spacious (even if it can be crowded) and cool with the AC Maybe a little too cool for shorts and a t shirt but we were not complaining to escape the heat for awhile It is a quick easy and cheap way to get around Would definitely recommend it The ticket windows just give you change in coins and tell you to buy your single ticket from the machine You can see the names of stations and how much it costs to get to each of them and then you just push that number and pay with your change The machine spits out a card and your change  You are not allowed to eat and drink in the Sky Train which is probably why it is so clean We took it around the centre and also to Chatuchak market

title: Convenient way to get around in a city with lots of traffic
review: Clean and secure and can get you to directly to the Suvarnabhumi Airport  There is a bus connection from Don Meong airport

title: A bit expensive for Bangkok but Very Helpful
review: Not much to say for reviewing a monorail But i will say I like that they don't print paper tickets they use these nifty chip coins that you scan and then deposit at the end of your fare The stations are clean and the people working in them are very helpful

title: Easy and cost effective transport
review: Take the train into the city and a taxi from there good quick way to get into town and avoid all the traffic

title: Forget taxis and traffic below this is the way to go
review: While the odd Tuk Tuk ride is a must  there really is no way better to get the best out of this city than hopping the Skytrain the views are fantastic and it all works relatively smoothly Well worth taking  day pass and then just getting on and off  from MBK to Paragon to Terminal 21 or Emporium thats just one easy line and one easy way to shop  There are many other lines and all with places worth jumping off  Grab a map and pick out a few then just hop on a go  forget the taxis and the traffic below this is the way to go

title: Fast way to get around
review: It is not easy to get around in Bangkok the traffic can be terrible So  Skytrain could be a good solution It is fast and takes you to all major places To find the right way to go and enter the train is not always that easy But ask around and you will get some help The same goes for buying tickets not always easy

title: Sometimes a great way to get to the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is an inexpensive and quick way to get to Suwannaphum Airport but is not for everybody  If you have a lot of luggage better to take a taxi  And it is still a long walk from the airport station to the actual airport

title: Fast track to Suvarhnabumi Aiport at a budget
review: A pleasant 30 mins train ride from Ratchapraprop station to the airport The cost was only 40 baht per way per pax minus the traffic jams or unscrupulous taxi drivers I would recommend anyone to just catch a tuk tuk or taxi to one of the airport rail stations and catch the train to the airport

title: Good Connectivity for major places in bangkok
review: One can skip Taxi fair and take the Airport link to reach to anywhere near by to the city it allows you to connect to BTS skytrain

title: Excellent transportation but crowded
review: The sky train is an excellent way to get around Bangkok  During rush hours it always standing only but the few seats are usually given up to the elderly  In nonrush hours you can get an overview of the city by taking each of the trains which cover the majority of the city and usually get a seat  If you do not get a seat there is no crown crushing on you like durning rush hour

title: Fast to go!
review: Very nice transportation system in bangkok  my advise if you go on group two or more better check out taxi  i used the rome 2 rio to compare my journey anhwhere in bkk and it works well  I travelled number of 2 and we ended up mostly taking taxi as the cost is pretty much same (depends from and to where) again  please check your distance and see the cost  Here I post the taxi meter fare   Also consider take the yellow green taxi  They never say no  never refused and always use meter no matter how near the destination

title: Nice!
review: Its not that cheap i compare with indonesia train😅 But the train on time (late several minutes its no problem) and the people dicipline with the line

title: Fast and Easy
review: easy cheap reliable clean not too busy  nice to see the countryside while relaxing better than a cab  cheap 90 Baht 2 people

title: Love it
review: So wonderful Very fast and convinient I offen use BTS to travel when i go to Thailand Just need small amount

title: All the shopping malls
review: Yes that's right visit all of the easily and cheaply from this little baby Stay at the Pathuwan princess hotel at MBK

title: So easy
review: Best way to cross the city cheap and easy to use Too bad it does not serve the most touristic areas of Bangkok (Royal Palace etc)

title: Long but fun tour!
review: Kiwi is the best She did such a good job taking care of silly tourists I’ve never seen a tour guide work and care so much about their group She made the experience a very pleasant experience Will totally be recommending it to others

title: best way around the city
review: BTS is a very good way to travel around the city and avoid traffic It is cheap but sometimes crowded

title: Great link into City
review: Journey cost around £1 each and service very good Great to then catch the metro or local services  If a family might be easier to get a taxi at an agreed rate

title: Very practicle and easy to go around the town
review: Its like any other MetroMRTTube in the world it is very simple and convinent  They do have a smart card as well they give you the coins( exchange for notes) to buy the ticekts from the machine We enjoyed our journes

title: Get the Rabbit card
review: I'm a frequent visitor to Bangkok (almost monthly at this point) and the Rabbit card and BTS are timesavers Though there are almost always long linesqueues at the BTS sticket machines this can be avoided with the purchase of the stored value Rabbit card It's 100THB for the card and the minimum deposittop up is 100THB The Rabbit can also be used at places like McDonald's to pay for food similar to HK's Octopus card which makes it useful for when you don't want to faff around with cash Once in a while there'll be some special edition Rabbit cards available that you might fancy  I've a Kumamon Rabbit card in addition to the regular adult card

title: Cheap way to get into town
review: A taxi to the airport will cost about 300 baht in light traffic where this train is about 50 baht or something like that Just go to the end station and get a taxi onwards from there save some money and in peak traffic periods some time

title: Skytrain
review: So easy to use and got to where we needed to go  Very convenient and airconditioned  Usually quite busy but that was no hassel

title: Cheapest way to get to Bangkok
review: Lot of people use this train and it is usually full The trip to the BKK takes about half an hour and you may depart at different locations some of them connected to other public transport services like the Sky Train and the Metro It's a good idea to check the map and plan where you want to depart

title: easy way to get around town
review: During traffic hours this is the way to get around the city But during down time it is actually cheaper to take a metered taxi

title: Brilliant way to get to airport.
review: This is a cheap and brilliant way to get to the airport particularly during the road traffic busy times The only downside is if you have too much luggage which is difficult to manage on potentially busy Sky Trains before you join the Airport Rail Link

title: The best of the worst
review: Congested confusing ticket vending machines missing too many escalatorsbut the alternative is to face Bangkok horrible traffic jam so no choices really

title: U can ignore traffic
review: Skytrains are really good Though not cheap for short distance if compared to Taxi when you are travelling as a couple or in a  group

title: Good mode of transport
review: Had been using the Airport Rail Link as next option to the taxis  A better option if you do not wish to get caught in the crazy infamous traffic jam  There are two type of services available the Airport Express Link and the Airport CIty Link  Frequency for the Express link are fewer  Is easy to use and convenient as there are stations that are connected to BTS (Phaya Thai) or MrT (Phetchaburi)    Do note that the local people also use the airport rail link heavily especially the city link during peak hour from 17002000hrs so do give yourself some time buffer if you are using it to catch your plane  Whole journey from Makkasan station to Suvarnabhumi Airport took around 30minutes

title: easy to do even for foreigners
review: Being a public transport taker myself it felt normal and nice to take the public transport I would suggest it as it is much cheaper and there are no tourist seeking people there trying to rip you off

title: Excellent
review: Extremely clean Puncture You either pay at a computer terminal and select station then receive coin token tap ontop gate to enter put in gate to exit Or get the MRT card and top up the card to avoid queues for  token machine  English language is widely used on signage  Security cards search your bag (briefly) and you walk through airport type metal detector  Value for money some exits only have stairs and others have escalators elevators

title: Best transport
review: If you want to travel the whole city at a cheaper price and faster then this is the best option Bcoz traffic in bangkok is worse I would suggest you to stay at siam if you want to travel by train Siam is well connected with all the train routes

title: great way to see Bangkok
review: I travelled from the airport to the city centre of Bangkok got to say it is worth it just to see the parts of Bangkok you would miss if you travel by taxi all the signs are in English and you can easy work out how to change trains to get into the city centre Trains have air con and are all very clean give it a try and you will see more of the city

title: Good Experience
review: Very clean and fast trains with a smooth ride It allows you to get from one side of the city to the other in minutes bypassing all of the traffic Impressive

title: User friendly
review: Was impressed with the overall BTS experience  It was safe affordable and convenient Coming from a city where the train system was effective one takeaway about the BTS was how quiet it is  At times it seemed like we were floating on air    If you are scared that you will get lost do not worry  The staff at the stations were accommodating and helpful in directing us to our desired stop

title: Excellent and on time
review: Great to take BTS in Bangkok for all the destination it save time and avoid traffic Some station is located within walking distance to few mega shopping  or district

title: Great way to beat the traffic
review: Very quick journey to the city centre and very good value for money Connects to the BTS which is less than 100m away much better alternative to taking a taxi or car transfer which could result in sitting in one on Bangkok's infamous traffic jams

title: Quick and cheap!
review: Easy way to get around the huge city that is Bangkok Is very clean and modern and astonishingly cheap

title: Fast and reliable sardine can on rails
review: This is such a great way to get around Bangkok and I'm not usually one for public transport What with the traffic getting more and more congested in Bangkok city taxis though comfortable are slow and expensive The BTS Skytrain is fast and reliable with trains every 10 or 15 minutes  On the downside queuing for tickets and then having to stand on the usually packed train isn't great but considering how quickly they can get you around the city I don't mind

title: Very good but very busy
review: Very fast and easy way to get places in the big Bangkok area but at the rush hour your packed like sardines in a can The price is also not too bad

title: way to bypass bangkok traffic
review: not really cheap if you are a group of 4 or more but definitely saves time specially during peak hoursjust expect to squeeze in since it can also be jampacked during rush hours

title: Convenient and cheap.
review: Cabins are clean and train times are frequent Highly recommended over taxi due to the horrendous traffic jams in BKK

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Fast comfortable and efficient There are two types of train here Rapid and normal all at low prices Cheaper and faster than taxis Avoid peak times 710am and 47pm

title: Nice experience !
review: We took the train BangkokChiang Mai twice Even if the train can ''shake'' sometimes we slept very well As other reviews have said the lowerbed provides more space It is a good alternative if you have the time You even save on a night at the hotel The train and all its facilities are very clean

title: Easy to use
review: Bts train covers a big area of bangkok and is very cheap and easy to use  i recommend using it as you will reach your location in no time while enjoying a tour inside bangkok

title: Great Connectivity..
review: To avoid traffic in Bangkok the best way to travel is using the Sky trainGreat connectivity and covenient Super fast and cheap and clean trains

title: Super economical and fast
review: What’s the fastest way to into City from Suvarnabhumi Airport RAIL LINK was fast and easy if you have the hotel within walking distance from the nearest station then you are set to arrive without any fuss at super budgetit costs me 20 times in my hometown airport rail link

title: Clean and cheap
review: It's clean and affordable The staff will clean it at the last station before allowing passengers to board It's fast and a cheap way to get around Bangkok You can just purchase a token at the ticket machine and hover the token over to 'tap in' at the gantry

title: Easy to and no worry getting into BKK cities
review: Once you arrive at  Suvarnabhumi airport Do go down to the basement  If you not sure do look out on the sign board which will guide you to the airport link (ARL)  Queue up to buy the token (ticket) which cost 45baht to get into Praya Thai station which is interchange with BTS For those accommodation is nearby

title: Really easy
review: Train station situated beneath airport accessed via escalators  Regular trains clean excellent value Link easily with Skytrain system

title: Easy Peasy
review: Super easy to get anywhere on this train You see yourself on the map find the location where you are going  punch the location # into the machine and it tells you how much the fare is put the money in & you get a ticket to where you are going round trip Its that easy Even I could do it

title: Fast and efficient but very crowded at times!
review: This is the best way to get around as the roads are jam packed all day The trains are sometimes very crowded and it mostly standing only but they run frequently and it's pretty cheap Seems to cover a huge area lots of options to get around the City Worth a try anyway it's good fun if nothing else

title: Cheap, easy and efficient way of getting to the city centre
review: 45B and 30 minutes later I arrived at Phaya Thai and was a 2 minute walk to my hostel (via a McDonalds for an ice cream how cultured) Easy to find in the airport although involves a fair bit of walking Organised queuing system when boarding Was able to get a seat most times  Trains are every 10 minutes

title: Easy to use
review: Good way to stay out of traffic and get around town quickly   Easy to use   It's public transportation What else is there to say

title: Easy to use
review: Catch the train on the lower level of the airport and you can be in city centre within 25 minutes  Be sure to confirm which station you need to disembark then just catch a taxi or tsk to your hotel  It's easy and cheap and you don't have to sit in Bangkok traffic which can be a nightmare

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: Thailand traffic can be a nightmare And having ridden a few cabs I must say you almost feel like you're putting your life at risk in every ride (They tend to speed up at curves and don't mind going on counterflow to do overtakes)  But when I discovered the BTS it was just great Affordable convenient and timesaving

title: Easy
review: A really efficient way to get around and see the skyline of the cityEasy to understand ticket system and inexpensive

title: Chiang Mai to Uttaradit by Day is a must
review: Taking the train from Chiang Mai is great Better to do this during the day and with refreshment facilities available The stations you pass through reminded me of some you see in Switzerland  very neat and tidy  and even some that existed in the UK before the railway network was decimated in the Beeching era It is interesting to watch the local Thais on the train as this attracts many people with the fares being reasonably cheap I returned by bus which took 4 hours  much quicker than by train  but not half as fascinating Well worthwhile

title: Amazing day
review: Amazing day Sara was an incredible guide with excellent local knowledge and the train and floating markets are a must see

title: The only sensible way to travel around Bangkok
review: Cheap convenient and clean don't travel at rush hour unless you enjoy getting really close to other people

title: Best way from Airport into the city
review: Once you get the knack of it and you choose a hotel near a terminal its a piece of cake getting into the city for less than $2

title: On time & good alternative
review: We used the speed train from MBK to catch a river ferry reasonable price and bang on time did not have to waste time in traffic

title: best way to move around bangkok
review: the skytrain takes you wherever you need to go in Bangkok Its very cheap and its airconditioned Its also spacious I never feel clautrophobic inside even when its full There is a stop near every main shopping area

title: Convenient
review: Great way to travel into the city and beat the traffic The train is clean fast and well maintained

title: Superb, fun and safe floating market and railway martlet trip
review: Caring and Professional service provided by our  knowledgeable n experienced tour guide Sarah Our driver Poyfai is very experienced as well and very careful Highly recommended👍👍👍👍👍

title: Excellent Service
review: Brilliant quality service Always very busy but trains run on a regular basis Very good air conditioning and trains all in excellent condition

title: Fast safe and punctual
review: Must not miss try getting on an mrt and you will forget all the traffic can get you to most places of interest 55555555

title: Awful
review: Awful child policy They charge even for children 23 years old as for adults and even if the children are sleeping in your arms BTS and MRT are OK only Airport Link has this stupid policy

title: Easy to use, fast
review: From the USA and it was super easy to use the sky train  figure out where you are going go up to the window and buy your ticket get on and go  Maps in the train make it easy to know when to get off  very clean and safe feeling

title: good and cheap
review: sky train is long all thailand very easy to go and cheap price for travel it faster if you go by taxi or train helpful with all people

title: Excellent system
review: Went on the skytrain on its inaugural trip and hundreds of times since Clean and easy to use Discount if over 65 Cheap if compared to taxis and so much faster Works well with the underground system

title: Very convenient and cheap
review: Really convenient to travel between central Bangkok and the airport Needed to walk outdoor a bit to change trains from MTR to ARL but it was ok in the temperature in January In hotter seasons it would cause some trouble

title: Efficient and affordable
review: We traveled from our hotel in the city to the airport using this and were very happy with the cost and service Its by far the easiest and cheapest (and often fastest) way to get to the airport The maps in the stations are clear to use If you can navigate the London underground you'll be fine hereif not you'll probably be fine too

title: Great Service
review: Convenient and always running not like the rest of Bangkok Great to get anywhere especially the boat's on the river and for Shopping Also very good to get to the train to the Airport which is much faster then by Road

title: Value of your Money.
review: Great service great value for money Good connection allover the city Fabulous and very impressive fair chart

title: Cheapest way to travel in Bangkok
review: This is the most affordable fastest and safest way to travel in Bangkok  Easy to use and get to all areas

title: Fast Travel
review: A very fast way to get around The stations are air conditioned and provide relief from the heat Great to get to where you want to go and good when used in conjunction with BTS at interchange stations For example we went from Silom to terminal 21 in 12 minutes then took a 2 minute BTS ride to Nana too easy

title: Easiest way to group and down Surkumvit
review: Very efficient way to go from one shopping area to another Be sure and have thevrightbchange for purchase of tickets by machine  Gets full at certain times which means you are often standing during your journey Lots of grab rails do no problem

title: Easy to use and fast but ..
review: Clean fast and easy to use but expensive compared to taxis and tut tutts Limited options as to where you can travel to also makes it limited in its use

title: cheap easy and clean
review: It's a shame that Europe does not seem able to build such an efficient cheap and fast public transport For sure the quickest ride through Bangkok and the views are also cool from such elevated level Highly recommended

title: Easy to use and travel the city
review: We normally catch taxi's but used the MRT because its easier to access Terminal 21  it was so easy and cheap

title: A great way to travel to the airport at the start/end of your holiday to Bangkok
review: The airport link is always busy Add in normal computers with travellers and their luggage and it can get chaotic but wow it's a great way to start your holiday  Cheaps and quick and cleaner than B500 that would will be changed by a normal taxi

title: Useful Link
review: The link is easy to reach from other public transport the express link is not in use as I write but the 'nonexpress' train is equally as efficient  just takes a little longer The link arrives in the airport and it is 6 floors up to reach departures  just know thisif you have suitcases to carry

title: simple quick and efficient
review: easy and cheap way to get into the centre of Bangkok at 45 baht They run approx every 20 minutes can get very busy though

title: gyoles skytrain
review: We loved using the Skytrain as it was central to where we stayed and it got us everywhere Purchasing tickets was very easy and detailed The trains themselves were very clean and tidy Overall definitely recommend using them to get around

title: Quick, clean, on-time
review: Best way to get to the airport in rush hour it's quick and clean and cheaper than a taxi Nice and comfortable too

title: Do not miss this tour!
review: Amazing tour The tour guide was an incredible person and very helpful informative and funny (her name was Tammy)  Worth every penny

title: A historically loaded train ride
review: Anyone who knows the story of the Death Railway (how the Japanese forced allied soldiers (and civilians) to build this railway under terrible conditions many lives lost will feel the weight of the experience when riding the train but will also marvel at how beautiful the surroundings are It is certainly an experience that one should not miss A must for students of history

title: Can't fault it
review: Not much to say other than its easy to get to from arrivals easy to use cheap and take you to the centre of Bangkok

title: So conveneint
review: No need to waste time and money with taxi when you can use this great facility to connect with city center  better to not have a lot of luggage with you depending of the time in the day it can be faster than using a cab and much cheaper  very convenient clean and safe

title: Fast and safe
review: I took the train from the airport to Phaya Thai which is fairly central It is fast clean and I felt quite safe having all my belongings on me I have been ripped off my taxis on previous visits in the past so this is a great improvement

title: Skytrain
review: The BTS Skytrain is the best quietest mode of transportation in Bangkok  It is inexpensive and reliable way to cross a major metropolitan city It is easy to understand easy to navigate and nicely air conditioned  If you get off at the wrong platform you can change trains without buying another fare In many cases it is directly connected to the larger stores and malls it also has a number of connecting points with the subway

title: Awesome!
review: Its fast efficient and extremely cheap If you're staying close by it makes no sense to take a taxi

title: Great for a foreign tourist.
review: Efficient cheap and convenient  We actually took it from the airport and it was extremely efficient  We made one change of trains at main station and was dropped off less than 200 paces from our Marriott hotel  Used it several times in Bangkok and was easy and cheap

title: Airport Rail Link- So Convenient and Efficient!
review: The traffic in Bangkok is one of the busiest in the world When I arrived in Bangkok I used the Airport Rail Link to get to the station near the end of the line From that station I walk 5 minutes to arrive at the home I was staying for the next 30 days The whole trip took 20 minutes but if I had taken a taxi from the airport it would have taken over 15 hours to get to my destination Along with the BTS SkyTrain and the MRT Subway I used it extensively to get around town and avoid the horrible traffic by car taxi motorcycle taxi TukTuk or local bus Bangkok has a fantastic and highly efficient transportation system

title: Great if it goes where you are going
review: The airport rail link is a swift connection to the central business district However it only has 8 stations The first 4 are in the eastern most suburbs of Bangkok and likely not very useful to tourists Like most of Bangkok's infrastructure it does not connect or connect well with many places the visitor may wish to go That will hopefully change some years from now as planned infrastructure gets built but as of now it is limited You cannot get to Don Mueng the former international and now low cost air hub in northern Bangkok on it It is difficult to get to the main railway station especially if you are carrying baggage It gets closer to but not really with convenient connections to the many low cost places to stay near the Grand Palace or the tourist sites clustered there With the new line which connects to NW Bangkok it does offer a swifter way to travel If you are going to the area near the Grand Palace take the dedicated bus (S1  60baht) from the airport bus station if you are a solo traveler If there are more than 2 of you take a taxi When going to the airport it is worthwhile considering taking a taxi from your point of origin to the nearest airport link station because once you are there you know you won't get caught in a traffic jam on your way to the airport If going to any flight from either airport and you have to arrive around rush hour (morning or evening) leave well before that time

title: The fastest way around town
review: this rapid transit train handles hundreds of thousands of people with ease Ticketing is simple and cheap it gets you to the major parts of Bangkok quickly so it is not to bad to be crammed in between certain stations Getting stuck is traffic is avoided and it is easy to read the maps Sky walks also allow you to get across busy intersections with ease

title: Cleanest skytrain I've ever seen
review: Great mean to get across Bangkok and beat the crazy traffic Is the cleanest skytrain I've even seen  Easy to use and inexpensive  Downsize the ticket machines only take coins  There are tickets booths but lines are usually very long

title: Easy and quick
review: Although the train does not go to all places in Bangkok it goes to most It is easy to navigate and is much better than taking a taxi which will cost you triple and take 10x's the amount of time the train will

title: Great way to travel around the city
review: MRT is the fastest way to get around bangkok taking you around the city's key areas it is easy to navigate and use

title: Public Transport !!!!
review: Good and cheap service in BangkokDay pass is very feasible for tourists  140 Baht per day  you can use only for particular day for which will issue BTS have 2 tracks and can interconnect each other at SIAM station and can interchange with Airport Rail Link from Phaya Thai station

title: Best way to roam around
