review: It is a comfortable way to roam around in Bangkok loved it But would suggest not to use with luggage as it has lot of stairs and not all are automatic  Also the price is not very low it's actually comparable to taxi for two

title: really good
review: great to get from the airport and back if staying in bangkokcheap tooand no hassle of getting stuck in traffic in a taxi

title: One of the four best ways of getting around Bangkok
review: The BTS is one of the most expensive public transports in Asia Having said that it still incredibly cheap for the ease of travel that it provides

title: Fast way to go airport
review: This is the fastest way from BTS Phayathai to Suvanabhum airport But it always have a problem with their system Sometime you need to wait around1530mins if it's a rush hour Please carefully check for the time and their service

title: Sky train.
review: We took it onceCrowded with ppl bt it was a fun experienceWe was on a marked thereAnd then we took the train back again 2 the Emporium mall

title: Reliable and easy to figure out
review: We took the link from Petchaburi the connection is not too long to walk with bulky lugggages The train is a good way to beat the jam and reach the airport on time to catch your plane

title: sky train Bangkok
review: very good and cheap way to travel around Bangkok If travelling with several people you may prefer to take a taxi

title: Easy access -clean- cool and they have a daily pass option
review: The Skytrain was within walking distance from our hotel (about 3 blocks)  The signage was pretty straightforward  There are booths to get change for the ticket machines  And you have the option of getting an all day pass with unlimited rides or buying single tickets  We were able to go to the river in airconditioned comfort

title: Visit to the Grand Palace
review: Would recommend taking the BTS to the river front station for the ferry to the palace saves time and is extremely convenient ( albeit slightly crowded)

title: Easy way to explore Bangkok
review: By BTS you can explore Bangkok easily but beware of the strong air con bring something to cover you up especially for children if you don't want to get cold For the price 140 bath for 1 day package to go to allover station  or you also can by one way ride ticket too

title: One of the most efficient metros i have ever travelled
review: Though it does not meet the sophisticated ariin of german city metrosthis is by far one of the most efficient i have travelled inMake sure you take a rabbit card that helps you to wish pass the queues in the peak hours and you are at your destination in not timeThat too in good Ac And mostly services all the major areas in the cityStops at most Malls and shopping destinationsclean and the people are very cooperativeWemen and children are given preference of seatingAnd they observe it strictlyIt's difficult to get a seat if you are not boarding the starting placeBut either directionsYou will get mostly get a seat when you reach SiamThe central shopping location where all the malls are locatedin shortAll the tourist destinations in the city are well connected with the BTS and they are doing a very good job with freequent trains and managing the crowd efficiently

title: Quick to central Bangkok
review: Good way of transporting yourself into Bangkok from international airport Suvarnabhumi depending on where you’re going you can change to skytrain boat or train at different stations

title: Convenient but Cramped.
review: Our experience is limited to the BTS line on Sukhmuvit Road and we used this to travel from the Marriott Hotel (south on Sukhmuvit)  to the MBK Centre (National Stadium Station) which is further North  It's a really convenient way to get about but the carriages are always jam packed so not making for a real pleasant experience  Pricing for 5 people was a shade cheaper than the taxi but it's nigh enough impossible to get about quickly in a cab owing to local traffic  In summary a quick convenient and affordable way to travel if you don't mind jam packed carriages

title: Siam transfers confusing
review: Be careful when transferring as the set up is unlike most metros Good idea to take a picture of a subway map so you can check your phone while riding before you arrive at Siam

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use and very cheap we paid less than £2 to get to the Chao Phraya River dock for the hop on hop off boats

title: Convenient & reliable commuter transport network
review: Stations are clean safe and commuter friendly Some stations with escalators and all with elevators Operation of train effective and reliable

title: Effective and efficient way to travel
review: This was close by for us to utilise and very handy in getting around  Not having been in Bangkok before and unsure of what to expect So easy to use  get the ticket and travel Nice and clean  fast and would recommend

title: nice help for Bangkok congestion
review: We rode this across town a few times It can get crowded at peak times like trains anywhere I lived in Bangkok before the skytrain  was built and I believe it has been a fantastic benefit for moving people around

title: Fantastic tour and guide.
review: Sara was fantastic So friendly and entertaining She kept us informed and happy the whole day All the instructions were clear of what to expect The trip was exactly as promised would highly recommend

title: An awesome, air conditioned, easy way to get around Bangkok!
review: Once we'd tried the Skytrain we barely caught another cab We went south all the way to the end of the line when heading to the Ancient City and north to JJ Market as well as many shorter trips in between  Once you know to have change for the ticket machines & work out how to buy the tickets (pretty simple) the rest is a breeze For those used to waiting for trains you'll be pleased at how often the Skytrains run Don't worry if you miss one as another will be along in just a few minutes  The air con on board is very cool you might even need a cardigan if you feel the cold Most carriages have electronic boards tv's showing ads (quite an amusing way to pass the time) and Thai & English announcements at & between stations  The Skytrain is a very easy way to get around the city & is generally cheaper than the super cheap Bangkok taxis & we didn't find them crowded as they can be in some Asian destinations The only drawback could be for thos who are not ambulatory as there are generally stairs involved in using the Skytrain  although they're not steep and are fitted with hand rails on both sides as well as down the centre of the stairs in most cases  Avoid the traffic & give it a try you'll be pleasantly surprised

title: Bangkok BTS “Skytrain”
review: Crowded at peak travel times but otherwise comfortable although on needs to stand most of the time due to limited seating capacity  never mind it gets you from A to B in cool airconditioned comfort in no time “flying” over the traffic jams and gridlocks below   Combined with the MRT underground network it’s a great way to travel within the city and to some suburban areas whether on business or sightseeing

title: Speedy transport
review: The BTS Skytrain is the fastest and most convenient way of getting around in Bangkok Its also very clean and efficient

title: Extremely Convenient!
review: A nice light railway system Trains come frequently even during the late evening hours and fully air conditioned The stations signs are clear and ticket machines are also in English Staff is helpful and the announcements on the trains are in both Thai and English

title: Take this, don't bother with a taxi!
review: Taxi wanted $400 baht to get into city this was $70 baht to the exact same location in same time Clean and convenient best way into the city

title: Fast and easy
review: One of the nicest pieces of public transport you could ever wish to use

title: Travel quickly and without pain!
review: Can not recommend this mode of transport more highly  Cheap fast and easy to use  Just find the ticket machine tap where you want to go it'll tell you the fee (not much) put your coins in and hey presto there's your ticket

title: Night Market Cha Am
review: Came here by mini van from HotelThe Regent Beach you can also get taxi's It is a very big market that is held on Wednesday night's Everything you can think offooddvd'sclothing live animalsbugs to eat copies of phone's watches and tshirts some good qualitysome notFood stalls galorelocalbars selling beer and soft drinks cheaply It is near to Cha Am railway station and is well worth a visit for a good night out

title: one of the best transportation ways in Bankgok
review: the Skytrain is now for years my favorite transportation in Bangkok clean fast and you can reach most sights or shopping center by the Skytrain If you are travelling a lot buy a "one day pass" for about THB14000 per person and you can travel all day by train this is about US$400

title: Easiest Way to travel around Bangkok
review: As Bangkok have bad traffic jams during peak hours if you want to get around to places it's the best to take the Skytrain It's easy and hasslefree to go to popular sightseeing places and downtown

title: Convenient and Time saving
review: It's convenient and time saving to choose BTS Not recommend during peak hours because it's so crowded

title: Fast way to the Capital or your plane
review: For years the taxi provided the only way to get from the airport to central Bangkok and beyond but thanks to the Rail link that's all changed The taxi will still get you there (outside 1st floor taxi ranks) but taxi a trip by liftvor escalator to the Airports basement and jump on the Rail link for a fast and pleasant alternative and at a much cheaper price in most cases The rail link provides trains from early morning until around midnight right into the airport and from its connecting terminal at the BTS Skytain stop of Phya Thai it costs just 45 baht  The days of sitting in a taxi in rush hour are gone thankfully Most visitors would rather reach their destination in the quick air conditioned train than pay the average 500600 baht to look at the motorway  Give it a try and I think you will agree which is the better option if you've just got off a long haul flight

title: Airport Rail to City Bangkok
review: Take to train cheaper and faster then taxi from Makkasan or at the end of the line or just connect to  other line

title: Extremely convenient and cheap!
review: I used this to get everywhere as a primary means of travel and only in some cases combined it with cabs or river boats for the last mile  Very well designed system with the traveller in mind  Clean on time combined with the usual Thai manners (they queue before the train arrives and gives up seats readily)  fantastic experience  The 1 day pass is great  Take note the BTSSkytrain is different from the MRTMetro Airport Rail Link etc Currently the card bought for one system cannot be used for the others

title: God's gift to visitors
review: I remember sometime in the nineties looking out of the window of the Pan pacific hotel (now Westin Grande Sukhumvit) and watching the trains do trial runs up and down several times a day When it finally opened it ran from Mo Chit to On Nut on the Sukhumvit Line and from National Stadium to Saphan Takhsin on Silom Line Since then both the lines have expanded including many places otherwise too distant for tourists Now with a smart pass and a few days to kill it is wonderful to leave the bustling Bangkok behind and comfortably explore its quiet and quaint suburbs for a real taste of Thailand ( I discovered Samrong this visit) which is next to impossible without the ease comfort and economy of the Skytrain

title: BKK Skytrain
review: If it goes where you want to go then it is the best bargain in town  Crowded yes  And fast

title: Fast, comfortable, inexpensive
review: The Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok City is fast (about 30 mins) reliable and at 45 Baht (2017) per person to Phaya Thai Station the last stop on the line relatively cheap  For those going to hotels in middle Sukhumvit Road get off at "Makassan" where you can connect to the underground line MRT at Phetchaburi (about 35 mins walk between stations separate tickets) Those going to Khao San Road area get off at Phaya Thain (final stop) and catch a taxi (avoid touts waiting at the station) Get one that just offloaded passengers have your hotel adress in Thai writing on hand and insist on using the taxameter  Also to the Silom Road and lower Sukhumvit area stay on to Phaya Thai and change to the BTS skytrain (separate tickets)  When travelling in groups of three or more a taxi directly from (or to) Suvarnabhumi Airport may be more economical and saves dragging your bags around Especially during  rushhours  however it can be much slower too

title: Excellent way to get around bustling Bangkok
review: Easy to navigate very cost effective with welcoming air conditioning  We were about to take a cab on our first day in Bangkok to the local mall then our hotel staff advised us to take the sky train instead fantastic advice  we used the sky train every day after that They line up to enter the skytrain which makes things very orderly

title: Not to recommend with a Baby stroller!
review: The skytrain is a cheap and quick way to get from one place to another My problem was that I had to bring a baby stroller and there's  quite a few stations exits without elevators or at least escalators🙁

title: Easy to use and cheap! AC is a plus!
review: Easy to use and cheap AC is a plus Kiosks and ticket counters make buying tickets convenient They ahve options for singleuse roundtrip and daypasses

title: Easy and fast
review: I always use the BTS skytrain when I'm in BKK It's easy and quick It's better alternative to taxi or bus Because of the traffic in Bangkok it's better u travel with BTS

title: It's the best way to go to the city from the airport or vice verse
review: The train was comfortable and fast  There are a few stops but in general it takes about 30 minutes from the airport to the city center of Bangkok From there you can either transfer to a subway or take a taxi  It's very convenient and it is so affordable too

title: Good system - hard to get a ticket
review: We loved the BT skytrain  once we got on  We found it very difficult to get a ticket  The gal in the booth took our money gave back change and motioned us aggressively to go over there to the machine  Right  What  Fortunately someone spoke english and told us she had changed our paper money into coins so we could use it in the machine and that she couldn't sell us a ticket for where we were going that we had to use the machine  Phew That was difficult and all the machines are not in english (that we could tell anyway)  So this person helped and with the right push of the buttons we got our ticket and on the train

title: express not working
review: since dec 2014 the airport express raillink is not working no sign nothing and this in a city like bangkok one has to take the publik raillink which takes 45 min to the city and is mostly crowded the express train took 15min only to phya thai station in the center

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: This is an ideal way to get around Bangkok Clean efficient and runs every 5 minutes or so  Great addition to the public transport in Bangkok

title: Preferred cheap travel
review: Skytrain save your Bahts in Bangkok n take you almost to all attractions if well planned One thing trouble some for Vegetarians is to find good veg Foodsyet on searching we could find it in Indian restaurants

title: Got us from A-B very quickly
review: Easy to purchase tickets and use maps in stations to navigate around Only used a couple of times as we walked a lot Good to get from Chatuchak weekend market back to Siam station and wall back to city centre

title: Fastest way to get around in traffic congested Bangkok
review: BTS skytrain for me is the best way to travel in Bangkok Taking a taxi may seem easy but the constant traffic jams can make your journey very slow You can never know how much time you are spending for a few kilometers in a taxi when the train gets you there in a flash

title: Clean and convenient!
review: Clean air conditioned easy way to get from point A to point B quickly Somewhat simple to figure out and use

title: Great
review: To get around this is the best way to travel  especially at busy times when the traffic is bad it is clean and efficient

title: Cheap and convenient
review: While staying Sukhumvit we caught the MRT to Chatuchak and Cultural centre It was one of the cheapest modes of transport in Bangkok much faster than travelling by taxi and less crowded than the BTS We waited less than 5 mins before the train arrived  Unfortunately you do sacrifice the views though

title: Great and fast way to cross Bangkok
review: Although slightly more expensive than taxi or Tuktuk it is the most convenient transport by far  Well organised fully automated all doors line up exactly with markings on the platform  Commuters are well behaved polite  Trains and stations are unbelievably clean

title: Fast and easy
review: Easy to find Quick way to get to the city Regular or express line You can connect to regular mrt network on some stations Ticket costs 140  160 T$

title: Cheap travel...but
review: This is a good way to get from the airport to Bangkok city centre Compared to English public transport it's incredibly cheap (one person can travel into the centre for about £1) and easy to transfer between trains if you're used to travelling on similar city transport systems My issue with operation is that it's not particularly fast and trains do not run as frequently as they could Trains were often very busy due to the gap between services When you're used to London Underground services running every couple of minutes this service comes across as restrictedbut great value for money

title: Brilliant
review: We loved BTS because is a fast way to move around avoiding traffic and caos in Bangkok  It’s quite chilly inside take a light jumper if you are going for a long ride

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Faster than taxi's but limited stations and can get busy during rush hours It is the faster alternative if your destination is on the line

title: Great for getting around the city on congested days

title: Wierd
review: Who is this service serving Some platforms had a lift while others did not Now if one were in a wheel chair and had got up on to the platform by lift and had then travelled to a destination that did not have one then your only option would be to go back to where you started We had a baby in a buggy and I have to say we soon gave up using the sky train as we were exhausted carrying the baby and buggy up and down two huge flights of stairs every time And the payment system is odd Unless you had copious amounts of coinage one had to go to the ticketing counter which asked you your destination how many people were travelling and then given the right amount of change for you to then have to go to the machine  to drop in those coins for your tickets Why not just hand over the money at the ticketing counter and get your ticket rather than a bunch of coins for you to get your own ticket A very odd system

title: Excellent Inexpensive Pleasant Mode of Travel
review: The idea of using the Skytrain (having repeatedly experienced London Underground) due to not speaking or understanding the Thai language was daunting However it was a great way to travel  so easy and very inexpensive   The purchasing of tickets was very straight forward We told the ticket attendant where we wanted to go and were notified of the cost you purchase for one way travel and purchase the return ticket when travelling back Very Inexpensive   Civilised queuing method  one behind the other rather than the London Underground method of horizontally along the platform therefore naturally requiring passengers waiting to allow those off the train before getting on  Directions for travel well signposted to explain which platform for destination Very helpful staff to direct when tourists seemed unsure Great experience and excellent way to travel Definitely recommend

title: A Major Component Of How I Beat Bangkok's Infamous Traffic Jams
review: I am a lifetime resident of Bangkok I love this vibrant city but I (like all rational people) absolutely hate its horrendous traffic jams Which is why I do not drive in the city any more In fact I avoid road transportation (eg taxis and buses) as much as I possibly can  not totally avoidable but taken as last option Rather I resort to alternative travel routes such as rail transits (BTS MRT and Airport Rail Link) and canalriver ferries (Saen Saep Boat Service Chao Phraya Express Boat)  BTS currently has two lines that run through the centre of Bangkok and can get its passengers to almost all commercial and residential areas of the inner city Areas not covered by BTS is made up by the MRT and the two systems has three convenient interchanges However their ticketing systems are separate which can be quite confusing especially if you purchase a single fare for each time you use a train The best way to overcome this confusion is to purchase a storedvalue card (available for both BTS and MRT) that you can reuse and topup as needed  I am not sure but I think that you can return the card for a refund on the amount not used I have been told that BTS and MRT fares are quite expensive compared to those of other countries but compared to the amount of your precious time saved from having to sit in the road traffic it is more than worth it   One downside of BTS is that the infrastructures of the stations do not comply with "universal design" concept and so not very friendly to the physically challenged BTS management has put in some efforts and investments to eliminate this shortfall but much more need to be done MRT is much better in this regard  Up until 2017 BTS and MRT serve primarily Bangkok's inner city but several more lines reaching out to the outlying areas are scheduled to be completed within the next two to three years

title: Crammed
review: As nice as it is to have this sort of public transport it is not the nicest choice Many times you cannot get on the train No matter what time the trains are bursting out of their seams Why cannot there be more cars on each train Bangkok is hot as it is to then get stuck  between sweaty bodies on a train is disgusting but almost unavoidable if you choose this form of transport

title: Always clean, eonomical, efficient and safe
review: Always clean economical efficient and safe  Unfortunately a limited network and crowded at busy times  a reflection of its success

title: MRT - Great System
review: Very similar to Japanese subway Arrows on the ground where to line up to board the train Very clean and very efficient Trains every 35 mins when there At end of line stops train cleaned before passengers can board Children over 140cms tall pay as adult  Still very cheap 3 x tickets from Phetcheburi to Hua Luphang 90 Baht total

title: The best way to travel in Bangkok!
review: As the traffic is always unpredictable in Bangkok The best way to travel around is Skytrain (BTS) it's really convenience and safe Most of the station are on landmark of Bangkok from 6am till midnight But avoid for the rush hours

title: ramkangheng airport link
review: my friend arrived from philippines i took ramkangheng airportlink to suvarnabhum airport  only 20 minutes and 20 baht the best no traffic by

title: Holiday
review: Clean and air conditioned cars move you quickly above ground Stopped are well labeled and booth ticket sales can be done in English

title: always use this
review: excellent brings you around central bangkok and among all entertainment areas and major hotels  similar concept to KL but less confusing   always use this to their airport though it does not travel to don muang airport

title: recommend moving in bangkok
review: its cheap to buy a ticket to move to city center fast moving clean and  you can easily buy a ticket at every counter in stop way

title: A worthwhile and moving experience
review: We did this with just the two of us on the tour (good luck) It was a great way to see some important historic sights and get a real feel for the events around the building of the BurmaThailand railway  Our guide was incredibly knowledgeable and helped us to really get the most of our time  The Hellfire Pass Interpretive Centre was a very interesting way to find out about some  of the experiences of PoWs during the railway construction

title: Convenient
review: It's convenient and a cheap way to go around Bangkok  It's also easy to figure out and the lines are not long  I didn't travel during a peak hour though so I'm not so sure

title: A must on a Friday or Saturday evening
review: Usually I arrive in Bangkok from Tokyo on the Sunday or Monday evening at midnight At this time there is no traffic  and after over 22 hours of travel from Florida I'm not really in the mood to take a train since a taxi will cost with tip included around 400 Bath (12) But if you arrive around 500pm and specially on a weekend ( as I did last week from Male ) you should take the train it will be much much faster The signs are not as clear as the hong kong train and not as clean but it's safe plenty of trains and cleanish enough When you arrive in Bangkok you can take the Subway ( get ready to walk a little bit with luggageafter 20 hours it's a little bit much for me ) or you can take a taxi to bring you were you are suppose to go ( that's me ) But again if you have a lot of bags the transfer can be challenging

title: Would be efficient...
review: Let's face it The idea of a skytrain looks interesting But the trains cut the city into parts If you are lucky and the train is going to a target near the tracks this is an efficient way to ride through Bangkok But the opportunities are small Only two lines are going through the city and you can't avoid taxis and tuk tuks therefore

title: Easy, clean
review: The Skytrain is incredibly easy to understand and use to get around the city It's clean and safe as well

title: Cool and futuristic
review: Great cheap way to travel Bangkok it feels like your living in the year 2050  Also air conditioned which is a relief in Bangkok

title: Very convenient and faster way to get around
review: Our hotel was situated 300 metres from the Nana BTS station near the Sukhumvit area  From the airport instead of taking a taxi we had taken the Airport Rail Link as we were not sure about the city traffic   We changed train at the Phaya Thai Station and took the BTS Sky train  We were three of us and the total cost of reaching the Nana area from the Airport was less than 200THB

title: Best way to go into the heart of Bangkok from the International Airport
review: As in most big cities road traffic is always unpredictable and the Airport Rail Link in Bangkok is the best solution for incomingoutgoing tourists Very easy to use even with luggages clean quick and inexpensive What more can one ask Connect to the BTS sky train Sukhumvit Line at Phaya Thai Station (end station of the Airport Rail Link) and off you go to the city centre Siam Paragon and various international hotel chains Highly recommended mode of transport to and from the airport

title: Quick, cheap and efficient.
review: For traveling in the small area covered by the skytrain it is really excellent  The only thing wrong with it is that it doesn't cover a big enough area

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to usequite cleancheapi would reccommend to use it to avoid the bangkok traffic for sure

title: Skip the hustle ....
review: Neat and clean Chill to skip the city heat  Comes in every ten minutes Fare is very convenient Travelers can save a lot of time using BTS

title: Buy a Rabbit Card if you will spend a few days in Bangkok
review: Consider investing in a Rabbit Card if you will spend a few days in Bangkok It will save a lot of time during rush hours  when there is only two ticket machines and people fumbling for change It can be used in some shops and foodcourts that take electronic payment too Those shops will have a black Rabbit terminal at their cashier

title: keeping cool
review: A cool as in climate way to travel and the best way toavoid the craziness of the t and traffic although you need to see the city from the ground

title: Never missed here
review: Crowded Tourist captured their memory trip here Waiting for the train moved pass a Death Railway to greeting people by the way Nice shot in the train with the River Kwai along the Death Railway

title: Best Way to Travel in Bangkok
review: Easy to navigate once you get the hang of it  Air conditioned too  It can get a little pricey but sure beats sitting in a cab with traffic going one mile an hour

title: Very busy, but cool and efficient.
review: For where it goes it is great Air conditioned certain routes can be very busy We bought one day tickets for 140 baht Worked well if you are planning more than 3 trips in a day You can only buy these at the manned ticket desk not the machines But in our experience the staff speak good English Seems to be a shopping mall at every central station

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Once you get over the initial shock of so many people using the service and take a little time to understand how it works for payment it's simple Cheaper more comfortable cooler and quicker than either Taxi or TukTuk

title: Easy, fast, and frequent trains
review: Excellent way to get around parts of Bangkok  clean fast easy access and trains come frequently  Stops convenient to many popular spots Central Malls (Chit Lom and Phloem Chit stations) Siam Square (Siam Station) river boat ferries at Central Pier (Sathorn Station) and the Chatuchak Park weekend market (Mo Chit station)   Prices between stations vary  You can buy one way tickets or a day pass (150 baht)  Some stations have machines that take bills and provide change others do not and you will need coins  If you need change ask at the entry booth  There is also a Rabbit pass that I THINK allows you to essentially add money as needed but all information was in Thai  3 types  student adult and senior  We will likely look into this more ifwhen we come back   However be aware the BTS is NOT tied into the metro or boat ferries so need to pay multiple fares when hopping between modes of transportation

title: Best Transportation in BKK
review: BTS is probably the best way to connect through the Bangkok citythis saves time anything in a jam packed dayIts very convenient to use and direction is duely given and a perfect way to roam around the cityprice is also reasonableVery clean given the standard of public transport

title: Save time and easy
review: Good and fast easy and not expensive good for visitor and have good experience to go airport save time and no traffics jams

title: Good transport to move around the city
review: This transport system is very good for roaming around the city with flexible and less cost the timing is good and easy to access

title: BEST WAY TO TRAVEL AROUND
review: This is the best way to travel around Bangkok Just get a map grid showing the lines stations and navigate your way from there It is easy and logical and easily followed through by a newbie It is safe fast and convenient though not very cheap if with family with 4 or more and if traversing multiple stations which you will inevitably do Incidently when we visited China every stop we went to was 6 yuan for the three paying family members no matter where we went That is super cheap compared to Bankok's BTS which is similar However one main advantage is you beat all the traffic by using the BTS and most places and malls can be reached via BTS One tip if not sure ASK and POINT to the station you want to go to on your MAP then anyone will understand you and point you to the right direction despite the language barrier I found most people to be helpful especially the train station attendants clerks and even security guards Help is everywhere Do not assume if you are not sure or you can end up on the wrong line or worse in a wrong station or destination

title: Best way to beat the traffic
review: We took a day pass wish was around Bat 140 The trains run frequently they are spotless and it is the best way to beat the frantic Bangkok traffic  Best to go to the ticket office tell them what kind of ticket you would like or were you want to go and they either give you the ticket or the change for the ticket machine   For my taste the trains were a bit too air conditioned

title: Cheap and efficient
review: This has to be the cheapest and most efficient way to get around parts of Bangkok given the city is always congested with cars and other types of motor vehicles  However all of the stations that I was in only have one ticket machines that accepts currencies with the rest takes only coins or scanning the QR code So if you don't have enough coins you will have to get in line at the ticketing window which seemed to always have a long line

title: Very Helpful
review: It is very helpful to ride airport rail link you can go to the city easily without traffic Easy to use and it is also connected to the BTS I enjoyed it

title: Easy to use, get your multi day pass to save cash
review: Clean and very safe easy to get around and helpful staff  Connects to the BTS to simplify getting around BKK  Just do it to save time and avoid the BKK traffic congestion

title: Quick and Fuss free
review: We took the ARL from National stadium BTS station It was cheap  fast and easy  Good connection to Priya Thai station where we boarded  so we could get seats and put our luggages in the overhead compartments  No worries about traffic jams and bargaining with cab drivers on the fare We arrived at the airport in good time  Highly recommended

title: Very good and efficient
review: WE were able to walk to the Sky train from our hotel Victory Monument was the closest station  Very efficient cheap and on time connects with the underground too

title: Quite quick.
review: First trip I go with this train it delays for more than 2 hours And the seating for upper berch are not spacious 2nd tripnever took this train but always wanted Finally returning here as a tourist I decide to try it

title: Stunning servie
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to find in Bangkok main road From the sky train the city looks very nice and beautiful it is accessible to major places like Sukumvit MBK Central Mall and many more

title: Part of Bangkok's very friendly mass transit system
review: This is an easy way to get from Suvarnabhumi to town fast and reasonably low price The interface between the Airport line and the Sky Train is a bit clumsy with stairs or an elevator (They could not have connected them easier) but it works well enough

title: Puts our system to shame
review: So easy to use efficient clean and very cheapwhat more can you ask foroh and you get great views from the system

title: best way to travel
review: though it might be a little expensive but if you are a couple its the best way to travel as the traffic on sukhumvit is sooo bad that you end yp wasting at least 45 mins for a 10 min drive and over 120  150 thb

title: So easy to use
review: Inexpensive and so much quicker than travelling by car  taxi  bus Easy to purchase tickets all instruction and directions in English Even has all the stations and routes on the ticket

title: cheap and cheerful
review: recommend the 120 baht 1 day ticket which we used during the day in Bangkok The train is clean and quick

title: Be aware of professional pickpockets
review: The BTS makes life easier in Bangkok but it is not so interesting that you have to pay for every trip you make it should be one payment for the whole way you go Waste if time and money Also wewere stolen very professionally normally very carefuland attentive we didn't even notice how the wallet with documents and only 10$ was gone from the pocket which was closed with two buttons So watch out  In addition it is always too crowded they need to have more trains

title: Nice way to get by
review: The sky train goes to most places in Bangkok except the Grand Palace and the Emerald Buddha The tickets are reasonably priced But do watch out for the crowds during office hours

title: The Best Way to commute..
review: The best and easy way to commute to all tourist places in Bangkok Shopping places of attraction street food airport Famous malls etc

title: What A Great Night Out
review: Now let me start by telling you something about me usually I hate crowds I hate shopping I hate the whole bartering thing and I hate markets in general so what you may ask would ever possess me to go to a night market in Thailand  Simple my girl friend  But how glad am I that she wanted to go it was one of the best nights (or should I say 2 because we went twice) in our 3 week stay in Cha am  The market is best described as organised chaos actually scrap that not so organised chaos The stalls go off in all directions selling everything you can imagine one side of the market is lined with bars should you feel the need for a chilled beer the 'street food' was some of the best food I've had ever  Whether it be simple chicken wings noodles and rice dishes you want or something a bit different like peppered crickets with silk worm larvae (which I can recommend by the way in for a penny in for a pound as they say) I absolutely loved this place fantastic experience

title: Efficient, a little crowded, cheap
review: Very modern and helpful if you are located nearby to the track  The train does not go into the heart of the old city which is a downfall  It covers the main attractions on Sukhumvit Rd and was very inexpensive

title: Cheap, Easy and Crowded!
review: Its very easy to use the skytrain but on the more popular lines prepare to be packed tightly No complaints though

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great way to travel Bangkok You can get a day pass for 140THB and cover a lot of ground The Skytrain is cleanreliable and efficient

title: Bangkok to Surin
review: Malaysia trip  June  2018   Back home on the train Travel on the new  carraiges with beds They are a lot  better than the old rolling stock have wifi charging points in the sleeping  compartments fare 899 baht lower berth

title: Efficient
review: Efficient and easy way to get from the airport to the centre where you can easily inter change for the metro The ticket machines at the stations available in different languages it's very easy to use Overall a great way to start my journey through SAE

title: Save a lot of time on travelling
review: This was our first time using the airport rail It saves you a lot of time It is safe and clean and nicely airconditioned

title: The best skytrain ever!
review: It was my first time to ever ride a train and it was awesome Not only the BTS takes you anywhere in Bangkok it’s the cleanest train I’ve ever ridden to If you guys want to save money on your trip I suggest you use the skytrain to look around the city of Bangkok

title: Amazing fast transit! Easy to use
review: I have used this many times  Coming from the Bangkok airport you go to the lowest level and follow the signs pretty easy it is just around the corner from the escalator  Pay for a token at the booth where they have live people  Price depends on where you go  The line is pretty straight but it does have stops  I take it all the way to the end  Phaya Thai  It is air conditioned and fast  Before you board at the airport they do have transit police that search the train when it arrives before they let anyone board then they let people in  You use the token to enter the station area where you descind to the platform area  The trains run very frequently This part is handicapped friendly a lot of the stations are not however  Depends on where you go  some have elevators to the ground (or escalators) many stations only have stairs though Phaya Thai station does have an elevator to the street

title: super easy
review: We had a conference at BITEC and this was the easiest and quickest way to get out there You can also get a day pass which means you can hop off and on all day  the stations are designed to be near tourist attractions

title: Quick and Easy
review: Excellent way to get around the city quickly and cheaply Make sure you have a lot of coins as its easier to just get the ticket rather than having to line up and exchange a note and then still have to line up again for the ticket machine  A little bit difficult to get around on with prams don't expect too many people to help you carry your pram up or down the stairs because they won't

title: Convenient way to travel in Bangkok
review: One can go for a one day pass or just travel from one location to another Maps and price charts are easily available at the station Easy and convenient way to travel

title: Can get crowded
review: BTS is an excellent and cheap way of getting around the city It can get crowded but the cars are air conditioned It is clean and efficient

title: Easy access to the city
review: Traveling from the new Suvarbhumi airport to the city has never been much easier it is only 5 stops away to reach Ratchabharop station and you can conveniently step out to connect by BTS sky train to all other parts of Bangkok  If I'm traveling alone I will likely take this route to get to the city

title: Quick and easy
review: The sky train is a quick and easy way to get to Bangkok centrum It has a much better view of the city than from a car or buss The biggest drawback were the limited seats And a lot of people who had to stand And the end station in Bangkok centrum It was hard to find the right way But the friendly staff pointed us in the right way

title: Prepare change!
review: The city's BTS is of great help when moving around the city It's fast it's clean and it runs often but as everywhere else around Thailand and especially Bangkok I couln't escape the feeling that Thais are going through a aircondition revolution and I find the temperature in the trains extreamly uncomfortable especially when riding it for more than just a few stops Otherwise it's the perfect way of getting around the Thai capital At some stations one can insert only coins to the ticket machine that inconvenient solution made us wait with the other passengers who didn’t have enough coins to pay for their ride

title: Cheap and easy method of transport
review: Most of the machines accept notes but only give change in coins It's easy to get a token from the machines and if not just ask at the counter Outside of peak hour the MRT is simple to use and get where you need

title: Cheap, easy to use
review: The airport rail link is a quick easy and cheap way to get from downtown Bangkok to Suvarnabhumi airport

title: Easy to understand
review: No problem buying cards for single trips or longer trips Like day cards The speaker screen or signs tells you where to go on and off Good maps and an easy app to use for navigation

title: My token did not work!
review: My token did not work but staff soon sorted it out It is clean and easy to use and is Google to miss all the traffic jams

title: Some experience
review: I've heard so much about this place and seen documentaries and photos During my last business trip to Thailand the railway market seems interesting Trip from Bangkok took 1 hour something It was already 330pm and I can see the train was still there at the station I saw a lot of people (tourist) taking photos and having food at the stalls It was a hot day and the market was very humid and uncomfortable (Morning trip should be better)  And it's time for the train to make its trip and all the commotions and excitement focused on the slow train moving along the market and seeing the paddlers closing the tents are some experience It really make my day worthy

title: Excellent public transportation.
review: Excellent way to go around I really inexpensive and very modern It have stations in the major malls Just avoid rush hours a lot of people use it

title: Airco not optimal
review: For me it was the first time using the metro in Bangkok During all my visits to this city before I always forgot to try this means of transportation In general I think it is a good and cheap way to travel if you can reach your destination using it The airco however in the train(s) I used was not working properly or not capable to do so Pity

title: Good economical way to travel in Bangkok
review: Good economical way to travel in Bangkok We found this to be a clean cool but most times crowded way to get around Bangkok Also if you want another way to get around take a taxi and ask for the meter Many taxi drivers will try not to use the meter do not fall for this scam If you use a taxi with a meter you will almost always be surprised at the reasonable cost of using a taxi Another tip once you use a Tuk Tuk once to say you have been in one never use them again as 9 out of 10 times a taxi is safer cooler and cheaper if you use the meter which is the law Still many taxi drivers try to avoid using the meter as it is more profitable for them to charge a high flat rate

title: Smart and better way to see Bangkok
review: MRT is smart and better way to see Bangkok at affordable prices Cover parts of Bangkok city tourists and locals efficiently use this trains Fares for Single Journey Ticket varies between 16  41 Baht depending on number of zones crossed For tourist with Day Pass it cost you 120 baht for unlimited travels in one day Otherwise you can use several types of MRT Smart Cards Not like BTS Sky Train travelling at high position unfortunately the MRT routes are underground routes and passengers see nothing along the waysTwo routes are available Blue Line and Purple Line Combine this BTS with MRT train services will expand your transport coverage of Bangkok city significantly One of the good thing about MRT is one of the end station is Hua Lamphong close to the main station of long distance trains with the same name

title: Very convenient
review: With traffic like it is in Bkk without doubt this is the best way to travel but avoid from 730930 in mornings and 500700 in evenings if you don’t like overcrowding A rabbit pass is brilliant or a tip if you want to just get an idea of Bkk buy a ticket to the next station from where you are but don’t get off there just travel to the end of the line and walk around to the other side and catch the train back  do not go out the pay gates and exit eventually at the station you paid to go to if you do this you can ride all the lines basically for 12 baht  Just a good way to view Bkk and get a feel for it

title: Good quality transportation in Bangkok
review: This is a decent way to travel in Bangkok It is clean and on time The only problem is that it has a limited reach (which is nicely complemented by the BTSskytrain) This is actually expected in BKK as most of the city is in a quite difficult geological area and digging under is not too much of an option

title: Best way of transport in Bangkok
review: Very good and convenient mode of transport in bangkok  Used the same to visit the grand palace and Wat pho temple  also used for the airport transfer using airport express line   cost effective than Taxi with time saver

title: The Only Way To Travel
review: Being a bit of a public transport hater back home I was not sure how I was going to get on trying to get around on public transport in a foreign country but it was the easiest and most straight forward system I have ever used It cost around 140 Baht for a day hopper which entitled you to use the whole transport system and the trains run literally every five minutes so if you miss one you don't have to wait long for the next one It is very well used so always busy but extremely well organised but the Thai people are very polite and are happy to squeeze in to allow you to board Do use it as it is so much quicker than the road transport and is air conditioned too so you get some respite from the heat and disembark feeling refreshed its also very good value for money

title: Great and cheap to airport.
review: Everything was very good Because it was Thailand New Year I got on for free The staff were very good and helpful Access to the airport check in was very easy Very quick into airport and so much cheaper than taxi

title: Good and cheap skytrain
review: I have traveled in many countries This is one of the good and cheap Skytrains The skytain(BTS) also connected to underground(MRT) You can go to many places in BKK and save a lot of time Traffic in BKK is really BAD For foreigners pls find the map and if you have some questions some of stations officers can speak English and help you I drive my car everydayexcept Saturday I use BTS Enjoy BKK  Now they are expanding to cover more area of Bangkok

title: Very good guide
review: Best tour guide in Bangkok Gentle and very sweet with good explanation of what to do and what to see

title: Convenient but limited
review: Only covers some parts of Bangkok I imagine this will increase in time It is a cheap well airconditioned and easy way to get around Bangkok  It's only negatives are you need to get change to use it (there's no oyster card in Bangkok yet)  In the future this will just get better and better If your destination is on the skytrain route use it

title: Very convenient for your trip
review: Now you can travel from the Suvanabum airport to the city (by express airport line) and around the city with this system I usually use this kind of transportation whenever I travel in Bangkok If you plan to travel many place you should buy 1day pass ticket 2days pass ticketit helps to save lot of money

title: Quick and easy way to get around Bangkok
review: Recommend sky trains for travel where possible as it avoids traffic and is clean and easy to use You need coins for the ticket machines but can get change from station

title: EXCELLENT, SIMPLE TRIP AIRPORT TO CITY !
review: The Airport Rail Link terminates at Phaya Thai station affording easy access to downtown Bangkok Cost THB 45less than $A2 Rail staff are friendly approachable and eager to assist

title: great service
review: great service and connections No hassles Easy commuting One can take a day pass or take individual route tickets Good commuting option Saves one from traffic

title: Fast, but a little bit of work
review: Certainty the fastest way into the city You will have  to transfer at least once to the BTS or MRT to get to your hotel which could be tough with luggage

title: Cheap and fast!
review: its great to reach the city in under 40 minutes While going to the airport theres a bit of rush and its very crowded especially when you are commuting on a working day there are lot a of locals onboard

title: Best way to get to the to the city and back
review: Whether u have luggage or not this is easily the best way to get to the city and back to the airport Can get crowded though during rush hour since most local use it to get home

title: Old rolling stock, noisy, not too comfortable
review: Took train to Bangkok and back "first class" not that much cheaper than flying Many stops along the way old carriages and very very noisy (and very slow) Aircon broke down along the way luckily not a very hot day (aircon got fixed eventually) Seats ok but only not very wide overhead (open) storage for suitcases Avoid the toilets On the way back the windows were that dirty and milky one could hardly see anything (enjoying the views of the countryside was one of the reasons for taking the train) Train crew friendly and helpful

title: Airport Rail to Phrong Phong
review: Tried taking the rail but was not a nice experience since i had to guess which station to go etc  it wasn't easy to change from Airport Rail to BTS and it can be very crowded  personally would rather take a Grab than the rail link the cost per pax is about the same

title: 21ST CENTURY TRAVEL
review: Every time I go to Bangkok I get the feeling it is getting more like Tokyo which is no bad thing especially taking account of Tokyo's infrastructure Bangkok's Skytrain is the ultimate in 21st century travel Always on time quiet fast clean and with panoramic views of the city it in conjunction with the underground network has revolutionised travel in this congested city I remember the 80s and the time it took to get from A to B by tuktuk Now just hop on the Skytrain and maybe combine it with the underground and you're there in no time   To give you an idea of the cost of using it a couple of weeks ago it was 28 THB for a journey of four stops

title: Faster than a taxi
review: Cheap fast and regular airconditioned service take it to Makkasan Station to catch the underground rail Phetchaburi to Sukhumvit area 1 stop away

title: Cheap easy movement around the city
review: Cheap easy movement around the city Can be busy during rush hour but still faster than being stuck in traffic They are clean and safe and easy to use

title: Best public transport
review: Really good way to escape the traffic jams can get very busy but then you can wait a couple of minutes for the next one

title: Incredible
review: The train was fast and so many choice if the last train did haven't been chased The price is not too expensive but we were really comfort when using this transportation from Mo Chit to Ratchathewi  PS From Ratchathewi we walked about 12 kilos to reach our hotel at berkeley pratunam ))

title: Ride the rails to Nam Tok!
review: Board the train at the bridge or at the city train station early  It's a great ridenostalgic historic and shows off the colorful and varied Thai countryside especially the river valley and the opposite mountainside as you approach Nam Tok  At Nam Tok youfind a beautiful waterfall with swimming pool a great souvenir market with fresh hot Thai food  And you can view and walk over the amazing Japanese engineered railway trestle and a natural cave once used by the Japanese Army  the cave is now is a Buddha shine A great day in Kanchanaburi  something for everyone

title: It's very convenient and cheap to transport from airport to Downtown
review: It's nice to use this transportation to travel around in Bangkok however the BTS is not so friendly because it lack of free access for the disabled so carrying a heavy luggage in Bangkok is TOUGH

title: The Way to Go
review: Travelling  around bangkok to a variety of destinations or connecting with the BTs  use the MRT Quick easy efficient air conditioned underground rail service  you can purchase station to station token daily pass or best value is a 3 day pass for 230 bht Avoid the traffic get the MRT or BTS

title: Best way to go to the City
review: From the airport to Makkasan MRT station to link with the Metro and to Phaya Thai to link with the BTS   Fast and doesn't depend on traffic get a taxi to and from the next station to your hotel and void the traffic jams

title: Clean and easy to use
review: Functions like any other metro so easy to use Selfhelp machines and counters available Inexpensive clean and air conditioned

title: Very convenient
review: BTS makes Bangkok city tour more convenient as the stations are strategically located It is also connected to the Airport Link line which is very convenient if you are using the Suvarnabhumi Airport The price is also cheap and they have decent time intervals to make sure that they can accommodate as many passengers as possible

title: As easy as ABC
review: Very easy to navigate & the best transport mode in heavy traffic Bangkok If u need to use it few times a day go get a card from the counter for 200baht included are a 50baht deposit On your last day before departure go to the counter return the card & get back the balance & deposit Do note this card are only meant for bts & not mtr Most of the station do come with escalator if u need them usually located near the end To take the bts to your destination u just need to know which is the last station for your direction The sign board will indicated the name of the final station There are random security check in some of  the station do get prepare to open your bags

title: Best option to get around.
review: The BTS skytrain is a easy cheap and convenient option to travel around Bangkok It can get very busy at times especially at rush hours but it is fast and your don't have to wait long to catch a train Purchase the Rabbit travel card so you don't have to worry about small change

title: Excellent
review: Just about empty these days  There was never a wait as previous review the train runs on a standardised time  Handy for some  but look where you are going to some directions it would be advised to just take a taxi to avoid the hassle    I enjoy the rail link however  it is part of my routine now since it opened

title: Chiang Mai to B'kok (FUN, FUN, FUN)
review: Reviews I've read is from B'kok to Chiang Mai Ours was the reverse And like most reviews ours was straight out fun  A nice experience  My partner and I got our seatsbeds on bottom across from each other  We did that on purpose  Don't like climbing down and disturbing others  Train starts off w everyone sitting and at about 89 ish a staff member transitions the seats to bed and makes your bed  Sheets and pillows It's actually impressive to see how they do it quickly and efficiently  We mostly hang out out in dining car  There we ate from menu played cards and looked out the windows  Can have them open for air or to stick your head out  Fun to do especially when train stopped Can also smoke there if preferred  Food was good  Not the best but it sufficed   Alcohol is not served  And you can't openly drink in train  I had a Thai whiskey bottle that I opened in dining car and they told me no alcohol  I put it away But soon after and discreetly the server placed a coke for me and said "for you"  Looked @ her puzzled  She repeated again that's for me  Wasn't sure if free but I took a drink to discover that it was spiked  YAY ) Well that situation was solved and proceeded to have about 3 drinks  Of course there is a charge and the money most likely goes to the staff  I didn't mind  I was grateful they brought the liquor on board and offered that "under the table" service  It looked like a standard operation or practice  Can't guarantee it will happen when you're on but doesn't hurt to ask for a beer or whiskey and see them respond w a coke and a smile  That is if you enjoy a drink on the train  Otherwise drink from your bottle incognito or pour it into a nonalcohol container or mix it w soda ahead of time so it looks like you're drinking a coke  The next table over were Germans and were given the same treatment  Obviously it turned out fun because we laughed sang The staff also were fun because they played music and occasionally danced here and there   We slept fine and at times would wake up in the night because of excitement or to see the station it stopped @  It has been years to ride a sleeper train so I enjoyed it  In the morning if you're a straggler or one of the last passengers to get out of bed a staff member will wake you so they can put bed back into seat position and tidy up for next reserved passenger  Again we rode opposite directions  Not B'kok to Chiang Mai but I don't think it is any different    You won't be able to open windows in your assigned seat so we enjoyed dining car for that freeedom  Plus it's livelier  Have fun

title: Easy access- good service
review: The BTSSkytrain is a very good and fast public transport Especially during the rushhours it’s meaningful to choose it because you go without stress and waiting directly to your destination or near by The system is quite easy You search your destination station  look at the price how much to get there and then you can get your reusable plastic ticket It’s necessary to have enough coins to buy the ticket because there are only a few stations with ticket machines accepting bills If you don’t have enough no problem the staff will change you very fast the amount you need at the counter With a single ticket you can’t interrupt your tour for a stopover If you want to visit many places at one day it makes sense to buy a dayticket You only have to wait a few minutes for the next train in your direction The trains are very clean and it’s not allowed to eat or drink in the train Now also the temperature is all right About one year ago the temperature in the trains was so extreme cold seemed to enter a fridge Many stations also have a special access for handicappedVery good and modern service Recommended

title: Beating the traffic from above.
review: Traveling by the SkyTrain is the best mode of travel in Bangkok Also called the BTS this train network is built above ground with stops at strategically appointed stations which are near most popular places like shopping malls markets tourist attractions and the like It can be very crowded during the peak rush hours but the commuters are quite orderly in the presence of the station officers The only minus point here is that most or all of the stations do not have a toilet for the convenience of the public   There are two lines of the BTS operating in Bangkok one running somewhat east to west & the other north to south For tourists it is advisable to buy their day ticket which gives you limitless travel on the SkyTrain for the whole day ending midnight The cost of the one day ticket is 140 baht which is a bargain for you to explore the attractions in & around Bangkok   The other rail system that compliments the BTS system is the MRT which runs underground to provide support by covering areas that go beyond the BTS network  The rail systems BTS & also the MRT are definitely highly recommended for traveling around Bangkok as compared to the notorious traffic jams on the road

title: National Stadium BTS to Airport (Wheelchair-friendly)
review: We were considering whether we should take taxi from our hotel at Ibis Siam to the Airport as we have 2 kids and a wheelchairbound elderly Glad that we opted for the BTS and ARL given the nice experience  BTS staffs are extremely helpful people They are always ready to point us to the right direction for the elevators and provided gapcovering ramp for the wheelchair   We travelled at 8am on weekdays a time which we thought will be super crowded In the end it was manageable for a group of 5 pax 3 luggages and 1 wheelchair definitely not as crowded as Singapore where we come from  The trip costs 28 baths for the BTS and 45 baths for the ARL per person It took us 1 hr and 30 min including the time needed to wait for BTS card refund as we dont plan to keep the cards   Although not completely necessary visiting Youtube guides will be useful to get us familiar to what we should expect (which was all good)

title: Great way to get about Bangkok
review: The Bangkok metro is wonderful efficient comfortable with clean and easily negotiated stations and also Very cheap  At present there are two lines with the Blue Line being the most useful for visitors  It connects with the Airport BTS at Petchaburi and the BTS at Sukhumvit as well as Hua Lamphong train station  Also use for Lumpini Park and the eastern end of Silom Road  Fares are cheaper than the BTS on the Metro you are issued with tokens rather than cards but travel follows the same principles as on the BTS  Staff at ticket offices all seem to have a good command of English and English signage is available throughout  The line has been recently extended to the west beyond Hua Lamphong across the river and this is very useful to visitors  The stop at Sanam Chai is really really convenient to Wat Pho Museum Siam the river and everything in the Grand palaceRattonisokin area  Also if you are over 60 ask for senior tickets half price on an already cheap ticket

title: A must to get around in Bangkok!
review: Bangkok traffic is almost always gridlocked  the BTS Skytrain is an excellent way to get around  There is English and Thai and it's easy to read and the announcements are in both languages as well  You are above ground so you can see the stops and where you are easily   I usually buy a Rabbit card and top it up so I don't have to buy one each time for each trip  I think there are also tourist cards available  Do wear sneakers or comfortable walking shoes as there are stairs and sometimes escalators    If you want to get to and from the airport from the city centre take the Sukhumvit line to Phayathai then get out there exit and walk to the Airport Link (you will see the sign) You need to purchase the Airport Link fare by cash (there is a ticket booth upstairs) and then take the airport link to Suwannabhumi (the name of the Airport in Bangkok)  Remember that the Airport LInk goes to Suwannabhumi Airport (international flights and some domestic flights like TG) If you are flying within Thailand pls check if it is Suwannabhumi or Don Muang that you're flying out of  If it's Don Muang it's a completely different airport   The other thing about the BTS is those red entry and exit gates move fast you need to get through them quickly or they will snap back on you and they hurt  If your body type might be too wide to pass through then there is a gate just to the right which accomodates families with children plus sized people and people with a lot of big luggage which will normally clip and be stuck through the regular entry gates    The gate to the right is manned by a guard you just give him or her your subway cards and the guard will swipe them for you and you can pass through the wider gate without time constraints   Enjoy It's the only way to get around Bangkok where you'll be on time

title: Travel in time!

title: Best Way to get around Bangkok
review: Avoid the traffic and jump on the Skytrain It costs up to 37 Baht for a one way fair and so a bit more expensive than a taxi (if more than one person travelling and the taxi actually uses the meter) but it's quick and clean and takes you above Bangkok's unbelievably bad traffic jams (1 hour 15 minutes to travel 5km the other night unfortunately we were nowhere near a BTS station and the ferries stop at dusk)

title: Kudos Thailand! The BTS is Awesome!
review: I find the ongoing expansion and continued operations of the BTS Skytrain mindboggling It is just an awesome system fast clean modern and efficient One can’t imagine Bangkok without it and its perhaps even more impressive underground (and spacious) MRT Kudos to all the forewordthinking Thais who made this vision a reality and who keep it running so smoothly even while vast expansion projects continue This is a worldclass public transit system that others can emulate in the future

title: bts
review: It's very fast and comfortable way of transportation in BKK but not very cheap Btw there is only a few lines of it In such a huge city it's surely not enough It was just ok but the crowd inside even at 930 pm was insane p

title: Fast and efficient
review: This by far the best way to get around Bangkok  We live in Bangkok and own a car but often leave it at home as it is quicker less stressful cheap and very efficient

title: 2nd class air con, catch 7.35pm train.
review: Two of us travelled in an upper and lower berth Staff were friendly food was so so (if you expect 5 starit's a train seriously) toilets were clean train is a little chilly so bring a hoodie but I understand why as when the curtains are pulled you get hot quick You can't please everyone and your in Thailand and the trip is dirt cheap compared to western overnight train so happy with it   A tip catch the 735pm train then you can wake up and see the beautiful scenery as you come into chiang mai And you get off round 10ish and that means you won't have to wait long for your room to be ready  Also free map at your arrival

title: great way to travel in BKK
review: Pretty much clean and mostly reliable It connects with the BTS skytrain at Sukhumvit and Silom station By using the MRT and BTS is a pretty good way to roam the city  chaktuchak market  Stay away from the rush hour (before 8 am and around 6 pm)

title: Convenient Public Transportation from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok
review: The airport Rail Link is very useful for those landing at Suvarnabhumi Airport looking budget traansportation to Central Bankok It is very clean and convenient for visitor to go as locate at the basement of the airport It is very easy to buy a ticket through ticket machine The cost is of course very reasonable with long distance to Central Bangkok

title: Great to go to the Koh Sam road
review: When arriving at the airport just follow the signs to the train Go to the terminal station ( if you have a bit of cash around 100 bath it is enough over wise change at the airport) when you arrive take the pedestrian bridge to exit A then at the bottom cross the traffic light turn left direction to bus stop 800 yards take the 79 or 511 30 baths then stop at the columns after the temple on your left inside  or ask the driver they know  then cross the road and walk forward to a tragic light  take the busy little street on your right and first on the left then you're arrived good luck

title: fast transportation in crowded bangkok
review: I always use this facility to move in Bangkok as you know Bangkok has got very bad traffic jams during day the best way to get rid of this nightmare is to use BTS  its clean  fast with good spots as stations the price has been increased a little in recent years  which is not too much

title: BTS skytrain Bangkok
review: Fast and hasslefree traveling to key destinations in the city  Access to nice shopping malls on both sides of many BTS stations

title: Good public transport
review: fast regular clean Bangkok is trying to get better integrated transport  that will be a real improvement

title: Easy to use!
review: The BTS skytrain was easy to use clean and organized It is great to use during high traffic hours

title: Must Use Public Transport In Bangkok
review: The BTS (Skytrain) and MRT have been a big relief from the crazy traffic jams in Bangkok  Pro  1) Avoid the crazy traffic jams in Bangkok 2) Price is reasonable  It may be better to purchase the Rabbit card or 1day pass (B140) than to purchase single ride tickets depending on the frequency of your travels with the BTS 3) Connect with the airport train at BTS Phaya Thai station for easy access tofrom the Suvarnabhumi Airport  Con  1) Can be extremely crowded during peak hours 2) Ticket machines only accept coins not bills  As such there is the hassle to exchange coins at the station control station 3) No public wifi or toilet  Definitely recommended to use the BTS Skytrain when in Bangkok

title: Supersonic Sky Train
review: The Bangkok BTS (Skytrain) and the linked MRT (Subway) makes Bangkok an incredibly efficient city It is easy to get to meetings and to to combine business with great restaurants yhe BTS allows you to access more good coffee and food than in Europe (with or without Britain) Taxis are ok in Bangkok but truly experience Bangkok you need to have the Mobility affirded by the BTS and MTT It also connects to the linear boats on the river that add another transport dimension The Venice like river scene is mega cool Temples markets and of coyrse the greatest destination of them all "the Grand Palace" Better than the Taj is the Pal

title: Easy way to get many places
review: Easy way to go to some big malls like MBK and Siam Paragon and other places Very inexpensive as well

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: I use the line under the airport straight into central Bangkok for 45 Thai bht that's just over a pound It misses all of the traffic jams and is quick clean and comfortable

title: Amazing! People stand in line to board!
review: Being from NYC the BTS is a shock so clean the riders are so well behaved   Air conditioned comfortable great signage  I don't know what Bangkok did before this was built

title: Quick way around Bangkok
review: Used the train system several times trains packed with people each time but you were quickly delivered to your journey's end Cheap to travel on and trains run continually Only downside were the flights of steps one had to walk up to access the station and usually another flight then up to next level bit hard for us oldies but we managed

title: Cheap and fast
review: The Skytrain is an essential means of transportation in Bangkok since the streets are always jammed especially during the day Beware though of over air conditioned wagons

title: comfortable , cheap and easiest way to travel .Each MRT stations has comprehensive guidance to our expecting desti.
review: comfortable  cheap and easiest way to travel Each MRT stations has comprehensive guidance to our expecting destination

review: Took less than 40 minutes from the Asia Hotel to the international airport at 7 pm on a Monday Price is fantastic 60 bt total I did not have to stand once on the Airport Rail Link did have to stand on the Sky Train portion It is safe fast and air conditioned I believe it runs until midnight but the sign at the Sky Train says it runs until 11 pm

title: Best way to travel in town
review: Its the best choice to travel in Bkk although avoid riding the train thru rush hours as it is packed It seems the BTS company doesnt want to extend the trains as they are very packed in the peak hours

title: Budget freindly
review: Convienient and cheap if you know where you are going However during peak period it is very busy and needed to wait for a while to get on train I was able to board the 4th train so just allow extra time if travelling during rush hour

title: Great way to get around
review: The maps were easy to follow A cheap way to get around You can get across town for about a dollar  They do close fairly early at night so be prepared to taxi back if you're out a bit late  Getting tickets are easy to understand and have an English setting

title: Quick and easy
review: Really quick and easy way to get around Also cheap Make sure you have a map handy Also clean and safe

title: Best BTS transport in Bangkok
review: BTS transport in Bangkok is the best for travelling here and there  A lot of place we can go and visit by BTS  BTS will not jem as taking Taxi always jem jem jem omg wasting time time time

title: Market tour with a super nice guide
review: Our guide Sarah was super nice she explained us a lot of things and give us useful advice Market tour was very interesting and I kindly recommend this activity

title: Not very convenient
review: Not convenient for hotels in the SilomSathorn area It does not connect conveniently with the rest of the sky rail system

title: Swift, Inexpensive and Air Conditioned
review: Excellent way to move along the bustling Sukhumvit Road or ancillary ways of the city  Each stop is preannounced in Thai and English  Be sure to get your coins to purchase your ticketpass from the counter first

title: Clean efficient cheap!
review: So efficient puts public transport systems in other countries to shame Takes you to all the major attractions and runs until midnight perfect

title: It's fast but i don't like it
review: I decide to try it for the  first time I transport by BTS but it wasn't feel like I imagize before it really fast so I can not see anything

title: On time
review: Reliable transfer to the airport You avoid any traffic jam and can be sure you are in less then 45min Direct in the airport

title: Convenient way to get around the city
review: The Skytrain was fast efficient and reasonable  Good connections to malls and other establishments
