review: so long as u have not much luggage n travelling alone easy access via cab to any of the stations and go up the escalator  buy your token at an atm n you are on may get crowded periodically  luggage has no storage facility on train so keep that in mind

title: Easy to use
review: I never want to argue with taxi drivers in Bangkok for the rate so I walk talk the metro or BTS BTS is easy you have first change bills into coins (at the counter) and then select the station you go on the automatic vending machine and insert the money in coins  You get out a ticket which you can use for one trip If you want to buy your return ticket at the same time this you can do because on some stations there are big queues  like in Siam However  the tickets can only be used on the same day

title: crowded
review: Obviously popular and the easiest way to get around congested Bangkok Buts its very very busy Didnt find the ticket office at victory monument helpfull wouldnt sell a ticket only pointed to a vending machine with large queues Did give the change needed though

title: Fast and easy
review: Best way to get around downtown Beat the traffic in a clean modern train Stops are announced in English and Thai and there is a map indicating where you are at all times so you can anticipate your stop Very inexpensive

title: 24 hours service
review: you can use this to go famous place and easy to take not very crowd don't worry about time hay always ontime and easy to take 24 hours service to enjoy night in bangkok

title: Efficient and safe. Easily get around from town to town
review: It is a good way to get around Bangkok Compare to taxi and tuk tuk it is much safer because you dont have to worry about scamming etc A lot of tourist attractions can reach easily using sky train They have the railway map too so grab that and you could move around easily Avoid rush hour like morning or evening

title: Go for the Express line train
review: Took the normal train from the airport to Ratchaprarop station which was 2 blocks from our hotel As we returned to the airport during peak times the train was over full so we opted for the express train For that you have to go one back to Phaya Thai Was worth the extra rate to go on express Less people plus place for bagage

title: Brilliant!
review: The airport rail link in Bangkok should be the blueprint for all airport transfers the world over It is a reliable fast safe clean easy and cheap means of transport from Suvarnabhumi to central Bangkokthe only way to go

title: Super convienant
review: Super Convienant way to get around BKK Especially with the crazy traffic in the city Great way to get from one side of the city in quickly Great for shopping and experiencing the city

title: Very convenient and clean
review: Very convenient transport which is cheap and clean Crowded during morning peak hours and I would suggest users who are taking it to the airport in the morning to leave earlier The direct express train to airport was closed 2 years in a row thus it's very crowded to take the train from airport to the city otherwise it's still a rather reliable transportation

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Clean and comfortable mode of transport  I would pick BTS over taking a cabgrab as you will reach your destination much quicker without the traffic jams

title: 8 Nights in Bangkok and More Nights in the Future
review: It's clean and very inexpensive Ticket machines have English translations And a great way to travel around Bangkok proper

title: Unique experience
review: We spent great time with Belle She was great and very well prepared indeed we did an insane program visiting the main temples as well as the floating market started from 1000 am to 1600 am She knew where to go and she made it possible Also the driver was extremely kind and attentive to our desires Highly recommended @Yousef and @Nada

title: It works but poor frequency and always crowded
review: The sky train has a low frequency which will quite takes a long time to wait for a train Also the train is always crowded and quite hard to get on and off the sky train (nonrush hour)  However it might still be a fair choice during rush hours as the road traffic really bad in Bangkok

title: Convenient but crowded
review: We took the City Line (the blue one) to Phayathai where conveniently links with the Sky train As the City Line is a commuter train there are many passengers In general it's a perfect form of transportation to travel from the city centre to the airport fast cheap and frequent

title: Great for easy airport access from city center
review: You will have to navigate the Bangkok transit system which requires you to get coins and purchase tickets through efficient machines (both in Thai and in English) while large crowds of commuters compete with you  The good news is that most everyone is very helpful and willing to assist you  You will need to allow plenty of time for transit at BKK but the SkyTrain airport rail link makes getting there much easier than by taxi  Getting multiple suitcases on and off can be a challenge so travel light )

title: Overcapacity
review: It is the most convenient way to visit Bangkok but it tends to be quite crowded and the waiting time between trains is 5 minutes even on rush hour There is definitely room for improvement

title: The best way to get around
review: If your tired to get ripped of by taxi driver and and want the near death experience in the TukTuks your should take the Skytrain instead It's cheap fast and takes you to most of the places you need to go in Bangkok

title: Most efficient way of getting around Bangkok
review: Quick efficient public transport  as a tourist we didnt have any difficulty using this or navigating our way around More expensive than Indian public transport though

title: Sara is the best guide
review: Sara was so nice and this tour was so much better than I expected We took the train took the boat in the floating market and had delicious food The coconut ice cream was the best one ever and Sara is such a fun and experienced guide I recommend this tour very much

title: Fast and efficient, if close to your hotel
review: This is a great link between the airport and the city center If you are close to hotel and can walk it is a gem if not try Uber

title: The only way to avoid traffic!
review: The BTS is the only real way to avoid the traffic on the streets below I can get squishy however But worth it to avoid the delays below

title: Ok
review: It is good to take the skytrain in Bangkok You should take it to the river and take a boat Very nice

title: It’s getting worse..
review: The service has declined over the years The express service has been dropped meaning that it now functions as a commuter line It can be very difficult to negotiate  particularly for getting TO the airport ( inbound is not so bad)  Why 1The concept of queuing appears lost on many of those using the train those passengers using cell phones ( 99% of commuters) prefer to sit so that they have 2 hands free for playing games using social media If that means pushing past passengers with luggage so be it 2 The ticket system is confusing The machines to purchase the tokens are not intuitive leading to confusion delays frustration There is no functionality with the other stored value cards for BTS and MRT and the proposed systemwide card has been delayed ( YET AGAIN) showing a measure of contempt for users on the part of the company 3 The trains are horribly overcrowded during peak times and just plain unpleasant the rest of the time 4 This system is not user friendly for airport users Many systems in other countries ( in which there is dual commuterairport patronage) designate certain carriages as ‘ Airport Only’and they work very smoothly to everyone’s convenience It would not be difficult to implement here but  10 years of operation not even a hint that this might happen It’s poorly run poorly managed user unfriendly and generally unpleasant On the plus side it’s cheap

title: Easy transport to city center from airport
review: No need to take taxi and spend so much time in Bangkok trafic as skytrain takes you to most of the places you need to go

title: Good transport, shame about stairs with heavy luggage
review: if you are going to use this there are changes required and not all stations have lifts or escalators there were four of us and we decided that it was not too much more to go in a taxi as their fares have gone down since the airport link gave travellers a choice

title: Good way to hang around Bangkok city
review: If you buy a full day ticket for 130 Bhat  it is worth as it can take you all around the must see locations in Bangkok Good air conditioning and comfortable journey Little crowded during office hours The funny thing you will notice is all the people will be browsing internet without even looking at each other inside

title: better no traffic
review: Bangkok is traffic jam city if you were traffic jam time should take air port link but the early morning time and late night time also more 3 people better take taxi

title: Moving and incredible.
review: What an experience this was It's best to do the trip with some knowledge of the history behind it's construction because it's just remarkable what was achieved by the thousands of POW's and local people who built it Very moving and very humbling it should be on everyone's to do list if travelling in the area

title: Good, affordable system
review: Took us a few minutes to figure out the first day but once we got the hang of it it was great Very affordable especially the all day pass

title: Railway tour and floating market
review: Sereh was A great tourguide She made our day so much fun She had A lot of information about the tour en the culture I would definitely recommend this tour and sereh as the tourguide

title: Fast and convenient
review: It was ok saved us time from traffic which can be pretty bad here in Bangkok  The only bad thing is they don't allowed water bottle on there which means you can carry them but don't bring it out and drink them in public lol

title: Good for getting city
review: Excellent for getting around the city and very cheap I used several times on my visit as close to my hotel

title: Cheap and convenient way to travel
review: Good and strong air conditioner Low fares and best of all they beat all the traffic jam  Where possible use this  Only set back is if you don't have coins you have to queue to get the notes changed  So if you are there for a week buy the rabbit card  I didn't cos I was only there for a week

title: An excellent way to travel from Suvarnabhumi to Downtown Bangkok!
review: Since the introduction of the Airport Rail Link I have made use of only this mode of transport from the airport to downtown Bangkok and back It is an excellent way to travel (in my opinion) for a number of reasons There are no traffic jams to contend with It gets you to the Pratunam area in approximately 30 minutes or so It is extremely competitively priced Comparitively speaking it is much cheaper than the airport links in Hong Kong Kuala Lumpur Johannesburg and the the Metro Rail in Dubai

title: What a let down.
review: You know when you think you must have missed something This is one of those times   Most of the market was closed there were only about 50% of the stalls open in one and 10% in the other The outside bit had about 1015 traders selling food That's it   It was suggested by a few people we go for a look we were there for 15 mins   Rubbish

title: comfortable way to get out of the airport but packed
review: when the train left the airport it was ok but in the next stops the train gets so packed i ended up going out in a later station and taking the train back just because i didnt manage to get through so many people

title: Overnight special express
review: We caught train number 9 at 1810 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai Purchased our first class sleeper tickets 2 months in advance for two connecting rooms bunk bed style Comfortable although the top bunk is a little cool being close to the well functioning air conditioner Small sink in the room which is made up (into beds) around 8pm and returned to seats about an hour from Chiang Mai Total journey time is about 13 hours and although not a fast train arrived on time at 715am and we were ready for the day ahead

title: Best for of transport.
review: So simple to use and so efficient Clean speedy and something we're used to over here on time Used this a lot and felt safe all the time

title: Great experience but be aware of inflated prices.
review: Both markets were a great experience But beware the prices at the floating market are considerably higher than in other markets elsewhere in Bangkok for the same stuff  You're paying for the experience which is fun but just be aware You don't get long at the train market so it isn't really about the shopping but again the experience is great and ive not come across anything like it anywhere else

title: Reliable and fast
review: Took less than 30min to get from Phaya Thai station to BKK airport Train was clean and crowd was reasonable ~740am in the morning

title: Zip into town with convenience!
review: The airport rail link connects you to the city centre of Bangkok via the Metro and BTS train networks It is very convenient and affordable to use the train networks to get to your hotels if you are travelling alone or with a partner For groups of 3 and above it will be better to take a taxi as the total travel cost is comparable

title: convenient and cheap way to explore the city
review: Used this for all the 6 days i stayed in Bangkok It's very accessible across the city from  Silom to Siam to Saphan Taksin etc It's cheap and if you miss the train fret not coz another one is coming in about 5 minutes It would be even faster in peak hours

title: Cheap and quick mode of transport
review: This is a very quick and cheap form of transportation The maps are tricky to read but you can not hear the cost of quickness Don't be scared to try it

title: Transport is ok
review: Just need to understand the system as the connecting train to bts is quite confusing Overall still ok as it brings us to many places with ease

title: Very clean!
review: It's always fun to take public transit in a foreign country and BTS skytrain is very clean and safe

title: Never need a taxi again
review: I have used this service from the airport three or four times and now it’s excellent value for money Simply research ahead of time where you need to get off and grab a tuk tuk or walk using google maps etc From the stop  Just remember that the station is downstairs at the airport as it’s very easy to assume it is on the top floor

title: Sarah is excellent and awesome
review: Sarah is an awesome tour guide Very caring and responsible Good to have her around We really wnjoy the trip

title: Easy way to get around
review: THE BTS is an easy way to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic The maps are easily understood the ticket machines have an option for English and most of the tellers at the ticket booths speak English as well Note that the ticket machines only take coins the MRT machines take bills You need separate tickets if you  transfer from MRT to BTS or the reverse

title: Much better choice than taxi
review: It’s fast  It’s much cheaper than taxi  And most importantly you don’t need to waste time to bargain with the taxi driver

title: Like meet and greet every morning
review: BTS Sky train always crowed every morning when people go to work and also when office people finish work in the evening time also I seldom have no  any sit in Skytrain  Always keep stand up  But i like it because the train almost clean and safety first The security alway helpful good service  and alert in their job  When u have log term in Bangkok u can buy rabbit card per 10 times or more Make it cheaper than buy ticket every time Thanks you rabbit card for make my life easy

title: like a trip back 100 years in time
review: i am yet to experience one of the socalled new trains and ive been using the railway for 15 years  nothing seems to change other than the accumulated dust  very reasonably priced but almost guaranteed to 'break down  driver needs a sleep'

title: bts skytrain
review: great setup caught skytrain from airport excellent trip into the city very smoth ride we also used this service while in Bangkok many timesstations were easily accessable and very user friendly

title: BTS Skytrain in Bangkok, Thailand
review: Best rapid transportation I have ever experienced  Traveling Bangkok in the 1980 and 90's was a nightmare  You spent half your vacation in traffic  Now the sky train eliminates much of this  People are extremely friendly and courteous  Now approaching 70 years old I was given a seat almost every time I was on it  Experienced 11 acts of random kindness in one day This does not happen here in South Florida

title: A cheap and efficient way to travel.
review: We got this straight from the airport to Makkasan  then from there to the hotel  If you get a taxi (even metered) it will cost about 400B with 100B in tolls on the motorway   The BTS train costs about 3040B one way ticket There is an express train (15 mins) and a slower train (3045 mins)

title: Easy to use.
review: Clean  Easy to use  Convenient  Friendly passengers

title: Great tour in Thailand
review: Sara is the best We recommend the big country tour accross train and floating market She explain lots of details and she is so lovely person

title: BTS - should stand for Best Train Service!
review: The BTS is the ONLY way to get around Bangkok just that stairs getting to the stations are a little daunting

title: Easy transportation
review: Traffic in Bangkok is pretty dreadful so taking the Skytrain is a great option It's easy to navigate just get there early to purchase a ticket as the lines can get long

title: Quick Way to Move Around
review: Anyone who has been to Bangkok knows that the traffic sucks  big time  The train got us from one end to the other in no time  A great way to get to the markets

title: Best way to get around bangkok
review: We used the skytrain everyday whilst in bangkok so easy to use very cheap  gets you around bangkok fast with no hassle we went to various places during the day and night via skytrain just great

title: skytrain
review: used a lot and was a fast easy way to get around Bangkok  buying tickets was easy in the stations and all staff were really friendly and helpful

title: Best mode of moving while in BKK
review: While you are in Bangkok think no further to move around BTS is the easiest and best to reach your choice of destination while in the city Split into 3 types BTS MRT and SRT can take you all over the place which includes trips to and from airport You can get used to this serivice in no times

title: Think before you buy a rabbit card
review: Rabbit card wont refund you 80baht and there is no discount for trips Besides you can't use it in other place like MRT system

title: Best transportation ever
review: This is literally the easiest and fastest transportation you can find in Bangkok It's really simple and all u have to do is find the nearest station of where u want to go and follow the map The service is good but it does get a bit crowded during the busy hours My family never use a taxi anymore because a driver tried to go around the city so that the fare would be higher I recommend to use MRT and BTS cards to everyone who comes to Bangkok My parents even let me and my sister (18 and 13 years old) to go off our own all the time so I can guarentee it's safe too

title: Sara is amazing!
review: Amazing tour guide She was so nice and energetic I 100% recommend sara as a tour guide Beautiful sites and an overall amazing day

title: Use selectively, primarily to beat traffic.
review: Well all modes of transport are cheap in Bangkok So a taxi is totally affordable But what can be a huge headache is the peak hour traffic It can be really nasty Distance till Siam Discovery can take upto two hours So the best way to beat it is by taking the Airport rail link  For the off peak hours I would still suggest that you take the taxi It is personal and will not have the crowds of the Rail  So if you are getting late or don't want to be stuck in the peak hour traffic take this mode of commute

title: Convenient and fast mode of transport
review: I used the Skytrain a few times and its a very nice convenient mode of transport as you avoid the heavy traffic down below Its not very cheap as a regular taxi is around 25 times more expensive for medium distance trips  Also the counter people were a bit rude on 2 occasions which was a bit off putting as I was polite to them at all times

title: Best means of transporation in Bangkok
review: With heavy traffic in Bangkok all day every day I must say that the BTS is the best means of transportation It is the fastest way to get to your destination I like that nearly at every stop at the Sukhumvit area the BTS is linked to a mall

title: Unforgettable
review: Sara was an amazing tour guide Kind warm and very funny The train market was an out of the world experience and the floating market was even better The food at the floating market no 2 was amazing 5 stars does not do it justice Unforgettable

title: Train transport
review: The train to this hotel from the airport was made by two very easy train rides The station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel The trains are clean and the trip was not all that long I found the Thai people very helpful when I was unsure of where I was going but I did note that the Thai's are a shy people

title: Very fast & on time
review: This skytrain is very fast and on time It is user friendly and you can learn to buy the ticket very soon The minor negative thing is some of the trains have no light for distinguishing the stops from the inner part of the train for travelersBTS skytrain is time and money saving for tourists I recommend it for all tourists specially families

title: quick easy system
review: We used it as it is quick easy and safe  Very cheap too  Highly recommend this form of transport  Trains travel about every 7 minutes so if you miss one there is one coming along soon  It connects to Skyrail too

title: Pretty Cool
review: Used the Sky Train to travel towards the river Great view of the city from a decent height Clean Comfortable and Quick

title: BTS Skytrain
review: I could not even think what would you do without the BTS Skytrain and the Metro They practically can get you almost around Bangkok It is very convenient The only downside is that it is so convenient that practically everyone is using it so the trains are always pack full But no worries there is always a next one in 5 minutes And they are fast and affordable I would suggest to get the day pass if you are planning to use it many times in a day the day pass is 140 Baht

title: Prepared a lot of coins first
review: Their vending machine really need to be upgraded to be the same MRT which takes notes  At the moment they takes coins only  To go a place with a family I had to prepare a lot of 10 bhat coins first Otherwise you will have to line up in the Ticketing Window for changing the coins Then line up again in the vending machine to buy tickets

title: Cramp, cramp , cramp!
review: If you travel with a lot of baggage dont use sky train It is not dear to use a Cab Ask Hotel staff for a price before you engage a cab

title: Efficiency at its best
review: Very quick and efficient way to travel from the airport to link with metro stations at a great price Good amount of trains so not having to wait ages for a train

title: Quick, cheap and easy
review: We used this every day very cheap and easy way to get around The only thing it was lacking was that it was not more extensive

title: Fast, convenient, cheap
review: The rail link to the airport is sensational as long as you don't have an excess of luggage I was only travelling with cabin luggage and a computer and found this the best way of getting to my hotel No traffic jams less than 12 the price of a taxi and a comfotable seat all the way You do have to make a train change to get to your hotel on Sukhumvit but again this is quick and easy I would only say that I would only use the train if my Sukhumvit hotel was close to a sky train station

title: BTS Skytrain
review: I have used the BTS almost everyday for over three years without any problems at all  More lines are being added very soon so travel to more areas of Bangkok will be even easier  Clean cool and fast trains  Early morning rush hours is a bit of a squeeze same in return home rush hours  Outside of thatnever a problem  Cheap fares free maps available at each station and friendly polite staff  LOVE THE BTS

title: train review
review: Good way to get around Bangkok train very clean and about every 5 mins from station  trains have air con nice and cool Peter J

title: Very easy for getting round Bangkok
review: Great train system  Buy one way tickets  Simple to navigate and fast to get around  Some trains are quite full but they run very frequently

title: Speedy
review: The fastest way to get around Bangkok and with the least stress Just lots of steps Great staff in the station and will direct you when lost

title: Excellent - clean SAFE & cheap Transport
review: So much safer and cleaner than Athens and London Great Quality and air conditioning  Efficient Gates and platform management

title: Great Way to Get Around Bangkok
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok It is a LARGE city and the BTS system will get you around quickly and for a low cost We took it between a few mall stations and used it as a meeting point for a few tours as well

title: Very convenient for city hop-around
review: I hate to take stairs up to the platform but some stations have access through nearby buildings so recommend to get inside those buildings and take escalators inside the building then walk out from there to station platform can save your energy

title: Easy way to access...
review: Having this facility allowed us to travel most of the shopping moles and markets quickly and eliminating traffic During my stay at Bangkok I did not want to hire any taxi even for airport transfers because of the availability of sky train and airport link   The most important thing is trains are available till midnight therefore we were able to get to the airport without any hazards  The only bad thing is it get little crowded during office hours so you have to wait for more than one train Since there are trains for every 12 minutes it not a big deal at all

title: one of my best train experience
review: I've been in many trains in my life but this  hours were amazing the view of the simple life in the country side the rice fields and banana plants the wild and  a river I took so many pics but still wasn't enough to see the beauty

title: Cheap and efficient
review: We bought a 40 trip Rabbit card which worked out to 23baht a trip no matter how long the journey Such an efficient system with trains arriving every couple of minutes Try to avoid peak times at popular stations to get seat

title: Easy way to access airport and city
review: Airport rail link will be the best source to connect airport with multi part of the city One of the best and must visit rail travel in bangkok visit You can enjoy the local culture and crowd especially in the busy offc hours Its a very good experience on ur business or tour visits

title: Great way to get around
review: Very easy to use economical and if you avoid rush hour not too busy You can buy day passes but depends on how many trips you plan to do

title: Gotta be fit
review: The rail link to the Airport is great  fast and inexpensive  IF you are physically fit But do not use if you cannot carry luggage up and down flights of stairs (no lifts) or drag it to your hotel down the crowded street

title: Convenient
review: It was so much easier than catching a cab We used it to and from the main Bangkok airport and found it fairly easy to navigate

title: Best way to get to the airport
review: Easily the best way from pretty much anywhere in Bangkok now to get to the airport The traffic even though it is getting better is still shocking Transferring from one train to another is easy The train was always full showing it is popular and so the express trains should be more often

title: Easily Accessible
review: what a great way to link and reach your destination Availed of the one day train ticket for only 135 THB  Went to Kingpower Duty Free through BTS  From Ploenchit to Victory Monument  Station

title: Made sure we rode on the MRT
review: Excellant and fast and it needs to be to cater for the thousands of people who ride the MRT on a daily basis

title: Great way to get from the airport
review: Great way to get from the airport to the city  I went to Koh San Road and it saved me lots of money in cab fares The train doesn't go to Koh San road but it will get you half way so you can then hop in a taxi and save yourself some money Or ask one of the people who work there to send you in the direction of the free bus that takes you to the palace just round the corner from the koh san area

title: Straight forward
review: This train is a super way of getting around Bangkok & straight forward system no delays   The ticket staff were very helpful to us

title: BTS
review: The Skytrain is one of the best transport systems in the world Build by the Germans (Siemens) just over 10 years ago it helps to battle the traffic jams in Bangkok And every year they are expending by building more and more stations

title: Easy Bangkok travel
review: The quickest easiest cheapest and cleanest way to travel around or through Bangkok Imagine the London tube with air con wifi seats & fresh air )

title: Thailand
review: I hope something diffrent here but overall not bad  YoU can see somany thing there if you really want to buy something you have to know thailand lagugage 😂

title: Quick but can be very busy
review: Very useful for getting around and beating the traffic of Bangkok but I found that if there are 23 of you and traffic isn't so bad it works out cheaper to take a cab Biggest bonus however is the direct links into most of the shopping centres across the line which makes shopping very easy

title: ticket machine
review: why ticket machines dont allow to insert the banknote or debit card im sick of queueing for exchanging the banknote into coin and then I have to wait for put the goddame coins into tix machine

title: Best Way To Connect With the Sightseeing Places
review: This is one of the methods I always prefer to use when I travel Infact the public transportation systems were also created with this aspect in mind to provide easy access to its travelers across the traveling country   The same thing applies here too As you pass through the exit doors of the Suvarnabhumi Airport please make it a point to collect the metro connectivity map as a reference to move across in the city   Not only is it the cheapest way to connect with the various sights in the city it is also hassle free safer and cheaper I practically did not have to 'ask' anybody out along the entire way as I traveled here The metro map is well updated and the information is laid down for an easy to understand language for the travelers   Buy a metro card and you can hop in and out into any part of the city at your own pace Try also to use it to interconnect within the transportation systems such as the waterways and  buses In one simple word I can say it is your perfect 'MONEYSAVER'

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: Very inexpensive and the cars are airconditioned so that is a big plus The stations are very clean and have snack stands and atm machines There are always security on site and I have never had any issues riding regardless of the hour The system runs from 6am to midnite   This is an elevated system and not all have elevators yet for the disabled Currently elevators are available at the following 16 stations last trip Mo Chit  Siam  Asok  On Nut Bang Chak  Punnawithi  Udom Suk  Bang Na  Bearing Chong Nonsi  Krung Thon Buri  Wongwian Yai  Pho Nimit Talat Phlu wutthakat and Bang Wa  If you are taking the Airport Rail train you can transfer to the BTS system at the Phaya Thai Station

title: Good value, efficient way of getting into the city. About TB 40 (£1) each way. Frequent, clean service.
review: Recommend this way of getting to and from the airport into the city Taxis available to meet trains if you have further to go

title: convenient but very busy.
review: If you are traveling with large suitcases or are physically challenged this may be tough to navigate  The trains became very crowded and was very difficult to exit with our luggage  Fortunately the people on the train were very considerate and helped us out

title: Faster way to  get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok is known for its notorious road traffic and the BTS is literally a lifesaver It is fairly easy to understand and use there are 3 ways to get tickets coin machines coin and bills machine (not all stations have these though) and manual purchase from a counter  The trains are clean and have excellent air conditioning and Thais are disciplined even during rush hour trains are full but not overly full that you feel claustrophobic   If you can skip the taxis 90% of the time taxi drivers overcharge you by as much as 4x the actual fare One driver even agreed to turn the meter on then "pretended' to fix something but actually turned it off and pulled over to the side of the road talking to someone  (scary incident I know)

title: #MakeTravelEasy #Effective
review: Airport Rail Link is really good cost and time effective traveling way Its help you to go Phaya Thai station that help you to take BTS that connect to more destination

title: Convenient
review: Very convenient You cant escape not taking this From the airport to the hotel to the central area Better choice than taxis

title: Too crowded
review: Far to crowded and hard to understand never seen anything like it and would use taxi instead if was to visit again

title: The only way to get around
review: Traffic jams are too common in Bangkok so taking cabs and cars and even tuktuks can mean long waits wasting precious travel time Try BTS Skytrains Can be slight more expensive but definitely easier and gets you there on time Prepare coins for the rides or you can always change with any station staff

title: Not so cheap
review: The train is convenient as it misses all of BKK traffic but the prices are quite elevated Local bus will take you for 7 Baht on the same ride as BTW Plus there is no train to any of two airports Yet the train is quite new but at the same time I would increase its frequency

title: Fast and timely
review: What a great way to get around the capital if you can push your way into the crowded cabins Not sure why is has to be so cold in there but for certain this is the way to go to avoid the terrible bangkok traffic grid locks

title: Getting around
review: Once you get orientated the skytrain is a great way to get where you wish to go within limits Staff very helpful to foreigners who look to be confused Ticketing system very straightforward maps and prices in English Voice over in each trains tells you which station is coming up in Thai and English

title: A better option than a hired car...when there is city traffic
review: We arrived Friday night around 6pm and knew there would be traffic on the roads  So we opted to take the Airport Rail Train  It is always an easy convenient and inexpensive way to get to the city

title: Very good
review: this is the first time I go to by sky train it's very cozy for your move in the Bangkok city quickly and cool I never see the trafic jam in Bangkok city because I has the ticket BTS ^^

title: Fast in and out from Bangkok
review: This is the fastest way and considering the service should be the most preferred transport to travel from down town to airport and vice versa Hardly took 30 minute for me to reach airport very convenient way to travel Crowed free traffic free and also give you chance to look around the city and surrounding Try must for once if you are in Bangkok its worth travelling in the county backbone of transport

title: over crowded and dangerous
review: The train is needed in bangkok due to the traffic BUT the system is so busy you may want to sit in the traffic We waited at siam to go to the hotel and we waited for 6 trains and when we got on just pushed Not the best experience and overcrowding must be dangerous

title: BTS
review: Clean cool fast and dependable  Rather crowded during peak periods  If it goes anywhere near your destination take it

title: Excellent!
review: The best fastest and cheapest way to travel from airport to the city  A great alternative to being stuck in the infamous BKK traffic jams

title: Great way to get downtown.
review: I was a bit scared at first to use public transportation but as I had very little luggage decided to just give it a try Its easy to use  very clean and quite cheap I did not regret it

title: Convenient and inconvenient at the same time
review: The skytrain is quite convenient if you want to travel around the city and avoiding the bad traffic jam on rush hour in Bangkok It makes your shopping trip and cafe hopping trip easy The inconvenient part is that it is not linked with the most popular tourist area so we still have to depend on the other public transports Plus i really don't get why the ticket selling machine can only accept coins and only one ticket at one time so lets imagine that if you come with a group of 10 friends firstly you need to go to the counter to exchange all your notes into heavy coins After that enjoy standing in front of the ticket machine and dumping 52 bath of coins into the machine and wait for the ticket to come out Repeat the process for 9 more times because you have a group of 10

title: Crazy Railway Market
review: We had a great tour with Victor our guide He was very informative and the tour was very well organised would recommend if visiting Bangkok

title: Easy to navigate
review: It took us a while to realise this is the best way to travel as tourists Cabs are hectic stop start and the roads constantly jammed Easy to work you way around all of the signage is in english and the journeys are quick and air conditioned

title: Cheap and great way to get into Bangkok
review: It's easier than it looks Just find your destination get your ticket (cheap) and hop on We had to get a taxi from our stop but the train took us most of the way there

title: So easy cheap and convenient
review: Got on at National Stadium changed at Siam then one more easy to navigate and helpful staff to ask directions if unsure 70bht all up to be dropped in the middle of the airport does need another carriage though

title: The Best way to travel in Bangkok.
review: Make your life easier and only take BTS in Bangkok  Avoid heavy traffic and it is so much more comfortable and fully AC  From the River to chatchuchak Market or a stop in Siam via MBK  Staff always willing to help at the counter with change and it is one the cleanest place  Well done for the city

title: Just what i was looking for!
review: Really wanted to see the train market and boat Market so this tour was perfect Free pickup from your hotel Guide was very informative throughout Also had water and snacks for us multiple times throughout the day There was traffic heading to and from but van was airconditioned and very comfortable Amazing deal

title: Beats the traffic
review: An efficient means of transport given the Bangkok traffic jams Can get a seat in the 'offpeak' times otherwise if gets crowded Easiest is to buy your ticket from the vending machine The website is good and you can check prices and routes in advance  One annoying feature is the noisy adverts that seem to be ruining public transport travel in many Asian cities

title: Great way to get around
review: Though it's not necessarily the cheapest way to get around in BKK It's definitely the fastest way Most stations are connected to Metro train station as well  Trains are clean and cooling But it could be very crowded during peak hours The queue to buy tickets can be quite long too  Be sure to get ready coins as the ticket machine does not accept any notes

title: Horrible experience
review: Tour operator Highly dodgy operator they charged me 500 baht extra on top of the price I paid already via trip advisor They also don’t properly pick you up they show up in a standard van to your hotel and you wouldn’t know if it’s them or someone else almost missed mine  Train market highly underwhelming honestly not worth the trip it’s just an old train and train station with a small mkt around it probably something new for a European Floating market decent experience

title: It´s a nice mean of transportation...
review: and it can actually be more expensive than taxi (if you are more than three persons and if you travel more than five stops or so  each ticket can be 42 baht)   As soon as you figure out the different lines and the correct floor it´s easy We bought single tickets but if you plan to take a lot of stops (one stop is only 15 baht or so) and several times you should look into a daypass It cost around 140 baht  Also The kids were the same price as adults  children under 90 cm are free

title: Express ...only till Makasan
review: My previous tripsthe express rail link brought me to Phaya Thaiapparently now this option starts and ends at M from the airport  Most passengers will have to opt for the 45 THB 6 stops journey to PT

title: Good Transport and Very convenient
review: BTS Skytrain is very convenient  and so fast so easy so clean so cool and so clearly about information  the first one for transport

title: Convenient
review: First time using the BTS since we are staying nearby the train station PHromPhong and of course because of the traffic  Signage everywhere you wont missed your stop or any landmark  Some stations are connected to the malls by a covered bridge Awesome Fare is okay

title: Amazing
review: Everything was amazing Victor was our guide and thanks to him we enjoyed a lot the experience He is so kind and helpful highly recommended ^^

title: Efficient and Economical
review: The Airport Rail Link is a very efficient way of getting from the airport to downtown Bangkok  The ticket vending machine does not accept credit cards so be sure to have some Thai Bhat with you  Transfer to BTS is fairly straight forward  just follow the sign )

title: What a great alternative to taxis
review: We were always stuck with taxis and limos and now with this mode of alternative transportation you can get to the airport at a fraction of the cost If you aren't carrying too much luggage this is the way to go

title: fast and easy
review: due to high traffic in rush hour in bangkok BTS is the best way to travel around the city it links to every attraction in the city and cheap too it's gets easier when you buy a rabbit card because you don't have to go to the ticket counters  overall easy and convenient

title: Cheap way to Bangkok
review: My first time on the SRT from the airport  it will get a little crowded when you get closer to the BTS  but i didn`t mind  travel time was the same as a taxi when i used both trains to get to my hotel a good choice for budget minded

title: Cheapest way to travel from the airport to Bangkok
review: We arrived early in the morning and took the ARL to central Bangkok  It was easy to buy a ticket very clean and easy to navigate the staff were very helpful with the gates as we had suitcases  It is definitely the cheapest way to get from the airport to the centre  We took a taxi on the return journey and wished we had taken the train

title: Brilliant mode of transport
review: easy efficientfast affordable and several trains running Also due to be up high on rails allows you to see some of Bangkok and its buildings

title: Phenomenal
review: Having grown up in preskytrain Bangkok and having lived in several cities overseas I can assure you this is one of the highlights of the public transport here  Easy to use with English ticket dispensers and timely it makes moving around Bangkok incredibly easy and has made me start reliking the city

title: Dockland light railway users will feel at home.
review: Stay calm  all the information you need to use the sky train is there but not always where you'd expect itTake your time and it all becomes apparent  English is used on signs To avoid confusion and hassle  buy a day ticket for 180 Baht

title: Put's NYC MTA to SHAME
review: Super clean people don't shove their elbows into your face and overall just much better maintained than NYC subways  Shame on you MTA

title: Saves time from congested roads upon arrival
review: I take a train from Suvernbhoomi  airport which takes me right to the 'Indra Hotel' in Pratunam area The entire travel takes a few minutes Travelling by taxi although not very costly takes a longer time as sometimes the roads are congested

title: Easy to use
review: Very simple to use Clean and airconditioned Maybe Transport of London can learn a few things from these guys

title: Good option
review: Cheap and if you can figure out how to get around a great alternative to taxis Not good air con though The people at the booths are really happy to draw lines on your map to show you how to get around and which stations to connect at Just keep asking for help  Also I thought I was pretty fun to ride and see the scenery

title: Modern, Clean and Smooth
review: Took MRT twice during my visit to Or Tor Kor market and Ratchada Train Market the stations are located close to these markets It is used by locals and many of the tourist so during rush hours the crowd is really huge I waited for 6 trains but frequency was very good during the rush hours

title: Great way to explore Bangkok
review: If we didn't walk to places we took the BTS skytrain Highly recommended as a cheap fast stress free way to explore Bangkok Easy to use and never had to wait long for a train

title: Avoid Bangkok traffic jams
review: the most convenient way to travel in Bangkok Fast efficient and reliable It is also cheaper than taxis and you will avoid the horror of bkk traffic jams

title: Used the skytrain Songkran 2015
review: Because of Songkran roads were blocked and tuk tuk very expensive we used the skytrain it has airco and is a fast and efficient transportation however crowdy

title: Best way to get round Bangkok
review: The sky train is really easy to use and runs every 10 mins best getting a day ticket  It’s stops at the big shopping complex Siam

title: We'll connected
review: Best way to travel from suvarnabhoomi airport  It is well connected to all the location in bangkok There are at least 100 hotels in a walking distance from various BRT stations You have a check in counter for thai airways at makasan station

title: Best way to get around the city
review: The BTS is no doubt the best way to get around Bangkok as it is affordable quick and (mostimportantly) has airconditioning There is debate about this but I personally think that staying in a hotel within walking distance to the BTS is the smartest decision you can make You'll still need to walk a ways or even grab a cab to get to some places though

title: Fantastic trip thanks to Alex
review: This was a really good trip and would surely recommend it Our host Alex was very funny and provided the day with fantastic comments on both the train market as well as the floating market

title: Bangkok
review: Rail line from the airport is inexpensive clean and very easy to use It is 5 stops to the Makkasan station which costs 35 baht and where you can pick up the metro To catch the metro you will have to exit the station and follow the signs to the metro It is a very short walk and will take about 10 minutes  The metro can take you into central Bangkok

title: Great way to miss traffic and be on time
review: Forget the heat madness and crazy traffic patterns when you can ride in ease and more comfort (and not watch your watch every few minutes and worry about getting to a hotel or an appointment)

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: The Bangkok Mass Transit System ( BTS) is the best way to get around Bangkok quickly efficiently safely and in many cases will take you directly to your hotel or shopping centre It is also a great way to look at the city from two storeys up My only caveat  not for families with children in push chairs or for the infirm Although there are usually two entrances on each side of the road  not every one will have an escalator  and there are no escalators going down Also except for very quite times the trains are full and getting in with a perambulator (baby chair) might be problematical BIG TIP Get the BTS Sky Smart Pass Even if you are in Bangkok for one day It will cost you Bt 30 ($1)  but will save you a lot of time Otherwise you need the exact change for your ticket and will have to queue up (sometimes for ages) You can keep the card for your next trip to Bangkok or pass it on to your host or friend when you get back home Many shopping centres have direct access to and from the BTS station (on the first floor level  or 2F if you are American)  Terminal 21 and Central Emporium for example You don't even have to go to street level Also there are many concessions at the 1F level You can buy snacks and drinks of excellent quality A must do journey  even if you don't need to go anywhere

title: Easy to use
review: The system is pretty straight forward and tickets are cheap so it's a good way of getting around The trains are busy but the air conditioning is a welcome break from the heat

title: A Great way to Get About and See Bangkok
review: We travelled on the sky train quite a bit during our stay in the city It's a cheap and efficient way to get around and to see the cityscape Gloriously air conditioned sometimes it's worth the ticket just to get in out of the humidity for a short while Anyway we'll worth using Great views

title: Convenient!
review: Best way to travel around the city Best way to beat the traffic jam People are very polite even during rush hours And most importantly it's very clean

title: Very fast
review: Everything a little fast We were running after the guide in the train market I would have liked to take photos but I couldn't

title: Easy and convenient
review: Especially if you get it from airport It's much cheaper than taxis and it's very convenient Clean and easy to use

title: Good service
review: One of the best mrt service I had encountered Smooth ride No delays On time I must say the locals are really discipline  They lined up one straight line no rushing into the train  Can be very packed during peak hours  Get the Day Pass for 150Baht which is worth for day use

title: Easy to use for travelers
review: We prefer to skip the line and not pay for each ticket at the ticket machine so we got a rabbit cars for each of us (3) Costs 200baht each (100 for card 100 for credit) When we return them we are meant to get 50 baht refund but I guess we will see if that happens

title: Efficient transport
review: This is the best way for travelling around Bangkok Using the system and buying tickets is easy and the trains are frequent comfortable and usually not too full

title: Let's check the newly opened MRT Purple line
review: This is the 4th route of mass transit system in Bangkok named Bangsue (Taopoon station) ( Bang Pai and) Bang Yai a large community on the  outskirt west of Bangkok which exactly is another province (Nonthaburi) My wife and I catched the train from Tao Poon station which is only 5 minutes walk from our home  to Bang Yai the second last station on the other end It takes sround 30 minutes which cost 42 bath for one trip the highest rate for the entire route ride The train is new (ofcourse) but(1) ticket vending machine is not enough especially at Bang Yai station which is a large station with lots of commutor (2) It also difficult to insert  onebaht coin into the slot as it always go down to the changebin not into the right path in the machine thus take a long time for each passenger to complete ticket buying(3) The electronic gate enteringexit the platform is also not enough (some of them are out of orderboth at Tao Poon and Bang Yai station) (4) The train braked quite hard when entering station as if they had not enough time to train the driver (5) Electronic sign board indicating station on lefthand side of the train did not work properly in both train we rode (6) The signage indicating point to get a transfer bus to Underground MRT Bangsue has to be visible easily and sufficient I wonder how hectic it would be in rush hour on working day if passenger have to wait in long line to get a ticket or even to get out of the station (7) Last but not least the government should enforce MRT to operate the blue line connecting between Tao poon station and Bang Sue station as soon as possible as it is not practical to transfer to bus to connect to underground train to ride downtown (which would take more than 20 minutes when the traffic is bad ) Hope to see improvement soon

title: Avoid the traffic
review: This is about the best way to move around The stations and trains are clean and safe and the routes get you close to many parts of the new city  The trains do get a bit crowded but Welcome to Asia If you're likely to be around for a while and taking longer trips consider buying a "rabbit card" Instead of paying a fare every time you can load the card with a certain number of trips  This is most economical only if you're going to be moving around a good bit and generally travelling more than four or more stops at a time You pay 100 Bhat for the card itself so definitely not the way to go for a short visit

title: only way to get around bangkok
review: Only way to get aroundcheap efficient and reliable can be a little crowded in peak times but there is no other way to avoid bangkok traffic

title: Fastest way to reach Airport
review: It takes approx 3040 mins to reach Bangkok Airport from the city center area of Pratunam They charge 80 baht and its the best way to reach Aiport

title: Fast and Convenient
review: Being a student in Thailand means a lot of travelling to other countries near by The rail link is super quick and easy to use and has saved me a lot of money Cheaper and faster than using a taxi

title: Very clean and on time
review: The rail in Bangkok is full of people who line up in orderly fashion  No food or drink allowed at the station or in the train  The trains run on time and are very clean  Felt very safe

title: easy convenient but very crownded
review: It is easy convenient but very crownded especially in the morning and evenind during daytime is ok

title: Convenient
review: It's pretty easy to use the BTS Very convenient and gets you to all the major places From the stops you can easily catch a taxi (car or bike) to the places you need to go to Also you skip the traffic which can be quite a pain

title: Easy access to some parts of the city from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Much cheaper than a taxi the Airport Rail Link can be a great way to get to your location in the city Check their website  easy to use You can also transfer fairly easily to the BTS and the subway

title: Clean, efficient, inexpensive and excellent way to beat the traffic
review: I used the Airport Rail Link between Suvarnabhumi airport and Phaya Thai (my hotel Sukosol was close to the station) during my last visit to Bangkok I find that the airport link can get extremely busy and crowded but it is still the best way to get to Central Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi airport and viceversa I really enjoyed the journey but it definitely gets busy Mind your luggage and be glad that you are not sitting in traffic Highly recommended to use this over taxi

title: One of the best transport networks in BKK
review: If you are not familiar with the transport network download the Rail network app before using it which will help you a lot to rule out conditions   One of the best transport networks where it give access to all over BKK at a very reasonable price Every few minutes you get access to trains Clean cost effective and convenient

title: Best easy way to get around in Bangkok
review: No need to get ripped off by cabbies  Taking the sky train is convenient easy maps are every where and it is very affordable   Hold onto your ticket for when you exit the train

title: Quick, cheap
review: Bangkok's attempt to put itself on the map of cities that have connected the city centre with their main airport quite successful There are not many stops but one of the those gets you to Asok so to the advisor city centre Head to the lowest floor of the airport and follow "City link" signs Using the Airport Link will allow you to avoid the unpleasant experience with Thai airport taxi drivers notoriously known for overpricing

title: Perfect! No reason to take the cab if your hotel is nearby a station
review: Best possible standard No problems Airconditioned The Thais have invested in transportation Not just the Airport Rail Link but also the Skytrain and the Metro are all topnotch Much better in fact than in some European cities

title: Skip the traffic jam: BTS best option
review: to be honest the condition and environment is exceed my expectation It's clean cheap air conditioning most importantly it save a lot of time to stuck in traffic jam So i would be recommend BTS Rabbit card can save time to queue for purchase single trip ticket

title: Use the train, forget the taxis!!
review: The train system is easy to use its not so huge that you will feel overwhelmed but it is clean user friendly and cheap

title: Cheap ALL DAY Travel
review: Get around Bangkok  on the cheap on the BTS Skytrain All day ticket Easy to understand route map DOES GET VERY BUSY DURING RUSH HOURSGreat way to get around the city CHEAPLY

title: Clean, cheap and on time
review: We used the BTS to move around while on vacation  The service was cheap and the cars were refreshingly clean  It definitely made a great break from the Bangkok traffic

title: Bangkok Sky Train Ride
review: Very convenient to get around the city Easy to buy ticket(s)  instructions are in English and quite simple instructions to follow  There are food stalls clothes shops and newspaper magazine stands around the area Just take note on connecting train stops if you need to transfer trains There is a train stop indicator inside the train And written on your card too are train stop locations Moreover there is an announcement being made for every train stop stating your location and next train stop  both in Thai and English

title: MOST CONVENIENT WAY to go around Bangkok!
review: The BTS Skytrains are very clean well maintained and very fast in arriving and leaving the stations It's also very convenient when going around Bangkok as it's near malls attractions and essential landmarks  One con of the BTS Skytrain is that there is NO tourist pass That means no unlimited rides for a certain number of days  BONUS TIP The BTS platforms are nice vantage points for taking photos of the surrounding area I got nice photos of street activities and even light trails of traffic Keep in mind tripods are not allowed  You can see my photos on Instagram @domcaligan  Thank you

title: Good clean fast but not the most economical
review: MRT is cheap fast and clean option But if you are travelling in a bigger group then taxi turns out to be more cheaper option Also you dont need to walk a lot or climp updown the stations if you use a taxi BTS network is not too extensive and the entryexit points are not too close to the major sites

title: Better than I expected
review: Used this when my flight out of Bangkok got cancelled It was much easier to use than I expected it would be and was great for getting into downtown

title: Very convenient and useful
review: Very convenient and useful way to travel around Bangkok You can buy a day pass or ticket as you may wish The train is clean and I saw they respect and offer seats to elders There are small snack shops in each of the station Escalators as well If you want to withdraw some money then there are ATMs available at the stations

title: scary
review: I found it totally impossible the first time until a local showed me the way  then it was fantastic I would still rather travel by tut tut

title: Traveling  without the traffic
review: I have been many times to Bangkok so after all these years and after checking in my bags to storage I caught the train into BBK from the airport for the day and it was so cheap and easy even with 3 changes

title: Great skytrain
review: Very user friendly service East you use and understand if you have never used it before It's a great way to beat the Bangkok traffic

title: Fast and comfy
review: Very easy to understand cheap comfortable Just need more routes to reach all part of the city And maybe more integrated with boats

title: wheelchair / stroller are not welcome!

title: Amazing Experience!!
review: The floating Markets tour is going to be one of my favorite memories in Thailand It was such a unique and fun experience and we had a blast with our tour guide Vicky   The tour started off as smooth as can be We were picked up from our hotel in KHAOSAN road on time The ride was there was interesting Vicky gave us all the fun facts about Thailand’s life style and tips about how to interact with local vendors It’s really great to know the do’s and don’ts at the market since the locals are very traditional and it’s important that we as visitors remain respectful   Our first stop was the train market We got to stop by the salt fields and enjoyed a train ride to the market The train market was hands down an amazing experience Street vendors are lined up along the sides of the train tracks and they sell everything from fresh food to clothing We also go to see the train leave We stood so close to the tracks as the train passed by it was insane   The second stop was the floating market We road on the long tail boat to the actual floating market From there you have about an hour and a half of free time to do what you want The paddle boat to ride the floating market was an extra 100 baht per person I recommend that you do it as it was an amazing experience We got to see the vendors along side the canal and bought coconut ice cream as we ride down the canal The ride was 30 mins long After that we walked around the market ate and bargained for some souvenirs FYI  stuff there are more expensive but I think it’s good to buy at least one thing to help out the local vendors Also Vicky gave us some great bargaining tips   Overall this trip was worth it It was a fun and unforgettable experience and we had the best tour guide to show us around

title: No Fuss No Muss No Bother
review: On my first visit to Bangkok about 20 years ago there was no Skytrain  To go from Sukhumvit to the weekend market ("chatuchak") I took a taxi which took an hour and a half of sitting in traffic jams and cost me proportionally  Today when I want to go to the weekend market from Sukhumvit I get on the SkyTrain (or the MTR) and in 20 minutes I am there  No fuss no muss no bother  The SkyTrain (BTS) is definitely an efficient mode of transportation  For those of us who do not like the traffic jams that characterize Bangkok you can ride over them by using the Skytrain  Like any other train the passenger is limited to go where the tracks take him and so as opposed to a taxi the chances that you are going to go from door to door are relatively slim and clearly there are destinations which are not reached by the Skytrain  However if you can come close to your destination it is worth the ride as it is airconditioned and avoids the jams  The down side is that in many places you have to climb steep staircases to reach the platform  Installation of more escalators would make this mode of transportation much more attractive  Additionally the ticket machines do not accept bills meaning that if you do not have enough coins in your pocket you may have to stand on two lines  the first to change bills to coins and the second to purchase the ticket  There are situations where the cashier will also sell individual tickets but this is more the exception than the rule

title: First Overnight Train - Amazing Experience
review: Before stepping on the train I had not realized that this thing had derailed something like 7 times the month before  But all part of the excitement of traveling  This was to be my first trip in a train and first time obviously sleeping on one    As part of my Contiki trip we were taking this from Bangkok to Chiang Mai  The train station was quite an experience as it actually had a KFC and Dunkin Donuts in it (we don't even have a Dunkin where I live in LA)  The heat and the atmosphere was like out of a movie  I loved it  The train itself was relatively clean (unless you had to use the bathroom although I doubt those area clean anywhere)  The place where you sit has a table and the area converts into basically a bunk bed for you and your seat mate    I was so excited I couldn't even tell you if the bed was comfortable however because of the movement of the train it lulls you to sleep anyway  They also provide meal service  While the meal itself was a bit expensive by Thai standards the food was actually quite good (seems to always bee good in Thailand)    The only quirky part was that you had to keep your suitcase with you (they didn't put them in the undercarriage) so it was a bit cramped with everyone's full sized luggage everywhere  Who cares  Great time  I'll never forget the experience    PS  Our train didn't derail  )

title: Good day out
review: Good day out boat trip up the river The museum has been done up since my last visit The area around the bridge has suddenly become more commercialised We were disappointed because we thought we would go over the bridge on the train check your tour details The guide really tried to make our day out a success I think people have forgotten how to tip someone This guy put a lot of effort into the tour

title: What a way to go...NOT!!
review: My brother and I decided to take the daytime dieselelectric train which leaves at 0830 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai We decided to do this as we wanted to experience the countryside during the journey which we figured we would miss if we took an overnight train Frankly from my perspective it must rate as one of the most tedious and uncomfortable train journeys in the world The train is airconditioned which is a bonus The seating is reasonable for a short trip of say up to 5 or 6 hours But we are looking here at a 12 hour journey and frankly if you think you have been uncomfortable in cattleclass on a plane over that period of time you ain't seen nothin' yet The train stops at every crummy little station going out of Bangkok and at practically every station of any size on the way to Chiang Mai and not for a few minutes either  You waitand waitand waitand waitad infinitum You have train attendants who bring around set meals and snacks at set times which aren't too bad but there is no refreshment car so you cannot get a coffee or a drink or snack outside of the set hours This adds to the tedium The scenery is boring until you get to the foothills and mountains going up to Chiang Mai and of course you miss a lot of that because it starts to get dark Frankly unless you are a masochist who enjoys discomfort boredom and tedium take the night train You will not miss much during the night you will save a night in a hotel and the sun will be coming up as you get to the interesting scenery around Chiang Mai You will have a restaurant car attached and you will get a sleep and be fresh for a new day when you get to your destination Take it from me The day train is NOT the way to go

title: Great way to get to Chiang Mai
review: I caught the #13 train & travelled in 2nd class AC sleepers  The bunks were for 4 people & I met some Germans & a Norwegian who were great for a chat before bedtime  The service is really very good & the attendant comes & makes your bed at about 9pm  You can get full service of food & drinks at the beginning and end of the trip too although I ate beforehand & then took my own snacks so only bought some very average but welcome coffee in the morning Get up at 530am & head to the restaurant cart to watch the sunrise & the scenery coming into Chiang Mai stopping along the way at a few small rural towns which was a nice reminder that you're out of the city  Buy your tickets with 12Go online & pick them up across the road from the train station before you go  The Hong Kong Noodle house was good for a light dinner before the trip too  Same cost as flying but you save on a hotel room And very safe

review: If you're traveling tofrom Suvarnabhumi airport take the airport link instead It's so much cheaper than taxi much faster during peak hours and pretty convenient when you're already inside the train The stations are easy to navigate and there are lifts for your luggages too   The taxi in the station left nothing to be desired though They will ripped you off big time They will try to go the long way round even though your hotel is only 3km away from the airport link station plus they will add 50baht into the fare I'm not sure if that is correct or not but i felt ripped off because i paid 3 times as much in fare between going to the airport link station and returning from the airport link to the hotel (50 baht going to the station and 180 returning from the station) The driver was a hoon too He drove so fast and the music was really loud boom boom thing

title: Kanchanburi Tour
review: I have been to Kanchanburi many time however this was the 1st with my family  7 people in total  We book the full day   Cemtey  Jeath Museum  Bridge  Train  Lunch Elephant camp  rafting  and finally Sai Yok waterfall   Tour was booked through Click2go  Thailand  about 1000b each but well worth it   Minivan was on time  clean and with a safe driver   We had varous guides through the day and the tour was mix and match but all knowledgable and effiencient   it was a public holiday in Thailand on the day we went so a little busy  especially on the train we paid a little extra for guaunteed seats water and wet towel 100b each    No real issues all day on time  plenty of time in each spot to do what we wanted   The family really enjoyed    the only issues was the waterfall Hot season and no water  no water  no waterfALLmore of a trickle   Very busy with Thai families enjoying the cool shade under the trees  so a good place to people watch
