review: The bangkok MRT is a few years old but you would have thought this opened yesterday Its very clean from the stations to the trains themselves We took a train from Silom to sukhumvit and was so cheap and took 10 minutes only Too busy at 6pm with the locals going home but thats everywhere in the world

title: Fast and Affordable Sky Train
review: Bangkok traffic is horrible The sky train was fast clean and affordable It was simple to use There were frequent announcements in English with frequent stops It was great alternative to the cabs and tuktuks

title: Easy peasy to get around
review: It takes you places that are faster than walking or taking a taxi The fare averaged 25 baut and took me to soi cowboy for fun times

title: Fast, reliable, cheap
review: This is a very good way to travel between downtown Bangkok and Suvarnabhumi Airport I recommend not to use the airport link if you have heavy or big luggage as some carrying may be necessary at the stations

title: The reason you come to Kanchanaburi
review: There is so much history in the railway with museums cemeteries and of course the bridge and trains  the horrors that went on here and now it is so beautiful and peaceful

title: Quickest way into town at rush hour
review: Cost 45thb each and takes about 35 mins to the end of the line  so really quick in a city where traffic simply grinds to a halt in rush hour  Gets very crowded though

title: Getting around
review: Wow this service is great easy to use very cheap and trains and stations spotless Easy on and off system

title: Clean and efficient
review: A great clean and inexpensive way to get around townHighly recommendedplan your journey ahead of time because se it's not sure you'll be able to get advice in English at every stationAll in all a cheerful experience

title: Incredibly good
review: Negatives standing room only most of the time  Positives safe secure security everywhere exceptionally regular every 5 mins or so comfortable easy to use

title: Best of Mass transit
review: The best in mass transit for getting around this HUGE city Bangkok Thailand Remarkably ontime incredibly clean low cost

title: BTS - most convenient to travel to shop
review: Their train system is really good well connected and available in English as well  You can plan your travel on the tourist spot just using BTS and buy their day pass which costs only THB135  Normally it is full on weekends and peak hour but the trains are plenty and on time

title: Easy and fast to get around
review: Easy way to get around the city even without knowing thai It's faster to take the train then a taxi in most times of the day You would get stuck in traffic often

title: Best way to travel downtown.
review: The Skytrain system is probably the best transportation option to happen to Bangkok since taxis were invented And its plenty cheap No wonder its becoming the preferred method of getting around The skytrain system is still in its infancy and is being expanded With Bangkok's traffic any expansion to this system will be welcome One thing they could do now to improve it is to make it completely integrated with the MRT Subway lines and the BRT system That way you can just buy one allday pass and use it across all platforms That would ease pedestrian traffic as well But overall a very well designed system

title: Best way to get around
review: If you are visiting Bangkok definitely use the BTS fast and cheap Buy a one day pass for 140 thb and gives you unlimited rides till midnight

title: Very efficient
review: Great way to travel around bangkok Clean fast and reliable Easy to navigate between stations and see main tourist attractions Air conditioned and well organised Only thing would be better if it had full windows to see views

title: Excellent tour
review: Sara is super knowledgeable and very organized  We were a family of 4 with 2 teens Sara made sure we were on time got to see the very fun railway market and helped us arrange lunch at the floating market too Very smooth trip  We highly recommend the trip with her

title: Fast, cheap and convenient
review: Although there might be a faster way to get into the city this line is not expensive and does stop at stations connected to the BTS skytrain and the MRT railway system Alternatively you can take a taxi from one of the stations in the cityThus you can avoid the long taxi ride and much of the heavy commuter traffic

title: Cheap and easy
review: If you are in Bangkok then you must try BTS Skytrain because it will save money as well as your precious time 😊

title: Best way to "downtown"
review: Fares are cheap (about $150) for a one way ticket from the airport to Rachapraprop station Much better and cheaper than a cab or limo as you don't get stuck in traffic   You'll have the get some Baht from an ATM in the airport to use in ticket  machines (English language option easy to select) or use a credit card Note that you need the token or card to get in and out of the stations

title: No Express
review: I moved to Bangkok deliberately close to Makassan Station in 2014 when the Airport Link Express was available Sadly no more In place you can travel to the airport via the City Line which runs along the same route However the City Line makes several stops There are 5 stops between Makassan and the airport with a journey time of around 3540 minutes The cost is very low only 35 THB one way so much cheaper than a taxi The bad news is that hundreds of cummuters use the same train so if you are traveling with suitcases allow a LOT more time especially if you plan to take the journey at peak times Chances are that you will NOT get on the first train you are waiting for  The train does stop inside the airport so not too much more traveling  apart from getting from B1 level to Level 4

title: Crowded and inconvenient with a luggage
review: although the ride is fast and price is cheap the overcrowded coaches and the absence of well functioning escalators or lifts at many sttions make the experience challenging More trains would be a welcomed solution

title: Excellent way to commute
review: I always preferred to stay near MRT it is connected to almost all tourist and shopping destination in Bangkok

title: FLY BY TRAIN - Cheap, fast and safe
review: Cheap fast and safe way to avoid the grid locks below Beware access is generally by stairs with an escalator on one side of the road only Not to be missed FLY BY TRAIN

title: Dr. Peppie Tandhasetti
review: Excellent This is one of best hotel stays I’ve had Recommend Chris and other staff provided excellent customer service

title: Escape the jam!
review: Fast & easy travel using the BTS system This is soo cheap and you get to escape the jam Although do take note of the peak hours because the trains could get reaaaally busy

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Used the sky train to get from central pier to patpong market Very easy to use Either pay with coins at the machines or pay at a kiosk Cost 30 Bhats each way

title: Avoid Airport taxis
review: This was very easy especially if your hotel is on the Sukhumvit or Silom BTS lines   Catch the airport link to Phaya Thai (last stop) just to make it easy to transfer for Sukhumvit   Catch the 4th stop for SilomMRT   Avoids the hassles of a taxi and only costs 1 to 2 USD

title: The better way to Suvarnabhumi Airport.
review: From BKK downtown directly to the main airport this is the better choice you should try The fare is very cheap

title: Was a fun experience
review: It was a bit scary at first but we had a friendly tourist tell us what station to go toThe skytrain is worth going on I would recommend you go on it

title: Handy way to get in and out of BKK
review: Very clean with good aircon about 40 baht from the centre of the city to the International terminal

title: The number one way to move around Bangkok
review: BTS or the Sky train is your greatest relief when you need to travel internally in central Bangkok Both the Silom line and Sukhumvit line are however extended and from 2020 the Sukhumvit line will take you really far out from Bangkok city center Cool down in an airconditioned train and the trains passes by something like every 5 minutes You also get to avoid polluted TukTuk trips or getting stuck in traffic in a taxi

title: Skytrain to airport
review: Taking a sky train to airport is easy The airport line is independent between Airport and Phayathai station Fee is 45 badh It takes about 30min and passes thru 8 stations total including Phayathai Forget the double red lines showing on the map for this line It probably was showing the express line in the past which is no longer available (it confused me a bit so I want to mention this)   Heading from airport to city When you get to the last station Phayathai you need to transfer to other city line for the city For example from Phayathai to Chitlom is only 3 station apart and fee is 26 badh Chitlom is the main station close to Amarin and Central World Shopping Centers   Heading to airport As far as crowd concern the city lines are so frequent so you can skip one if overcrowded no biggy At Phayathai all passengers from airport will empty here as being the last station so you shouldn’t have any problem heading to airport from here  The only one concern might be is some of the stairs at platforms are without elevator or escalator so you need to hand carry your luggage If you can manage that go for sky train is cheaper and faster Unless you have more than 3 or 4 people then taxi might be more economical if that’s the case

title: Easy and inexpensive
review: Worth saving money to get into town just be careful w the taxis when you exit the station as they will most likely rip you off bc they fight against putting the meter on Not the best welcome to Bangkok but really liked taking a cheaper and easy ride into the center

title: Amazing experience at the markets
review: SaRa was an excellent and entertaining tour guide Explaining everything along the way including beware of the tourist traps The day was just long enough to see all the highlights including the train and boat rides Highly recommended this tour to anyone Five stars

title: This or the skytrain...you will go everywhere
review: Sometime you can get to an attraction by MRT or by the Skytrain both are complementary and very easy of use Don't take the cab too quickly

title: Not for airport travellers with big luggage
review: Arrived in Bangkok Friday afternoon so thought this would be a smarter option than taxi Boarding was okay but we had 2 large suitcases and had to travel to the 2nd last station Did not think it would get so crowded but it did I think if we had smaller luggage I would try again Also tried to get to the airport via rail link but was too crowded to even board even on a Tuesday night

title: The Best Way to Travel
review: quick easy and probably the fastest way to get around Bangkok depending on how much you use this you can pay by eat trip or just get a day pass (BHT 140)

title: Good way to explore BKK
review: Cheap comfortable and good way to transport in bkk You can explore thai people how live and learn somethings about their life  Don't forget the buy street fooda near to stations )

title: Nice airport, full of thailand culture
review: Nice and clean Only take 375 Baht to get there via Uber And only take you 30min if you take train  There is a 24hour food court in 1F called Magic Food and the food there is very cheap and unexpectedly delicious Please get there and take a meal before you pass through the passport control Better not to have your meal after the passport control  standard airport price inside  Also got a Family Mart there and the price is reasonable

title: Interesting transportation
review: I took the train only to go to Central World so it was a short travel We have to change our money for the coins that we will use to go to a certain station

title: Excellent Service and very good value
review: Very efficient means of travelling around the city You can buy a rabbit card on entering the station and use this for all your journeys Trains seemed to come every 3 mins so always reliable No food and drink are allowed on the trains so they are always very clean

title: Well worth the money.
review: Excellent trip and well worth the price It’s certainly longer than half a day We were picked up at 8am and didn’t arrive back to the MBK Centre until 3pm Our tour guide Mindy was very knowledgeable and helpful

title: very modern and efficient, fun and easy to use
review: In our four days in Bangkok it was hard to develop o mind's eye view of the city There are some samll areas where you can wander around but it's a large modern chaotic city The Skytrain makes it all manageable It covers most of the important areas and is easy and inexpensive to use

title: Best transportation
review: I like travelling by skytrain Its easy accessible and on time Sometimes lot of crowd but thats ok Its everywhere) its convenient)

title: Too many steps to climb
review: Efficient and airconditioned but  what a climb  Same as elsewhere there is no way to see a young person playing with his her smartphone giving the seat to an elderly who had some thirty or more steps to climb to reach the platform

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: Air conditioned and convenient this is the best way to get around Bangkok   If you plan on doing a few trips in a day make sure you get a day pass  It only costs you 140THB and saves you scrounging for change or waiting in the queue for the ticket machine   Like any public transport it does get crowded so be prepared to squish in

title: Good way to get to downtown
review: Easy and quick way to get to Bangkok from the airport Takes appr same amount of time as a taxi (if the traffic is good) Price is ok too

title: Easy Peasy Squeezy Freezy
review: 'Of course we didn't bother with the organised trips  we did what we usually did and booked a taxi for the day  the traffic wasn't too bad and we think it's the only way to travel and see the sights'  Daunting words for us as virgin Bangkok tourists but anyhow we pressed on with the BTS (aka Skytrain to you and me) and boy are we glad we didn't follow the 'taxi' advice It's hard to imagine how the system could be made any easier  you simply look at the station you're at find the one you want to go to and it tells you the tariff to pay Don't bother going to the womanned window though 'cos all she does is tell you the fee and give you change to feed into the machine anyhow The exception is if you want a day ticket  144 Baht which has to be purchased and activated by the cashier The signs to the platforms are clear and in English and there is the added bonus that the walkways often help you over busy (manic) street junctions The queues are wellbehaved and stand to the sides to allow passengers easy egress Any problems then Well only the usual problems of crowding at peak times  inevitable  but you can look down smugly on the mayhem in the streets and that makes you feel all warm and cuddly  not that you would overheat though  the air con suppliers seem to use the train as a showroom and boy it can get cold Opportunities for improvement  the day ticket only relates to the Skytrain and it would be handy if the metro had a combined ticket otherwise a 5* service

title: Excellent Alternative to Taxis
review: Great way to travel if you are visiting Bangkok on the Cheap Payment is straight forward The routes are well marked and there are booths available if you need change for larger bills The trains are prompt and fast but can be crowded

title: Good, reliable and lots of trains....a great way to get around
review: Why a yearly card and top it up as you need toquick to buy and you get back the balance if you are leaving the country when you hand it back

title: Fast & reasonable
review: Getting to the heart of Bangkok from the suvarnabhumi airport is very easy & has various options to connect to the bts and getting to various locations It saves a lot of the travel time especially during the peak hours Only available from 0600 to midnight Best way to beat the traffic

title: Fast and easy way to get intermediate distances
review: Get your tickets from the machines or manned counter insert it into the machine and there you go  Can get crowded during office hours (910am 171930) and may not be suitable for families with very young children imho

title: Excellent
review: Fantastic means of communication Punctual and well maintained Excellent means of communication and most convenient mode to commute

title: Good for single passenger
review: This is very frequent service that you can find in Bangkok You may also avoid traffic jam and can easily move to destinations But if there are few others with you I personally think it is expensive though

title: cheap way of going to your hotel directly from the airport!
review: cheap efficient and comfortable This takes you to your destination in bangkok easypeasy lemon squeazy

title: Bangkok
review: We are regularly going to Bangkok and love to use the BTS Skytrain It is easy fast and clean People are very helpfull for explaining how to find what you need and how to get the required coins Make sure that you have studied the map in advance and you know where to go  Unfortunately the destinations by BTS are rather restricted It does not cover Bangkok by far

title: Fabulous transport
review: Boy does Bangkok have the best train system Stayed in Bangkok 5 days (used the train) then onto Phuket On our way back to Australia we had a 10 hour stop in BKK so we hopped on the train at Airport then connected onto another train & went to SiamMBK for shopping stress free easy as no traffic & was brilliant

title: Good way to avoid the congestion
review: We took the 1802 train and arrived at the airport after about 30 minutes On the way we saw congestion everywhere and felt lucky that we didnt have to wait in there The price is also very attractive 45B brings you from Phya Thai to the airport The only drawback may be that there are not many seats you may need to stand through the journeymost of the journey

title: The best way to travel around bangkok!!
review: This is the best and easiest way to travel around bankok Really easy to use and pretty inexpensive

title: Best way to get to the city center
review: If your hotel is near the main area this is the cheapest way to go to the city center from the airport 90 baht max Airport taxi is 400 baht and limo is 1400 baht

title: Fast, cheap, and efficient way to get around
review: We took the Sky Train a couple times during our visit  for public transit it is quick relatively clean and easy to navigate

title: Fast and clean
review: A fantastic way to get into the city from the airport cheap (45baht each so less than £1) and fast and very clean so after our long journey to get to Bangkok it was a welcome way to travel and we got to see a bit of the city on the way in aswell

title: very convenient
review: This is a very convenient mode of transportation if you are traveling to Suvarnabhumi Airport It is connected to the BTS You can get to the airport really quickly If you are traveling from Silom area it takes an estimation of about an hour to get there

title: Very Convenient Connection to the City
review: The rail is so convenient that you don't need the Thai translator Travel time is not too long Only one complain the service is quite pack considering the airport rail also serves as local train service

title: easily accessible
review: Very easy to use and gets crowded at times but overall it's extremely clean and safe You also see Bangkok on the way and it's beautiful

title: Fast, efficient, AC
review: This is definitely the best way to get around Bangkok its fast easy to use and a day pass is a cheap way to get to all the major sights without the need for taxis or walking in the heat

title: Very convenient
review: Very convenient And reasonably priced The only downside is the train gets a lil stuffy due to too many passengers in the train Aircond is not really working well

title: Economical Way to Transfer From and To the Airport
review: The trains are usually very full given there are total of 8 stops along the route so if you don't get on it from either end you are going to have to find your way to squeeze your luggage and yourself onboard  You can find yourself waiting more than 20 minutes at peak hours as each train shows up already packed even if you are just the second stop from the start of the route towards the airport  Once on the ride is smooth and there are announcements before each stop to alert passengers to stations where you can transfer to other train lines  Certainly a good way to avoid the time consuming and energy sapping traffic jams that Bangkok is known for just time your trips with enough buffer to find a train you can squeeze on to

title: A marvel
review: a great way to get around this sometimes crowded city( I would not have it any other way) some excellent links to the MRT underground too which means you can get almost anywhere without using the congested roads though I do enjoy taking the local busses too 😄

title: Easy way to go all over city
review: During peak hours traffic jam it is good way to go anywhere All the major shopping areas and nightlife areas are covered with this sky train You just collect ticket from machine by using coins only If you have baggage with you staff are helpful to open side gate to walkthrough

title: So easy a baby could do it
review: I was little nervous taking the airport rail link by myself but it was super easy I got on at Phaya Thai Instead of going through to the skytrain there are signs for the airport rail link Follow the signs Get your token (hold on to your token because you will need it to get off) from where I was it was about 30 minutes to the airport but I was able to follow along on the map to see which stops we were at Each stop was also announced in Thai and English over the loudspeaker It lets you off literally at the airport just walk up the stairs This was so much easier than haggling with a taxi driver

title: Best way to get around Bangkok!
review: We will always try to stay within easy reach of a BTS Station This mode of transport is just great very inexpensive easy to navigate clean and the trains themselves are air conditioned It's not a huge network but if you can use it to connect to the river then a "hop on hop off" ferry ticket is the perfect combination for a great day out Keep an eye on your valuables not that this is a specific BTS problem but a simple precaution when  travelling in Bangkok

title: Best time saving and economical transport
review: Best way to reach aiorport on time and economical It start from Phaya Thai  Pratunam  area Which is famous for shopping and street food 1st to last station cost 45 bhat But service is available only up tp 1145 PM

title: Cheap way to get from airport to hotel
review: cheap easy to use getting from the airport to your next location Try not to go during their peak hours with a lot of luggage Can be a nightmare

title: Easy way to the airport
review: This is an easy way to get to the international airport with connections to the MRT Worth it especially if you don't have a ton of luggage to carry with you

title: Very useful
review: Very useful and cheap to go and come back from the airport It could be very crowded between 5 and 6pm but there is a train every 10 or 15min

title: Best way to get around
review: If you want to travel around Bangkok but want to go further afield get the sky train and the subwayvery easy to usethe staff are very helpful and friendly One thing to remember is the security is tightdon't get on the trains until you're told to get onbags will be checked but cheap and clean

title: A trip into the old Kingdom of Thai Ayutthaya.
review: Whistling sounds followed by the horn from the head of the local train clickety clack sound from beneath our seat we are on our way to the old Kingdom of Thai Ayutthaya THB 15person for a great experience in an old local train (equipped with only ceiling fans) with open windows heading north The trip took us about 15hours Not expecting any wow scenery along the way we find it still a great way to travel because the tickets to and fro BangkokAyutthaya are easily available the train makes many trips these two destinations at different times

title: Nowhere else!!!
review: This train made our way from the airport to city center completelt quick and easy Definitely worth for a value and quite safe as well I wonder if this train could be built in other cities

title: easy commute
review: it is the fastest and easiest way to commute in Bangkok The routes are pretty simple and instructions are given very clearly The staff is helpful You get food and some shops to buy necessary items inside the stations there are usually two or more exits so make sure to choose your exit based on where you want to go Frequency is good and though it is crowded you can breath and stand

title: Very efficient clean and spacious and air conditioned
review: Very efficient system easy to navigate Make sure you have coin change so you can easily buy your ticket Simply click on the station you wish to go to and it tells you the price in baht If you don't have change then you can go to the desk and they change up your money for you and then you go and use the machines

title: brilliant
review: The best means of transport in Bangkok Fast safe clean well organised A bit overcrowded near Siam station

title: Dishonest BTS station worker
review: Avoid exchanging big notes ie 1005001000 to coins because you will be cheated with insufficient coins in return to purchase the BTS ticket This happened to me during my first and second visit to bangkok It is almost like every station will be doing the same My advise is buy a day pass or Rabbit card or better still use Grab or Uber to travel around because skytrain is almost all the time packed

title: Easy
review: Access to Hua Lampong Train Station metro line comes off the Bang Wa BTS line  You have to make your way to BTS Sala Daeng and exit the BTS system  The walk is about 10 mins and signage is not obvious to the MRT  Just ask but don't let anyone ask you if they can help they will try and get you you to go somewhere else  Simply say NYET  Then they know you don't speak english and will leave you alone  When in the MRT system you have to buy another pass (this time a black coin that is used the same way as the BTS system  Don't lose the coin as you need it for exit  The system was quite quiet both days we used it to get to and from Hua Lampong  After getting off it is a fair underground walk  You arrive at a 19th century train station that still has the commodities of 20th century

title: Easy!
review: The most easy way of travel in Bkk  Buy a day card for your convinience and hop on and off No hazzle at all

title: great service
review: we use the skytrain every time we go to Bangkok and it wonderful cleancheap and faster than using the taxi or tuk tuks get the rabbit card and jump on and off

title: Great link from BKK to downtown
review: They have a city line that has a few stops and an express line that goes from airport to downtown where most of the tourist hotels are then take a taxi to hotel The traffic is very bad here and can cost a lot in a taxi as you are in jams all the time except during the early hours 1am5am

title: Great way to travel
review: The BTS is an easy way to travel in Bangkok A very reasonable price clean efficient and frequent Good coverage takes you very close to DMK armour port too Mochit (there you can get A1 bus the rest of the way to the airport)

title: Place for excellent Tailor made suits
review: New Armani on Sukhumvit Road next to Nana BTS Station is the place to visit for excellent Tailor made suits suits in Bangkok city Jimmy and his team will give you the suit to cherish all your life and the price is very friendly The place is easily accessible by road or using the BTS It is next to Nana BTS Station at the junction of Sukhumvit soi8  Delivery can be made to your hotel in the event you have no time to collect the items  Give them a try and you will never regret

title: Efficient
review: Very Efficient way to travel in Bangkok Takes a a few times to get used to it but once you do its an awesome way to get around

title: BTS Bangkok
review: A very good fast and clean  transportation  It takes you every where you'd like to go in a very easy way

title: A great transportation system that helps you a lot
review: If you gona visit Bangkok you better choose BTS Skytrain as the transportation you prefer to ride First of all this kind of transportation is  reach almost all places on Bangkok Secondly the price is very affordable if you are going to visit many places in one day you can buy one day pass bts ticket for only 140Baht Thirdly people in Bangkok dont speak english fluently by riding bts to your destination itll make you easier   Before you ride bts for your trip make sure you have bts map in your phone I hope you enjoy your bangkok trip

title: Getting too busy for tourists
review: Since my previous visit pre COVID I can report several new stations have been added making theses trains now very busy with local commuters  So if you are trying to transport suitcases to and from the airport I cannot recommend any more There is no provision for luggage and packed in like sardines is no fun after an 11 hour flight If you can travel long haul with just a small bag great otherwise the ARL is really not fit for the purposes of airport to city travel Taxis cost around 500 Baht compared with the 45 baht ARL fare plus onward city travel (ie another 24 baht to Siam)  but is door to door with considerably more comfort

title: Great cheap and easy way to explore Bangkok
review: We chose our hotel Eastin Grand in bangkok because it had a direct access link bridge to the BTS Skytrain Once we learned how to get the tickets printed and move around travelling through the Sky train was a breeze All the places we went to were very near the Sky train stations For eg MBK and Jim Thompson are walking distance from National Stadium the Salar daeng night food market is below the station by same name and the major attarctions Grand Palace Wat Pho etc can be reached by ferry from the sky train station

title: An Absolute Must!
review: Such an amazing experience and the whole day went smoothly The driver and the English speaking guide were very friendly and fun and made sure no one got lost or left behind when exploring on their own There were lots of opportunities to wander around at your own pace to take photos eat and shop The railway market and the floating market are both so unique and fun to experience that I can't even pick which one I enjoyed more I think this is a must for anyone visiting Thailand

title: Get an “elder” card or “elder” ticket
review: If you are over 65 you are entitled to “elder” tickets (or card) which cost half the price of the normal tickets Ask at the counter

title: Very Fast and Economic way to travel
review: We were surprised that this rail heads directly to the city where our hotel is near already The fare is cheap too Very convenient Reasearch the nearest station to your hotel and it works like a charm

title: Best Tour Guide!
review: Sarah made our tour very fun and exciting We learned a lot about the rich history of Thailand on our way to the floating and railway market's We also learned some Thai phrases and she made us laugh plenty of times I will definitely book her again

title: GUT !
review: Good experience nice views and a really fast way to cross the city I would recommend especially if you need to get close to shopping area

title: Very efficient and quite comfortable
review: Do ride the tuctucs for fun local flavor and to cover short distances but rely on the modern BTS trains for real transportation in Bangkok (a huge city) The occasional great view from the elevated tracks comes in at no extra price

title: Very efficient
review: If you are close to the BTS station you are in luck If you are staying more then 3 days it is wort to buy a card and fill it up as you use it BTS connects to Metro and you can cover most of Bangkok Fast Efficient but lots of stairs

title: Easy and cheap to use!
review: Easy to use whilst in Bangkok Queue up at the desk  to swap notes to coins then use the ticket machine to select what fare you want you then use your ticket on the touch button to get onto the platform The train is cool when on it and easy to use we went to the Siam paragon on it which dropped us off outside

title: Fast service to city
review: This is the best cheapest and fastest way to get from the hussle of the airport to the even husstlier (if thats a word) of Bangkok city

title: Good and convenient transport.
review: Very cheap transport You can have nice view over city Clean and fast to go from one part to another of the city

title: Wonderful Skytrain
review: It is one of the best systems in the worldAlthough it is not cheap it is so much faster than taxi due to the traffic in Bangkok Very efficient and always clean and people actually queue in an organised line to board and let the passengers off first not like in MelbourneAlso it is very easy to use

title: Two short trips
review: As underground trains go this is amongst the best of them Easy to navigate clean frequent and well designed Dovetails quite well with other surface trains

title: Quick, good currency exchange boots nearby at airport
review: I used the rail link three times over the past four weeks and overall found it quite convenient  Those with larger pieces of luggage getting off at Makkasan will find elevators (lifts) both at this ARL station and the Petchaburi MRT  However getting out at Sukuhumvit MRT station meant hefting my wheeled bag up and down some stairs  HINT If arriving Suvarnabhumi airport use the currency exchange booths (Yenjit Super Rich1965 Value Plus) on the ground floor adjacent the rail link office  Rates there are at least 6% better than those on the 4th floor  Value Plus stays open the latest closing at 1130 pm

title: Very Bad morning and late afternoon
review: Never use MRT before 930am and around 1700pmit's too much crowdedand you have to wait long time

title: Easy to commute but doesn't save much time
review: Impressed with the transport infrastructure Taking the airport rail link is easy well connected to Bangkok city at Phaya Thai station Cheap fare of Baht 45 But there are many stops and long stop at each station so thought we will get to hotel faster compared to taking taxi through peak hour traffic ended up still more than an hour to reach hotel Will probably still try again next time

title: Quick & Good
review: From Phaya Thai to Suvabhurmi in only 25 minutes  you can't complain at only 45 THB As per nearly all public transport in Bangkok it is exceptionally clean and also exceptionally busy

title: Skytrain is the most suitable transport to get around Bangkok. There is also an airport link just a couple of changes an
review: I disliked the crowded carriages of Skytrain but in spite of this you can always get on

title: cheap, easy, direction quite clear
review: it is very cheap just thb45 from the bts station to the airport there are staff to help you to buy tkt in the station the direction is quite clear but just you have to take lift to the departure floor after you come out of the rail link

title: You must learn to use this if staying in Bangkok
review: If you are planning on traveling around Bangkok you must learn to use this service After a few trips to Bangkok and several hours and alot of money wasted on taxis we finally gave the sky train a try I wish we would have done this earlier It is the cheapest and fastest way around the city It may seem confusing at first but there are employees in the area that can explain the map and how to purchase tickets Many of the stops are at or near major shopping centers At every terminal there are machines that will accept coins as well as paper money Many hotels have information on the sky train ask questions and learn how to use this and you will never take a taxi again

title: Travelling with 10 kg trolley/hand bags? The Airport Rail Link is the best way into the city.
review: Airport Rail Link  Bangkok City to Suvarnabhumi Airport  Read around the subject and you’ll perhaps understand the basis of the BKK Airport to City rail system  infrastructure overcrowding mixed potential and more that comprises the train that you catch today Whatever the history of the project  targets that were missed during the planning stage (pre2005) delayed delivery deadlinesimplementation (threeyear overrun by the time commercial services began 2010) and the initial underutilization followed by staggering growth such that by mid2018 the system is carrying 72000 passengersday with severe overcrowding for much of the time – this is still the best way to travel into the city  The reality is one wherein the rail line has simply become another part of the city Metro system for those living in the eastern suburbs And there’s you the eagerbeaver tourist hustling into town with a couple of largishsuitcase between the pair of you plus trolley bags and you can barely find space on the train once you’ve left the airport Getting off becomes a serious challenge given the limited time in which the trains stand in the station If you’re travelling light no issue if you’re travelling heavy then you’d need to reconsider the taximeter alternative  Inside the carriages are also well unfriendly Few seats most people standing and no separate areas (close to the doors) for stacking luggage People tend to sit on their luggage in the doorways Hmmm  And by way of comparison it cost us THB500 (AU$21) by car for the ride from the airport to the hotel in Makkasan the comparative train ride was just THB70 (AU$3) for the two of us second time round Sure those with BAGS will probably need to engage a taximeter car at Makkasan Station and particularly if you don’t actually know where your hotel is located in relation to the station At night the streets are dark pavements are broken and local traffic is horrendous  The train system shouldn’t be like this – that’s not what was expected during those halcyon planning periods – but that’s just the way things have worked out First the more expensive Express services were cancelled – back in 2014 (from lack of demand) and then the limited capacity of the rolling stock – trains of 34 carriages (and platforms that can take 10 carriage trains) This was further exacerbated by maintenance issuesreplacement rolling stock that has resulted at best in 75% of the fleet working at any one time Further the reality is only nine trains in total – for a twoway service over 28 km  And the rail line is due to be extended to BKK’s second airport Don Mueang And there is new rolling stock on order And there are encouraging words promising actionchange Then the system may begin to make money – that it can be reinvested that it keeps pace with demand There has even been mention of highspeed train services a case of ‘watch this space’ but equally ‘don’t hold your breath’  Notwithstanding the elegance cleanliness and spaciousness of the infrastructure the system is not that easy to understand for first time users ‘Express’ ‘City Line’ & ‘Airport Rail Link’ continue to be used in the signage the ticketing machines are well challenging – there was a friendly official hovering nearby to help us first time round On the screen you shift the language to ‘English’ (unless you can read Thai) access the train line touch your station feed in the money required – no notes THB100 please and the machine delivers a black plastic token together with your change Occasionally it rejects perfectly soundseemingly undamaged notes Frustrating Equally don’t buy your tokens the day before you need them – they don’t work the next day  You touch the token to the screen set in the turnstilegate on the way to the platform (you and your halfdozen bagscases) You put the token back into your pocket At your destination station you drop the token into the slot and the gate will open to let leave the platform If you have a problem the people behind you may assist  lifting the cases you left behind over the gate  For all that the Airport Rail Link is still the best transport offer available between city and airport Service staff and convenience warrant a ‘good’ evaluation unfortunately TripAdvisor doesn’t offer one   Peter Steele Bangkok 15 June 2018

title: Learn to ride, save lots of $$$
review: A friend showed us how to navigate the BTS Skytrain on our first day in Bangkok and I'm so glad he did  Once you orient yourself to the city and understand the train stops you can get from here to there in little time and for a fraction of the cost of cabs and tuktuks  It's so easy  The attendants at the ticket booths have a good command of English  All you need to do is study the map a bit to figure out how to get where you want to go  The only difficulty we had was figuring out how far certain destinations were from the train stops  It took us a couple tries and tuktuk rides to get off on the right stop  Still it's part of the adventure of a new city and it's what the locals do so it's fun

title: Fast and clean transport with a nice view
review: Tickets are bought from machines at the stations outside the gates Payment can only be made by coins but change is given at the service desks Tickets are currently only valid within the BTS system   It's a cheap smooth cool clean fast and scenic way to enjoy Bangkok Major shopping malls Chatuchak Weekend Market all Sukhumvit Road's attractions and even the riverside are accessible by Skytrain   While the Silom line runs west to south the Sukhumvit line runs north to east So if you're new to Bangkok it's a great way to find your way around and see a large part of what the city has to offer  Note that BTS runs between 0630 and midnight The trains are full packed during peak hours (0700  0900 and 1600  1900) Trains are completely "overaircondishioned" so it's more than reasonable for woman's naked shoulders to take some light silk scarf for a longer ride  Major shopping malls Chatuchak Weekend Market all Sukhumvit Road's attractions and even the riverside are accessible by Skytrain  Fares start at 15 baht per one stop  A oneday pass may be a good option for those planning to do a lot of hopping on and off for one full day for 120 baht Ideal for tourists

title: Nice transportation into the city

review: Most of the hotels around Bangkok lay reference to the BTS Sky Train Rightfully so Its the most convenient way to travel around Bangkok Its basically a compass to where you go North South east and West Its also the link to to Airport Its easy to get a ticket via machine or vendor Air conditioned once you are on and it does get quite busy Cant rave enough about it Quite Brilliant

title: Great fast transport into Bangkok
review: Great fast transport into Bangkok is quicker than a taxi in  the traffic to get you from the Airport to downtown Bangkok You can change at Makassan for the MRT(underground Railway) to go anywhere along the MRT or get onto the SRT(Above ground Railway)

title: Choose this over the BKK traffic jam
review: I've been taking taxi tuktuk in Bangkok for the longest time Always had a perception that the train is unsafe because of risk of being picked  But I was wrong The BTS is the answer To beat jams it felt safe (still pls be responsible and careful of your belongings) its clean Its convenient you can take the taxi for your last 1km so you won't have to spend hours stuck in a jam

title: A worthy trip outside of Bangkok, highlight of our Bangkok experience.
review: Sara was fabulous  She knew all of the ins and outs of making this trip perfect  The Railway trip was a lot of fun and what an experience  The floating market was very well organized and it was incredible seeing all of the vendors on the waterway  Sara was a wealth of information about the local people and traditions  It was a super fun day

title: Best way to travel.
review: Best way to travel Cheap  5 stops about 30 Bht Air con Gets busy at the Siam station (shopping malls)

title: Easy access
review: Best way to commute in bangkok Try to avoid rush hour otherwise bts is awesome   Elevator is very hard to find This makes travel with suitcase very troublesome

title: Easy, clean, fast
review: BTS will get you through the heavy parts of town (Thong Lor  Siam) quicker than a cab almost all of the time Can be marginally pricier than a cab if you have multiple people but is worth it Downside day passes aren't offered at regular stations You must buy a ticket each time you ride and pay the correct amount for your destination If plans change midride and you get off the train before your original stop BTS eats your money  no carryover balances

title: Not that cheap as public transport
review: Occassionally taking uber might be cheaper especially when travelling in a larger group Even when it's juz the 2 of us the cost spent might end up the same and we don't even need to walk to the station if we take uber )

title: Escape the Bangkok jam with this train
review: The notorious Bangkok traffic jam can be very annoying if you are on a tight schedule and need to get to the airport fast I take the train to the airport during my business trips to circumvent the jam in the city

title: The only way to navigate Bangkok's horrendous traffic!
review: We took the Skytrain everywhere because the traffic is terrible no matter what time of day or night  It is clean and incredibly efficient  The signs are also in English as are the announcements  We always bought a one day pass which was very good value for money and found that people were always willing to help if we got lost

title: Cheap and easy!
review: I prefer taking the Airport Rail Link over taxi's It is fast and usually isn't too packed The only downside is when you transfer to the BTS at Makassan or Phaya Thai The BTS is public transport and isn't really suited for luggage and is often much busier Also depending what exit you take at the station you might have to lug your bag down many stairs If you are a light traveller (or strong) none of this will be a problem

title: REACH DOWNTOWN IN A FLASH
review: This is the fastest cheapest and best way to reach Downtown You just need to check your Hotel on the map and find the nearest stop and then walk to your Hotel

title: Tour went well
review: It took about 152 hrs bus ride out from Bangkok to the Samut SongKhram area where the railway and floating markets are located The railway market was an interesting experience where vendors had shops parallel to the train tracks and had to close shop whenever a train passes by On the other hand the floating market is targeted at tourist with souvenirs and western food

title: So convenient!
review: Best way to get around Bangkok and avoid the crazy traffic We use this every time we come to Bangkok it is so easy and very cost effective

title: So convenient and cheap
review: Instead of taking a taxi I normally take the Airlink to get to Bangkok central place It is a mere 50 baht compared to a taxi ride that could easily cost you about 500 baht It is fast and hassle free You can take your luggage with you too  as long as it does not bother other passengers

title: Best way to and from airport
review: Goes often inexpensive and connects with Sky Train for access to most of central Bangkok  if you are concerned about finding correct stop near your hotel when arriving just get a taxi from Phaya Thai (easy stop well marked) Also at Phaya Thai you can take Sky Train to other locations You can buy tickets from machines (process well described or go to staffed ticket booth)

title: No traffic issues here
review: Between using MRT and BTS getting around Bangkok is way quicker than being stuck in traffic Get route information and your ready to move about the city

title: Thai metro
review: It is nice to travel with the metro especially when outside is hot or very hot since in the train the air conditioning it is always present ) So if you are tired or you can't resist outside take the train one station )

title: Unreliable
review: it is always broken and late Too crowded with bad flow management If you rush to catch your flight don't trust their service operating well as usual I used to miss my flight because of their poor train

title: Easy and efficient
review: Ver modern an excellent condition Easy to navigate Much cheaper than a taxi and takes you right to the heat of Bangkok Connected to two other public transit lines

title: Great way of getting around Bangkok city
review: Always nice and cool Clean On weekdays I tend to avoid during peak hours (pre and postwork rush hours) and on weekends I try to avoid between 1pm to 6pm Not so surprising the BTS tends to be most crowded during the weekends when everyone is out of work or school so they are out and about shopping meeting friends and basically using the BTS system en masse The BTS does not run to all areas of Bangkok however such as places like Ratchayothin or Ramkamhaeng where in which place I highly recommend taking the Thai public buses The buses are really cheap Use Google Maps It will tell you how to get to your destination with which buses to take on your selected route which is handy for touristsforeigners who can't read or speak Thai

title: Airport Adventure
review: After arriving at bkk I found the airport link very good First of all it takes away the traffic jam in bkk Those with limited liggage it is very good to go to any hotel in Bangkok and faster and economical and clean too I enjoyed the journey and the convenience of connecting airport to city centre

title: Take this during traffic hours
review: Takes about 30 min from the phaya Thai bts connection Great if you don't want to sit in traffic during peak hours Can get very busy   There is a restaurant next to phaya Thai bts that you can see Decent food but terrible service I had the pad Thai and it was good nothing special though

title: CLean and well organised
review: It's well organised and run efficiently You could say as you would expect but there are examples round the world which let themselves down  this one does not

title: Easy and fast
review: From bkk airport its easy to take airport rail link and its a cheap and fast way to beat the traffic Its aso connected to bts which you can take to whicheva destination stop you wanna go Train is fast and clean Definately a gd alternative to beat the heavi bangkok traffic

title: Best way from Bangkok to Chiang Mai
review: We went on a sleeping train from Ayutthaya station to Chiang Mai and I must say i was pleasantly suprised with it We payed abot 700800 bath per person and it was worth it This train had cabins with 4 beds and an AC (it was a bit cold because of it) The beds were very comftorable you had a pillow and a blanket The only thing is that the train was late to arrive in Ayutthaya (45 min) and also an hour late in Chiang Mai  Btw If you are a light sleeper i recommend ear plugs and a sleeping mask because they don't turn of the lights You have a curatin but it can still be a bit bright Anyway I slept like a baby )

title: Airport Rail Link
review: This is I think an underrated service Connecting Suvarnabhumi airport to Sukhumvit stationwhich then connects to the Other Skytrain lines and also  the MRT lines Super  service and a change of scenery from the usual skytrain lines travelled Cheap and clean fast travel  Better to the airport than a taxi in peak hours

title: no traffic stress
review: fast clean and practical it will take you to a lot place you desire to go to I enjoyed the visit and skytrain tour of Bangkok the fare is very reasonable

title: fast and convenient

title: My preferred  mode of transport to get around Bangkok
review: This mode of tranport around Bangkok is cheap  punctual  clean and  the  announcements  for each station is clear and easy to understand   The best way to travel  above the crowded streets below

title: Moving experience, stunning scenery

title: Excellent service to get you around
review: Very clean and efficient service maps are posted everywhere to aid you in your journey  Great way to see parts of the city from up high

title: The train AND connecting walkways are fabulous
review: What a difference this has made to Bangkok Not only that it must through the traffic but the walkways connect large parts of the city offering comfortable pedestrian access from one mall to another (avoiding traffic and road crossings) Many malls now have an additional 'M' level entrance connected to the walkways in addition to their ground floor entrances The only thing to improve  ticketing (1) The stored value 'rabbit' cards require a photo ID to purchase (2) the self service machines require coins (3)  so the probable option for tourists would be to queue at the service counter Fortunately the queues were not too long

review: We started our journey from Chatuchak terminal and went to our destination Union plaza but again it was awesome moreover the staff was very cooperative with the tourists

review: Because of traffic jams in Bangkok people like to use BTS to travel around It used to be good but it is getting extremely overcrowded They should increase the number of carriages and frequency

title: Effecient, cheap and fast
review: The skytrain is quick clean and gets you to the main tourist attractions (well for me shopping malls) It's cheap and easy to follow once you get a map They come very often we hardly had to wait for one

title: convienent
review: With the airport rail link you can connect along the route and change to BTS or Metro lines Cut short of time and cheaper than taxi The train are well kept and clean

title: Subperb
review: This is the way to travel while in Bangkok This skytrain is excellent and safe One can navigate the whole city with reletive ease The anouncments are in english and the people working at the stations I found where always helpfull and polite

title: Lovely experience
review: Very convenient as traffic is huge in Bangkok road this options is definitely a easy pick loved the ride smooth and quick and definitely cheap

title: The only way airport to BBK.
review: What a great service this is Direct into BBK no fuss no messing about One price for all that in its self makes a change Linking into other train services in BBK it is quick clean and efficient A win win for all

title: clean and quick
review: great way to get to the main airport cheap clean and fast only 3 stops and halves the time and cost of a taxi

title: The only subway in Thailand
review: These subway services are good but the problem is the subway trains are too old and it feels depressed when we're going to somewhere by using this subway trains but it's convinient for traveling

title: Excellent Holiday Experience!
review: We took the Overnight Train from Bangkok purely for the experience The Brother & Sister InLaw had done the journey a number of years ago whilst travelling in Asia To make it extra special for us all we booked 2nd Class Tickets First sight of the inside of the carriage and you do wonder where the beds will appear from The carriage was very clean and well maintained even though it was obviously of some age Travelling like this does infused a great sense of community everyone quickly starts chatting and getting along The Train Staff come around with Drinks and Snacks to purchase There is a Canteen Carriage where you can get Hot Food (Thai Cuisine) which had a real party atmosphere going on We didn't try any of the Hot Food but the menu had a good selection We embarked on our journey around 1900 so an hour into the Journey the Carriage was converted in preparation for lights out (they don't actually go out) Now we were very tired so we all slept reasonably well even though the train bumped around like a dodgem car This is a 15 Hour journey which may sound a long time but you are a sleep most of it The time does however fly by mainly because we had such a laugh I really do recommend this trip if you want to have a different experience during your time in Thailand We absolutely loved it and will never forget it

title: Use the Sky Train
review: Easy to understand gets your everywhere you want to go and very good value You can get a Day Pass which allows you to use the Sky Train for a day

title: The fast way for go everywhere
review: Last time when u arrived in BKK international airport Suwanaphuni I try to use it firm airport to my hotel because was closed to Plom Chit station Well the BTS is the fast way for go around BKK only in airport is not so bear do you have to walk 20 minutes Well 60 minutes I was in hotel Enjoy the BTS

title: Economical and fast around the city
review: The Skytrain (or BTS) has a network of overhead rail lines around Bangkok and links up with the underground MRT rail system at certain points  Both rail systems have separate ticketing systems Tickets on BTS cost from 15 baht to 52 baht for longest journeyvery economical  The services are very frequent like less than 10 mins  I have noticed they have installed barriers along the edges of platforms within the last two years which is added safety when platforms are crowded

title: Convenient way to get to the City
review: The train is usually crowded  We travelled from the Airport to Phya Thai Station Because the trip start end were at the final destination points of the train there was no issue with handling luggage This is the fastest and cheapest way to travel to the City when considering traffic jams in the city areas Thaya Phai  station has lifts and elevators As such taking luggage was not an issue

title: Marked
review: It's worth visiting but you should arrive early to have a suitable seat The visit must be combined with the floating market one morning arrives

title: Just okay!
review: William was a really nice guide and explained everything very well But this tour was just ok The salt lakes were a so so The umbrella market is something worth seeingid done the floating market before so wasn't fascinated I just thought this tour costs more than it offers a train ticket a guide and a driver for 12 people a boat ride journey to and front Bangkok

title: Not an ordinary train ride
review: My dad was an Allied POW (Dutch) who worked (and survived) on the Death Railway and this trip has been on my bucket list since I was very young The train ride itself starts at the train station in Kanchanaburi If you are starting in Bangkok it is a 3 hour ride to Kanchanaburi You don't need a tour group or a guide to do this Buy your "ordinary" (third class) one way ticket half an hour before the train leaves The train's windows are open and there are fans on the ceiling No AC so it can get a bit warm especially during the monsoon season (July) The train stops in a number of stations including right by the Bridge Over the River Kwai which was made famous in the movie by the same name You can get off here but it is terribly commercial and a real tourist trap If you want to visit Hellfire Pass you have to stay on the train until Nam Tok station (about 45 minutes from Kanchanaburi) then hire a tuk tuk or van to drive you to the Hellfire Museum (about a 30 minute drive) The view from the train is mostly fields and farmhouses with some beautiful river and mountain views  While taking the train you might imagine what the POWs went through as they were transported in blinded train cars and stuffed in like sardines so there was no place to lie down The heat must have been unbearable Building the railway was a back breaking job made worse by the mistreatment by the Japanese and by the diseases and starvation that they suffered  This is a highly recommended train ride

title: Very good public transport
review: This is another way to beat traffic jams and get to places further afield  The fares are very cheap  I don't know why people take taxis during normal hours when there's a good train system

title: Great way to get around
review: Took this train to Thailand's largest market It was easy to use and the ticket people were very helpful

title: A fantastic way to discover Bangkok
review: Newbees jump into the BTS Skytrain to get a great view on Bangkok Clean safe with a high rotation of trains (you never wait more than a couple minutes) The only drawback is the weird fact that tickets are not compatible with the subway Think about the Day Pass is you plan on hopping in and out

title: Airport link
review: Fast and cheap alternative to a taxi Taxi downtown 300bht upward Airport link 45bht to phyha Thai station then can change to BTS system  Airport link is on lower floor in airportnext to airport link are money exchange much better rates than in main airporttry super rich

title: The best way to travel in Bangkok
review: In fact this should be your only option if you want to get anywhere in less than an hour  And fortunately it's still growing  I love it except during rush hour

title: The Overnight Train - Chiang Mai to Bangkok (second class)
review: With my husband spending the last twenty years telling tales about his overnight train experiences in Thailand and India I wasn't holding out high hopes for this trip  how wrong I was The train trip was wonderful new trains clean facilities and a reasonably good sleep We weren't able to get first class tickets so were in second class Not long after the trip started (at 600pm) locals were getting the attendants to convert their seats to beds and going to sleep We chatted and played cards til 830 when we got our beds made up (which took 60 seconds  so efficient but I think he was showing off to the westerner videoing it) Our beds had a sheet pillow in a clean pillow case and blanket (everything was packed before it was made up) I get hot at night and light travel pants and a tshirt was plenty I slept on and off all night  not great but far better than I was expecting The beds are hard but I like my bed firm anyway I discovered why the locals went to bed early  they started rousing at 500am  Positives clean comfortable transport and hotel for around USD 35 there is a power point in your cubicle area if you bring a transformer you can charge your device Each bed has a light that dims for reading You have curtains for privacy around your bed Your suitcasespacks fit under your seat so you always know where your belongings are Negatives aircon was very cold for a lot of westerners  bring a wrap or sweatshirt lights go on  full at 515am (I was asleep when they were dimmed so I don't know what time it was) If you're tall the bed won't be long enough for you  I think probably 170cm (5ft 8inches) is the tallest you can be to stretch out I'm short so it was all good

title: Good to travel
review: It very comfortable to go city but not on prime time BTS station near many of shopping mall and hotel

title: The Easiest Way Around the City
review: For years the BTS has been the easiest way around the city Now it seems the lines have been extended so you can explore further out than most tourists do Some of the malls in the suburban areas cater to mostly locals so you may just stumble on a nice bargain While the BTS remains the most convenient and fastest way to commute in Bangkok it is prone to delays  as a frequent visitor I have encountered no less than 5 occasions in the last few years when the BTS was disrupted This ranged from trains running in 10 to 15minute intervals to delays of over an hour That said most of the time it runs like clockwork And if you’re looking at citycentre hotels you may want to select one with direct connection to a BTS station via a pedestrian link bridge

title: Skytrain
review: This is a very easy way to travel through the city  It is air conditioned which is nice and very affordable

title: Most efficient
review: Very clean and punctuation Extremely well laid out easy to use processes Great signages The best thing of the BTS is its connectivity with a walking facility below that connects to all shopping malls Great vision by the Thais in building a strong tourism infrastructure

title: Easy!
review: Very easy to navigate  Ensure you have plenty of change to buy tickets or invest in a reloadable card

title: Best way to beat the traffic

title: 1st class sleeper train to Chiang Mai

title: Crowded but convenient

title: Great option to travel to the City
review: I was staying at a hotel in Lat Krabang (near the airport) and went to the city by Taxi It cost me around 330 Baht ($10) including the toll road and more than an hour (without the toll road the time would be double) However while coming back I took the Airport rail link back to Lat Krabang with a fraction of the taxi fare It was not crowded and people can easily take their luggage with them and save some time and money

title: Comfortable, Convenient, but a tad pricey
review: The BTS is perhaps the most convenient mode of transportation in Bangkok The trains are clean and relatively fast However there can be delays especially during the rush hour and the fares are quite pricey comparing to other world cities   The best way to get to places in Bangkok

title: Inexpensive
review: Great for Long distances less people  For example a taxi from Chattuchak Weekend Market to Sukumvit costs about 100 to 200 baht (depends on the time) and of course there is traffic at around sunset hours Whether you have three other people traveling with you or you are alone the cost is pretty much the same But using BTS skytrain you can travel at a much cheaper price and it's faster Like about a 100 baht for four people together

title: Great mode of transport
review: A great way to travel across the city see the views and it's air conditioned and clean everyone is polite and there's no pushing or shoving

title: Clean, safe, convenient
review: BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around above the street traffic  Very clean very safe very convenient  Very fast too  The maps in the stations make it easy to figure out how much it will cost (based on distance)  There are change booths with helpful attendants as well  Often the street below is crowded with cars and people yet when you go up to the BTS stations you rise above all the chaos

title: Very convenient

title: Skytrain
review: Fast air conditioned especially in the hot humid weather it was nice to have a breather for 10 minutes until your next stop in the air con It was reasonably clean and we did not wait long at all for the next train
