review: They seem to go every where we needed to go and were well run better than being stuck in the traffic for sure Not very expensive and hit all the major shopping areas

title: great way to get around
review: Bangkok has many transpiration options that one can chose from the BTS is one of them its a train that is traveling on top of the roads and is a great way to see BangkokIt has extended its routs and one way to experience Bangkok is to get of at each station and just walk around Bangkok is full of surprises and you never know what you might find in one of the little soi"s

title: Overnight 1st class - Noisy
review: The 1st class sleeper is quite basic our compartment slept 2 The beds were fairly comfortable however it was father cold  I would recommend you take an extra jumper and take a silk sleeping bag for your journey  Dinner and breakfast are served in your compartment or if you would prefer you can dine in the dining car The train leaves Bangkok in the early evening however due to the time of day you are travelling you don't get to see much of the country  If you want to see more of Thailand the daytime service may be better  The train makes quite a few stops overnight and is very noisy Not a good nights sleep  There is no alcohol allowed on this service During the night I did hear someone trying all the doors in our carriage I would hope it was just the attendant or security checking  I would not do this again I would prefer to fly

title: easy way to travel
review: very crowded but best way to get around to see different cities and it was cheaper than taxi and  traffic is terrible

title: Never again
review: not even close to the Hong Kong service arriving in the middle of nowhere and then waiting forever for a taxi and spending even more time in traffic jams does not seem like a well thought travel experience

title: Clean as anything but not growing with increased acceptance and demand.
review: During the initial years of operation the BTS system found acceptance only slowly and one normally travelled on empty trains This has changed and during rush hours the trains are as packed as in Tokyo Seoul or Hong Kong Neither the length of the trains nor the frequency has changed at all although the stations could accept trains at least double as long The number of in and out card readers will have to be increased drastically as there are cues already now at the more frequented stations such as Siam the so far only interchange between two BTS lines Getting from the upper platform to the lower one already now is a real hazard and if ever there is reason for panic the problem will be immense BTS would be well advised to visit for instance Hong Kong When one train has left the next one enters the station  minute to two minute intervals and the trains are 3 to 4 times longer

title: Excellent deserve all the city, very quickly
review: Excellent  deserve all location in  the city very quickly but very full of people The BTS is safe and very easy to use

title: The view of this place is phenomenal
review: I am still enthralled by the scenic view of the death railway What I loved about it is that its not crowded so you can actually enjoy the scenery and take good photos

title: The most convenient way to go around Bangkok
review: Clean spacious reliable on time ride in comfort the fastest and cheapest way to go around places to visit

title: Great way to avoid traffic
review: We found bts a little daunting to use but asked the staff for help and they were happy to give us directions always quite busy but a nice fast air conditioned way to get around main part of Bangkok without hassle of traffic jams

title: A simple way to get around
review: The BTS system is efficient and easy to use Every station has an escalator if you don't want the added exercise of the stairs and some stations have lifts (check their website for a list of those)

title: Buy day travel pass - cheap by UK standards
review: TV commercials played loudly in the carriages which is just annoying to our ears Trains very new and air conditioned and quite frequent

title: Efficient and clean
review: BTS far exceeds expectations Very well ran and very reasonable to travel around on BTS staff helpful with directions Highly recommend

title: Amazing tour with variety
review: This tour was an great value to experience both the train ride to Maeklond station Market   We drove into the market and we’re able to record it all on camera visit the market and see the train leave and experience it from the market itself we were than taken by van to an awaiting boat to take us to the Damnoensaduak floating Market   We strolled around and took the optional boat tour inside the market as well Had lunch and we’re taken back to Bangkok by van   Our Guide Sara was a sweet angel she was very funny and informative Bought some local treats for all to taste and made us all feel special  All in all great tour with a small group of 12 worth every penny

title: nice public transport
review: we used it a lot during our stay in Bangkok it's very efficient easy to understand and navigate and the reseau is big you can reach a lot of the city and it's very affordable

title: Great for Airport to town, but if alone
review: Its good if you are travelling alone and without luggage and want to save some buck just take a cab if you are with three people would almost cost the same if your hotel or house is not near the station

title: The best way to get around
review: Cheap clean efficient Moaning about gridlock is as regular a feature of Bangkok visits as tuk tuk drivers trying to overcharge naive punters  the BTS gets rid of all the hassle and connects well with the metro system to give good coverage of Bangkok As a bonus enjoy some great vistas of the city (particularly Sukhumvit) en route It's very straightforward to use so long as you know where you want to end up and the staff are helpful

title: Clean, safe and air conditioned
review: Clean safe and air conditioned Chapter than tuk tuks and they'll take you from Sukhumvit to Chattuchak

title: Wish sydney had one of these
review: Great rail system to get you around Bangkok The carriages are clean and air conditioned and it is really easy to work out the fares and ticketing on the ticket machines They are fast and frequent and comfortable What more could you ask

title: The best in the world
review: A vey effective and goid transport system For a few bath you can travel arround central parts of Bangkok There is also a chance to by a day card for approx 1 Euro per day Trains are fast clean and very cold inside

title: Excellent &  efficient travel
review: When in Bangkok it is easy to be frustrated  by heavy traffic and in peak hours a short trip can take a long time BTS Skytrain is an easy an efficient way to get around Bangkok above the bumper to bumper traffic below on the streets Signs at the stations are in Thai and English and it is easy to find your way around town Often crowded but trips are generally quick Best way to get around Bangkok

title: Sometimes it is your best option
review: If you're heading to or from the airport on rush hour or on Fridays when it is always rush hour you might want to consider this Simply because there are firm and regular arrival times as opposed to sitting in traffic for an hour

title: Skytrain
review: I highly recommend taking the bts is is eady toget around and the signage is very good can get you tomost places in bangkok in use witis the subway I would give this piece of advice buy a bts card and losd it up will save time standing in line for a ticket  Also if buyinh a ticket you must have change so first yiu have to het in linr for change than line up again to get the ticket

title: Good means to save time
review: Was very close to my hotel could easily get into the shopping malls like MBK and Siam without having to get stuck in the horrible traffic

title: Bangkok's Rail Link-not perfect, but improved
review: Bangkok finally has an efficient and inexpensive high speed rail link from the airport into the city   The Express train costs 90 baht and took 16 minutes from the airport to Piya Thai where I was able to get on the BTS Skytrain to get to my hotel   The City Line costs 45 baht and takes about 1015 minutes longer A taxi normally costs around 300 baht and takes about 30 minutes depending on traffic It stops (for a minute) at a dozen stations on the way to Piya Thai  If you have a lot of luggage a taxi may still be the way to go as there are a limited number of escalators from the airport link exits down to the street level for taxi service to your hotel The same can be said for the BTS where you have to carry your bags down several flights of stairs at most stations (except Asoke)   All in all the rail link is a great savings in time and money it can be improved with more down elevators and more trains during peak hours I will use the Airport link which runs from 600 AMmidnight on my future trips to Bangkok I can only hope that some of the improvements mentioned will be addressed

title: inexpensive
review: another fast and inexpensive form of transport in Bangkok especially in the rush hours a good alternative to taxi

title: HANGOUT
review: I ride the BTS BTS Skytrain is very convenient AC train cool and okay It can ease my way up in the carriage go to the famous places

title: Easy & Convenient
review: Taking the skytrain is easy and convenient thou you will have to avoid timing around 4pm as the crowd is bad

title: Very easy to use
review: The rail link was 5 minutes walk from our hotel Indra Regent and we used it frequently to connect us to phaya thai where we could catch the sky trains on the other lines Though we did not use it to go to the airport we saw that it's very much used by tourists and has all facilities needed like lifts for luggage and staff to guide people the right way Very clean and user friendly I would recommend to ensure that staff understands english as its an airport rail link and they come across tourists all day long Staff not knowing English are not helpful to foreigners

title: Easy and quick way to travel.
review: This is the best way to travel into central Bangkok when you arrive or when you are returning to the airport after your holiday Very cheap and safe Don't get ripped off by taxis

title: Fast but Not Cheap
review: I quite satisfied with this BTS since this is very fast but not really cheap for budget traveler but if you think your time to reach your destination go use this BTS Recommended

title: Easy
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok traffic is a nightmare Taxis expensive

title: The perfect way to travel in the city
review: Fast air conditioned in good order above all the traffic jams and without the pathetic need to find a meter taxi We chose our hotel nearby Siam station to easily interchange both lines Buy a rabbit card in advance in the first evening and top it right there to avoid all the queues at rush hours (morning till afternoon) Best traffic solution for Bangkok

title: Still essential
review: Not sure why the fastlink express isn't running so you have to use the stopping service but it's still the best (fastestcheapest) way to and from the airport by a million miles

title: Easy to use
review: Very cheap mode of transport and after working out the ticketing system very easy to use  Easier than the metro in France

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: Fast cheap comfortable but try to avoid peak hours

title: All the way to Bangkok for 35 bath.
review: This is the way to travel to Bangkok from the airport Costs 35 bath per person and then you change to the subway for another 30 bath Go to the station closest to your hotel and from there you don't have to pay more than 100 for a tuktuk The scammers at the airport tried to offer us a taxi for 1400 bath  Go to the bottom floor at the airport and follow the signs to the trains

title: Air Conditioned and On Time
review: This mode of transportation is very impressive and punctual  Even on the hottest of days this runs like clockwork and the air conditioning is very welcome  If only the London Underground could learn by example

title: Excellet service used freqeuntley as a familiy of four to get about Bangkok
review: Cheap travel very safe though lots of signs for pick pockets so make sure your zipped up   You cant buy return tickets and you must specify your exact station

title: Travel with BTS to everywhere
review: It is a good transport system to use  just buy a card so need not alway queen up to buy ticket   Save lot of time using BTS as bangkok land traffic is bad  too many car and too much delay   The only feedback is BTS & MRT should have same ticket system  it will be more easy when change line

title: Clean And Efficient Way Around Town
review: Great economical way to shopping markets and weekend markets of Bangkok Not available to many of the major Wats in the Northeast parts of Bangkok

title: Cheap option to get to Bangkok, no combination ticket with other service
review: Airport Rail Link is the cheapest option to get to Bangkok City Only 35 Baht (90 Euro Cent) to get to Makkasan station Signs and announcements are always available in (Thai) English When we arrived it was not possible to go to Phaya Thai It was also irritating that the intersection to MRT has a different name Phetchaburi You also had to pay a new fare for the MRT The Airport Rail Link Ticket cannot be combined with other like MRT or the Skytrain For tourists it would be more convenient if all the services could be combinded with one pass It is also irritating that the intersections have different names depending on the provider When I travelled back to the airport it was in the main traffic time so I had to wait for the train in a long queue but the traffic on the streets was much more horrible at that time

title: Very convenient way to avoid Bangkok traffic
review: Bangkok traffic is notoriously bad You can be stuck for hours One easy way when arriving at the international airport Is to hop on the Airport Rail Link It will bring you into central Bangkok in about 20 minutes where you can connect with the MRT subway or the BRS sky train or grab a taxi

title: Worth using bts SKYTRAIN to beat the rush hour madness !
review: Easy to use sign posted and cheap quick and easy  Have used many times as taxis  cars  tuck tuks stationary in bkk traffic  Common problem   Also airport link if traveling light with hand luggage

title: Easy traveling
review: If you want a quick and cheap way of getting around then the SkyTrain is the way to go It's quick It's cheap For me it was a nice experience since it's been years that I have been in a train It's safe I liked it

title: Our train trips
review: Wow what an excellent train service The station staff are very helpful to non Thai speaking customers  The train was very frequent and clean it was a pleasure to use this service The skywalk is a brillant idea and is easy to use and signage is everywhere 1010 to this service

title: Best Way
review: Best way to get from airport to the city Otherwise you need to spend a lot of money Taxi is very expensive so you should go link if you don't have a lot of luggage

title: Bangkok train system rocks!
review: Don't put it it off use the train Safe inexpensive and easy I took a taxi into the city when I first arrived but never again I carried a tiny crumpled map in my pocket to keep me going in the right direction Trains to the airport were about 60 baht taxi was 500 baht because of the traffic As a solo traveller it's a better deal The ticket machines are easy to use and if you do have problems there are attendants nearby to help

title: Easy n convenient
review: BTS sky train is the best mode of transportation in Bkk Only 2 lines available ie Silom line and Sukhumvit line and the simplicity of the two routes tells it all just by one look with Siam station as the intersection point just like the City hall station in Sg Min fare is 15 baht so meaning less than Sgd040 which is so cheap and their ticketing machine is easy to operate The day pass costs only 140 baht (Sgd550) which allows you to travel freely between the two lines The only minus sign about the station is that there is no barricade and hence a guard there who has to whistle once the train is approaching so as to warn passengers to keep clear of the rail track However what I like about their BTS is the skywalk which is a footpath to areas where all the shopping malls are and thus it is very easy to walk from Erawan Shrine all the way to MBK The skywalk is clean wide and so convenient for people to walk between malls without getting caught in human jam It is also good to know that it is being extended gradually

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: One of the easiest and convenient way to get around Bangkok and to visit most of the landmarks eg Chatuchak Night Market Victory Monument etc Please be advised if you travelling on rush hour period (probably 630  800 in the morning and 430  800 in the evening) you will expect full of passengers in each car and sometimes long queue or even delays I advise you to calculate your time carefully and trying to avoid those rush hours period Other than that it is very clean and timesaving

title: Highly recommended for solo female travellers and all
review: The ladie who lead our tour was fornomanal and set our group up at the most amazing location to get on the train before other tours got on This gave us the prim sets to come in to the market on  As  solo female traveller the guide looked after me amazingly 👏 so grateful to her I have the best experience way above what I could of possibly expected)   This tour operator caters to every aspect all you have to do is sit back and enjoy   Highly recommended and will do more tour's with this company

title: The best mode of transport in Bangkok !
review: The trains are clean  cost effective & very punctual  in my humble opinion it’s the best mode of mass transport in Bangkok

title: Fast cheap transport
review: The sky train is very easy to use and the trains are a fast way of getting around Bangkok Tickets are cheap and we got a day pass so you can hop on or off as many times as you like where ever you like The sky train was very clean And we enjoyed looking out the window and selecting our next spot to get off Staff were very helpful

title: Unkwon cheap way of getting into Bangkok
review: It is on the B level in the airport and easy to access the train brings you to Phaya Thai from where you can take the BTS to the center of Bangkok For only 45 bath (+ 1€) Airconditioning on board and all stations are anounced so missing yor station is not possible if that would be before Phaya Thai Enjoy it

title: Great time at the floating and rail market
review: Great time at the markets The tour guide Jokey was amazing passionate and very polite The only thing I would complain about is paying an extra £10 for Hotel pick up to later find out that I was 5mins from their pick up point

title: best transportation way for tourists to go around bangkok
review: this way is good for tourists to go around bangkok even if it can't cover all attraction places but it can save your travel costs and safe for cheating if you plan your trips it is very useful transportation

title: Good and cheap way to go to town
review: Cheap way to go to town with not too much luguage The direct connection to the BTS Sky Train and therefore the access to a great number of hotels mskes it a good alternative to taxis

title: Efficent
review: Nice mean of transportationespecially during peak hours when easily stuck in traffic jams Clean and on time Not expensive at all

title: Nice trip
review: Saw a lot in a short time They were good at English and gave lots of good tips A bit much bus but this was expected (The bus was nice and new) But very nice trip

title: Amazing experience
review: The tour guide Puy was very friendly and professional The transportation was good and the experience was completely worth it I highly recommend you take this tour if you are in BKK

title: very convenient to all shopping areas and airport
review: Train cabin is big enough when you are going back to airport with all your luggage people are very organised in queening to go into the BTS Fast service also

title: Only way to go in BKK
review: Quick clean efficient Once inside you would think you were in HK (less crowded) or in another first world country Very good way to get around Bangkok above the fumes and traffic Could use more BTS connectors but thats for future expansion I guess

title: Best way to avoid traffic
review: So simple & easy to use Trains run so frequently that no timetable is needed They are clean getting on & off is quick

title: Great!
review: Keeping always on time  and has great airconditioning I don't know what else I can say to make this thing 100 characters

title: Getting around Bangkok by underground
review: The MRT subway is Bangkok's underground companion to the BTS Skytrain and it is a welcome addition The two systems complement each other and the MRT goes some places that BTS doesn't (and vice versa) The trains are fast and efficient and the stations are spotless and easy to navigate with highly reasonable fares There's some overlap with BTS but MRT is best for some destinations such as Chatuchak Weekend Market with the subway train delivering passengers right inside the market via Kamphaeng Phet station

title: Simple and easy to use
review: Took the Sky train from BKK and linked up with the MBK to get to our hotel in Chinatown  Same time or quicker than than our return taxi  Cheaper to  about 75 baht including MBK transfer

title: Nice train
review: I really liked the BTS train  I think it one of the most clean and easy train I have ever been Only issue it that the subway and the sky train is  not connect so you have to get off from one and take the other one if you wanna switch train

title: Great way to avoid traffic!
review: Had an extended layover in Bangkok waiting for a flight and decided to hit up the siam paragon Not only was the airport rail link less than 4 CAD one way for two of us it was incredibly user friendly Bypassed all the rush hour traffic and the ripoff cab drivers

title: Easy travel in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is so easy and cheap to use  Just be aware of keeping your belongings close and zipped up and it's the safest and quickest way to travel around the city

title: a must for getting around Bangkok quickly
review: Typical underground system that serves well different areas of bangkok and intersects with both BTS and Aiport Link Crowded at Rush Hour as to be expected

title: great in concept but lacks in execution
review: I can see how this works from the airport to downtown but the other way is terrible I wanted to avoid the crazy Bkk traffic trying to get to the airport so I tried the airport rail link I took a taxi to the station I then proceeded to wait on an non air conditioned platform for 25 minutes waiting on a train It was unbearably warm wait So much that I had to change clothes when I got to airport It is a big miss not to have an air conditioned place to wait for the train Will not do it again from Bkk to airport Rather sit in traffic

title: This is the best way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS or Skytrain is one of the best and most reliable ways to get around Bangkok Even if it does not take you completely to your destination you should ride it to the nearest point and take other transportation from there It will save you time

title: Great way to get around once you get use to it
review: Very modern and good locations  I was staying by the Empire Building S3 station It was easy to get to long boat ride and the shopping maul MBK and Jim Thompson house by the National Stadium  If I had been there longer I would have been able to benefit more using this transportation especially during the rush hours At times the streets seemed like large parking lots when I took taxi's  For the true adventurer without too much luggage it looks like a great way to get downtown  I admit however with luggage I took a taxi both ways to the airport

title: A great way to get around
review: Fantastic transport system great frequency and the aircon was a godsend on hot days to cool down Very easy to use if you are there for a short stay then buy the 15 trip package  The airport link is the easiest way to get downtime

title: Worth it for the A/C Alone
review: Can't wait for them to extend the lines further would use this to get everywhere and avoid the Bangkok traffic if I could Would be nice if the ticketing machines accepted credit cards or larger bills but that would be my only complaint

title: Really easy to use
review: Was a bit nervous about using the skytrain but it's so easy and cheap Buying tickets from machines is really clear it's cheap clean and everyone seems to use it

title: Great service, easy to use
review: A terrific service to get around BKK One day pass at 140 baht is good value Always good to get some relief from the heat in the ac of the Sky Train

title: Very good transportation system for Bangkok
review: Even if there are not many lines this is the best transportation system in a city where traffic is always chaotic If you have to go to a place served by the Skytrain this is the best option if not always try to combine it with others (taxi tuktuk boat etc) Best solution to move in Bangkok

title: Class 2 Sleeping Coach
review: Disappointing  Train was 1 hour late Apparently it’s normal as staff seemed nonchalant I Do Not recommend the top bunk Bright fluorescent lights in my face all night Top bunk very narrow I’m amazed I didn’t fall out  People getting on and off and Conductors with Walkie Talkies throughout the night  In the morning I was stuck in a windowless little space Only access to a window was from the stinky toilet Bottom bunk bed looks quite spacious and has a window No food or water available whatsoever I don’t think I’ll travel by train in Thailand again

title: So easy
review: We flew from Phuket to Bangkok  it was so easy to get the rail link then we took sky train absolutely beautifulwell worth the effort

title: With a little planning its the perfect way to get around
review: The Skytrain is really easy to use  The steps can be rather daunting however most stations have escalators  We didn't get a day pass as we were only in Bangkok for a couple of days and had tours planned but it is reasonably priced and very efficient  You can link up for a trip to the airport also

title: most convenient
review: Its the most convenient way for a transfer mode to suwarnabhumi airportSave you a lot of time and money tooIts feed back is shut down after midnight and not operated from all areasBut service is good and in every 510min you will find them so no need to hurry for missing one

title: Great way to travel
review: Fantastic and cheap mode of transport You got to queue up to buy the tokens which can potentially take some time All the staff spoke English

title: Takes you to the main places in bangkok
review: fares are cheap and service is good with AC and takes you everywhere you need to go Most stations have shopping malls connected to them

title: Great public transportation system
review: The Skytrain is the easiest way to get around Bangkok (along with the ferries on the river and the tuktuks) It's a little intimidating at first but the locals are helpful and many speak English very well One or two trips and you feel like an old hand

title: Too easy
review: Was easy and fast On time and easy to navigate for peopke from English speaking  countries Linked up with the sky train and we beat the traffic

title: Fast and Easy
review: We found it afast and fun experience good views and easy to use Hold on to something or you may fall Shows you just how big the airports are as you will see when you give them a go

title: Taxi is better
review: Why wait and stand in a crowd when you for less money can take a Taxi   Second of all you cannot get better entertainment when you grab a cab

title: Avoid traffic!
review: If you're staying in Bangkok near a MRT or BTS station getting a connection to Makkasan airport rail link is a piece of cake 34 of a taxi price if not more and traffic independent   Look at a map for MRT BTS stations to plan ahead and be prepared

title: Great day
review: We had a very fabulous guide  I forgot his name  but he was very attentive and helpfull and good tips on pricing and where to get a good lunch

title: Low cost, convenient transportation
review: It covers many tourist attractions Low cost clean & safe Aircon comfort But long queue at some stations   Beware when changing Thb 100 notes to coins at the counter I had been shortchanged 3 times within a week Just count those coins & don't rush off like everyone else

title: Cool efficient ride
review: As far as subways go the Bangkok MRT rates as good as anywhere in the world  Decent prices efficient and clean

title: Distinctive countryside with a unique 20th-century history
review: Railway is quite dull until the junction where it leaves the main line South but the last 50kms through Kanchanaburi and up to Nam Dok is fascinating and varied with some dramatic trellis viaducts holding on to the hillside above the river Best enjoyed on the early morning train (currently 0750 from Thonburi in West Bankok or 1035 from Kanchanaburi

title: Typical subway
review: To a first time traveller it was easy to use the trains were on time and low cost fares  It is a subway so if you want to see the sights take the Skytrain

title: Best way to beat the traffic
review: Bangkok traffic is really bad  I take the MRT and Skytraining around the city whenever I can  The people speak good English and are friendly and will tell you how to get to where you want  I loved it

title: Very easy to use!
review: I arrived at the Bangkok airport at 2100 hrs and walked directly to the Airport Rail Link train  Purchasing the ticket and stepping on the train was very easy  Great price and ease of use going tofrom the Bangkok airport

title: Fastest way to go to the city center from Airport
review: Airport rail link is connected to the BTS on phaya thai station Fast and convenient way to go to the city center directly from the airport

title: You will be taking this train for sure
review: In my opinion the best way to get around Bangkok  this train is fast reliable and cheap What I did is just watch a youtube video on how to purchase tickets prior to boarding the train and I found that helped me out quite a bit to understand how the system works

title: Too easy...
review: Easy to find ( basement of airport ) and easy to use Make sure you have some baht  my fare was 35 Baht for about 23rds of the way You can buy ticket at ticket office they speak English but you'll need to know which station you want to get off at FAR FAR FAR better than dealing with Thai taxi drivers and so much quicker during the day Think Bangkok think traffic jams

title: Systematic
review: The Stations are systematic and well organised Easy access to most of the famous places in the city

title: Commute with speed
review: I had the experience of using the sky train in Bangkok and it was very comfortable Stations located very close to each other one need not walk for long to reach a station Sky train has come a s a boon in Bangkok to cut travel times

title: Not a must
review: Railway market overrated Plus the tour was not that organized I didn't have a chance to properly photoshoot the train Too crowdedtoo hectic Floating market is OK ish

title: Easy ride .
review: The sky train is quick cleancook and easy to manage It is very crowded in the early morning or evening rush hours Otherwise can get a seat It is a great way to get to Saphan Taksin  and get off to take a ferry on the ChaoPriya River which accesses many sights such as China Town The Grand Palace 32 piers Also you can take a short walk down the road to The Asiatic Shopping Center with many stalls cafes and the ferris wheel

title: Convenient
review: The trian is very convenient to access every spot in Bangkok I suggest you take this train and not take the taxi due to there are many bad taxi drivers won't collect the fee by meter

title: Easy
review: This is one easy way to zip from Suvarnabhumi to parts of central Bangkok  Although it ends at Phayathai you can easily transit to a BTS sky train from there or the underground MRT Fare is cheaper than taxi and you can get a view of bangkok Train may get crowded with no place to sit so this is recommended for those travelling light

title: Good way to tavel to - from airport for light traveller
review: Good way to travel to from Bangkok airport best if yr travelling light as trains can get crowded during peak hours Great value for money compared with Taxi fare to town Trains stop around Midnight

title: You'd love it
review: I only took the BTS twice from Asok station to National Stadium station (and return) for visiting MBK mall but I totally loved it As the weather outside was very hot and I was sweating a lot while walking from my hotel to the BTS when I stepped into the train my mom and I just felt like 'Oh Thanks God for this cool AC' It's clean and cool although it's super crowded I highly recommend taking BTS if you want to avoid the traffic congestion in the city

title: Railway market
review: A solid 6 hour tour  The market is interesting but the floating market is not a functioning market just a tourist concoction Staff excellent

title: Great mode of transport
review: Fast cheap easy to use & gives a great view of the city  what's not to like Covers all major tourist and shopping areas  way cheaper than tukyuk (& safer and you don't get detoured to a 'friends' shop)

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: MRT provides you a great way to travel in Bangkok as it not only saves time it also saves money One can travel from one corner to another in less than hour Most importantly it has connections with BTS Skytrain to Sukhumvit as well as Silom line

title: LOVE IT
review: A great way to commute around Bangkok Aircon is greatly appreciated on hot days

title: This this public mass transit system
review: If only  if only this type of transit system existed fully for the major cities in the US  Very clean always kept clean quiet travel and courteous riders  Fast moving always climate controlled and cheap (from a westerners standpoint)

title: Very convenient clean train
review: My husband and I used the Sky train to go to Patpong and the malls from our Eastin hotel It was clean convenient but sometimes crowded The air on can sometimes feel a bit cold when out during the day at 36C but may feel refreshing for others I thought the experience was ok you can see some of Bangkok but it was very similar to the Sky train in Dubai I much I refer a tuk tuk ride

title: Very cheap and reliable way to get around
review: A great way to get from your hotel to shopping areas or to tourist sites you want to visit Drops you off close to boat to get to temples

title: Amazing
review: We spent 3 nights in bangkok and it wasnt enough had a great time and must visit again for longer The skytrain is just so easy to use as the traffic is pretty bad

title: Great transport!
review: Good transport but I don't understand why it's an attraction Our family live in Thailand and we just use this as transport

title: Private trip
review: Fabulous day out to Bridge cemetery and Hellfire pass with train trip back over the bridge Awesome guide Well recommended

title: very fast and low price for expat
review: You come very fast from airport in the city and can cange to BTS or MRT Service Better than taxi they stay every time in traffic jam

title: Brilliant
review: The sky train is really good if you got a map just put into the machine which stop you want to get off at and pay or ask at the counter they are very friendly and happy to help quick and easy to get around

title: Fast reliable and cheap
review: Connecting Bangkok Airport with Centre The price is 15b + 5 bath for every stop or 45bath all the way to the centre Safe and modern way to travel to and from airport without worries about traffic jam Run from 6  24h

title: Fastest way to Bangkok
review: Arrived Bangkok at 430pm and the best way to avoid the traffic jam is through the airport rail link The train is clean and arrived city centre in within 30 minutes The train was packed mainly because it is the best option to get to the city Will use it again tomorrow )

title: Convenient
review: Nice clean and convenient skytrain Rush hour unfortunately is one of the hells of Bangkok with unbelievable crowds stuffing in the train (can't really help with that) Otherwise trains come usually within every 5 or 3 minutes very convenient

title: Clean and very easy to navigate
review: We used the skytrain on our recent visit and found it very easy to navigate our way around the system

title: Best way to get around
review: Traffic in BKK can be brutal but the Skytrain even though crowded at times is the best way to move about the city  Price is good it's modern and the ac is great

title: Shopping area.
review: A station that you can switch from BTS(skytrain)and MRT(subway)or vice versaVery popular and busy placebut you can pretty find pretty much anything (foodshoppingbars)

title: Very efficient and timely sky train system.
review: Always reliable the BKK BTS system is your best bet to move around the city The prices are reasonable too

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok traffic is horrendous  Do yourself a favor & use the sky train MTR and boat transportation

title: Getting about Bangkok
review: Easy access to areas where it goes and in other areas take a taxi  It is very crowded at rush hours

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Easy to get there It is simple to purchase of the tickets Accurate fast airconditioned The best way to get in or out of the city

title: ease of use
review: The Sky train is very easy to use and takes a lot of stress out of getting around the city of Bangkok  We tried walking to some destinations however we felt unsafe crossing some roads the train makes life easier and quicker

title: Public Transport quickest way
review: MRT can be very busy at rush hour but still the cheapest and easiest and fastest way to get around the city

title: easy way to go out from airport
review: great experience and nice train it will give you the easiest and cheap way to go to the city directly from airport

title: Efficient and on time
review: taking the BTS is always a pleasure even in rush hour the fare map makes it easy to compute how much to pay

title: Can reach almost everywhere.
review: free from traffic no fuss just don't use it during rush hour such as 5PM so full Whenever you bring child (baby toddler) most of passengers will give out their seat for you That's how friendly they are

title: Interesting
review: Interesting how it travels above the city It’s quick convenient way of travel Relatively cheap as much

title: Convinient
review: 1 day pass at only 130baht for unlimited ride Try to avoid in catching the train during peak hours (8am9am) and (5pm7pm)

title: Experience not to be missed!
review: You just have to experience the skytrain great laugh trying to figure out how it all worked (not the train getting the ticket etc)

title: No contest
review: Amazed by the efficiency of this service and even more impressed by the cleanliness of the trains  Compared to our "Tube" there is no contest

title: BKK BTS
review: BTS is the best quick mode of transport in the car clogged city of Bangkok It is economical clean and provide connection to the city interests for visitors Advisable to but the rabbit card to buy the tickets and save time and money

title: Great overall experience! Everything is planned out and explained.
review: The tour was very interesting and our tour guide Kiwi was super motivated and took care of everything Overall a great experiance where everything is organized for you I only wish we had a little more time at the train market to actually go shopping but there have to be some concessions for only a half day tour I later learned that you can just take a minibus from Ekkamai station (fairly central in Bangkok) to the train line that goes through the market Round trip should only be a few hundred baht

title: Good train system
review: Jumped on the MRT to get around places a few times found it cheap and easy to use and quick to get places Happy days

title: Good train service
review: We used the train to go to Asiatique from Mayfair Marriott  (After the train we had to use a ferry to get there) It was very easy to navigate for foreigners  The ticketing agent at Ratchadamri did not give us tickets Instead he gave us change and told us to buy the tickets ourselves Coming back we had no such issues The ticketing agent took our money and gave us the tickets

title: A better option than taxi
review: If you need to go to a sukhumvit or Silom hotel this train is cheapest option Easy to find at lowest level of international airport Less than 40 thb to makkassan station connect to Asoke Bts by mrt subway 16thb Beats traffic but some stairs involved

title: Fast and efficient, but not necessarily the best option when you're traveling in a group
review: BTS is a good option when you're traveling solo in pairs or in a big group where taxi is not possible It's also a good option if the traffic is bad  However if you're traveling in groups of 3 or 4 (or 5 if 2 of them are children) taxi might be a better option as it goes direct from point A to point B and the cost is cheaper

title: Airport access
review: In my experience this was an easy way to get out away from the airport during rush hour although terminating  a fair distance from our hotel we avoided being stuck in traffic for hours The ride was smooth but crowded as you would expect in a big city in rush hour Cabs can be a nightmare as they tell you things like I can't turn on the metre its illegal on a Saturday or trying to charge outrageous fairs for what is only a small distance

title: The way to go
review: If you want to get arround Bangkok the BTS Skytrain is the go   No need to worry about not so good taxis the busses are fun but very old and bumpy and very difficult to negotiate if you don't know Thai motor bike taxis are dangerous so for the average tourist do the Skytrain  All the facilities are in English buying a ticket is simple quick and the trains are very modern air conditioned and give a great view as they are elevated I find the combination of Skytrain and a short taxi is an efficient and a good way to beat the sometimes nitemare traffic

title: Cool travel mode
review: The BTS Skytrain is one of the many modes of transport in Bangkok Compared to other developed cities one may feel let down by the landscape coverage of the skytrain or the mrts but for a tourist this is still a very good bet  Skytrain covers all the key areas of Bangkok namely Silom sukhumvit siam paragon chatuchat market MBK mall payathai (a kilometer away from indra square)  What is good 1 high frequencies 2 Always on time 3 very neat and clean trains and stations  what is not good 1 crowd  be prepared to be cramped because the trains are normally flooded with people  It is still value for money especially in the sukhumvit area where one may spend hours on the road to overcome the traffic

title: Excellent!!!
review: Excellent transportationfriendly staff and best service in securityWe went there at July 2016Awsome

title: Good to use for travel solo
review: The easiest way to travel to the interesting place in Bangkok such as Paragon shopping mall Emporium The west gate etc

title: Skytrain
review: A good way to see Bangkok in a cheap efficient manner Works well and on time  It is a nice clean and on time way to roam around and explore Bangkok Would recommend it to all

title: Great and easy way to get around the city
review: Fast way to get around the city can be crowded early in the morning lunch and when school and work gets out

title: Very efficient and cost effective
review: The BTS system is so helpful to have getting around a city always filled with traffic jams The skytrains all have great ac inside the cars and the cost of a ticket is less than 50thb

title: Good transport to beat the jams
review: 1st time taking this train from Ratanacrop station (sorry not sure of the spelling) near Indra Square to the airport  It only took about half and hour and it only cost me 40 bahts  Trip was very smooth but to reach the departure lounge you got to go up the escalators from lower ground to the 4th level  Huge airport

title: Easy
review: This was an easy trip with staff speaking English and offering help Thirty minutes to the last city stop we had a seat  but after a few stations the train got full some people were standing Staff on arrival were also very helpful and we got a taxi to our hotel

title: The best transport from Bangkok city centre to Suwarnabhumi International Airport
review: This modern and efficient train is the fastest and cheapest option for getting from Bangkok city (Phya Thai) to Suwarnabhumi International Airport On Phya Thai station excellent connection with BTS Skytrain to city centre (Siam) Sukhumvit and Mo Chit Tickets available rom ticket machines

title: Cheap and Fast travel
review: We took the train from airport and we got right in front of our hotelit was very convenient even with luggage

title: The best way to travel in Bangkok !
review: This is the fastest cheapest & a very safety way to move yourself in the city of Bangkok  It cost you only 130 Thai Baht for a full day from 6 am till 12 pmThe trains are coming every 3 minutes at peak times and they have  aircon inside )

title: Good transporation
review: One of the best ways to get around Bangkok without being stuck in the traffic jam The trains are very modern and they offer a nice view

title: Nice Experience
review: I took the train from Asoke Station and got down 3 stops later I found the train identical to other monorails in India The ticket machines are easier to use and when in doubt seek help from a local Thai national they are one of the best helpers you may come across

title: Frequent fast, efficient service to get about this huge bustling city. Extremely good value for money
review: Cheap and effective way to navigate the huge hustle and bustle city of Bangkok Service is frequent and seems to be run with military precision Stations and trains are clean although cant always get a seat at peak times  similar to the London underground in this regard Staff are efficient but less friendly than usual Thai customer service

title: Great
review: This is such an ideal way of getting from the Airport into Bangkok We used it 4 times and it was brilliant So simple to understand even as 1st time visitors to Bangkok

title: Easy!
review: I took the BTS skytrain from the airport to the city It truly is the easiest way to get there and skip the gridlocked (and CRAZY) Bangkok traffic The token system is easy to use and incredibly cheap The stops themselves are easy to navigate and there are always plenty of taxis to take you to your fina destination

title: Maekhlong Line
review: It’s always a joy to ride Thai trains Mingling with the locals snaking through Thai country side and indulging yourself in the sights and smells of Thailand   This time I took the train from Wongwian Yai to Maeklong via Mahachai and Ban Laem Great and cheap alternative to a day tour to The Maeklong Railway Market I took me half a day  it I loved it

title: The BTS Rocks!
review: The gateway to the city  Clean  Safe  Economical  The Alink An adventute in itself  Always have small money aka Change

title: Great
review: This made Bangkok such a breeze for us as we were only there for 2 days It is cheap reliable and super easy to use

title: Efficient train system
review: Efficient train system Very easy to go by Famous malls are featured on under some of the stations' names in the train map in the train

title: Best way to get from hotel to airport
review: This is similar to London underground system but 40 feet in the air Very simple system well I managed

title: Cheap and convenient travel to the airport!
review: The best way to get to the airport saving money and time Good organized connected with metro All signs and ticket machines are clear (and in English)

title: Like Skytrain necessary to travel Bangkok
review: This is the second best way to traverse Bangkok The subway will take you all over Bangkok or you can travel to a station then finish your journey with a taxi  When traffic above is in gridlock during the day you can speed to your destination quickly The subway is new clean and on time Again when I take the subway the cars are filled with mostly Thais they know the best way

title: Fast
review: Fast clean and comfortable Fares are reasonable If you are a senior buy your ticket from the cashier you will get 50% off the fare

title: Cheap and efficient
review: Bangkok is enormous and congested so its nice that theres an easy way into the city from the airport  45 Baht (120 USD) makes it really good value too

title: Easy to use

title: convenient way to access most major shopping malls
review: the skytrain also comes way adjoining walk way you can walk instead of taking the train which i did  See the sights and bustle of the city better if you walk it is also a good workout

title: Fast to airport~
review: Though there are not so many trains to the airport a day as BTS and the position of those stations are a bit weird it's still a fast and comfortable way to the airport

title: Crowded but efficient
review: Although the train was a little crowded it was an efficient way to get to where we wanted to go as it connected with the other systems in the city

title: Reliable network, fun to use.
review: As first time users we were impressed by the whole network  from the staff who were willing to help us buy tickets to trains running on amazing frequency Other cities could model themselves on this We used the network intially from the airport to central Bangkok and then in and around the city Great

title: This sure beats taxis
review: If you haven't tried this train give it a go make the effort to find your way to it it is cheap safe and easy  Take it to the nearest stop to your hotel then get a taxi if needed  We were delighted to discover the train system

title: good, reliable, clean, safe and cheap
review: we could not get a taxi  long queue so tried the train  Very cheap clean and safe  Might be hard to get a taxi once in the city though

title: Best Transport in Bangkok
review: It was our first time in Bangkok and we are really fond to travelling like locals do anywhere we go We just had online BTS map of Bangkok with us and we are able to get through many major sightseeing points of Bangkok City by BTS skytrain It’s cool and convenient to travel around Bangkok

title: Thai version of London Underground
review: The sky train was cheapaffordable and on time  Although extremely busy had to stand up the inside of the train is a spitting image of London Underground trains   Overall though I got to A to B on time and quickly would use again

title: Airconditioned and super fast!
review: The Express link gets one into BKK city in less than 20mins  It's super fast faster than getting into the city using taxi One can even avoid the nasty traffic jams in Bangkok Highly recommended

title: Great connection to the city
review: Taking the Airport Link makes the trip to the city of Bangkok quiet fast The final stop of the Airport Ling is a BTS train stop close to the Asia Hotel which is a great place to stay by the way In earlier times I used cabs from the airport to the city but now only the Airport link

title: Very good!
review: Very convenient and pocket friendly it's a fast way of travelling through Bangkok We did 3 short trips and it saved us a lot of time and money Good services and well maintained  one must ride the sky train for travel Maps provided at the 1st station we got in from (Saladeng) helped us to find our way around  not only of the skytrains but also places to visit Do pick up a guide from the station when you travel

title: The best way to move around
review: Bangkok is filled with traffic jams everywhere In the morning in the afternoon and yes even at 2 am there is traffic The best fastest and cheapest way to mive around is the skytrain What a pleasant easy and convenient way to travel I thoroughly enjoyed the ride

title: Fast and efficient way to travel the city
review: Beats traffic and is a major time saver I enjoy the little stationary and socks kiosks at the stops Have the cutest things If you get stuck the operators are helpful

title: A hassle-free way to commute around the heart of Bangkok
review: As a resident I use skytrain to commute through the heart of Bangkok instead of driving It surely saves you time especially in the rush hours For tourists you can even plan your day along the route of the skytrain I recommend a one day pass ticket in this case

title: Day pass is perfect
review: Easy to get around clean quick Day pass is a great bargain if you plan on making more than two tripsEasy to get to or near most major points of interestSathorn pier river shopping Chatuchak markets

title: Cheap and easy to navigate
review: For about 70p you can get around most of the important areas of bangkok Just need a bit of change for the automated gates ITs safe quick and simple to use Can get busy during commuter times You literally only need to wait 2 mins for a train

title: Cheap and easy
review: Great way to get into the city Easy to use and cheap Cheaper than taking a taxi all the way from Suvarnabhumi Also you can avoid some of the traffic jams that frequently occur

title: Convenient, easy to use
review: As long as you know where you are and where you want to go it is very easy to use The names of all stations are written in Thai as well as English so it is easy for foreign travelers to follow

title: Convenient and fast
review: Easy to take from airport to town Better than getting stuck in traffic but the cabin is smaller with lots of people during peak hours

title: transport back to airport for going home
review: Trains were clean but the transfer point was quite a distance to walk with luggage and very confusing next time I will book a taxi worth the extra $18  This was included in the tour

title: Much quicker than taxi.
review: Quick easy CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP If travelling to Bangkok it's definitely worth considering getting the train from airport Get great views of city as well

title: Great accommodation terrible food
review: Two years ago had really wonderful meals on the train this year the worse Thai food I have had anywherecold and tasteless small portions for 250 baht Better to go with the random vendors for 40 baht Otherwise kind staff and comfortable bed just don't eat from the "restaurant"

title: Modern transportation
review: Modern transportation that we dont have in our country it was clean and nice air conditioner its just the staff couldn't speak in english

title: Take the Train - It's Simple!
review: I initially was very hesitant to take the train  I thought since I didn't know the language well that I was going to get lost  Well now I'm comfortable and becoming more familiar with this great mode of transportation  Read the wall map to decide where you want to end up  Either change your bills into coins for the machines or use your Day Pass or Rabbit Card  Buy a Day Pass if you're going to hop on and off numerous times in one dayit's worth itsave some baht  The Rabbit Pass is great for if you are staying in Bangkok for a length of time  Sort of like a debit cardyou can put anywhere from 100 baht on it and just add money as you need it  Both are better than standing in some of the long lines for 10 baht coins for the ticket machines Too easy There are station stops that will open up on Mall levels can't beat door to door service  Some if not most stations have a lift for wheelchairs  haven't seen them usedThe BTS can get crowded at certain times and certain stationsso little kids may get squeezed easily

title: Easy to get you around the city
review: The skytrain is the easiest you can get around the city if you don't want to get stuck in a horrendous traffic in Bangkok especially during rush hours From the airport you can easily connect to the sky train via the airport link except that it closes at 11 pm Plan you destinations ahead and navigate the city with a breeze with the sky train  If you want you see the whole city with a quick glance use the sky train

title: A relaxing and historical ride
review: The ThaiBurma Railway is a must do experience in Kanchanaburi The ride is generally pleasant While there isn't any air conditioning the windows are always down allowing for a cool breeze to enter and the tickets are cheap (100 baht) The train takes you along the famous Bridge on the River Kwai and along the steep cliff next to the river The sights are gorgeous and will take your breath away At the end of the railroad you can easily walk or get a truck over to Hellsfire Pass to continue the historical adventure

title: Sky train
review: Best way to travel around in the city  Super cheap and easy to understand and follow Comes highly recommended

title: Very good
review: With bts sky train is the cheapest way to came from Suvarnabhumi airport Trains are very clean and always on time Only 45 baht airport  downtown

title: Cool (literally)
review: One of the best methods of transportation I've ever taken It's fast clean and organised Sometimes during rush hour you get stuck inside like a pack of sardines but at least there's aircon P

title: CONVENIENT
review: Very convenient way to get around town Sad they have only line Hopefully they extend more routes Interiors are clean compared to many european metro

title: Nice and Clean
review: The train is clean and runs timely It will get you wherever you need to go We took it everyday to get to the main shopping places

title: So easy to use and great about
review: Perfect and cheap transport to see and get about the city nice aircon and can get cold on the trains but you see so much

title: Above the traffic
review: We were in Bangkok for just a week and our basehotel was in Sukhumvit Soi 18 which was conveniently around the corner from the BTS stations Asok and Sukhumvit  Whenever possible we used the BTS Skytrain as Bangkok seems to have a permanent traffic jam and the other option by taxi was usually hopelessly too long Skytrain operates very efficiently and is cheap It only took us a couple of trips to master the ticketing system The carriages were clean cool and comfortable and in the main directions for us tourists was reasonably clear But so many people spoke English we just had to ask  It can get very busy at rush hour time and you must have the right change to purchase a trip token although there are daily ticket options we believe Overall a good experience

title: Systematically managed and always clean
review: To avoid rush houralways planned in between the traffic hoursdon't get in from 7  9 am and from 5  8 pm It's the easiest way to get around the citydon't border catching a cab It connects most part of the city also the Subway MRT

title: Is there any other way to cross the city?
review: In short this is probably the best way to get  around if your travelling big distances Download the Bangkok metro app and the system becomes easy to use The ticket machines are dead simple too and it’s well priced Can be a bit of a squeeze now and again though

title: Skytrain
review: We've been on the sky train hundreds of times over the last fifteen years and have noticed one thing about the so called friendly Thais We are a couple in our mid sixties and seventy years of age One thing we have noticed is that the younger generation do not give up their seats for the elder While the younger generation enjoy the luxury of sitting down we were left standing during our journey At the end of the day the Thais are just as selfish as the rest of the world Now whenever we see a spare seat we grab it before anybody else can and we couldn't are less Do as the locals do I say

title: Very clean n nice bts
review: Took airport railway n bts as a transport to travel around Bangkok which is very convenience Very Clean Bts there are many different station where it made traveling to other location very convenient

title: Convenience
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok in comfort and avoiding the traffic The cost of travel is reasonable and most important it is time saving

title: overloking the city
review: The sky train is the best possible way to move around the city particularly if your destination is along the route  It offers a nice view since it moves 20m or so above the street level and is easy to spot and see where it moves Hints the passengers are forming lines where the door sill of the train is about to stop Don't attempt to move outside of the lines or you will be looked at  Also never take the sky train during the rush hour if you can avoid it It is heavily packed There are different ticket booths that exchange your bank notes for small change and different for purchasing your ticket The tickets are priced per travel zone

title: Fantastic
review: Brilliant way of getting from  the airport no expensive taxi with the free way toll charge  very quick and super cheap and nice cool air con very friendly staff

title: The most efficient and cost effective way to get to the city
review: A long time ago I used to take the taxi from the airport to the city Finished Use the Airport Link It will cost you less than 50 bht one way per person from the Airport to the city to access the BTS and MRT stations It’s a 20 Minutes ride and the BEST way to get into the city From BKK international airport follow the Airport link signs which will almost bring you to the basement level Easy efficient and made for everyone from family’s with strollers to the elder Hope this helps If so think of the thumbs up Thanks

title: Ok
review: Fine but a lot of people there are using the train So sometimes its not for sure you get the first train

title: Convenient but extremely packed at peak hours
review: The BTS gets you to most places a tourist would need to go to but avoid the peak hours as it is packed with hardly any breathing room Still it beats getting stuck in the Bangkok traffic down below

title: Excellent way to get around town
review: The sky train is an overhead very modern train system that is affordable air conditioned and fast compared to local traffic Use it to get yourself into an area then complete your journey locally with taxi Tuk Tuk or scooter ride service

title: Affordable transportation
review: I was surprised by how low cost transportation is here 100 baht got me 4 stops away from nana plaza  very busy during commute hours be ready for standing room only some of safety features I noticed  exceed what bart has in bay area us

title: Clean and Fast
review: I went on the rail link to get to my hotel  It was very quiet  But nice and clean  Will use it again

title: Not too bad
review: We booked through 12Go who were excellent to deal with an I would book again1st class sleeper was fully booked so we went 2nd class aircon  The trip wasn't badand was actually comfythe only part is the porter wanted to make up the beds very early and was waking people just after 500am our arrival wasn't until 710 Take ear plugs some people talked loud than the noises of the carriage

title: Most convenient way to travel
review: Even if you're not local this is easy to navigate  Just go to the ticket window if you speak Englishthe agents understand enough English to assist

title: Avoid the Bangkok traffic jam
review: I always take taxi from airport to downtown and it cost me around 600 baht and takes 45 min To 1 hour This time I i tried the airport rail link and wow it cost me only 75 baht to get to my hotel in Nana station  It was brisk fast and convenient Try it and you will be more than happy

title: Needs some updates
review: One thing I don't get about bangkok is that I get the feeling a lot of people are employed for the sake of giving them a job The BTS is a prime example of that and me scratching my head wondering what the heck are these people doing The train service itself is reliable fast and clean But getting to the train is a bit of a "what da" moment If you don't use a pass because maybe you're just there for a few days and its not worth it then you end up having to buy a ticket individually The ticket machines look like they were installed in 1975 It takes cash only but worse does not accept bills just coins Are there machines that will give you change Nope You have to get change from a person at the service booth Generally fine but if you're in a busy station or event there will be a long line I notice a few station had newer machines that can accept bills Of the 2 machines that I saw one was working And the BTS seem like its a completely system than the MRT Seems to be a recurring theme in bangkok Things kind of work 50% correctly

title: First Rate travel
review: Of all the airports that we have visited on our six week trip I have to say that the airport in Bangkok was by far the best coming into the country and leaving was so easy ( Vietnam please note ) that it was a pleasure to go through it as it is very easy to get about with helpful staff We had heard so much about Dubai but this airport was by far better than it

title: Must us this next time
review: We had ovet an hour ride into Bangkok in rush hour and the same out to get back we must remember to use the Airport Sky train it is so convenient to beat all the traffic

title: Frequent, cool and convenient
review: We would recommend booking a hotel not far from the skytrain stations as it is a fantastic way to get around busy Bangkok

title: It's good
review: This is a nice simple option to get I and out of Suvaranbhumi if you don't have luggage Be aware it doesn't go to Don Muang where Air Asia flights & some other International flights leave  If the taxis make you nervous I would recommend it However you may need to get a taxi to your final destination  Clean safe & efficient  Separately for the adventurous Don Muang can be reached by mainline train From Hualamphong to Donmuang can take as little as 45 minutes However if you are in a rush then avoid it  All trains on the Northern branch stop there then it is a walk to the terminal through the airport hotel Current fare 5b and a fascinating journey through the back of Bangkok

title: A must visit
review: This is one place that is a must visit if your near it A really facinating look at the history of it

title: Good service
review: Very good serviceand very cheapMost of the places connected this btsStaffs r very helpful if tried once u cannot miss to ride itvery fast n very cheap rather then any other taxis or tum til

title: Economical, fast and frequent
review: The city to Suvarhnabhum airport link is economical fast and frequent clean and reliable A must use I wish its hours extended for early morning flights though

title: Cheap and nice
review: Its cost about 3040 baht per person Station was normally not full with seats available ( at least during experience)

title: Clean, Cool and Efficient
review: The Sky train is an excellent way of getting around Bangkok It is well organised and the trains are clean spacious and cool It is also relatively inexpensive compared to taxis A trip from Mo Chit (nearest station to Don Mueang airport) and BTS Nana was 42 Baht

title: Great tour for tourists to see something different.
review: After a very early start to the day the tour outside of Bangkok was good We were lucky with weather and got to ride the train as it entered the market as well as see the stalls survive as the train returned The floating markets are ok Definitely have the food cooked on the boats so skip breakfast if you can

title: Great transport
review: great transportation that serves the city well clean and air conditioned car  price  really to use Bangkok as there is lots of traffic on the roads and a big waste of time in the car

title: Amazing transit service
review: The Bangkok Sky train is an amazing transit system People wait in line the staff is helpful no pushing and even when we weren't sure where to go people would help us out Even if they didn't know much English ) I found the Skytrain to be well connected and efficient

title: Convenient way to travel
review: We are in Bangkok this week and loving the convenience of the bts It's pretty easy to figure out where to go using Google maps + the station map Some stations have ticket machines that take notes some only take coins but usually there has been a ticket booth open Trains are often crowded but people are so respectful here that it's not uncomfortable

title: Best way to travel
review: We visited Bangkok for 5 days and used the sky train when we can as it is convenient easily accessible and easy to use Highly recommended for all tourist visiting Bangkok

title: Easy to use
review: Just like the MRT  MTR except above ground and traffic

title: Interesting ride on a famous rail
review: Read about this before going on it  I did not read it until later (I bought a book there from a vendor and read it on the plane on the way home) I just enjoyed the scenery the river and the cliffs  I would have been in much more awe if I had know then what I know now

title: Very easy way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS we found easy to navigate and get around as the traffic is so busy it is often quicker to  We used it to go to the river and found it cheap and convenient worth a try  Taxi are cheap but they take so long depending on the time of day

title: Zipping around the city while traffic crawls below
review: Bangkok just won title as 2nd worst traffic in Asia and maybe globe  The elevated train system known as sky train clean efficient safe and air conditioned  Great way to get around the city see sites and inexpensive

title: Quicker than any other way
review: BST is well connected to most of the places And you can reach your destination well with in the time

title: A train runs throught it!
review: Never seen shopping like this I think everyone should do this tour if in Bangkok to see how the train runs through the market while you shop  You are sure to find something in the market to take home

title: The train traffic monitoring need to be resolved
review: The train traffic monitoring is bad Every months bangkokians experienced the maintenance and delay Also we never get a chance to sit on the chair Good thing is that it is clean and faster than taking a vehicles in bangkok

title: bankok trip 1
review: we used the airport rail link to get to airport on time no traffic blocks and reaches airport without any delays loved the system

title: Very good
review: Easy and fast only 40 Baht from Airport to Bangkok center Good alternative instead of Taxi especially during rush hour

title: Easy, Fast, Convenient
review: I've taken the skytrain multiple times in Bangkok  Bangkok has so much traffic so this definitely helps During rush hour you do feel like a sardine in there but there is ac and no ine seems to mind if you are standing on too of them  it's actually pretty funny I do wish that the hours were extended until later in the evening though  Overall super clean and people really do wait in line to board verses rushing the door when it opens

title: Crowded and slow
review: Not the best The queue to buy the tickets were so long they had 2 machines and it took me 25 minutes just to get to the window After arriving on the platform the screen said train arriving and it did but 2 minutes later lol Very busy and packed

title: A convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok and to avoid the road traffic It is easy to access with many stops just avoid peak hour as is very busy at those times

title: Very convenient
review: Bangkok Railway Thailand  Suvarnabhumi A1 ➡️ Lat Krabang A2  It’s so convenient just pack your luggage and drop it off at B2 45baht per person The direct route from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city is half an hour away and the most important thing is not to worry about traffic jams The shifts are all ok every 10 minutes There are many Thai locals getting on and off the train at every stop along the way

title: Surrounded with 3 Sky train stations
review: Surronded with 3 Sky trains (BTS) which are Saladaeng station located at the east Surasak established at  souutheast and Sapan Taksin is at the South of the Lebua Hotel at State tower Easy for travel & roam in the fabulous city

title: It's better then in Europe
review: I love the bts in Bangkok It's cleaner and nicer then a lot of public transportation in Europe or the US It's not that cheap if you drive a lot but in the traffic times of Bangkok it's really the best way to get around The only bad thing is that its pretty new and there are still a lot of spots you could not get by the bts or mrt

title: Ok
review: Ok typesit is highly hypedit's like a normal metro traincleanliness and timeliness  is there

title: Great Trains
review: Nice clean and cool Easy to access tickets A bit overcrowded at times but still a good fast service

title: Easy to Use and will take you to most places
review: Make sure that you have coins for the ticket machine but if not there are change booths Most trip cost between 25baht and 28 baht

title: Convenient, Fast and Clean
review: I've took a BTS Skytrain from Suvarnabhumi airport up to Phaya thai station and it only costs 45 baht per person it was fast and clean riding here is the best way going to Bangkok City

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: We took the special express train 40  from Surat thani to Hua Hin It’s a 5 12 hour trip and it left on time and arrived as scheduled I wasn’t expecting to be fed but they brought us packaged food two different times not great but it wasn’t that bad either along with coffee tea or water They do keep the air conditioner cranked up so take a cover up There are also fans but it was cold enough that no one turned them on It cost us 490TB ($15US) each The train has a slight odor to it but it’s fairly clean as they were constantly sweeping and mopping the center isle I did not use the bathroom but my husband said on a scale of 110 he would give it a 3 and he would not want to sit on the seat When you arrive in Hua Hin DO NOT take the taxi’s outside the station they all want to charge 500TB We walked about a block to the main road and got a metered taxi to Chaam for 215TB I would not hesitate to take the State Railway again

title: Easy link
review: Easy and fast link from the airport to some terminals in Bangkok where you can access other ways of transportation to hotels etc

title: Clean and Efficient travel
review: Tickets were easy to purchase and the metro was clean quick and safe to take the family  It doesn't cover the city as completely as the Washington DC metro or the tube in London but it sure beats the traffic on the street for efficiency

title: A piece of history that should never be forgotten.
review: As a railway buff this is an iconic journey that is a must to do but is certainly bittersweet to personally see where so many men suffered and achieved this incredible featThe old wooden bridge of course is not the real Bridge over the River Kwai but it certainly holds a fascination along with great sadness and is a must see if you have the time to travel out of Bangkok to its location

title: Cheap, fast, effective
review: Took this to get to the International Airport From Phaya Thai station is very easy to get to the Airport line and it will take about 30 minutes to arrive I paid about 30 bhat for a ride The view form the windows is amazing one can enjoy the ride looking at the beautiful scenery

title: The Emergency Exit for any traffic jam
review: Always pack during peak hours with long queue to purchase a ticket Go ahead and purchase a Rabbit cardthe time saved from queuing to change money and purchase single trip ticket is worth it

title: great
review: for tourist is the easiest way to move and secure fast I would love that the lines covers all the city

title: Excellent access from the airport
review: Took the train in to the city to meet a guide It was very easy to purchase a ticket Instructions are in English as are announcements on the train

title: Cool and fast Bangkok transportation
review: Always on time cool clean and cheap Close to a lot of attractions Comfortable transportation with very smooth start and stop

title: Great train
review: Airconditioned trains Staff at ticket desk speak English  All staff helpful Easy way you travel round the city and cheap

title: Memorial place
review: I visited there on June 19 It was memorial place of World war IIThis road connected Ban PongThailand to Thanbyuzayat  from Myanmar as logistic road for Japanese army during 194243

title: efficient and practical
review: always have coins available as the machines do not take notes the trains are spacious air coned and well maintained easiest way around bangkok

title: Well Worth The Long Journey
review: Both the train and floating markets were well worth the visit our guide and driver were both great The train ride and hour long visit in the train market were all you'd hope and more the floating market wasn't quite as eye opening an experience but well worth seeing This trip can be well over half a day  we went on a Friday and there are massive roadworks on the route out of and into Bangkok We were collected from our hotel at 8am and dropped back at the central Mall (there is not a dropoff service on the way back) about 4pm and spent about 5 of those 8 hours in the minibus

title: Seamless!
review: Definitely recommend this trip Pickup and drop off were seamless the tour guide was great and it was so nice to have someone guiding us throughout the day and making sure we saw everything

title: Cheapest to visit city
review: I used this and made a tourist pass for a day The entire city is well connected with this sky train and very fast and convinient way to see bangkok

title: Easy Trip to the Airport
review: I personally wouldn't take the Skytrain if I had to drag more than one bag but if you can handle the luggage this is probably the quickest way to get to the airport as you bypass the sometimes bumper to bumper traffic There is some walking involved but really not a bad trip Very convenient access via the BTS or MTR I would recommend it over street transportation anytimeexcept as I mentioned if you have too many bags to wrestle with

title: Sky train is life-line of Bangkok
review: It is great experence trains are clean in time what else we want also appropriate cost of transportation

title: Efficient
review: You can easily buy tickets from a machine that has english available or at a counter quite cheap and fast and reliable We had more difficulty in locating the underground with the above ground construction Sky train was easy

title: Quickest way Bangkok
