review: Easy Access from the airport jump in the lift or get on the escalator down to the lower ground floor  when the train arrives EVERYBODY wants to get on at once with all their belongings so let them fight it out before you get on  Swift service from airport to bangkok with connecting stations on route to different parts of the city connections to the Skytrain and the MRL ( underground system ) along the way saves taxi fares and toll charges very efficient service

title: Modern and efficient
review: The BTS Bangkok Skytrain is very cheap with journeys between 3040 bht and a pass (like an oyster in the UK) Costs 100bht (£200) then you put money on it and journeys are cheaper too 100bht allowed us to make 3 or 4 journeys  The trains are clean air conditioned and modern The sky train sits above Bangkok's streets and some of the views are great A great way to get across such a busy city with ease They also have some underground stations on one particular line too

title: Cold Break
review: A short ride from Terminal 21 to MBK BTS Skytrain served the purpose Clean and orderly Hot weather in Bangkok gave me a cold break when I rode this train I liked the promptness of this train Announcement during stops certainly gave a tourist an easy way to know their stop The fare is just right The directions are easy to follow I liked it

title: Probably the cheapest airport express train in the world
review: Amazing  this train takes you to the heart of Bangkok for about 30 minutes and for just over 1 euro Running every 15 minutes from 6am to 24pm it's obviously the easiest fastest and cheapest way to get into Bangkok connecting you with both metro systems (MRT and BTS)

title: Great air con
review: A cool oasis in the middle of a boiling city Easy to navigate cheap day pass 140 baht a day Would be better if it went more central

title: Very good
review: This is the perfect solution for escape the traffic jam This is clean and fast Perfect to go to the airport

title: Wasn't worth the travel time and money
review: We were in a van for almost 4 hours while we only spent 30 minutes at the railway market and about 45 at the floating market The tour guide was very nice and meant well by it but she took complete control of the experience Due to the limited time at the railway marketwhich was insanely packed with almost no room to walkwe had to rush to meet her at the beginning of the market or be potentially left behind as she explained We couldn't see the vendors pack their things and clear the rail tracks  when the train arrived because of it and that was a big reason why I wanted to visit there  On the way to the floating market she took everyone's lunch order which surprised me because the listing said lunch wasn't provided It turns out it wasn't  we had to pay for the meal she ordered for uswhich was at the food court no different than any other food court in Thailand I would have happily paid the steeper price to buy food from the passing boats and eat on the boat for the experience I was too full at that point She did it to help us save money and I wouldn't be surprised if there's a relationship with a certain food stall and they get a percentage of profits but that was a disappointment

title: So convenient and easy to figure out...
review: I love the BTS Skytrain in BKK  The elevated train goes to most places you'd want to check out while in Bangkok including many shopping malls  A plus of riding the BTS is it's airconditioned  When it's hot in Bangkok a ride on the BTS can help cool you down before going into another airconditioned building  Prices are very reasonable  If you're a local or expect a long stay in BKK you can get yourself a Rabbit Card  It's a prepaid card that allows you quick access to the trains without having to buy fares on a trip by trip basis  Another thing is if you don't have the right coinage you must stand in line to get change then stand in line to buy a "ticket" to ride BTS

title: A marvel to the city.
review: Do not miss the Day pass to explore the city and then take the 3 day Pass should you feel the need to

title: Good one!
review: Easy to use convenient clean well lighted A relief to ride coming from the very warm weather Also a great alternative to car or taxi  Easier to get around due to the traffic  Would definitely recommend to use

title: Fast and Cool
review: It's not extensive as the train systems in Seoul Tokyo or London But you can get from point A to point B without being stuck in the BKK traffic Get a rabbit card and save even more

title: Great tour of Floating Market and Maeklong Railway  Market
review: Sarah is the best She was a good tour guide throughout our tour She knows a lot and gave a lot of knowledge about Thai history

title: Convenient,
review: Trains ran frequently throughout the day stopped around midnight Cheap & clean easy to use Not overcrowded

title: Easy way to the airport
review: This is the easiest way to get from the airport to the MRT or BTS and then to wherever your destination is or vice versa If I did my research well I would have not taken the taxi upon arriving at Suvarnabhumi airport I would have used the Airport Rail Link But I did when leaving Thailand From Phaya Thai BTS Station you can easily walk to the Airport Rail Link no need to get outside because it is connected to it The Airport Rail Link takes you directly into the airport

title: Quick and cheap
review: We stayed in the Silom area and upon our arrival at the airport we checked google maps and it said they journey would be 1hour 15mins so headed for the rail link and got the train to the end of the line (Phaya Thai taking 25mins) and then got a 10 minute taxi from there  Great option at only 45THB each

title: Sky train
review: Great transport service inexpensive and very easy to navigate  Day tickets cost about 60p and gives unlimited travel until midnight  Staff were very helpful pointing out which way you need to go and which tickets were the best value  There is no eating or drinking allowed on the Sky Train system so it is very clean  The queueing system works well due to the high frequency of trains there is very little waiting even when busy Great air condition on the trains so it's a good place to cool down

title: Convenient, Safe, Effective
review: Without BTS Bangkok would have paralyzed in a heart beat  BTS makes it possible to move around in Bangkok without worries  I can schedule any events with friends and will be on time Security personnel on the platform make people feel safe from the train  BTS staff and users are helpful when I asked questions about train directions and stations I feel safe traveling in Bangkok

title: great way to travel in Bangkok
review: Travel by skytrain is economical and free of traffic jams Convenient way to travel Trains every five minutes and announcements in english and thai

title: Great means of transportation in Bangkok
review: Skytrain gives you a great mode of transportation convering some important shopping centers of Bangkok and major attractionsIt has dual benefits you escape the traffic jams of Bangkok and that too it is way cheaper than the taxi

title: World class
review: I had to go airport in a rush Airport rail link saved my life It is fast and cheap way to go to the airport from the city center It goes to bkk not dmk 35 THB for 1 person

title: Good!
review: Clean Fast Good for short distance Otherwise if u need to go to the other side of Bangkok it's better to get a taxi

title: Fast and cheap
review: Great idea if you want to see Bangkok and not get stuck in the unbarely able gridlock traffic Very cheap too around 120 baht for a day pass

title: No need to use taxi
review: In my opinion you do not need to use airport taxi when your destination is to the downtown Step in one of them and then plan your route with a conjunction skytrain or metro

title: Wow!!!
review: We were extremely surprised to get such a great journey with sky train  Amazing view and easy way to see the town

title: So easy!!
review: The best way to get around It comes very often really cheap easy to navigate through The trains go almost in all the areas of central Bangkok with connections to the metro The best thing is AC A relief from the hit)

title: GOOD IN THIS BIG CITY - BUT ACCEPTS PRIMARILY CASH(NO CARDS)
review: Like any big city this is a valuable way to get around but overwhelming with large number of stations with challengingly similiar names     I was surprized to find that most tickettoken machines DO NOT TAKE CREDIT CARDS   So try to arrive with BAHT small bills(100 or smaller) or coinage otherwise you will have to wait in lines just to get change  Another observation was that once you select a fare option and pay you will get your change PLUS A BLACK PLASTIC TOKEN   Whereas in most other cities you would get a paper ticket  At the ENTRY turnstile take the BLACK PLASTIC TOKEN and hold it over the display screen on the turnstile  At the EXIT turnstile deposit the token into the slot to exit  So again be sure to  grab your change AND black plastic token  ONE IMPORTANT SIDE NOTE   En route to a site I found that there are pocketsareas of the city that are not closeconvient to stations   So i reccomend you plan ahead as it may be prudent to go to a station and grab a cab to your destination otherwise it may involve some considerable walking

title: Awsome easy way to get around.
review: Once you take it a couple times it all makes sense You pay for how far you are going on the line anywhere from 2040 ish baht We bought a pass with 15 pre loaded trips on it which is 30baht no matter where you go or connect with the other lines that is good for 30 days We stopped in Bangkok on our way to Koh Tao and will be back for our flight home at we should use most of the 15 round trips we purchased

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Trains are clean and the fastest way to get around BangkokTickets are affordable especially for europeans

title: Do not hesitate to use it! Cheap, easy, clean!
review: First time in Thailand and we used this to get to the city and transfer to the BTS  #1  not a real concern but don't lose your chip  It is clean quiet fast easy to use (machines and instructions have English translations) and cheap It is much faster than a cab and WAY WAY WAY cheaper Definitely the way to go And no sitting in traffic

title: First time I have tried airport rail link
review: Even though I am Thai I have never tried this airport rail link before This is my first time Surprisingly seeing ticket price is very cheap comparing to btsmrt Very convenient way to get into downtown from Suvarnabhumi airport BUT long queue for ticket and it seems like train run very slow

title: Busy and Crowded
review: Not the easiest system I have used but it did the job very crowded but good air con in the 35 degree heat a bit tricky at the machines if you pick one that only takes coins So take plenty

title: Easy and cheaper around town in AC
review: If you're not all about bartering with taxituktuk drivers See if your next destinations is located around the stations of the skytrain It rides frequently and is way cheaper to move around with through Bangkok The skytrain and ferries are the cheapest and probably most fun ways to move through this bustling city

title: Easy, cheap and safe way to get around Bangkok.
review: The skytrain was really easy to use and low cost  we got on 2 x trains approx 30 mins journey one way to the river and it worked out about 80p each  They have glass screens that line up with the doors and only open when the train is there so safety is great  no falling or jumping onto track There is someone telling you in Thai and in English which stop is next etc Ticket machines only take coins but there are ticket desks open

title: can interchange to bts and mrt
review: I touched down at Suvarnabhumi Airport Look for the sign of airport rail link It only cost 40baht for single journey to Sukhumvit area It is very convenient fast and cheap

title: Floating market and train market
review: Very informative and an amazing experience Floating market was beautiful with great shops And the train market had a lot of good and interesting food Thank you sarah

title: Very efficient
review: I love the BTS here in Bangkok when traveling alone It's cheaper than taking a cab or Uber I can't wait for all the new lines to finish especially the line to Don Muang airport

title: Trip from Airport to Bangkok City
review: Inexpensive efficient professionally operated I was pleasantly surprised by this great experience Highly recommended

title: Nice,cool, easy to travel
review: We took BTS most of the time as the traffic is very bad Too busy in rush hour (try to avoid that time) More routes would be good but has improved since 6 years ago when we were last there Best way to travel in Bangkok

title: ZIP to your destination
review: Convenient and the best  This takes you into the heart of  bangkok and MOST likely you will have to change trains to get to your destination

title: Clean and efficient
review: I like riding in Bangkok's MRT system It's a far cry from other Asian train systems I've tried before It's very clean aircon is working properly there are protective gates before the rail tracks It can get very crowded though during busy times in the day

title: Fast and Easy to use
review: Makes negotiating Bangkok quick and easy  Ticket machines are intuitive and change can be obtained from the manned booths

title: Just not bad
review: The idea of ARL is surely correct However it is all about poor design and management It should have been designed to link with BTS and MRT more efficiently The speed should be faster Thanks to its decent pricing If a model like in Hong Kong where check in and loading luggages can be done in town would be much better At least we do have some other choice than just taxi

title: Great opportunity and guide
review: Our guide Jum was amazing  she was super nice and gave great info The tour itself is pretty short and you don’t have more than 30 minutes at the markets which is too short But still overall the trip is great recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok

title: Easy to navigate
review: Very easy to navigate good for luggage stowage Dont try to take a drink on this train they make you throw it away before boarding

title: BTS - Getting around in Bangkok
review: Bangkok itself is a great city and it's BTS transportation system is great too Quick service cheap clean and even if you stand the experience is good We used it at various hours and always had a smile through the ride just maybe 3 weeks in Thailand is contagious If you are staying a while I definitely recommend a Rabbit card to bypass the long lines (but quick) The card costs 200 Baht which include 100 Baht issuing fees and 100 Baht initial stored values so 100 That goes to traveling fees  I do recommend the service from the Airport to the city which is a different system and then catching the BTS to getting close to your destination

title: The Skytrains in Bangkok are Great
review: So easy to get around once you get a feel for the map and where the stations are We used the skytrains a lot since they were close to our hotel Best to buy a fare card for easy inout at the stations

title: Very convenient and cheap for commuting between cities in Bangkok and Suvannabhumi Airport
review: Thanks to all Thais and foreigners who used the link for their disciplines to make the rail link very clean and organized The "express" airport rail link has however stopped it's services for sometimes now therefore the normal airport rail link is very crowded during rush hours as it stops at all stops along the way   As a result prepare time well for going to the airport

title: Use it whenever you can. It's cheap, safe, clean and incredibly convenient
review: If you use Bangkok taxis you can sit for 2 hours in a traffic jam and pay for the delay Or you can dive down into the MRT and arrive quickly and comfortably (aircon) within 15 mins on the other side of town Used together with BTS Skytrain it's the clever way to navigate the city Take a little time and trouble to preplan your daily itinerary and take advantage of this highly efficient and cheap travel option Bangkok traffic is a nightmare of congestion and keeping off the roads is highly recommended unless you have time to waste

title: Simple to use
review: Being Londoners we are well used to public transport  The BTS system was particularly easy to use  saved a lot of time compared with using a taxi

title: Best City Transport
review: With an extended line and joining the MRT and Airport Line gives travellers a hassle free travel but it would have been better if lifts are built and functioning for the benefit of the elderly disabled and travellers with large luggage

title: Fast and Comfortable
review: Great way to get into the city from the airport  Cheap fast and comfortable  Strongly recommended  Much easier than some cities' rail links

title: Ayman
review: Skytrain was a very good experience in Bangkok  Clean and go to everywhere  30 Baht for three station  I think a littel bit expensive comparing with Bus transportation

title: Easy access
review: 'Bangkok Jam' living up its name Its better to travel via BTSMRT than being stuck in a jam with taxi although the metered taxi  uber are quite easy to get and inexpensive Bts map is clear and precise station name are clearly mention in Thai and also English  Athough peak hours can be quite pack But its definitely one of the best way to travel

title: Good
review: It is ugly and very crowded but it serves it purpose as it should arrives promptly (there was a train ready both times we used it) Prices also reasonable

title: easy to get into city
review: easy way into city quick and easy and cheap as well just a long walk to get to train if you have lots of luggage

title: Doesnt really do its job
review: So arrive in Bangkok after a pretty long flight tired and think we shall get the airport rail link to the center easy ) actually not so easy at all it doesn't go to the center so we had to get the airport rail link then the underground and then a tuk tuk  Its was fast and pretty nice but doesn't link you to the center

title: Progress? OK, sometimes it is good!
review: I was in Bangkok in the days when Sukhumvit Rd was just a road and two ways the 80's Then they made it in to a one way and that really was bad With the sky train who cares So effiicient and for the most part clean and convenient When travelling downtown it's the only way to travel Just wish they made it faster and easier to get your tokens at stops like MBK and Siam Paragon

title: City to Airport..fast and cheap
review: best commute from airport from the city starts from 6am till midnight an fare not at all expensive compared to taxi terminating at Paya Thai u get metro connectivity from there to other parts of the city

title: Airport link
review: An outstanding economical facility's I used it with my family for thrice it costed us 35 bth from airport to makassan station and from their you can change the train and go to bts train stations  From airport to makassan it takes 25 minutes approx

title: Just use it
review: Taxi or Skytrain We took taxis the first couple of days as they are so cheap BUT the time you can sit in traffic is painful   Its easy to follow and once used you will keep going back as it is much quicker to get around

title: Beat the traffic
review: Everyone knows that the traffic in Bangkok is horrendous Using the BTS skytrain will shave hours of travel time  in some cases  daily

title: Easy to use!
review: User friendly and quick transportation service  Had a hotel walking distance to 2 stations Used to go to jim thomson house shopping centers and chao phraya express boats  Clean with AC

title: Cheap and a good way to escape the traffic jam
review: An easy way to travel Make sure you have sufficient coins to purchase tickets at the machine or risk having to queue at the counter to buy one Certain stations may have a long line for example Mo Chit on a Sunday due to the Jatuchak crowd Tickets will not cost you more than 45 baht The shorter the distance the cheaper the tickets Train intervals are fast Trains clean Personally I would take the train to commute because the traffic can be terrible

title: BTS Fantastic overhead rail system
review: Very simple convenient clean and reliable transport system Runs very regularly never have to wait long Plenty of signage and easy to download to phone Can pay for short trips or get a card and top up if in Bangkok for a number of days Love using it and where I stayed the Station was next to my hotel @ Asia Hotel Highly recommend

title: Local transportation
review: It’s fast transportation service to avoid the heavy traffic Only disadvantage is you need to buy each time separate ticket if you are changing the lines (routes) which is very frustrating & teller machines only accept coins  Imagine if 4 pax you need to insert 40 times coins if each needs to pay 10 TBH

title: Sky train
review: This travel is the recommended way around Bangkok Easy to get to many attractions and through the road congestion Payment and usage is easy to follow Helpful staff and clean trains

title: Family - Me and my aged parent
review: The BTS skytrain is great and super clean Great way to get around Bangkok and their the bigger shopping centres like Siam Paragon Siam Square Siam Discovery MBK Chitlom etc are all walkablesky bridge from the BTS stations Very economical way to travel time efficient and save the hassles of bargaining with taxi driverstuk tuk drivers   Negative  in the less popular BTS Stations the lifts don’t work It’s hard work for an aged person (78 years old ) to climb up and down the stairs How hard is it to get them fixed

title: Efficient Way to travel around Bangkok
review: This is a quick and better was to travel from one place to another in bangkok While taxies are cheap there is a lot of traffic in Bangkok The trains are always on time and clean As always be careful with your purses and wallets Its better to take the BTS to the closetest point and then take a taxi This will save you a lot of time

title: Very Convenient
review: Very convenient and accessible service Easiest way to commute in Bangkok Very cheap too and easy to get a hang of also

title: Convenience
review: This is the way i travel very convenience and easy i wont use taxi anymore I will come back soon

title: Stand near the doors
review: This is very quick and easy to navigate and as your travelling at a high level the route is actually reasonably interesting If like us you're travelling with suitcases and not riding to the end of the line  make sure you stand near the door If not it gets busier and busier as you head into the city and you will find it very difficult getting through the crowds with your luggage

title: Easy affordable fast travel in Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok for many locations  Combine it with the MRT Subway and the Airport Train (and for the adventurous the Khlong Saen Saeb Water taxis) and you can get most anywhere you want to go  The BTS Skytrain is easy to use and will save you hours of time sitting in a taxi in traffic

title: Efficient, Simple-to-operate and Cheap
review: Great way to move around Bangkok Inexpensive and safe Good access to city shopping and links to river boats allowing connections to places like Khaosan

title: Smooth ride
review: Used to take taxi from airport to downtown Bangkok whenever I visit Bangkok  No need now as I pick a hotel where the airport rail stations are located n save hours on the chaotic Bangkok road traffic Can plan my travel time n also escaped the smoky roads

title: Very easy to use
review: train station in basement  just follows signs  Lots of ticket machines and click on the language Choose the station you want to get off and it will tell how money you need to insert Final station is phaya Thai  From where you can get BTS train to nearest station near your hotel It's all very simple and nothing to worry about also very cheap  You don't need taxis

title: Easy access
review: Had a Thai friend she had a car we drive to the nearest station and take the train to get to the city the faste way ) its easy to know where your going as long as you do your research before starting your tour )

title: It is easy to take
review: It is easy to take and not expensive to take a train But  I prefer to Singapore MRT  No food allowed to eat at the train station

title: Express link at Makkasan station is the way to go!
review: The express link is very comfortable with cushioned seats It's not crowded I think I paid 90 baht Will arrive at the airport in 15 minutes

title: Easy access from bkk to city!
review: Fuss free and easy to use A trip from bkk airport to ratcharaprop (pratunam area) cost only 40thb for a 25 min or so ride Train wasn't crowded when we boarded at around 1pm on a Thursday afternoon

title: Avoid Bangkok heavy traffic, travel on skytrain
review: Convenient as any skytrain this one offers good views over the city of Bangkok It helps you to escape the crowdy streets and heat and offers airconditioning and comfortable seats Trains are in pristine condition and run on time And most importantly the discipline and respect of the Thai people is truly heartwarming

title: Excellent mode of transport
review: So easy to get around once you have tried it It is cheap secure and comfortable and most of all it moves you swiftly around Bangkok

title: Easy as abc
review: Very clear signage everywhere and very helpful staff always around to assist when in doubts Fast and easy to move around in bkk to skip the massive jam on the road Unsure of station or price Just go to the counter and all solved in seconds

title: Very convenient to use
review: easy to use and very good mode of transport safe and reliable The track runs past most of the main attractions

title: eay
review: The rail link is the best way to get to the city  very efficient and fast and avoids the terrible traffic

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Skytrain is a great way of beating the traffic jams around Bangkok and now has a line to the airport If there are more than two of you traveling from or two the airport it is sometimes cheaper with a taxi on the toll roadsTip get a map of the BTS and the Skytrain and it will be of great help to avoid queues always have plenty of small change for the Ticket machines on skytrain

title: Easy, inexpensive way to get around Bangkok
review: Wow my city should take lessons from this metro system  Fast clean efficient and cheap transportation system  Don't be intimidated  Look at the metro map figure out what station you need to get to then look up the price on the chart located at the cashier  You will get a small black coindisk  Simply swipe this on the screen at the turn stall  At your destination you need to use this coin to get out of the station  Easy

title: Excellent choice
review: We were in Bangkok January and February and it was the best and fastest  way to go to our destinations There are too many maps and you can't go wrong

title: Excellent mode of transport
review: was really impressed with the BTS sky train in BKK cheap and clean ppl queue up and take care of the cleanliness

title: Fast, air conditioned and cheap
review: I liked that every station had Englishspeaking staff ready to assist us tourists with getting around Keep your eyes peeled for exit numbers so that you get to the right part of the street The Bad not every station has elevatorsescalators to go down so opt for a cab if you are carrying heavy items with you

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: We completed our latest trip to Bangkok recently and found the Sky Train as always the perfect way to get around the crowded city (where it ran that is) Air conditioned trains led from our hotel (the ShangriLa on the river) to Siam Central's shopping malls and the fun packed areas around Saladang Once the further improvements announced have been finished (in a good few years time) the service will be better yet

title: Reliable
review: I expected a crowd that it would be like other trains in other countries where you would be pushed in with the crowds and tight cramped spaces But when we rode it on a rush hour (57pm) it was like empty (on hongkong and japan standards i guess) Overall it was a pleasant experience and you can have a good view of the city as well

title: Great moment !
review: Really enjoy the tour with Sara she was great guide  She learn some Thai speciality with always the smile

title: Best way to get around
review: The BTS is the best way to get around central Bangkok although it does have limitations and needs to be combined with the water bus buses or taxis for some places of interest  eg the national museum and palace Still it is very useful if staying in the centre and don’t want to walk too far

title: fast and reliable
review: Easy even for unexperienced travellerscost 50 baht and connects you directly with bts skytrain at phraya thai station

title: Excellent Mode of Transport - Safe, Cheap & Available
review: It is the best way to get around quickly avoiding the busy & congested Bangkok traffic Besides it is extremely clean and very safe not to mention  pretty economical too

title: Nice rides
review: This is a very good transportation option in Bangkok Specially to avoid traffic We used this service to reach China town and very satisfied This is also very cost effective But sometime you have to change the line between stations so be careful about the same I you are traveling on your own and have time than try this mode of transportation

title: Reliable and quick transport
review: Easiest way to reach hotelairport Connects both BTS and MRT lines which give us access to reach almost all places

title: Easy way to get around car crowded Bangkok
review: An easy way of getting around Bangkok if you want to avoid using a taxi or tuk tuk  Directions and signage was easily understandable even if one does not speak Thai    Transferring between lines was also easily done at the Siam station although understandably a bit crowded (but I've seen much worse at other Asian cities)

title: Easy
review: Yes easy to use Nice air con Some escalators aren't working But not much dearer to catch a scooter motorbike rider

title: just take a taxi
review: if you're traveling alone and so long as your hotel is right near the link station then it might be worth it Otherwise it's not A taxi is around 400 Then the extra bts costs to get to your hotel (or a taxi) and many of the bts stations don't have escalators or elevators so you're pulling your luggage up and down busy long flights of stairs The rail link is losing money because most people just don't see the valueTwo people might save 50 baht a pieceThree even less

title: Efficient
review: It is rainy season and needed to get from sukhumvit to Silom roads were packed  I looked up and thought let's try the bts Easy to use  Plan simple maps  Efficient to get coins for ticket machine  I picked a good time as carriage not too packed    Even in a thunderstorm arrived at destination in under 30 mins dry and could walk straight into the mall completely under cover    Taxi are good in Bangkok but sometimes the quickest way is by train when the roads become a tad busy

title: The only sane way to get around if it is avaiable in yoru location
review: I always try to find a good hotel as close to the Skytrain as possible  to eliminate the taxi cluster in Bangkok Trains run very often always cool on the inside anad the best way to get around

title: When visiting Bangkok, the airport link is best mode to skip traffic and taxi-scamers
review: Unfortunately the number of carriages is lacking and schedule is too far apart  This is the best mode to get to Central Bangkok in just 40 mins or less fr Suvarnabhumi Airport However and just a word of warning is that the train is packed during peak office hrs and if one is traveling to the airport to catch a flight in the evenings (in particular fr Makassan Station be prepared to fight your way in (with your luggage in hand) or give yourself an extra hr to make it to the airport

title: Great experience
review: Enjoyed the great ride Very convenient and systematic Used by most locals and tourists Wonderful to see the heavy traffic from up therewhen we reach our destination in a few minutes

title: The best way and it can also get cheaper!
review: It is fast clean efficient regular It assures a confortable frequency It brings you in a lot of places It is fresh  It has a reasonable price plus you can get a ceaper day pass or 15 trips or more usable within a month The price will then be progressively reduced  The only con it can get very busy in certain hours

title: Holiday in bangkok
review: It is fast regular clean and cheap Only criticism is that it doesn't stretch into main Bangkok you are either required to get a taxi duk duk or walk to get into the main stripas I have witnessed the traffic is crazy so out of options Not only this it stops running at 12pm so it makes late nights out not possible  If you are wanting to go to China town travel on the SkyTrain (BTS) and then change on to the metro (MRT) Only a 10 minute walk to China town from there If you are going to see the main temples travel down to the river on BTS then get the hop on hop off canal boat

title: Taxi first then rail
review: I took a taxi from the airport my first time through It was very expensive but I was in a hurry The second time I took the train It took the same amount of time as the taxi but at 16th the cost   The train isn’t as nice as the sky train or as pretty but it runs on time it’s inexpensive and it’s clean I highly recommend researching it’s use before traveling to Bangkok so the organized taxi pricing can’t be used on you Airport taxis don’t go by meter Nor can the price be negotiated Minimum prices are set by the airport taxi company and prepaid for one stop then the car returns to the airport I was quoted 1300 baht to Sukumvit Road The actual metered price was 13 that (I took a taxi back one early morning)

title: Experience rush hour @ Sukhumvit !
review: the MRT is an underground line but for an 'experience' try (or best not to ) an evening rush hour We got on at Sukhumvit (the interchange with the Asok BTS) and what an experience  It was 630pm  Lines of hundreds to get a small black token from either the machines or counters to then a massive amount of more lines downstairs on the platforms We waited for 9 trains before we were able to be squeezed onboard yes9 trains Trains arrived every 4 mins More carriages and frequency are urged needed  It's a pity that the same BTS Rabbit card can't be used on MRT

title: Excellent transport service avoids traffic snarls
review: Excellent service and a viable alternative to using taxi during rush hour or holiday traffic  For single persons it will save money although not an essential consideration for most as all transportation options are relatively inexpensive  What I like is the ease of train access from city or airport end cleanliness and speed of transit  I often use taxi for the final inner city trip from Train stop to hotel by which time heavy traffic has been avoided and taxi driver has more local knowledge

title: Handy to move around
review: These trains are very handy to move around the city as you do not end up sitting in the traffic Fares are very cheap We found the system at the stations a little confusing however there were plenty of staff that spoke some English and guided us

title: THE way to go
review: Very fast air conditioned and very inexpensive this the best way to get into the city and back to the airport I took a taxi to get to my hotel when I first arrived but never again Do soe research and use this convenient transport like the locals do

title: Brilliant
review: A very cheap and efficient way of traveling around Bangkok easy to use fast and an experience in it's self

title: Very convenient but packed
review: It is an easy an quick way to move around the city Very easy to use and to get tickets Machines only accept coins so go to the ticket counter if you pay with notes I paid 25 bath for a 3 stations ride

title: BTS Sky Train - Excellent Public Transportation
review: The BTS Sky Train is a great way to get around to many parts of the city Especially when you consider the terrible BKK traffic which can effect taxis The cars are air conditioned During my 8 days in BKK I rode the BTS at all sorts of timeshours and never had a problem This included rush hour I purchased a "Rabbit" stored value card This saved me from waiting in the long lines for the vending machines which provide the coins used for paying fares And also the long line for purchasing tickets The fare depends on how far you are travelling  Some of the popular stops are Saphan Taksin  for the Chao Phraya river ferry (orange flag15THB) for transport to Grand Palace Wat Pho & Wat Arun  National Stadium for MBK Siam  lots of shopping Bang Wa  Then a taxi (90THB) for Taling Chan or Khlong Lat Mayom Weekend Floating Markets The BTS connects with the Airport Rail Link at Phaya Thai  There are connecting points for changing BTS lines  And also connecting points for switching to the MRT Look at a BTS map on Google

title: Used the sky train and it was pretty simple
review: If you can access the sky train to travel around then do so the Bangkok traffic was so heavy when we visited

title: Such a fun and efficient system!
review: We used BTS every single time we were in Bangkok it is such a seamless clear and efficient way to travel with AC cheap costs Only wish it went in the older parts of the city but if you are on the business side and shopping in one of the main malls you can't miss it

title: Best way to get around "central" Bangkok.
review: One of the things that really surprised when I first landed in Thailand and Bangkok specifically is the TRAFFIC  It is a different kind of congestion compared to American traffic but it is every bit as time consuming as any major US metropolitan (NYC LA Chicago etc) maybe moreso So the BTS (in conjunction with the MRT) is ESSENTIAL for getting around the main parts of Bangkok  During my 3 days in Bangkok (rest of my time was in Pattaya) the BTS was by far the EASIEST QUICKEST & CHEAPEST way to get around town The one and only downside is some stops are SO CROWDED that there is literally no room to move  Otherwise it makes getting around this incredible metropolis much easier on the wallet and feet

title: kind of odd gettin gto it...
review: While the ride was fine there seemed to be a lot of time lost in transition from the connecting train to get here

title: Works well, if you don't have too much luggage
review: It was great previously when I used it (without luggage) to visit central BK from an airport hotel but arriving this latest time at BKK with luggage it would have been a struggle to get to my hotel so took a taxi

title: GREAT way to get around a traffic packed city!!
review: Don't let the BTS intimidate youEVERYBODY takes the BTS and it's very simple to figure out  Lots of people to ask and the ticket vendors are very helpful

title: Its unfortunate that the express train service has stopped
review: The Airport Rail Link connects Suvarnabhumi International Airport to Phaya Thai station in downtown Bangkok If you are on a budget this is the best option to travel to downtown BKK from the airport It costs from 15 to 45 bath one way It takes about 30 minutes to get to BKK which is about the same time taken by taxi under normal traffic condition   The down side is train could be full and you will have to stand in the train together with your luggage Once you have reached the station of your destination you may have to take taxi to your final destination   Well if you are on a budget you travel light this is the best option

title: dont use this
review: Went from the airport to Makassan station and had to wait almost 2 hours for a taxi Do not use this link

title: BTS Skytrain
review: The best way to get around in Bangkok to most of the major places cheap and a very good experienceAt certain times of the day it can be a little bit full but do not be shocked when the doors open and you see the amount of people on it get on and enjoy the experience

title: Best Rail
review: Any where you go by MRT it will be perfect BTS and MRT in Bangkok are the best in whole worldNo Lacking helpful staff

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Travelling alone in Bangkok it was safe and a cheap way to get around the maps are easy to readthe trains are so clean no food or drink and at rush hour the line ups to get on the train are very orderly

title: Air Con comfort
review: BTS is a really good system for getting around the traffic problems of Bangkok The carriages are airconditioned keeping you cool whilst travelling It is safe and reliable and will get you there much quicker than a taxi The only downside is sometimes it can get very busy and it stops at midnight After midnight the traffic problems have gone so taxis are a good option

title: effective system of transportation
review: BTS is very efficient and runs very often you don't have to wait long for another train Can be really crowdy at rush hour and especially at the major interchange station at Siam But wait for a next train as it will come in a couple of minutes It is nice to see people que in lines to board the train which also make it once again efficient People go out in the middle and people enter from the sides

title: Economical and efficient way to travel
review: BTS Skytrain is the perfect way to cheaply see a large part of Bangkok Not expensive and trains every 5 minutes allows you to travel quite far The Skytrain is also being extended so in the next few years there will be even more access to more of Bangkok

title: Recommended to everyone who have time in Bangkok!
review: I personally think that everyone who visits Bangkok should come on this trip I did not expect anything at first but my husband and I enjoyed this trip and rate it 55 The railway market was a unique experience and the floating market itself was one of a kind If you have time on your trip and unsure of what to do this trip is good We started at 0900hrs at River City and ended at MBK centre at 1600hrs I was worried about the location of meet up point but it was really easy to find them They have a pitstop as well so even if you didn’t manage to get breakfast you can buy essentials at the pitstop Also for muslim travellers if you’re particular about halal food  stop and buy the food the moment you see it because on ground level there isn’t any halal food

title: Pretty hectic
review: The system inside the airport was great but my stop at makasan was not so smooty ( maybe picked a bad day

title: Easy Access
review: Since our hotel located in Sukhumvit Road it is very easy to use this kind of transport Saving our money and time We also easily connected to town Most of our destination is within the reach of MRT So it's very easy and comfortable access to Bangkok (Suvarnabhumi) Airport The train is also compatible for people with disability

title: Guaranteed distination unlike the taxi's and tuk tuk's
review: safe and reliable for getting around the city Cheaper than taxi's and Tuk Tuk and your guaranteed to get to your desired destination

title: Very conveneint to travel to and from the airport
review: The metro is well planner cleanly maintained and a very convenient mode of transport to far destinations

title: Easy and convenient! Crowded during peak hours
review: The best way to move around in Bangkok  What would take you 2530mins on a Bike and more than an hour in Car the BTS will have you reach your destination in 60% less time including a brisk walk Business hours gets extremely crowded and you will have to wait for 34 trains to pass (Approx 1520mins wait)  If you are a tourist take the BTS before 7am or post 930 in the morning and avoid between 37 in the evening

title: Always Airport Link
review: Everytime I go to the airport I take the airport link I make me transport faster and easier The price is not expensive

title: BKK-CNX
review: Took a sleeper train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai Train I took was recently refurbished in Nov 2016 (train 9) The train was very clean and comfortable Wanted to book a first class cabin but was fully booked due to the holiday season Took the second class cabin instead and was more than pleased If you want to to see some nice scenery of Thailand take the sleeper train If you want to save time and have some extra cash to spend take a domestic flight But I strongly suggest you take the train It is an experience you must try Train is safe and has many other Travellers So you need not worry much

title: Complicated yet convenience
review: Most convenience travel method in super busy bangkok city However for a tourist please do home work before you decide to use BTS because you might need to transit to another line or MRT to get to your destination   Suggest to get a Rabbit card otherwise you will need to go to the machine and get your ticket If you like to collect card look out to the special edition rabbit card which this time I get the Sesame Street’s edition And please remember to bring your passport for registration purpose

title: Skytrain (BTS) way to travel.
review: If you are a tourist or local in Bangkok Skytrain (BTS) is the way to go The constant gridlock of traffic jams will definitely deter you traveling around Bangkok but Skytrain will help you to  overcome most of this  Major shopping malls local attractions  convention centers airport  transportation and hotels are link to the Skytrain Visitors can have a quick birds eye view of the city within the safety and comfort of the trains As a traveller a day  3 day or monthly pass with unlimited travel will help to elevate the cost of traveling around the city if you do you homework It also helps to find accommodation along the BTS route or at least walking distant from it  Like most transportation it gets crowded during peak hours but  local commuters are always courteous to allow family with prams to get on or even give up seats to children elderly  monks and pregnant women Upon disembarking at most stations there is usually  a motorcycle service located nearby if you are in a hurry to get to your destination as well as helpful station staff to answer your queries  The down side of traveling on the BTS not all stations have lifts to assist wheelchair travelers passengers with luggages or prams or elderly  Majority of stations don't have comfort rooms so be prepared  Generally the BTS cabins are chilled to freezing as it helps with body odours while eating and drinking aren't permitted which assists with cleanliness Be alert there are ear piercing whistle blowing security guards warning you from stepping on the yellow lines on the platforms Not all stations have platform rail guards to prevent commuters from falling from the platform Lastly not all areas on the outer Bangkok are covered by this BTS   Otherwise I strongly recommend visitors and locals to use BTS even if traveling in groups as it saves time and aggravation Getting a topup card is also a definite plus as it saves on  long queues  at peak hours after all you can always redeem your deposit for the card which is valid for 2 years

title: TAKE THE SKYTRAIN  AVOIDE THE TRAFFIC
review: Avoid the Bangkok traffic  Cheap  Convenient  Easy to use  Clean  Take the Sky Train and walk  Goes everywhere in Central Bangkok

title: Pleasant surprise
review: With a population of 14 million in Bangkok you become jittery But once you know life becomes easy We stayed in Sukhmuvit area Took a Tuk Tuk ( a must) and reached Asok station Here you have to punch in the number of station you want to go to  it Will tell the cost Don't worry if you don't have change There is a counter which gives you change for your Baht notes Insert required coins and you get a ticket  Most people want to go to either SIAM station or National stadium If you are going to latter get down at Siam and catch another Skytrain just on the opposite platform Queues for Skytrain are very organised and the trains have air conditioned When you get down at any of these stations you will enter huge malls  Enjoy shopping Cost of ticket per person per journey 31 Baht ( 50 Baht = 1 GBP)

title: train travel
review: Easy to use to get around bangkok which we did to get to some of the marketsand to the river and anywhere else we could think ofThey are very very clean and no graffiti in or on them not like in Australia its a pity we cant run our train service like they do  on time

title: Fast, clean, comfortable
review: I always travel with the Sky Train in Bangkok In my opinion it is much better then the taxi since the traffic coul be crazy in Bangkok Downtown

title: Most convenient and easiest way to get around Bangkok.
review: With great connectivity BTS saves you a lot of time The stations and trains are veey clean The staff on duty are ever willing to help The maps will also direct you on how to go about using the multiple lines Morning evening office times and holidays can get busy

title: Best way to travel
review: This is by far the easiest and cheapest way to get to and from the city This service connects directly with the BTS for easy connections

title: fast and cheap
review: The sky train is great  gets you across the city a lot faster than any other type of BK transportand the best thing is it is being extended to areas out of the citywell the outskirts anywayso in a couple of yearsyou will be able to visit Bang Kaealso getting to and from the airport is a lot fasterif you dont have a lot of bags all in all worth every bhat of the ticket price

title: the queues are too long
review: we wanted to take the MRT from sukhumvit to Silom at 6pm and we went into the station and the queues were around 100 deep they could not cope with the amount of people so we left and took a taxi

title: Smooth going
review: Never seen any trouble in the subway in my experience Recently passenger no is increased but still ok to go anywhere Hope to be improved to increase train no to prevent cloudy train inside like for small kids old man

title: Express probably not worth the extra money over stopping city service
review: When we left Bangkok on 13th February the Express services had been reduced to one an hour so there is even less reason to choose them over the City link which only takes about 10 minutes longer As the previous reviewer states there is a bit of a walk (and flights of steps) to connect tofrom the BTS at Paya Thai so it would depend how much luggage you had whether this would be a good means of connection for you As our accomodation in Bangkok was very handy to a BTS station and we had packs rather than suitcases it was a good choice for us Trains both on arrival and departure were uncrowded so plenty of room for luggage and the journey was not affected by the frequent traffic congestion BTS on arrival in late afternoon was VERY busy though

title: Fast
review: Easy fast convenient but sometime crowded during peak hour like 9am & 7pm at Thailand Hope it have direct connection to the Don Muaeng & other airport for tourist ease

title: Civilised Easy access to Bangkok and the airport
review: Friendly civilised travel Saved us so much time getting to the airport Travellers offered us seats and helped us get to the right platforms

title: Easy to use, fast and cheap!
review: There is NO reason to take a cab from the airport if you plan to be anywhere near Central Bangkok A cab will cost more and will be slower given the traffic in Bangkok Take the ARL  it is a straight line and easy to navigate Then use the BTS or MRT to connect you to a specific area you want to go

title: This is the fastest way to reach the shopping areas
review: The BTS is clean and fast  It is faster to go around using the BTS rather than a cab   It can be crowded though during peak hours in the morning 8930am and then again 57pm It goes to MBK (national stadium station) Siam Paragon and Central World (Siam station) and to Chatuchak (mochit station)  To go to Pratunam area one can go off at Ploenchit station and walk through the malls and walkways to Pratunam  He doesn't need to walk on the streets  It also goes to Silom area (Sala Daeng) and the banking district (Chong Nonsi)   It also goes along Sukhumvit road where there are a lot of hotels malls and shops

title: Nice and Clean BTS. never have to wait for a long time to the next train. a very nice security and maps around the town.
review: a very good sky train a lot of stairs it will be better if there some more of elevators but everythings was nice

title: Too easy!
review: So easy and quick to access the airport line in Bangkok Clean cheap cool and efficient Great way to beat the traffic and arrive on time and cool Really easy to navigate and to get you to and from airport

title: Cheap and fast connection from the airport to the city centre
review: The Airport Rail Link is certainly a very quick and inexpensive (THB 45) option to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the center of Bangkok and from there if necessary to continue your journey with the BTS or subway This is the best way to escape the Bangkok traffic chaos

title: Most convenient way of transport
review: BTS is a live saver for Bangkok traffic Has stations to almost all  the tourist places of visit  It's better to get a rechargeable card for 200 Bhat rather than standing in long lines to get the tokens   Well clean and very well maintained and saves a lot of time

title: Easy to use
review: We found the sky train easy to use although some may find the steps somewhat difficult  SCAMS the color gem scam has been running for many years now We didn't know about it but were taken in Therefore u am posting on trip advisor to inform others before they visit Bangkok Internet search color gems scam

title: A Must do
review: Take the time to ride this piece of history As you ride think about the number of people who died in constructing this Railway most of them doing so under duress as POWs and indentured slaves The windows are open so it is very easy to view outside and take pictures

title: Cheap & Efficient
review: Excellent way of moving round Bangkok Journey of approx 20mins for about £1 Clean regular service Links with main line & metro at various points across the city

title: Airport Rail Link Bangkok
review: The Airport Rail Link (ARL) was found to be the fastest and cheapest way to get out from and return to Suvarnabhumi airport when I reached Bangkok from Kolkata I was traveling light and that could be a reason for ny convenience of travel via ARL The ARL express line runs from this airport to Phaya Thai and connects to BTS skytrain route taking about 40 minutes to reach The ARL city line stops at six stations and takes around 30 minutes The maximum fares for one way travel are THB100 for express line and THB60 for city line The comprehensive map of Bangkok city comprising all the 3 modes of transportation (ARLBTSMRT) is likely to help first timers to Thailand plan out their journeys to and from the Suvarnabhumi For ARL you need to follow the RED line on this map Since I had chosen to stay in a hotel near Ramkhamhaeng station the Airport Railway Link proved as the route of immense convenience during the solo visit to that country this year

title: Easy way to get around
review: We bought a day ticket and used the sky train to visit lumphini park MBK etc It was quite busy in the morning but quieter in the afternoon Good air con so you can cook down

title: The fastest & cheapest way to Suvarnabhumi Intl. Airport
review: It only takes 17mn to go from Makassan station downtown to Bangkok International Airport One way ticket costs 90 Baht and RT 150 Baht This is only valid from the area of Siam Square However there exists another line which functions like the Skytrain and stops at several stations on the way The Express Link is smooth and comfortable It also offers a great view over Bangkok skyline

title: ARL by any means far exceeds expectations
review: Once you get through the prompt process of the cordial immigrations people of the Thai nation you must ensure to use the speedy air conditioned train service into the inner city via the network of transfers to your preferred destination Prior planning and preparation allows you the freedom with patience in mind to not allow your first initial introduction to Thailand's welcome to international visitors be a negative one Be prepared to have small change such as the relevant Thai baht and 20bht notes to make the transition go smooth Take note of all the English translation freely available and give courtesy acknowledgement to the local people with humility Wait time is minimal at any of the stations and a viewing screen informs you of the next available service no more than 5  7 minutes Adjust to peak periods when there maybe full carriages this is NOT a negative aspect as they have a large population The local people love and respect there silence as a appreciation of there environment and do not interrupt visitors no barging or aggressive nature exists

title: Easy
review: Easy great and honest staff clean and safe You can’t get lost Convenient all main places can be reached and all connections are clear and simple

title: Great Service
review: I have used the airport link twice now & each time it has been faultless From the Airport to the center of town where you can connect to anywhere else using the BTS really is a greatfast & relatively hassle free experience Worth a try

title: Cheap and easy
review: If you don't mind a standing room only and a crowded train this is a great way to get around Bangkok It's much faster than taking a car as the there can be traffic jams in the city especially the Sukhumvit neighbourhood where many foreigners tend to concentrate

title: A great local Thai market
review: I always go to the ChaAm night market every Wednesday for the food selection and the things you buy even if you don't need them  The selection of food is fantastic  all cooked in front of you  squid cuttlefish poultry fried mussels corn Curtis etc And I could go on  The cakes are unbelievable and everything us so cheap  A meal for two people last night included bbq cuttlefish meatballs honeyed pork mussel omelette all for a smidge under $2  The most expensive thing was an icy cold beer at just over $1 a bottle  Then there are all the stalls selling clothing accessories electrical stuff computer components handbags and one stall which features knuckledusters replica handguns which fire pellets and batons  just the thing a tourist from Australia needs

title: Nice
review: Convenient  neat  well organized with clear routes  Cheaper and faster way to get to the airport

title: Avoid the traffic
review: To move around in frantically busy Bangkok use the skytrain Buy a day pass for ease of access Network is easy to understand trains are clean and frequent This is a nobrainer

title: very standard train and cheap
review: Highly recommend BTS  truly is  one of the best rail systems very easy to access Incredibly clean efficient on time safe and travels to many of the major places you would want to go

title: gets you round
review: Cheap enough and ideal to get you round BangkokBut very busy between 1700 & 2100hrs when its almost like being like sardines

title: So much better than by car
review: We use this every time A train every few minutes straight thru to central station in c2025mins All for 45bht each Added bonus is that at the airport end  there are three currency booths that offer the best rates around ideal if you’ve just landed

title: Nice and comfortable ride
review: Although it is not a express train but the ride and smooth enough to avoid traffic jam in Bangkok It about 3540 baht and take about 2030 minutes ride  Therefore it is worth while to take even though I have to take BTS to transfer over which cost addition of 42 Baht

title: Good experience
review: Both markets are worth seeing but I wouldn't recommend shopping on floating market because prices are way higher than in Bangkok The trip was very nice especially our tour guide Ping() who was very energetic and engaged explained everything with details helped us on how to negotiate prices The bus could've been more comfortable with better air conditioning

title: Clean, air conditioned and cheap to get around Bangkok.
review: The best way to get around Bangkok Very clean cheap and reliable Easy to navigate around the city avoiding the chaotic jams and the unpleasant haggling with taxi drivers Many foreigners use it so don't worry and give it a go and save money  Can get busy at peak times and in the centre of the city so best to travel off peak times for a pleasant experience

title: On A
review: Price getting higher every year rush hour always have system problem Some staff can’t explain for tourists understanding about the way or cards type

title: Sky train 2015
review: still a great way to get around used it more than ever this time and it is getting very busy though not as bad as Hong Kong

title: Near by hotel
review: Sky train near by hotel Just few minute walk and can travel by skytrain BTS for shopping or dinning around the hotel

title: Chill out night
review: Good for visiting and easy with transportation all good with staff are so nice and approachablewe love it

title: Summer Holidays
review: Excellent Air conditioned services Although for tourist visiting Bangkok it does not directly connect to any Tourist places directly

title: Maeklong train station
review: Amazing Must see Try to buy the return tickets to Bangkok after arriving to Maeklong otherwise you get stuck until late like we did

title: Good but poor connectivity
review: A good service and being raised use it to tour the city from the air Coins only accepted at the machine The ticket office staff will only give you change to use at the machines  No interchangeability with the MRT line which s a completely different and independent service

title: Very efficient city transportation
review: If you want to avoid the traffic jams and move quickly within Bangkok this is what you should take A very efficient and quite inexpensive mode of transport The maps and signage are very tourist friendly

title: BK couldnt run without it
review: easy to usebut why you have to get change then go buy the tickets separately defeats me Always clean and coolMBK worth a visit Now this has been extended as far as Bangna

title: Gets you fast to town
review: Cheap and fast if you have a Hotel near the raillink or shukumvit area Taxi takes much longer during rush hour

title: Very Nice and Comfortable
review: Its very Cheap Easy Fast Safe for budget travel it is very good for sure i would travel again when i go back to Bangkok

title: Ease of travel
review: The MRT is very east to navigate and will take a person to the sights within the city of Bangkok that you would like to see It is a great transit system

title: Air Conditioned & Cheaper than a Cab!
review: Before you fly out to Bangkok learn which district your hotel is in & if the airport rail link is near your hotel Please mind that some train stops do no have liftselevators so pack lightly if you're on a budget Bangkok is relatively safe and thus far nothing negative has happened to me whilst traveling on my ownbring your street smarts

title: Great way to travel and see Bangkok
review: I admit I was intimidated at the thought of figuring out how to use Skytrain (I am a solo female traveler) but after a few questions I was easily able to purchase the ticket I needed and hop on to my destination (Jatujak market) Trains are clean and air conditioned and even though it can get crowded it's a fast way to get around the city and the views aren't bad either This is a must do if you are in Bangkok it beats taking taxis especially in peak traffic

title: BTS Skytrain
review: The skytrain is convenient for us to travel to our locations The train are clean I am very impressed with the locals They are very friendly and helpful in the train They gave up their seats to children spontaneously It would be great if the different train system has a common payment system Which is fro instance whole day pass can be used for all trains whether it is BTS or MRT

title: Good & clean
review: the airport link is good effective & value for money

title: Train okay, but overcrowded
review: After a long flight maybe it's good to stand since the trains are mostly full Once on the disembarking station having a bit of luggage it's very hard to hail a cab hence no parking spaces are available for these  don't suggest walking to the accommodations as it's very humid hot & risky

title: Exceptional Tour
review: Our tour guide Tao and driver Art were fantastic Their knowledge and hospitality was exceptional Thoroughly recommend this tour

title: If you need to get about - use the Skytrain
review: Airconditioned fast and reliable It's a must to get around Bangkok as traffic is ridiculously bad all the time

title: clean, fast and easy to travel
review: People are eveready to help if you are lost so don't be afraid to ask  But make sure you have the information (of the place) in Thai as they can understand better in Thai instead of English  Tip you may ask the hotel front desk staff (which you are staying) to help you write them down

title: ESKIMO ADVENTURE. FASTEST WAY IN BKK.
review: The BTS is great  just make sure you get one of the Rabbit cards so you don't have to queue at the machines During peak hours it is a bit crowded and it is always super cold  the usual Asian AC exaggeration For sure it is the fastest way around BKK

title: Efficient
review: From the airport to Khao San Road area cost us 45 bhat pp we followed the blue city line which was well signposted and ticket staff were helpful its about 20 minutes We found the Bangkok public transport system very efficient

title: Fast and easy to use
review: Very easy to use the ticket machine and its a great way to use your change up  Staff are friendly and answered my questions in English

title: Trains OK, system average
review: The trains are clean and efficient but the system isn't great There is often a long walk andor unclear escalatorsigns in general to get to the platform Interconnects to MRT are also misleading For ex  Sala Daeng and Silom on the map are shown as interconnected but it's a 10 min walk from one to another

title: Easy
review: Definetly the best and easiest way to get around in Bangkok My wife and I hardly ever use public transport in Australia due to the limited schedules and difficulty in geting from place to place so we were a little nurvious about using the Skytrain given our limited exposure to Bangkok however it couldn't have been any easier or convient Trust me this is the quickest cleanist and definetly the most entertaining way to get around Buy a day ticket and just jump on and off rather than sitting in traffic

title: Worth trying
review: What a great way to travel around the city of Bangkok It is very tourist friendly and easy to use  to find your stops

title: Beat the traffic to airport
review: Going from Makkasan station is quick although the trains can be crowded  the journey is short so if you're light on bags and in a hurry This is good option to get there on time

title: Nice travel
review: We tried the bts skytrain in going to the Chatuchak market I personally appreciate the efficient service of the staff in the counter During our ride the airconditioning worked well we cant help but fell asleep We are awed by the disxipline of the passengers A very nice experience

title: Reliable transportation within the city
review: Given BKK' s traffic and if we don't have much luggage we generally prefer using the BTS train system instead of relying on cabs It's relatively affordable and very reliable We particularly like that it directly connects to the Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Easy peasy
review: We caught the airport rail link when we came back down to Bangkok  was cheap and easy  Easy access and alot of tourists and locals use the rail Plenty of room for bags on the train

title: Best way to move in BKK
review: If you go in Bangkok find a hotel near BTS Traffic jam is terrible here Also BKK airport is linked with BTS

title: Best way to get around
review: Fast easy and always on time  easy to purchase tickets An all day pass was 130 baht per person (around 250 gpb) Easier to use than taxis and buses avoids the traffic and good links to all major attractions

title: Bangkok travels
review: Good experience Super efficent and user friendly for all commuters especially with disabilities And saves you money

title: Quick mode of transport in hevay bangkok traffic
review: Excellent Services but gets little crowded at times Its easy convenient and easy to use  Only downside is  you have to buy separate tickets for the BTS MTR and Sky train

title: Easiest transport around bangkok
review: The two main lines serve silom and sukhumvid and the surronding areas very conviniently  with connection to the mrt at a few hub stations  The longest wait at any time of the day is about 3 to 5 minutes  Most train ran until midnight but its always better to check with the station and be certain of the time of the last train  The rabbit card (reload ) card is very convenient and can be used for other purchases at McDonald and certain food centers The users assist by the the station security staff are very orderly getting on and off the skytrain The train and train stations are nice and clean

title: Convenient, but express trains cancelled
review: The Airport Rail Link was definitely cheaper than a taxi or hotel shuttle and was only slightly less convenient  But I was disappointed that the express trains were cancelled so the trip took about 1520 minutes longer than otherwise  I took the Airport train to Phaya Thai station and then took the BST to my hotel

title: Great tour
review: We throughly enjoyed the tour Tee our guide was very helpful kind and knowledgeable We loved it The train market was amazing and there was lots of opportunities for photos

title: Crowdy
review: I have taken the ARL several times from Paha Thai station both to the airport and to other stations The train is full most of the time so its a nightmare to take it with luggage during the rush hours But the alternative is taxi and that can also take long time if you dont pay extra and drive the express toll road

title: Great way to see the city!
review: We rode the Skytrain everyday while in the city It was easy to ride and was better than taxi We enjoyed seeing city from the train

title: AC and very clean
review: Good experience when not in the rush hour The train is with Air Condition and very clean arrives and leaves on time  Really loved the ride

title: Best way to the airport
review: The train is fast with less stops The final destination is Phaya Thai station which is in the center of Bangkok It is a bit crowded but still has enough rooms for luggage The price is very reasonable than taxi You can also interchange to other BTS at some stops on the way Air conditioner is too cold

title: Convenient Skytrain
review: If you are heading to chatuchak (Mo Chit station) siam square siam paragon Big C MBK (Siam station) all sort of popular area this would be the most convenience way to reach there give it a try

title: Easy
review: Great efficient way to get around I found when using the MRT or BTS it was easier just to buy a day pass than work out individual stops A day pass for both transit systems is around 140 baht so very cheep and I usually find myself on them at least twice a day so it pays for itself As other have said you cant buy a combined ticket you think that could be worked out but oh well that's the Thais for you Thats why we love them

title: Very convenient
review: Easy to use fast cheap safe and well connected Look for skywalks after you get down from the train to reach malls Most of the malls are well connected I bought the tickets every time Didn't buy any cards Most ticketing machines accept only only coins which is a pain but there are counters where you can get coins for notes so it's not too bad

title: Best way to get around
review: The title says it all really Avoid the traffic jams and use the Skytrain or MRT (underground) Both excellent and clean Perhaps Transport for London could visit

title: New connection through China Town & Subway Art
review: It is great that the MRT has been extended Going through China Town it now easier to get there AND the last stop before the river makes it evenevepossible possible to reach Wat Pho and the Palace dy walking   The station Wat Monkrut has great Art on the walls Theme coffee (probably sponsered by Nestlé)   To not wait in the qeue to get a ticket pay with coins at the machines Goes faster

title: so easy to use
review: It's so nice to be able to get off of your flight walk through the airport and boad the subway to whatever destination your going to Everything is well labeled and to make it more comfortable the trains have ac

title: Great way to get around

title: Excellent
review: Excellent prompt service  Definitely use if need transfer into Bangkok from airports much quicker takes about 30 minutes we made mistake to take taxi too us 2 hrs to do 40km because traffic gridlocked most of way into town

title: Much better than sitting in a cab in rush hour
review: Much safer than getting a taxi from the airport Only takes an hour including taking the Skytrain from Phaya Thai to get from the airport to Sukhumvit all for about BHT 100

title: Clean, quick and anybody/everybody helps you !

review: We love BTS so much because our condominium is just next to the Wongwian Yai station so we both can go to the place around Bangkok like a shopping mall and restaurants feeling convenient

title: Convenient, fast and clean
review: Just use it best way to move around the city  Try to keep away during peak hours as most office workers appear to use it and it can get crowded  Thais are very polite therefore if you get stuck during peak hours it's bearable

title: Great service from Bangkok Transport Railroads
review: It's comfortable  it's puntual it's on time convenient clean and always ready to take passengers from A to B

title: Interesting experience
review: Our tour guide was brilliant and was probably the most insightful tour guide we have ever had My only issue was that the whole experience felt extremely touristy The floating market was definitely a tourist trap  if you look at any of the stalls even glance they’ll pull you over to their stall and hassle you until you buy Prices are at least 2 times what they should be For example the boat selling beer was 150 baht for a small beer (usually only worth 6080 max) The food was ok at the floating market but they had a menu for Thai folk and a pricier menu for tourists Just watch out Overall an interesting experience…

title: MRT Underground
review: If the MRT is going near your destination  it is often a much quicker and cheaper route since taxis can get bogged down and take a long timethe MRT usually travels quickly and is convenient and clean and is a preferred mode of travel if one has a choice it also offers senior discounts and it's very cheap

title: Aircon is pretty bad
review: Fast and straight to the centre of Bangkok Aircon not so good in hot day No digital screen or notice board Broadcasting instead

title: cheap, cool and clean
review: Great way to get around and links you to most key places in the city it was cool and clean and easy to navigate

title: It's good
review: It's fast clean and on time If you want to avoid the traffic in Bangkok during rush hours this is not a bad choice at all especially to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: If a station is near you, then it can be useful
review: Well the BTS is a good thing in Bangkok but I did not find the exitindication about the direction of the train very good I was close to go in the wrong way and miss the right exit because the train was overpacked and I had numbered shopping bag  If you are far of the center or you have one station close to you it can be useful  Personally I prefer one hotel in the center then i use UberTaxi Tuk Tuk BTS depending where you go and the distance

title: Very efficient
review: Always on time We always use this type of transportation every time we go to Bangkok to avoid the traffic

title: Extremely convenient
review: Easy to use Trains come every few minutes  English speaking staff if you can't follow the easy instructions  Cheap travel

title: Convenient and economical airport transfer
review: I used the airport rail link from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phyathai Station then transferred to taxi to go to the hotel I did not only save time due to heavy traffic in Bangkok I also saved money Besides I also used the airport rail link to connect to Pratunam market and Platinum Mall via the Rajprapop station which is just about 10min walking distance

title: Great alternative to Bangkok traffic jams
review: I definitely recommend this train You don't even half to leave the airport just walk downstairs It's very cheap too compared to taxis and airconditioned and quick Have used it twice now and will again Can't wait till there is one to Don Muang as well

title: Easiest way to travel
review: A fast clean and cheap way to travel Takes the hassle out of taxi's with the congestion on the roads A train every few minutes Can be busy at times and at certain stations but difficult to avoid Seating available air conditioned

title: Bangkok
review: Cheaper quicker & easy to use Traffic and travel by taxi is a nightmare in Bangkok Train is central & gets you close to most attractions

title: Fast mode of transport
review: It is a very a quick mode of transport in traffic afflicted bangkok Relatively cheaper than taking a tuk tuk or a taxi or an uber the only disadvantage it stops after midnight

title: Useful
review: My other hotel was situated at Lat Krabang so I took the Airport Rail Link most of the time Fast and cold Perfect
