review: Limited coverage by area but very useful if you want to escape Bangkok’s horrible traffic jams Note that not all stations have machines that accept bank notes but there is always a ticket office if you are stuck No eating and drinking on board

title: Easy to use
review: We decided to use the sky train to avoid the traffic The staff were helpful we told them where we wanted to go and they told us which platform to go to and where to change trains as required The trains themselves were clean and air conditioned and good value for money

title: Super friendly hosts and great experience
review: Our guide Sara and our driver were both extremely friendly and helpful sara had great English and we learnt a lot from this trip

title: lucky didnt miss my flight.
review: when you are late to catch your plane you only have this train no traffic no delay relax you will be on time

title: 30 minutes airport to centre
review: Fantastic service for getting from airport to centre and back switch to underground at Rakasan similar speed to taxi

title: Fastest Way To Airport, Even With Check-In Luggage
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be a disaster Using the ARL will get you to the Airport quickly I have clocked it a few times and from you arrive at the ARL till you are actually at the checkin counter or selfcheckin it takes roughly 3540min max  At my last ride on ARL only 36min from entering the station till I had selfcheckedin and was PAST the domestic flight passport control and security   Cost for a trip is a mere 35bht  I can highly recommend using this mode of transportation vs taxis when destination is Suvarnabhumi Airport And even with big luggage this presents no problem at all

title: Perfect transport in busy Bangkok
review: Bangkok traffic is horrendous take the sky train it's very user friendly

title: Skytrain
review: Easy to navigate & very clean cheap way to travel

title: Clean, convenient and safe
review: Each year that passes the skytrain gets busier and busier it's rare to get a seat straight away when entering at any of the busy stations Move inside and stand away from the doors and you can be the closest to a seat which becomes vacant Only negative with traveling by skytrain is the beggars on the steps

title: Easy Transportation Around Bangkok
review: Cheap way of getting around Bangkok but if you have difficulty climbing stairs take a TukTuk or taxi  The stations have killer stairs and are very crowded

title: The only way to travel... Into Bangkok
review: Flying in business class into Bangkok we had some hefty luggage to take into town to our hotel I was a little concerned that having also damaged a knee before heading out on holiday take a cab would be a better option but we decided to try the airport rail option having heard so much about how bad the traffic was in Bangkok itself  The reality was that the train couldn't have been easier There's very simple to use ticket vending machines in the airport and within a couple of minutes of clearing arrivals we were heading into town at about 10 on a Monday morning with no fuss whatsoever  The sting in the tail was the then planned swap to the monorail system which is equally clean and efficient to get to our hotel was made a difficult task with cases due to the apparent absence of either lifts or escalators in most stations   Definitely recommend the airport rail but if you do have a lot of luggage then perhaps grabbing a cab once in town is worthwhile and save the monorail and other (very cheapens excellent) public systems for when you're luggage free   PS Having headed down to Hua Hin we did get the chance to compare in contrast with taxiing in and out of the city Definitely take the Airport Rail

title: Easy and cheaper transportation
review: Very convenient to travel from swrnaboomi airport to payathai and cheap when you travel alone It is always better to know where your hotel is before getting into the train

title: Fast ride into town
review: I took the express train to Makassan Cost was 90 baht and took 15 minutes Clean safe and air conditioned Train was almost empty so lots of space At the airport go to the lowest level and follow the signs At Makassan I was able to walk to my hotel but there were taxis there waiting If it is raining and your hotel is far from the station you may be better to take the local train and connect to the skytrain or just take a taxi the whole way from the airport  Andrew

title: The best way to commute in Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the best way to commute in Bangkok It reaches some of the most important areas of the city Avoid the peak rush hours

title: Best option to/from airport.
review: If you say in one of the hotels near BTS in Bangkok you best option will be taking airport link and continue with BTS to your destination Although the taxi is very cheap but 3 factors kept me from avoiding them mostly firstly heavy traffic most of the time and secondly they try go little in circle to change you more but mainly is time consuming than just few extra Baht for cab driver

title: Cheap cheap cheap
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Easy to use and very sensible price format Your location will have a set price Clean and reliable

title: Easy and convenient
review: This is one of the better things to have been built in Bangkok To get away from the traffic and in air conditioned comfort There are now more people using it the tickets are easy to get and the overall cost is small You can get a daily ticket if you wish to complete a number of stops The interchange with the MRT underground expands the options Great way to move around in Bangkok

title: Nice tour
review: It was a very very nice tour with Sara to the markets We have seen and learned a lot and she is sooo funny

title: Convenient, easy to understand, fast
review: Though of the stations name the map for BTS in Bangkok are all very easy to understand and fast Trains are relatively clean and high in frequency so we don't usually take very long for the wait Spacious too and airconditioning is cooling and well ventilated

title: great
review: easy to use helpful staff watch the boards for your stop and go after 10 am when quieter stop near rembrand hotel took 40 mins to grand palace and river

title: Excellent way to move about Bangkok
review: The BTS works like a charm It's a great way to move about the city quickly It even goes to the airport I recomend buying a daypass to bypass the lines Only drawback is that the network is not very extensive but it covers most of the places you will want to go

title: very convenient and efficient
review: We loved using MRT skytrain in Bangkok ) it is very safe and very clean  We will have preferred to be able to buy one card to use BTS and MRT without the need of buying individual token for each trip Besides that it’s the perfect way to move around in Bangkok Careful last train is around midnight But then traffic in Bangkok is much easier and there is plenty of taxis available during the night

title: Good airport rail link
review: Easy to navigate from service to service  reasonably priced clean  regular service throughout the day   Does what it says on the tin really

title: Spacious, Cheap and Efficient!
review: Brilliant form of transportation I took the train from National Stadium station to On Nut station on a Thursday evening The train is big and spacious even when full seems fine (way better than London's trains)   It's cool inside and quite modern main thing is thought it is very efficientno delays short stops and much quicker to get from A to B than in a Taxi

title: Floating market really is fantastic
review: Firstly it’s more of a full day than a half day tour we got picked up at 8 and didn’t get back until after 3pm to the city centre   Overall the tour is brilliant we had Aori (I think that’s how her name was spelt) she was very enthusiastic and knew lots about everything we asked We didn’t expect to be actually getting on the train for 25 minutes which was a very hot cramped experience Seeing the train market is what you would expect  The real highlight is the floating market which is brilliant and very fun  Overall it’s definitely worth doing while in Bangkok and you won’t regret it

title: Helpful staff, efficient
review: Just ask for help if you need any staff have good English skills Grab a Rabbit Pass from the kiosk if you will be using the service for a few days The trains run every 5 minutes but at some busy stops you may need to queue for the next train

title: Always good
review: Never let me down Keeps expanding the network to cover more places Efficient but prices edging up still the best

title: Good option for an introductory tour
review: I would not have been able to figure out how best to do this tour on my own so I do appreciate the ease of arrangement this tour provided Both the railway track and floating market tour provided a good glimpse into a way of life in Bangkok We did not have a lot of time in either location to linger and soak it all in Both locations were so full of tourists with the train experience being especially crowded However this is still a good convenient option if you are looking for a quick introduction of these tourist attractions

title: Not worth it
review: The excursion is not worth it It starts too early and a lot of time is spent picking up other attendees The guide talks too much and says little The train market consisted of arriving by train to a station that is in a market and being there for half an hour The floating market is an artificial spectacle set up for tourists who take a boat ride on a canal packed with boats (all of them for tourists) You can buy some things from vendors who also go by boat or are on the shores The excursion is definitely not worth it

title: Constant Breakdown
review: I used to like taking the Airport Rail Link because it was efficient and convenient But it has made me missed my flight for 3 times in 6 months when it constantly break down and causing me extra money to buy new air tickets The efficiency needs to be improved tremendously

title: Quickest way into central Bangkok
review: A quick easy and cheap way to get into central Bangkok Conveniently links up with BTS at Phaya Thai Avoids the inevitable traffic jams encountered when travelling by bus or car

title: Fantastic way to see the city
review: After using taxis and tuktuk and sitting in rediculous traffic we decided to use the sky train awesome efficient way to travel   ppl are courteous and its easy to use

title: easy and fast
review: If you should be staying near a sky train station its well worth riding on this as opposed to taking a taxi Its fast and reliable avioding the heavy traffic and polutionGreat option getting to and from airport and weekend market (chatuchat )and the great shopping area of siam square

title: Superb facility
review: Always a joy to use and ride an efficient inexpensive and clean public service system Nothing beats it

title: Best transport to avoid traffic jam. Always packed.
review: If you are in Bangkok this is the best way to save money and time if your destination is along the limited line It is cheap clean and always full Buy a multiple fare card at the ticket counter in order to avoid long queuing  at vending machines during rush hour

title: Best way to get arround Bangkok
review: Bangkok is a fantastic city it has such a variety of attractions A dinner river cruise is a must do

review: if you're traveling in a group of 4 or more it is preferable to get a taxi but if you're traveling party is less than 4 it is more convenient and more costefficient

review: Right beside the bridge on river Kwak & worth the look 40 baht to enter Very ornate with a lot of old war things  Beautiful hand painted pictures of kings past & present  Veil & walks covered in hand painted pictures depicting past wars & people 4 floors & amazing view Old train engine out front with Japanese staff car on top

title: Reliable service.

title: Best way to travel to beat tha Bangkok jam.
review: This mode of transport besides the MRT is a lifesaver for those living and working in Thailand to commute to work or get to their destination in the city center It's cheap convinient and the trains come every 10 minutes or so  Avoid rush hour But get use to not having any personal space in Asia as people can stand quiet close to you  If you are alone and have a baby use a carrier as not all the stations have elevators for strollers and often you would need to go up and down the stair  Get a travel card if you plan to use the train alot during your stay Also many malls are connected to the station Just look for the exit signs before you exit to make sure you are on the right side of the road and that the exit lead to you destination

title: Excellent trip with a lot of extras.
review: Excellent trip you see a lot more than advertised Very knowledgeable and helpful guide adding extras where possible Worth the trip

title: Fantastic day in markets.
review: Sara has been a great guide I recommend visiting the floating market and the train market with her because she explains everything very well and always with a smile highly recommended )

title: Only way to travel
review: Taxis are very cheap in Bangkok but the traffic can be horrendous This is so easy cool and clean plus low cost If you're there for more than few days get an oyster style card as otherwise you need change

title: A very attractive option to escape the infamous traffic jams of Bangkok.
review: Together with the BTS Skytrain light rail (which runs East to West) the fully underground MRT line links the Northern part of the city to the Southern districts Below are my thoughts about this transportation line  The GOOD  *  Tourists can easily buy a stored value ticket at the station ticket office The staff speak fluent English The refundable deposit is THB 80 and the first time purchase cost THB 180 So you would have THB 100 worth of stored value On average the fare for two stations costs about THB 19 one way The stored value ticket expires in 2 years  *  Clear English signage at station entrance concourse and platforms *  Orderly queues at platforms before boarding the train *  Good cleanliness and housekeeping of station and platforms *  Dual language announcements (Thai and English) in the train when a station is reached Also safety announcement on platform gap *  Clean air and environment and ambiance in the station and platform *  Many stations are directly linked to shopping malls  The BAD  *  Train is congested during peak hours *  Bag check and security gantries at all station entrances could be inconvenient if we are in a rush *  Location of underground MRT stations is sometimes not obvious when signage along the road is lacking For example the Sukhumvit station entrance is not obvious for the uninitiated  Overall a winner mode of transport in a gridlocked Bangkok An overall rating of 4 out of 5  Highly recommended for tourists

title: Best thing for Bangkok transport services!
review: The city of Bangkok tends to be choked with overwhelming road traffic daily This city’s above ground mass rapid transport system called the BTS is air conditioned efficient and effective It is dependable and clean and brings you to most places around Bangkok Most importantly it appears safe too

title: Finally! An efficient, clean and quick way to get around Bangkok
review: I can't wait for the completion of the additional sections to be done but for our group  this was an great welcome for travel into Bangkok It's clean secure and inexpensive compared to other cities with subway systems It's well complimented with the BTS Skytrain It's easy to use with great signage and verbal announcements I applaud the safety considerations and modern subway

title: Quick Travel

title: Easiest way to travel

title: Easy, safe way to get around Bangkok

title: exciting

title: What could have been, and might still be.
review: It's not as efficient as should be Does not run frequent enough and it is not recommended if you carry a lot of luggage and travel with wheelchair or a baby stroller as there are not sufficient lifts and  connections from all stations If you stay at hotels right near a station it's great But getting to some stations can be a hassle as taxis will scam you every possible way If it starts to run as intended with the express line as well and one day connects better with more public transport it might be great  Solo travelers and backpackers should use it as the price is very fair

title: Excellent, convenient and great value

title: Very good transport to bring you to MRT

title: Connect within Bangkok City Centre with no traffic jam
review: It is so convenient for travelers to move around in Bangkok City with Skytrain BTS service With affordable fare and high frequency of trains service I can move around the city without stuck in traffic jam

title: As good as any Asian MTR
review: Ticket machines only accept coins but you can buy a ticket or day pass at the service booths  Service was great frequent trains were clean and people on the train behaved properly  Announcements were in Thai and English and were clear and easy to understand  Most stations we used had escalators and elevators for easy movement of luggage  In some parts of town there is a walkway underneath the track level that makes walking through those parts of town easy cooler and off the street level  Great system all around

title: Good if your point A to B are closer to a station

title: Fast and efficient.

title: Very efficient
review: Highly recommend this mode of travel   Low cost and efficient especially compared to sitting in traffic or contending with the various Bangkok taxis

title: The best transportation in town

title: Floating market

review: We used this system daily for 10 days  It's  very crowded but very efficient and can get you to most parts of the city

title: fast and cheap

title: Nice way to get around

title: Sombering
review: It's quite easy to imagine how difficult it was to build the railway and how the POWs suffered Careful walking the track as the trains still come through Beautiful natural backdrop and the cave not too far from the track Just stop and reflect many people lost their lives not far from where there was a camp

title: Transport
review: Easy to navigate and regular service Economical way to travel especially to the famous weekend market at Chatachuk Fully air conditioned and very clen

title: Great transportation for Bangkok city travellers
review: BTS Sky Train is very convenient and popular among locals and travelers because it helps shorten the traveling time is wellconnected with lots of tourist attraction with reasonable price    For shoppers either at the Department stores or Jatujak Weekend Market BTS sky train is superb You should stay in a hotel along the BTS sky train line  If you want to go to the Grand Palace or  take the Chaopraya River boat tours or Asiatique Night Market I recommend you to use BTS to Taksin station and take the Chaopraya Tourist boat This is perfect  For party animals ride BTS to the clubs (either in Sukhumvit or Silom areas) and take a taxi back cause the operation time lasts only until midnight  Although in rush hours are quite packed just be patient cause you will arrive places faster than riding a taxi   Anyhow BTS Sky train is not ideal for travelers with disabilities    If you stay at a hotel on the BTS route I recommend you buy a oneday pass or smart pass (prepaid) to avoid the hectic queue at the ticketing machine

title: Family visit
review: Good infrastructure Easy to use well connected with major shopping areas Airconditioned reasonably priced Guided well by boards in English

title: Efficient and Reliable..
review: The Bangkok BTS sky train is an excellent means to get around in the main city area of Bangkok and it's one way to beat the bad traffic jams when travelling on the roads via taxi or Grab one can get to one's destination within a reasonable timeframe based on the frequency of the trains and number of stops involved though it can get pretty crowded at time during the daily peak hours and sometimes have to wait for the next train or two before being able to get squeezed in onboard the rides are usually very comfortable in aircon out of the stifling heat of the Bangkok weather  especially during the hot "summer" months so the BTS Sky Train is a fast and reliable way to get around in Bangkok central area

title: Perfect for getting into the city
review: I only had 6 hours to have very brief look around the city  but I was advised not to get a taxi but to get the city train into town  Good air com in the train carriages it only cost 45 bh for the trip  at each station the people are lined up to get on and off the train unlike the multi people scrum we have in the UK Great service  quick  the best way to travel

title: Clean and easy to use
review: Need to have change  can queue for change but then need to queue to get tickets  All happens very quickly though

title: Clean and fast
review: This train is very nice Air conditioned clean and very efficient Just wish it traveled more places

title: Easy and Convenient
review: The MRT subway system is easy and convenient to use  It intersects the BTS skytrain in a number of places  The largest and most central intersection is probably Asoke Station  It's clean and air conditioned  Most stations have ATMs and convenience stores nearby  There is a metal detector you'll need to pass through but I find the security mostly perfunctory  Most locals just ignore the security if they're passing through with a small purseslingbag  If you carry a large backpack or bag be ready to open it to show the contents of the main compartment  It gets very crowded at rush hour (mornings and late afternoons)  There will be long queues of 15+ people at each egressentry point  Be prepared to be squeezed in tightly if you travel during that time  For first timers who don't speak Thai   Go up to a token machine select English and then select the stop you want  Insert cashcoins  Machine will dispense a dark blue plastic token as well as change (if any is due)  Go to the entry turnstile and touch the blue token to the sensor plate to pass through  Keep the blue token and continue to train waiting area board train and get off at your stop  Upon leaving through the exit turnstile insert the blue token in the coin slot and pass through

title: A good adventure for kids
review: We took the night train from Bangkok to Chiangmai and travelled second class sleepers The kids loved it The beds were comfortable we took our own food and the toilets were what you would expectpretty bad  The express day train back from Chiangmai was very long and they don't sell food nor let you off to buy any  rookie error The food provided was very local  Definitely take your own food be ready for an adventure and it will be fun for the kids and long for the adults  The booking office was very helpful It wasn't so great needing to go and collect the tickets before traveling from Bang Sue it took a long time round trip

title: Spot on in the smog in the sky
review: BTS is an excellent and cheap service that is easy to negotate even for a chimpanzee I use it all the time and it is sometimes super busy but always flowing

title: Hands down the best way to City Centre.
review: Taxis are convenient but beware of the infamous Bangkok Jam that can cause you to snail through the traffic for up to 4 hours to reach city centre and definitely so during the rush hours If your hotel is in the Pathumwan (Siam Square) Wattana and Khlong Toei (Sukhumvit) districts take the ARL to BTS PhayaThai Station and transit to the BTS train as it runs through these districts Most hotels are within walking distance from these stations If your hotel is in Ratchathewi (Pratunam) district get off at the ARL Ratchaprarop station By the way take note that the ARL BTS MRT SRT are all under different operators and use separate own ticketing Their preload cards are not interusable

title: Use this!

review: The BTS is quick reliable and cheap  It travels to all the main attractions and run late into the night we’ve used this a couple of times definitely recommend

title: This will save you much cash xx
review: Bangkok is big and Bangkok is busy The traffic is unbelievable and unless you go for the local bus (which once you get your head around is great and costs from 8 to 30 baht) the sky train will be your best air conditioned friend Yes it gets fairly busy but Bangkok scenery will distract you from it and in no time you'll reach your desired destination The price is from about 15 to 52 baht at the most It's modern and it's safe   It will be much cheaper than an Uber or a taxi so don't think twice and book your hotel near any BTS station   Have fun   Flo xx

title: Fast and convenient way to discover BKK
review: BTS is the fastest and convenient way to visit the city  The ''day pass'' costs 140THB but if you are going to use the BTS 2 or 3 times It may be more interesting to buy single journey ticket 1sr trip cost 16baht  Try to avoid the BTS during rush hour as it can be very packed

title: Faster than a taxi and lots cheaper
review: I have been to Bangkok quite a few times over the years and have been waiting for this to be up and running  I was there again in June 2015 and took this Airport link for the very first time It links up with the BTS in central Bangkok so that you can speedily arrive to most areas in Bangkok straight from the airport at a very cheap price  It is very easy to find from the main BKK airport and there are very regular trains all day I was in my hotel half an hour after stepping of the plane If I had done my usual transfer of using a taxi I would have had to queue up at the taxi desk for an official taxi chit (so that the price is fixed and you don't get ripped off) and then been in the taxi for some 20 to 30 minutes to reach central Bangkok and then another 30 to 40 minutes sitting in traffic trying to reach my hotel through the all day everyday gridlocked traffic  Well done Bangkok this is a very usefull and helpfull transport system

title: The Best way to travel arround Bangkok
review: The sky train is the best way to travel around central Bangkok It is fast efficient cheap It has two lines and is connected to the airport via an airport link It connects the MBK shopping center with Chatchutak weekend market It does not service the Grand Palace and the older part of the city It may be very crowded but is a better option than using a tuktuk or a cab whenever possible as it is much faster not going through the traffic jams For example the best way to reach chatuchak market is by the skytrain It would take about an hour to reach the market by cab from the Grand Palace in rush hour but about 20 minutes by skytrain from the Siam station Have small change for the ticket machines (there are change boots if necessary)

title: Great way to get aroung Bangkok
review: We were lucky our hotel had a shuttle that took us to one of the main transfer stations at Chong Nonsi This enabled us to get to several major shopping and entertainment areas in town Figure out where your destination is by looking at the map at the ticket kiosk It will give you a numberfare to get to that destination Insert the amount into the slot and it will give you a ticket to get to that destination To figure out what which platform you go to look at the end of the line on the map in the direction of your destination  same as any train or metro in any other city For a quicker pass through the gate get a BTS pass for 200 THB (around $6 USD) to save time Another benefit of riding the BTS you get a quick overview of the city We walked the Siam Paragon Shopping Center because we happened to see it on our train ride to Chatuchak Weekend Market We found an interesting food court there where we had dinner of some delicious Hainan Chicken and Rice with a very tasty chili sauce We would have never found it if we had been taking a taxi

title: Thai Burma Railway in Tourist class
review: We took the 1255 train from Nam Tok to Kanchanaburi and paid 300 Baht for the tourist carriage which we bought on board the train from the steward The normal 100 Baht tickets are bought at the kiosk on the platform  After being at Kanchanaburi museum visiting the cemetery and having walked Hellfire Pass we felt we needed to see the area from the train to complete the picture The trip took two hours and was enough to appreciate the countryside and to visualise the supreme achievement of the build of the Thai Burma Railway at the most horrendous cost in term of human life and sacrifices The area is of sombre historical interest  At our previous Kanchanaburi trip we were unable to get a ticket on the train which was full leaving Kanchanaburi so we were pleased to take it from Nam Tok (we went direct from our overnight stay at the Float House) Was it worth the difference in price It was a gorgeous Thai experience Yes it was but it is probably not necessary You get the same views the same open window no air con carriage in the 100 baht seat  What we got was the carriage all to ourselves better condition of the carriage and the seats a food box containing oreo biscuits cakes water and coke A certificate and personal attention when it rained for someone to shut the windows ) The toilets were an 'only if you have to' visit

title: Very sad but proud day
review: We did a private taxi from Bangkok for 2700baht through our hotel You can get cheaper but will get what you pay for Our guy was great Visited the war memorial firstly which is kept in great condition and paid respect to the many buried here Then we got the train up to Nam Tok where our guy picked us back up and took us to the waterfall and onto Hellfire Pass This is the deapest cut made by Australian and British POW's of WWII and under the harsh treatment of the Japanese I recommend you do the lot and take the train ride which has some beautiful landscape and a few stops along the way if you want like a cave but be mindful that there are only 3 trains through here each day so plan ahead

title: Perfect connection

title: Great

title: Amazing tour
review: Such an amazing experience The tour guide was amazing and made the experience a lot better I can’t imagine having done everything we did and learned all we did on our way Highly recommend doing it this way

title: Good way to spend a day
review: A couple of points to clarify to what has already been written here   We could the 1045am train from the bridge Ticket prices are fixed at 100baht regardless of where you get on or off  For this you get a wooden seat That's your lot   For 300baht you get the comfy carriage  A guaranteed seat with a thin cushion snack box containing water biscuits and a tiny cake Hot tea or coffee and a cup of cola Also a commemorative certificate and ticket  Bear in mind this is only 1 way You need to buy a ticket to return  These 300baht tickets are available from the green ticket booth at the bridge end of the platform next to the tourist police  Don't be fooled into paying 300 each way as we were about to be  The return journey has no refreshments so you are paying for the cushion Thankfully a nice tour guide pointed this out as I was about to pay  Just get a ticket from the guard on the return journey and pay 100 for it

title: A good way to beat the traffic jams in central Bangkok
review: Generally an excellent service but if travelling during the rush hour be prepared for long ques and packed trains  Outside the rush hour a really good way to travel

title: Bts sky train
review: Convenient air conditioned and modern The BTs sky train makes traveling in Bangkok so much easier So nice to be able to get around easily

title: Oh WOW, Why can't we have one of these in Sydney!!!!!!
review: This is the best thing for transporting huge volumes of people I'v ever seen  Wow it just works great and absolute value for money The train is at the new International Airport pronounced  suwannapoo but not spelt like that Cost 45thb to use from airport to end of the line how cool is that  No more getting my head bashed in from taxi drivers offering to extract as much money from me as possible to take me to Bangkok CBD The system that hooks into this train runs right through Bangkok and once your shown how to use it it's very easy and convenient Also there are people to assist you  Safe and very inexpensive to use You'll be hooked like most of the Thai people who use it daily

title: Very efficient to go from Suvarnabhumi and soon Don Muang
review: Have used since opened and like the variety of stops to go different areas of BKK If live here know how to leverage efficiently Otherwise airportMakkasanPhayaThai will suit many's needs

title: Easy to deal with
review: cheap and efficient maps are easy to follow and the stops light up on the map in the carriage so you cannot lose track of where you are Staff in the booths are happy to tell you the fare and provide change so you can purchase the correct ticket from the machines

title: Easy to Use and Inexpensive
review: The sky train is easy to use and inexpensive However the lines can be long to buy the tickets Make sure to have coins to avoid waiting in two lines one for coins and one for the tickets

title: Fastest way to the airport
review: Acheap and fast way to get to the airportComfortable clean airconditioned trains and only cost 40 baht avoiding any traffic jams

title: Very easy to use
review: The skytrain is really easy to use the AC is on a good temperature Its also very cheap If you have a rabit card your travels will be more easy

title: Ok but costs a lot for family of 6
review: It is easy to get around in and gets you places But as you ou for 6 people it adds up a lot I like Uber SUV if can get them best for getting us all around

title: Time Saving For Sure
review: For the first few days we took taxis and tuktuks Because of the Bangkok traffic getting to the hotel was a nightmare Traveling 23 kilometers took our more than an hour Once we decided to take the BTS we were in our hotel in all about 2030 minutes Clean and on time Thumbs up

title: We need this in the UK
review: Such an efficient quick and cool (air conditioning) way of getting around Bangkok  We stayed near Sukhumvit so it was easy to pick up the Skytrain from the station there

title: Excellent, impressed with it.
review: We were very impressed with how punctual the skytrain is and we could hopoff near our hotel just within 5 minutes walk the BTS is a great way to navigate through bangkok traffic jam Very accessible from everywhere  The train is clean too

title: Very cheap & convenient!
review: It's simply a great way to get around the city The route map is very easy to read Air conditioning always work well Staying somewhere near a BTS station is definitely a key to get around Bangkok

title: Easy way to travel
review: While we looked out the window we observed the locals had their heads in their phones Great way to get around

title: Quick and easy
review: I found that the Airport rail link was an easy way to get from the airport to my hotel and back The cost was reasonable and the service efficient It was a little difficult to connect with the subway at one of the main stations as you had to leave the station and walk a block and a half to the subway and the signage was poor but you just follow the others and have faith and lo and behold there it is the subway If you have a lot of luggage it would be challenging but otherwise it was very easy Cabs are pricy and the traffic is absurd so this is a great option

title: A must for Australian, Dutch and Britick tourists.
review: I have been three times to Hellfire Pass and the War Cemetery in Kanchanaburi Once I was lucky enough to see the ANZAC Dawn Service in Hellfire Pass and later at the War Cemetery  Both were very moving ceremonies Apart from the natural beauty of the area it was an honour to pay homage to those who made the ultimate sacrifice during the Japanese occupation Kanchanaburi itself is not a big town but it is well equipped to offer all that is required for the tourist You can also see the Bridge over the River Kwai  There are many good hotels restaurants and bars to keep yu entertained in the evenings

title: Amazing experience
review: The best  grateful to our guide Sam and driver big day of incredible sights and exleriences  Sam was across everything war and Thai  do it must do for Aussies

title: clean and cool
review: the train is a bit crowded but very clean runs frequently and it is climatized It was a nice experience to ride it during the hot time of the day

title: Quick and efficient
review: BTS skytrain is best transportation system for city like Bangkok with traffice and distances I always stay in hotels close BTS station Always travel using BTS to get from one point to other in Bangkok both for business as well tourism I have purchased a pass which is valid for four years and you can load the money when ever required BTS makes my travel with in city very quick and efficeint

title: Awesome
review: The only way to get to and from the airport It's very clean fast and affordable Don't even think of taking anything else

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: A little confusing at first but a wonderful alternative to taxis or TukTuks  It goes near most major sites and allows you more time at the area you will be visiting

title: JUST DO IT
review: The only way to travel to or from the Airport UNLESS you arrive after their opening hoursits the BEST and CHEAPEST way to and from the Airport

title: Easy to get around
review: We have ridden on the sky train many times in the past three trips it is easy to get to the main shopping area and extremely inexpensive very well airconditioned and you're not hassling with the typical Bangkok traffic

title: Pleasant but lacking knowledge
review: Please send a professional Tour Guide who knows the history and salient features of the tour being undertaken  Although Sam was a nice person and with a lovely personality Poor guy had no knowledge of the Kwai Kanchanaburi landscape  Most of the time he was quiet we had to ask him questions and half the time he had no convincing answers so we ended up reading from the posts  What do you expect from a delivery driver turned tour guide Waste of AU$ 460 for 2 people Could have done better with another tour operator

title: Quick and Cheap Travel
review: A clean fast and inexpensive way to travel Onetime and with many stops Very secure and safe The only small problem was that the seating arrangements meant that many had to be standing Overall a good way to travel quickly and cheaply

title: worst case scenario
review: i don't recommended when you hurry Train delays around 2030 min if you you hurry i recommended to use Grab car or Taxi much better

title: The only way to get around.
review: Aircon clean and fast this is by far the best way to get around Bangkok Found buying a day or weekly (depending on the length of your stay) ticket is the best way saves having to find change all the time

title: Ideal to get around bk
review: Used many times with no issues  easy to follow ticket info and maps  trains are not overcrowded  they are full but still room to move  we travel with 3 children and it’s fine

title: Easy Moving
review: Pick the hotel close to BTS especially if you never visit Bangkok before  Most of the major tourist attractions can be reached by sky train

title: Use It!
review: Cheap fast easy way to town from Suvarnabhumi If you can use it A rather long walk from main BTS station

title: Easy Access
review: I preferred the trains better than the taxiFrequent trains and most malls are walkable distance from train station We took train from Asok where termimal 21 mallwas and got down at the chit lom station  where you have central world mallSiam Paragon mall MBK malls and Erawan Shrine Trains are much faster than the taxi

title: Get your guide with Sara
review: Ms Sara she is so amazing and we had fun with her 😍 It was unforgettable experience  ✨ You must go with her 🧡

title: Best way to the airport
review: Not much to say it's like the bts and the most comfortable way the airport Espacially when it is traffic time

title: FAST
review: It's very fast and cheap and easy for go another station or another place in Bangkok but if out from the airport can't take big bag with you

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Traveller tip buy multi passno queuing and saves moneyBe prepared to stand as most times its groundedits quick cool and clean

title: the only way to see bangkok
review: having been to Bangkok in the pre skytrain days I can only tell you it was expensive (especially from the airport ) and time consuming now with skytrain you can get from the airport to many parts of the city for like 225$ and quicly less than half an hourthe only way to visit sights is either skytrain or river boats beware in the morning from 600 to about 900 and in the afternoon from around 230 to 600 it's very crowded so if you have luggage and are going to the airport PLAN YOUR TRIP

title: one city, three system, three kinds different tickets.
review: BTS was the first mass transit system in Bangkok and MRT are later Therefore I lower my score to MRT because of the nonunion system with BTS Passengers need to by 3 different cards for three mass transit in BKK MTS MRT Airport Link That is not friendly for all passengers citizens Compare To Asia's near cities as Singapore Taipei Hong kong that one card for all MRT and BUS especially Taipei smart card that one card almost for all life you need  BKK and KL Mass transit are behind and second grade of service

title: The Jewel in the crown of BKK transport
review: The BEST way to get around Bangkok SO convenient and covers the best part of the city covering Sukhumvit Silom down to the Chao Praya River and up to JJ Markets The ticket (token) booths can get VERY busy at peak times so it can be worth purchasing a daily pass or a Rabbit card if you are going to be there for a few days The staff can be a bit short at times and there was some confusion in applying for a refund of rabbit card but generally they are friendly and attentive ALERT The BTS system is NOT accessible for people in wheelchairs

title: Effective service
review: Good connectivity although personally I find the interiors a bit cramped especially if you have a bag or two Plus early mornings the staff seemed a little grouchy towards tourists so make sure you have change and know a little bit of Thai

title: Skytrain
review: A good way to see the city Very cheap travel 3050 baht for an average journey Also a good way to get around the city during rush hours

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: Such a cheap form of transport and gives you views of the city which are wonderful The only down side is it only goes so far into Bangkok and does not extend into the main tourist areas where all the places and temples are

title: So cheap and convenient!
review: The best way to beat the BKK traffic is to make the most of the the MRT and BTS Once you get used to the different lines it is the easiest way of transporting in BKK

title: So cheap and easy to follow
review: The skytrain is great value and of course you avoid the traffic though during AprilMay Bangkok is hot sometimes it can be easier to catch a tuktuk or taxi to avoid the hot walk

title: Reasonably useful, again crowded had to stay on platform as some MRTs were too full.
review: Very crowded stations not actually near what their name suggests The Siam Cultural Centre for instance was a 20 minute walk from the station of the same name Lots of stairs need more escalators and lifts for anyone's use not just wheelchairs and a station assistants permission

title: Super Easy
review: Super easy and fast to use the screen has an English option which is fantastic I'd definitely recommend using it

title: Ticketing Machines
review: Getting around the city with BTS is extremely convenient Although purchase of tickets can be done at the ticketing counter it is still best to improvise the ticketing machines to accepting currency note for convenience

title: Not worth it at all
review: Not a good experience at all The entire tour not just with this company is a scam Just a tourist trap stay away and use your day on enjoying other things in Bangkok

title: Almost better than London tube
review: It’s always on time always clean and the staff at the station is very helpful and courteous We bought 120 BHT day pass which was well worth it

title: great to get around City - be prepared for walking up and down stairs first
review: convenient when staying in City as traffic is appalling  MRT much better for getting around  we stayed at Renaissance great location near to Chit Lom station so only 2 stops to the famous MBK shopping Centre

title: Quickest Way to Get to Bangkok
review: The Airport Rail Link is the quickest way to get in and out of Bangkok  The BTS can be caught from the Airport Rail Link and a cheap taxi ride can be acquired to get to your hotel  However a metered taxi must be found or a negotiated rate  If you don't know what you're doing the taxi drivers will try to charge you six times more than the ride should cost which would negate any savings made from catching the cheap Airport Rail Link  A ride into Bangkok takes about 25 minutes  When I went back to the airport and took a taxi it was 1 hour and 20 minutes

title: Efficient and Safe
review: We rode the BTS as we found it to be quite an efficient way to get around A must do if you are in BKK Quite safe and efficient

title: Fantastic
review: Great way to reach Bangkok city from the airport Probably the fastest I have every reached the Bangkok city from the airport Cheap and 100% on time

title: Too busy
review: the skytrain is always way too busy during rush hour They should make the trains come every minute or two instead of every five minutes This means that the train is always way too packed and you end up breathing in everybody elses body odour it's disgusting

title: Best way to commute in bangkok
review: clean well connected fast and most economical means of travelling around the busiest areas of bangkok

title: Great way to move around Bangkok
review: I was amazed how easy the Skytrain was to use plus I was able to get  to many more places than before because I was not stuck in traffic You move above the traffic and get to your destination in minutes Just read the fare instructions and easy maps and you will be getting around Bangkok in minutes instead of hours

title: Excellent Piece of Infrastructure
review: Great way of getting out of the Airport hassle free and you can access most parts of the city using the air conditioned skytrain system

title: best for moving around in bangkok
review: Excellent transport system well operated and very well maintained Convenient to reach even far off places It covers all the major places

title: Great service
review: Takes 30 mins to the other end of the line which is Phaya Thai and costs only 40B per person Definitely worth using and you can then more than likely continue your journey on metro or via tuk tuktaxi Very easy to use and the airport link is within the airport sign posts easy to follow

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok streets are so crowded all of the time The BTS is cheap airconditioned and will get you to most places faster than a taxi Day passes are the way to go

title: Handy
review: Sky train I use it all of the time handy as he'll to get around bbk fast and cheap buy a token and jump on

title: Easy to travel around
review: When i'm in Bangkok i like to use the MRT to go around If you like to know more about the MRT go to Hua Lampong station and take the train station exit Many photos and information about the MRT I can not wait till the new lines (purple line and extension of the blue line) are available

title: Fast and clean
review: Train was fast and clean To get from the airport to Siam square just follow the signages to the airport rail and pay 45 baht per pax Stop at Phaya thai station (45 min) and change to BTS takes another 15 min to reach Siam station Most convenient and affordable Seats available if you take from the airport which is the first stop Airport rail link gets crowded later on

title: Awesome way of traveling through Bangkok
review: I combination with the river boats (getting very crowded) the train is really the best way to travel through Bangkok  Clean  easy to use  on time  Highly recommend

title: Blessing!
review: This is the best improvement in Bangkok ever Getting into town was never so easy Travel time from international airport to centre of town is about 40 minutes  Going by taxi could take you on a good day up to 15 hours(depending on the trafic)

title: Super cool for easy, cheap and cool traveling!
review: You want to get from A B fast without breaking into a sweat and at a low cost Welcome to the Bangkok public Transport Its really well connected the only real downside is that you cant get daily tickets that would pay off for us unworthy tourists You will have to go and buy a ticket for every journey you make ech way yes But other than that It is airconditioned the Trains run rather frequently (we never waited longer than 5 minutes) and you will get easily to all sight apart from the Wats by the river side boats take overe there we used  it every day many times and it as fun and fast did I mention it was cheap

title: Quickest way around town
review: The Thais have it sorted with this one Built by an Italian company I think it is quick efficient and the only way to get about in Bangkok in my opinion Half the fun is planning your journey and buying the token The staff help you happily especially if you try to speak a bit of Thai I usually give them their laugh for the day There are route maps everywhere in both Thai and English so it is quite easy The local tourist map shows all the routes and stations too with the links to the BTS the skytrain

title: Thumbs up !!
review: Best way to cone to the city from the airport Helps to reach quickly and comfortably Take this to avoid the Bangkok traffic and especially if your hotel is situated near a BTS station

title: Efficient transit system
review: The MRT is an efficient way to get around Bangkok It is important to do your homework and check out the MRT website maps and maybe some Youtube videos to help you navigate the subway You will need to know which exits to use and where your stops need to be The ticket machines are easy to use as well as the customer kiosks are very helpful Bring your coins to save time

title: Asoke BTS
review: Train was very clean and time arriving is very accurate Near to the Continent Hotel and Sukumvit MRT station Well done

title: Great!
review: A really easy way to get to or from the airport It takes about 30 minutes to get to Makkasan Station from where you can get on the metro or in a cab

title: So fast and cheap
review: I like it it is not over 100 baht per person per ride I think it helps when you are in a rush Very comfortable and you can avoid of the bad traffic in BKK

title: Fine if you just want to see teh markets
review: For all the time taken the time at the market was extremely rushed It would have been better if we had skipped the the salt pan and had time to explore the market properly  I would describe teh trip better as arranged transport than a tour as there was very little by way of a guide

title: Very nice
review: easy to use convenient and faster than getting stuck in very horrible traffic jams for hours Recommended

title: Easy Locomotion
review: I always stay somewhere on Sukhumvit Road when I come to Bangkok The skytrain is a great way of getting from A to B The aircon is nice on a hot day and it is always spotless   I suggest buying a multiple ride Rabbit card for ease of getting arond

title: good and convienience
review: its a good way to travel from one distance to another becalms its cheap and traffic jam free more faster to reach destination

title: CHIANG MAI TO BANGKOK - DAY TRAIN
review: I recently caught the day train from Chiang Mai to Bangkok on a Tuesday booking via 12 Asia Go which was a straightforward process I would recommend getting to the station early on the day of your journey to purchase a ticket in person so that a) you can choose your seat and b) you aren't ripped off My train carriage was half full and my seat didn't have a window As I'd booked the day train instead of the night train because I wanted to see the countryside I was a little disappointed The attendants were quite strict about seating  Take food with you (there aren't options for vegetarians and it's pretty average anyway) and book your tickets in person It's a pleasant journey

title: Fast transport in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a fast relatively low cost form of transport in Bangkok and a wonderful way of avoiding the traffic and pollution on the roads The train is clean and speedy Strange system for buying tickets You need to stand in line while each passenger inserts exactly the correct amount of coins into the ticket dispenser There does not appear to be a facility to purchase a return ticket which is frustrating We were only in Bangkok in transit for a few hours and therefore it was not economical to buy a day ticket Trains are crowded and passengers are packed in like sardines at peak periods Nevertheless this is the best way to get around

title: The best Thailand experience with tour company
review: We had private tour to Railway Market and Floating Market and Coconut farm It exceeded our expectiations Guide was very profesional and super friendly Great knowleadge of any topic  Highly reccomend

title: Convenient and comfortable
review: The MRT is a great way to travel round Bangkok It's easy to get a travel card from the ticket office so you don't need to keep buying tickets each trip Trains come every few minutes and are well signposted in Thai and English so it's really easy to navigate the system It's well worth trying to  stay near an MRT station to make traveling convenient

title: A great way to see and move around Bangkok
review: Having only a few short days in Thailand and not wanting to spend a fortunate on getting around we decided on giving the skytrain a go   Being walking distance to the Silom Complex we started at Sala Daeng and took the Silom Line to Ban Wa and then back again to the National Sports Museum  We purchased day trips for 560 baht in total (note these only last for the day of purchase and not 24 hours) and are approximately $6 Australian dollars per person  It was a great way to see over bangkok and get to places quicker  This line links up to another skytrain line which we didn't get the opprtunity to try this day   Can get busy and congested but is good value for money If planning to use service more than one day I assume the rabbit card is the way to go   Would definitely recommendable use again

title: Nice and Clean
review: The BTS help us to move around bangkok easilyits nice and clean Try to arrange time to get on the BTSduring office hours the traffic is not to bad but please avoid around 5  7 pm as it is the busiest time when Thai people going homeU will get squish in there and it is not recommended during this hours if you travelling with young children

title: Quick and cheap
review: Board at the starting station if you can as this gets busy just 45 baht to Airport Use taxi or private taxi via Grab app for cheaper way to Airport by combining TaxiTrain

title: Easy way to get around
review: Regular and good service to get to malls and markets and just to see the city from above and in comfort and air conditioning I did not use it for the Airport but it conveniently goes there Regular reliable service intervals

title: The best public transportation I have ever used
review: The title of the review says it all Cheap easy to use super clean and very fast Transfers to different rails are easy too

title: BtS skytrain - weekend in Bangkok
review: First time user of the sky train and was so impressed at the efficiency I made numerous stops without difficulty Announcements are in both Thai and English Countries like South Africa could take a leaf out of Thailand's book with regard to the efficient rail system  both underground and above

title: Fastest way from airport
review: Last year when i came to visit bangkok it took us 2 hour from the airport to out hotel in sukhumvit This year in 2 we dicided to go with the airport link it connected to the bts and we went down right infront of our hotel in nana atleast 4 times faster than taxi

title: What a transport system!
review: Once you have studied the Map of the BTS and mastered buying a ticket it is a wonderful transport system ( If you are going to make numerous journeys a day ticket may be a sensible option) The trains are very regular and clean but can get a little crowded The Thai commuters can certainly show how to queue whilst waiting for a train very orderly The trains are also very clean and the announcements are made in Thai and English

title: Best way to travel in bkk
review: Pros  Air con  Cheap  Used mainly by locals  Easy to use   Cons  Can get over crowded at peak times   Best to travel in Bangkok

title: USE it only if alone
review: its good but doesnt make sense using the skytrain if you are in group of 2 or 3 as the problem is that the taxi would cost the same as tickets for 3 people on skytrain

title: Fastest way to get around Bangkok
review: The best option to travel around Bangkok is the the MRTBTS since the traffic is very bad in bangkok MRT and BTS is very easy to travel saves lots of time You can take a one day pass for 140Baht It connects to all major areas in BangkokFerry service Make sure your hotel is near to any of the MRT or BTS station

title: Convenient & Low Cost Airport Rail Link
review: It is very convenient there are two lines express and city line Normally people use city line 42 BHT for the longest distance (the more shorten the more lower) to Phyathai which you can connect to sky train (BTS) to anywhere in Bangkok  It is very effective way low cost and convenient  From the Suvannabhum airport go down to B1 level

title: Great Way to Get Around Bangkok
review: The BTS stretches right through the middle of Bangkok You also have access to the MRT (underground subway) via the BTS We traveled from one end to the other on a daily basis There is a map of the stops at every station and you can purchase tickets through the machine or ticket counter

title: Only 2 lines
review: Bts is really necessery in such city like Bangkok Unfirtunatelly there are only 2 lines of bts Train cars are clean Probably you can't pay by card for the tickets Usually you need coins to buy ticket

title: Excellent value for money
review: The Sky train is a cheap and easy way to get around Bangkok once you get used to it We got taken to places we did not want to go too by taxi and the traffic is pretty bad Just make sure that the train is going where you want too be the train can also get very busy so watch your bags etc

title: Best way to go around Bangkok and beat the heat and the traffic!
review: Best way to go around Bangkok and beat the heat and the traffic

title: fast and easy to get to the city center
review: The best way to beat the crazy Bangkok traffic during peak hours to reach the airport or the city center   Economic as well as faster than a taxi  One might have to walk a bit to the train station at the airport If you have too much luggage then better take a taxi

title: Probably the easiest way to & from the airport
review: This train service travels between the city & the airport in only like 30 mins Fast & efficient  To get to the airport train station proceed all the way down to the basement of the main terminal building  Get tickets from either those selfservice machines or the ticket counter

title: Avoid the terrible traffic in Bangkok
review: great transport in cityAvoid the terrible traffic in Bangkok If you stay for a while please buy member card called "rabbit card"

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: try to avoid peak times as the trains get very busy but a great way to see BKK not so good for disabled as a lot of stairs but do have some lifts

title: Cheap, Clean & Easy
review: Great way to get around if you're not in too much of a time crunch Clean and quiet and easy to navigate through the sky train system Also very affordable

title: Good quick way to get around
review: Felt really safe travelling on the sky train great way to get around we got a rabbit card which made it easy to get about

title: On the move while sleeping
review: We decided for the overnight train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai Currently both the old and new trains are running We had the old one which is still quite good Once on board you get offered an orange juice You have to pay for it later Dinner and breakfast menus are provided but you can also bring your own Food in board is average Beds are being made directly after dinner Lights stay on during the night Toilet was working In the morning beds are cleaned while still on the road We left on time but arrived 15 later than planned which is not unusual Be prepared for a lot of people wanting to take you into town

title: Easy and clean
review: Great but warning There is a veeerrrry quiet little voice announcing the stops and no obvious signs so you have to count to know where you are at

title: Great value
review: We tried the airport rail link for the first time Only 45 THB per person gets you to Phayathai Station in around 25 minutes You can then switch to a BTS line to get to the area you are staying In our case it was Nana so down the escalator and exit to the BTS platform purchase a ticket to the station 28 THB Overall the trip was around 40 mins & we had to walk the 500 mt to our hotel but the train was clean and airconditioned and something politicians in Victoria should look at

title: Excellent
review: Efficient Clean and easy to use Great system and cheap tickets  Used everyday to get to different places

title: Beat the Bangkok traffic
review: Best way to get around most of central Bangkok overhead above the crazy busy roadways in the Thai capital and it even comes with a view

title: Clean and easy to usse
review: I like the BTS very much IT was easy to get aroudn with it I avoided alot of traffic I wish there was more stations and it went further though

title: Cheap Airport Transport
review: If you have the time and don't mind transferring to and from other trains The Airport Rail Link is a great option Much more affordable than a taxi but is not as fast Can get crowded but generally there is space for luggage

title: Convenient
review: It is the most convenient way to commute around in Bangkok given the traffic and weather conditions Cheap and fast

title: A great way to do two must see sights.
review: A great way to spend the day Amazing experience at both the railway and floating market with a great guide and driver The hotel pick up made everything very easy Just be warned although it is a half day trip you don't get back to Bangkok until approx 1530

title: Cheap and Easy
review: The quickest and easiest way to get around Bangkok Very simple to navigate around and always people there to help It is a lot better than getting stuck in the Bangkok traffic

title: Airport rail link
review: This is not only the cheapest (45 baht) way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport it's also the fastest Connects directly to the BTS at Phaya Thai station so you can get anywhere in the city without getting ripped off by a taxi driver at the airport

title: Practical and fast
review: If you want to impress your partner with an $85 limo ride from the airport (as I tried last year) and sit in traffic for 6090 mins and watch the other smaller taxis do the same then fill your boots This year we took the rail with our luggage and got into town in 20 minutes  Now I must admit that the 2 km ride from the downtown Makissan Station to our hotel took some time because it was Friday night (10PM) and taxis were hard to find The rail link ticket was only 35 baht and was easy access from airport arrivals  Need direction ask anyone Rolling the luggage was no problem on the conveyor escalators Will use again without question  Returning to the airport was a breeze several days later and took us 30 mins including taxi to the Makissan Sta

title: How to get around
review: It is fast efficent and clean The system is easy to understand The stations are numbered and instructions are in english

title: Very cheap and convenient during rush hour
review: Bangkok traffic can be terrible so a massive advantage of flying to Suvarnabhumi airport (BKK) is the option of taking the airport rail link especially if you're landing during Friday evening's rush hour  It's just THB 45 to Phaya Thai and takes about 30mins It does get quite busy but it's air conditioned and I'll take this over being stuck in Bangkok's infamous grid locked rush hour traffic

title: Fast, air conditioned, easy to use
review: We buy day passes as much for convenience as anything  Really easy to use lovely and cool You need to do a bit of homework in terms of correct exits and so on  Always felt safe lots of guards posted around the system   The only thing I could have done without were the adverts blaring out of the TV screens with their shrieking voices and over acting

title: Infrequent
review: Train leaves too infrequently go be trully convenient It's almost never faster than taking a taxi when you include the waiting time for a train   Do check the train schedules before hand

title: Best way to get around
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be hell Move around faster and with less stress on the train especially during rush hour

title: Easy to use and cool
review: Jumped on the BTS a few times as we were staying really close was easy to use quick and cool Would jump out and get tuk tuk to where we needed to go

title: very easy to use
review: It was very easy to use the Skytrain  We bought a daily pass for one day and it was perfect to hop onoff of it to get to different locations

title: Super convenient and very low fare
review: Super convenient terminal to terminal only THB45 30 mins ride After exiting the custom just take the elevators down to the lower level and the train station is there have space for large luggage There are two stations can transfer to city metros one for metro underground and terminal station for BTS

title: cheap way to Airport especially if you solo traveler
review: Its really a cheap way to Airport especially if you solo traveler You can't share your taxi fee with anyone after all this public transportation really useful and helps you manage your budget Make sure your flight arrive and depart tofrom SUV so you can enjoy your new experience with this service

title: The way to get around Bangkok
review: Don't take a Tuk Tuk who wants to breathe exhaust and be ripped off at the same timecabs are cheap but the traffic is gridlocked Take the skytrain in air conditioned comfort They run often and never get stuck in traffic They pretty much can g t you close to where you want to go and they are pretty inexpensive

title: Great
review: Very easy and also cheap way to travel in Bangkoknice and clean and also air conditioned carriages)

title: glad we stopped
review: the history surrounding the structure is what this is all about take the time and walk the bridge surrounding museum is interesting

title: Normal like other MRT in Hong Kong, Singapore and etc
review: Price is ok  It will be better for you to take taxi if you have 4 pax only a bit cheaper by BTS)  Quite crowded  Announcement and signage are available in train for every stop

title: Fast, Clean, Efficient
review: Fast easy transportation Not a common thing in Bangkok The AC was a nice break from the heat outside

title: Very Humbling to Travel on Part of the Death Railway
review: A short one hour train ride towards Burma ending after crossing one of the original wooden viaducts built by the Allied POWs in 1943

title: Clean and spacious
review: Not sure if it is due to timing or just our luck the MRT is almost empty but no many seat are available as the train cabins are more for standing spaces Easy to get around thou did not know about it until skytrain office brought to our attention

title: Excellent
review: Compared to the taxis Airport Rain Link is really cheap And Fast And Convenient Just take the ticket from level 2 and you are ready to go

title: What a hoot!
review: If you are going to Chiang Mai from Bangkok the only way to go is by overnight train Forget about  the hotel fare you are saving This is an experience not to be missed It only costs about $30 Austalian dollars for an air con sleeperThe fun starts as soon as you board The lovely ladies selling coffees and orange juices make for theatre The train attendant who comes to set up your overnight bed is super efficient and then comes the dramatic moment when you get to climb into your little sleeping cubby hole for the night Sleeping on these overnighters takes you back to when you were a child and everything was fun The madness of the world dissipates as you fall asleep  dreaming of the adventures that await you in the wonderful town of Chiang Mai Forget about flyingyou'll only get stressed and wonder why you didn't make the effort to catch this moment of why you travel in the first place As a famous shoe company sayjust do it

title: Best way to travel
review: 150 bhat from city centre to airport compared to 1700 in the AOT limo  Easier than travelling on the tube takes about 45 minutes

title: Very efficient, reliable service.
review: Whilst not as extensive as transit in some other comparable cities the Skytrain is a very useful and largely stress free way of getting around BKK and does connect with the MRT in a number of places Cheap accessible and keeps you off the rather manic streets

title: Watch out for peak times!
review: Easy to use and cheap but not practical if you have large rucksacks and the school children pile on  felt like I had half of Bangkok pushing against me at one point

title: Best way to get around
review: Bangkok traffic can be a real stress doesn't matter if you are in Limo or getting ripped by Cab best way to move around is Skytrain quite well networked and safe to use

title: Good
review: One of the best method to travel around the Bangkok City Many famous places can be gone by this sky train This is the most effective way for me

title: Great transport if not elderly
review: The sky train is super Gets you most places in Bangkok fast ( Not like it used to be) My only complaint is not being able to get a seat because the trains were always busy For me at 75 and my wife at 70 its a bit too much climbing stairs and standing in a crushed train However it is the cheapest and easiest way to get around Younger people should lap it up they would love it I'm sure

title: Can't do without it
review: The fastest way to travel in Bangkok Buy a day pass to make it extra convenient The Skytrain takes you to all the big malls and important nightlife areas A great way to travel in this busy city

title: Unbelievable Trip To The Airport for only 40THB!
review: Normally I pay RM60 to RM90 to go to the Airport in Malaysia (550THB TO 800THB) via taxi Even via train it is RM40 (350THB)  With this I can conclusively say that Bangkok is one of the most economical cities to live in when it comes to mass transport

title: Great
review: My hotel was literally outside one of the stations so this was an essential way for me to get around Bangkok It was clean and cool Everything you need in the hot city

title: Convenient mode of transport  from Suvarnarbhumi Airport to the city
review: We had been using the airport rail link a few times already whenever we go to Bangkok arriving at Suvarnabhumi Airport It is cheap and convenient It's costs 45 Baht from airport to Phaya Thai station and from there transfer to the BTS On our recent trip we had to alight at Chidlom BTS and the one way trip from Phaya Thai BTS to Chidlom BTS costs 25Baht For each passenger traveling from the airport to Chidlom costs a total of 70 Baht For 2 pax is 140 Baht so that is so much cheaper than taking the taxi minus the traffic jam However the only downside is most of the BTS in Bangkok has no escalator to the street level so we have to carry the bags down the flight of stairs Arriving into Bangkok and taking the train is okay as the luggage is still light However if you are departing from Bangkok and after a shopping spree taking the train may not be too convenient as you have to carry the heavy luggage up the stairs to the BTS station and maybe platform

title: Great
review: It's cheaper and more environmentally friendly than a taxi It costs 45 Bhat one way and is well worth the money Beats the traffic too

title: Sky Train
review: Great way to get around BKK Buy a daily pass and you get on and off all day longEasy to use air conditioned Surprised when people say you only pay at machines as we have gotten passes at ticket windows staffed by people Each year that we go back we find they have extended the system so more areas are reachable by Skytrain

title: A great, quick excursion for friends
review: We had such a great morning on this trip It’s fast and it’s very touristy but we still enjoyed it The train market is like no other and a ride through the floating marketing is perfectly set up from the tour

title: Efficient but could be better
review: The trains were efficient and somewhat comfortable however it'll be good if they could provide better ventilation on the train platform as the weather in Bkk is hot and humid Also there should also be escalator as the flight of stairs are high

title: Excellent service
review: Used MRT for travel between Phetchaburi and Si Lom a number of times and found it easy to use (even with a large suitcase) cheap and very reliable Services were every 10 minutes or so starting at 0600 until midnight Station maps are inside and outside the train and there are regular announcements in English of the stops

title: Clean comfortable cheap and quick.
review: I used the rail (not express) from Ratchapraport to the airport which took less than 30 minutes The fare was 40 Baht which is lead than AUD2

title: clean, reliable, fast, cheap transportation
review: best way to travel in Bangkok Close to major hotels and shopping malls Easy ticket machine in English Air conditioned

title: Travel almost anywhere in the city
review: I toured the city In one day almost over The car was good clean convenient and fast but expensive crowded fares should be avoided during the time off work because people are tight

title: Efficient
review: The main road is always packed and even in rush hour the bts will win Effiecient frequent clean and cheap Only improvement would be if it were to go later into the night

title: Bts
review: Great way to travel round Bangkok puts London Underground to shame cheap air conditioned fast service and super ease of service

title: Cold, bright, bumpy
review: We read the reviews about the frigid AC and brought extra clothes to wear for this but they were still not enough They give you a thin thin blanket but it really was extremely cold The AC must not have temperature control They also never turn off the cabin lights throughout the night so it stays very bright and the ride itself is not very smooth In all we didn't get a good night's sleep at all and would recommend taking a plane if possible We've taken sleeper cars in China and those were much more comfortable in comparison

title: Best way to travel and enjoy city vew in Bangkok
review: It is so easy to find the station eventhough it quite inefficient on the payment method The train connects most of the popular place in Bangkok So if youre playing tourist then you should take the BTS and make sure you have lots of coins to skip the line

title: Best way to city center
review: Don't bother with a taxi take the train It is a fraction of the cost of a taxi and you won't get stuck in traffic Its cool clean comfortable and fast If you get off at makasan station you can walk to the MRT subway station and get to about any place in the city from there (but if you have a lot of luggage it's better just to get a taxi from the station)

title: BTS - the best skytrain system
review: Cheap easy convenient mode of transport to take you to your location or connect with MRT subway  Australia should learn from Asian countries we are too far behind and expensive  Do your research by studying the system before you travel

title: Best way to go from point A to point B in often traffic-crazy Bangkok
review: Aside from the everreliable motorbikes the BTS is still the best way to go from one place to another in Bangkok Though obviously the stations are limited and it won't take you everywhere but it can at least help minimize your commute hours  especially during rush hours The trains are clean and almost always on time It's also not that expensive and certainly cheaper than taxis

title: Good way of transportation in Bangkok.
review: Clean low price reliable and the fastest way to move in Bangkok The investment made really worths not only for the locals but for tourists The traffic in Bangkok is quite complicated so the Skytrain makes easy for everyone

title: Easy to go and comfortable
review: When you come to station you can easily find ticket machines Choose your destination and number means price Better to have coins Conditioned clean fast

title: Your Way to Bangkok from Airport
review: It's easy to get into Bangkok city by this Airport link Just keep walking to underground of Suvarnaphumi airport Getting the tickets for train You will be in Bangkok at your hotel within 3540minutes  Mike Bangkok Thailand

title: Fast and efficient!
review: This is the easiest and fastest way to travel from the airport into the city by avoiding traffic jams along the way most likely you will be stuck in jams if you were to take a taxi to the city

title: Good value for money
review: Speedy connection to city and bts trains Inexpensive Ends in Oriya Thai where you can connect to the bits sky trains

title: Inter Connection Express Line
review: Air Port Link Connects from Phaya Thai to the Suvanarbhumi airport with Skytrain and MRT Express LineAll trains are cleanon timefaster and cheaper than grab taxisIt is the best route to get from Bangkok Mega city to the BKK Airport You do not need to worry about traffic unexpected taxi drivers high way fee or fixed metersTrains are often very full and not just at rush hoursVery comfortable and reasonable cost to reach your time

title: Better than even the sky train!
review: I love the BTS (Sky Train) but like the MRT even more The terminals are cooler (temperature wise) and while busy they to be a lot less crazy during the nonpeak hours than the BTS

title: Great
review: Really enjoyed it Went on Monday Better than expected for floating market …still a lot of interaction of boat market Excellent guide

title: Quick transport from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the city.
review: Very efficient and quick transport from Suvarnabhumi airport to the Center of Bangkok It also departure opposite direction from Phaya Thai station

title: A great day outside of the city
