review: Kiwi was such a fun guide She gave us great information and had a lot of energy Everything was very organized and she gave us plenty of time to try some local foods from the vendors and do some shopping She took us to the best places for snacks and for lunch so we knew it was all quality It was an amazing day I highly recommend this tour

title: Ideal way into the city
review: Having used taxis from both Don Mueang and now Suvanarbhumi this is a great way into the city  Trains are clean and frequent  about every 15 mins  and amazingly cheap if using the slower City Line Each time I've used it the train has been very busy which is a bit of a nuisance with luggage but go with it and adopt the Thai attitude of "sabai sabai" I always use the Makkasan terminal which as another reviewer has pointed out is near but not next to the Phetchaburi MRT station which requires travellers to make their way across a road and a railway track to reach it though it appears that a connecting bridge is being built (This is Thailand  don't expect UK  US style joined up thinking)  Makassan itself is a strange bard like place not easy to find your way around but there are people to ask  Cheaper and quicker than a taxi I'll continue to use this

title: Trip in Thailand
review: It easy to go everywhere in Bangkok Asok station is not far from me can go to Jatujak market Very convenience i love transportation

title: Convenient
review: The bts in Bangkok is so convenient Just that some of the station to station is kind of expensive as I don't know how they calculate the price But overall is a good experience The only things is unfortunate was that I meet a un civilised Thai man who think he own the station giving unnecessary attitude on the day I was leaving Bangkok

title: very clean
review: very clean and very fast The Thai people are very helpful and very polite

title: Can be crowded
review: Outside of rush hour this is a very convenient way of going from the airport to the inner city During rush hour it is over crowded and you might miss a few trains before finding one with space to board

title: A great way to get around Bangkok
review: I have travelled on the BTS Skytrain many times and found it easy to use and very quick  Sometimes it gets very crowded but always manage to sqeeze in  Other times there are plenty of seats vacant which makes the journey more comfortable

title: Cheap and fast to airport
review: Wish there would be one to Don Mueang soon We travelled by airport rail link when we arrived and departed Good timing no need to rush and cheap from the last end station Phayat Thai to Suvarnabhumi airport only cost 45 baht one way per person This is my usual transportation from airport to the center whenever I came to BKK

title: Good service
review: Most times its crowded but still convinient and easy Some stations need to upgrade the ticketing machine to accept notes as well Especially asoka station

title: Get to the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link was a 15 walk from my Hostel You buy your ticket when you get to the station Inexpensive and fast way to get to the airport

title: great price - super clean
review: Have caught this about 20 times over the years They no longer have the express but the ride is still quicker than anything else

title: "DRC" not direct
review: I took the train from Chiang Mai to Bangkok I was really happy to get my tickets the day of but I think that was due to taking the day train and not a sleeper Basic service but I don't need much The guy in front of me was very fidgety which isn't usually a problem but every time he moved my entire tray jolted around because the seats are older I took the direct rail to Bangkokexcept it make about 30 stops making a 10 hour train close to 12 It got me from point A to B plus it was nice and cool so I gave it three stars But the stops I wasn't prepared for and less than sturdy seating prevented me from giving it more

title: Very efficient, crowded and economical
review: I only had one experience of the Skytrain of travelling between Siam and Nana It was easy to figure out  self serving machines with a counter to provide you change regular trains and sufficient exit points It was very crowded  and this must be so because it is good and reliable

title: Still Not an Attraction
review: I first reviewed the BTS in 2012 Back then I said that it was not an attraction but rather a transport network And that is still the case  Is it useful Yes Does it help one get around Bangkok Yes Is it a tourist attraction No

title: Well worth a day ticket!!
review: See how the other half travelsBeats the London Tube System  Hands DownYou would be MAD to miss the day ticket ride aound the cityAnd It goes to the Airport now

title: Insane easy means of travel
review: I recommend this means of transport to the major areas of the city it does get crowded and you must be patient

title: And buisiness
review: This is my favourite place to stay in Bangkok the staff are awesome friendly love kids The pool is well kept and the gym is up to date i train  here when we visit The sky train is adjacent clean and air conditioned The hotel is best to Erawan a holy and highly respected holy  place malls and street food are easily found  I recommend it

title: the best for to go around
review: Dear peaple that you you want visit Bangkok don't go with a taxi driver they try to bring around for to buy this and thatand the traffic is tragedyskytrain is the most easy way for to visit the city

title: Clean fast and efficient
review: Used this method on my last trip Well worth it faster than taxi and did not struggle with my luggage I will certainly use it again

title: Efficient
review: BTS is very efficient Conducters ensure boarding occurs in an orderly manner Air conditioned interior with maps over doors Would recommend Be sure to bring change for ticket machines

title: Busy
review: It was extremely busy and crowded  but easy to work out and get around

title: Amazing experience!
review: Our family had a wonderful time here in Thailand thanks to Ms Sara from Big Country Vacation She was such an attentive guide from the moment she picked us up till the end of the journey Love her cheerful attitude and extensive knowledge about the Mae Klong Market as well as the Damneonsaduak Floating Market Highly recommended 👍🏻

title: Easy way to explore Bangkok
review: Once you have understood the system and also the possibilities of the MRT connections which are attached to many BTS stops you can move easily and conveniently in Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: Very helpful especially with all the traffic jam We recommend everyone to take airport link first if you will go to the heart of bangkok and take taxi after much much easier save time

title: Really busy
review: A quick and efficient way to get around Bangkok Dont use it during rush hour if you are claustrophobic though as it gets really crowded

title: easy and cheap
review: A great way to get to and from the Suwarnabhumi airport even with a couple of suitcases It connects with BTS and you can get almost anywhere skipping the omnipresent legendary Bangkok traffic

title: Traveling through bts
review: Esiest way to travel and escape from the horrible traffic in bangkok But still have to have patient while traveling during rush hours because almost 60% of working peaple are using this bts and it is so crowd by 79am and 59pm

title: Great way to get around
review: if you get a day pass you can get on and off the BTS it save a lot of waiting in lines if you plan to stay longer than  3 days you should look at getting the top up ticket

title: Occasional, short and over-filled trains
review: This train could be a serious alternative to taxis and traffic jams It is not Trains run not very often and are therefore mostly overfilled A basically generous baggage are is hence full of people standing Announcement of stations is drowned in their chatter Also despite the fact that the stations could accommodate longer trains the current ones are just 3 or 4 carriages long too short So you there you go an expensive but totally underused infrastructure which would have a lot to gain fro better management

title: Timely, clean and safe
review: Bangkok has an extensive system of trains that wind into most neighborhoods of the city  We recently stayed near the Phloen Chit station and used the BTS to go to the weekend market at Mo Chit  The ticket vending machines are really easy to use and tickets like everything else in Thailand are very inexpensive  For first time riders don't dispose of your ticket once you get through the access turnstyle because you need it to get out of the station once you reach your destination  I would recommend the BTS to anyone visiting this busy city

title: Speedy, clean and cool
review: We went on 4 trips on the Skytrain  buying tickets was easy the lady spoke English sign posts easy to find trains cam often  Very clean fast air con is fierce and for us Europeans maybe on the cold side  Highly recommend

title: Best way to get to the airport
review: For just 40 bath you can get to the airport from pratunam in just 20 minutes Most convenient way to get to the airport  Although we had 4 bags of luggage we were able to manage  the staff is extremely helpful

title: Good system
review: Good way to get around as long as your place is near it Doesn't go to places like Khosan Rd Price is reasonable Bus is cheaper

title: Good but not the best.
review: Upside fast and convenient in the business and downtown areas of Bangkok However if you go across the river to the old city where BTS doesn't exist You need to take a taxi Also BTS is not cheap per se For example from Silom to Surasak it costs 25b person Imagine 34 friends taking BTS it is cheaper on taxi But then again it is not wise to take a taxi in these areas during the rush hours Downside you cannot buy ticket with the staffs You get the changes and then put the changes in the machine This system is not wellthoughtout and it is not connected to the underground system the MRT In addition it is not friendly with disabled peoplesenior people using wheelchairs

title: Fine
review: The Airport rail link is convenient for you to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport its not so expensive but if you want to go to the city you have to change to subway at makkasan station and the then change to sky train at Asoke Station Sometime are more difficult if you have many luggages

title: Easy,Cheap,Safe and Convinent to travel in bangkok via BTS
review: It is really Easy cheap and convenient to travel in Bangkok via BTS It connect to Suvarnabhumi airport via airport link and DMK airport by Mo chit station then take A1 or A2 bus to  DMK airport Frequency of BTS train is high and its well connected to all shopping places It connects to MRT through Mo Chit station Unlimited travel within the duration of a single day for 120 baht Ideal for tourists

title: Great rail system
review: This is a great system and I enjoyed using it Highly recommended if you are in the city center Is crowded so keep you bags close to you Barely any tourists

title: a real life saver
review: as a traveler in BKK for the first time or 100 th it can be very tricky to get around  to say the least  The B T S is a real life saver for everyone who takes it  It's easy to use  and very reasonable cost wise  and it's very clean and wonderful AIR CON for those of us who are melting  With the addition of the Airport rail way  life is that much easier for those who need help maneuvering through BKKpeace johnny o

title: Saving time
review: I can save time if I have to go to airport price is cheap  beat the traffic  but evening time is little too much rush But still ok

title: Fast
review: Great views of the city and as with all other Thai train travel well organised Took the metro from the airport and once we could got on the sky train to get us to our destination quickly much faster than a taxi

title: The way to go!
review: The train link was busy on our way back to the Airport but the transport was quick efficient and clean and at c£1 one way an absolute bargain

title: World Class
review: I actually lived in Bangkok Thailand when the BTS first opened  I also have lived in the US capital Washington DC and from the first day the BTS was every bit as modern and efficient as that DC system  I recently visited Bankok again and the BTS is as good as ever  Much more popular with goodsized crowds making frequent use  The system has upgraded with automatic safety gates at some of the more congested stations  It remains extremely clean excellent air conditioning  I actually select which hotel I will stay in in Bangkok based on how close it is to a BTS station I use it that frequently

title: Reliable
review: Easy to use DIY tkt machine Just remember to bring small notes to purchase tks You need to exit station  walk to another station and buy another ticket if you need to transfer train

title: the Airport Rail Link ends NO where???
review: The Airport Rail Link ends and there is NO connection Crazy You must hand carry your luggage down three flights of stairs then carry or row another 200 meters the pick up your luggage and carry your luggage down three flights of stairs to the closest mass rapid transit system  Not good NOT well planned Terrible

title: Convenient and fast way to travel
review: The Skytrain is a faster way to travel than by taxituktuk if you are in an area and going to an area that has a skytrain nearby  If there is a family traveling then you would need to decide if speed and convenience is what you need versus cost as you pay for each person  People line up waiting for the train and it's quite orderly and we found it ran ontime  Children enjoy traveling on the Skytrain

title: Great day out
review: Excellent trip although could have done with a bit more time at the train market and a bit longer on the boat but overall excellent

title: Meh!
review: The train travels at a rather slow pace but compared to other transit methods it's the best If you are in a hurry to reach Suvarnabhumi this is your best option

title: By far the best way to get into the city
review: Easy to access within the airport Check the route to your hotel first to see if it's the best option for you We have been to Bkk many times so are familiar with the Skytrain which links with the airport train and the relation of where our hotel was We had a couple of changes but easy peasy even with medium size luggage (Not for older people though)

title: Fast and Easy way to go around
review: Just like in other countries it makes it easier to roam around the city with these kind of transportation Very easy to follow routes and faster way to get you to another place You just hop in and hop out

title: Easy to get around
review: Really liked the Skytrain Its fast and convenient although there are many steps to climb if you are a bit infirm( not us thankfully)

title: I travel about twice a month on the Rail Link and because I join it at the Airport I most of the time are able to get a
review: The one big drawback is that the Station announcements could be a lot clearer Not just for me but for Visitors who use the train In most countries in the World the "Next station announcement is clearly pronounced and made more than Once Travellers to Thailand all understand a basic knowledge of the English language The majority of locals know where they are going but visitors seem to get confused at the time in what I have seen Many many times I have had to help them out Its no problem but most Thai people are too gentle to try and help someone who may be a bit lost

title: Fine until you get to the main station
review: The airport rail link is a fine idea however when you reach the main station it's nearly impossible to get a taxi to take you to your hotel condo etcThe taxis are reluctant to come there as they see the link as competition  The express train is fast and clean  The local which runs more frequently makes a few stops but takes only 10 min or so longer  However during the rush hours its very crowded  Hard to manage with bags when it's jammed with local commuters  The train is a good option if you're heading into Sukhumvit and traveling lightly You can now take a walkway to the MRT (underground station) instead of leaving the station and going down an access road and crossing train tracks on foot to reach the MRT  With large bags it's still a pain though

title: Fast way to get into town
review: This was great hopped on at the airport and off at the end then got a train to Central World Plaza this place is so big and there are 3 different buildings to get through There is all sorts here to do and see Madame Tussaud's and the Sea world are here also and a huge cinema Lots of shopping and eating outlets also great for filling in long lay overs at the airport It only takes about 20 min to get into town but be warned it takes longer to get back out and very overcrowded if it is peak hour it will amaze you how many people actually squeeze on at these times

title: Fast easy way to get around Bangkok
review: Even if it doesn't go exactly where you need to go better to take a skytrain most of the way there especially during rush hours Clean organized and safe

title: convenient to go any place
review: We visited Bangkok free&easy for 2 times 2011 & 2012 Each time we took BTS and subway MRT depends on where we want to go The train is clean The security for MRT is more strict than BTS

title: Easy to navigate, really cheap
review: The Skytrain is really easy to navigate and links Suvarnabhumi Airport to the centre of Bangkok We took it to and from Saphan Taksin walked down to the adjacent pier and took a free ferry straight down to our hotel from here  It was much cheaper than a taxi and with air conditioning much more pleasant than a bus

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: Great way to beat the Bangkok traffic They interconnect to the MRT subway at a few stations and it makes it easier to get around BKK

title: very convenient
review: Whenever you travel to Bangkok  should use BTS instead of taxi It's really convenientThe map showing very easy to find a right Station

title: Punctual
review: Excellent service It is very clean and quiet It is the only public service I have been on in the world where a group of cleaners get on board at stops litter pick and sweep the carriages whilst train is in service

title: First time take bts in bangkok
review: So much faster and cheaper to take bts in bangkok in view of their traffic Highly recommended to try (first try for me even I went bangkok for more than 5 times) imagine how much you can save if you are travelling alone Cab fare from airport to city need at least 600 baht vs bts (less than ~150 baht)😅

title: Funny, entertaining and informative !
review: Very nice trip with Sara  Informative und hilarious we hat a lot of fun ) Even did an extra stop at a temple because we had some spare time  Greets from Germany

title: An easy Aircondition way to get around
review: Although a little crowded sometimes this mode of transport is cheap & easy Getting change & buying a ticket from the machines is extremely easy A lot of the exits lead directly into the major shopping malls downtown so there is not a lot of walking to to to get to the shops If you get lost on this rail system Seriously give up traveling

title: Excellent & easy to use:)
review: Easy to work out where to go & how much it costs Generally very cheap

title: Sumeth
review: Very convenience for travelling in bangkok arrive your destination in predictable time You can go for shopping eating and sight seeing easily

title: Easy to use, gets you close to the city center
review: Title says it all Just buy a ticket at a vending machine or at the cashier's at the airport   In traffic hours it will be your fastest choice for getting into the city However often you will need to get a taxi from the train station anyway

title: Why Not!
review: A very efficient service which keeps you above the traffic snarls of Bangkok Not real great if you are elderly or have lots of bags

title: Easy access to all
review: Instead of getting stuck in the traffic and wasting hours use the Sky Train in travelling Very convenient and accessible No need to bargain with tuktuk or taxi drivers who will give you high prices It is very difficult to find an honest driver in Bangkok

title: Smooth ride
review: We went from sukhumvit to chatu chat market Comparatively a smooth ride for 25mins Neatclean and gave a safe feeling   There are many routes available and if the shopping areatourist area is near by station it's good to go by skytrain Avoid taxis during peak hours

title: save yourself time and let the train take the strain. Great a/c.
review: Save yourself time and let the train take the strain Much quicker than a taxi Great ac although I stood every journey

title: Fast and covenience
review: Since I had some time on this business trip I decided to take the train from the aiport into town What a great way to travel Cheap and very enjoyable too

title: easy to use
review: Very easy to use map tell you how much will cost for each station which is from 16THb59THB each way or you can buy day pass cost 120THB

title: It would be great if they ...
review: I have been using this facility since I live in Bangkok I have seen many change (new station new line etc) and I wish they will connect blue line & purple line together in to one line It would be easier for people who leave out of town using the facility (no need to go down the station and grab a bus for blue line station)  Service team are nice especially the one on purple line

title: Thailand 2016
review: The train is a great way to get around Bangkok It is clean and air conditioned Very easy to ride and it takes you to or walking distance to all the major sites  I did not ride it to and from the airport but that is an option   I highly recommend using the skytrain not a taxi or rental car for the sites do to the traffic in Bangkok

title: Awesome connection
review: Amazing connection very fast and right on time  high 5 for the service   higly recomend you guys if you wana go to city in quick time period

title: So easy and faster than a taxi!
review: This was our first time in Thailand The ticket machines are user friendly and the clerks at the counter are very helpful You do have to go to a ticket counter to get change as the ticket machines do not take paper bills Train is very clean and air conditioned We used the sky train 45 times

title: Disgusted!
review: I was totally disgusted with this service Treated literally like cattle the moment the train came into the station it was like we had 10 seconds to get on and off before the platform staff blew their whistles and we were pushed and shoved in like animals Apart from that it's a good link to have to the centre of Bangkok just extremely badly treated as customers I cannot for the life of me understand why the rush

title: Fun but confusing lol
review: Tried this for the first time Have to say it was confusing to begin with but that's part of the expireance of traveling to another country Just make sure you read the map correctly and if in doubtask The people here are very friendly

title: clean and comfortable
review: first i was confused how to buy tickets as i was carrying only paper currency but the staff at info desk very kindly explained about the coin for cash machine  the journey is through the heart of the city  keep lloking out of the windows

title: A must when visiting Bangkok
review: We really enjoyed ourselves It was a lot of travel to get there and back but so worth it I didn’t think they specified very clearly that to get there you get a mini bus and the local train there which was very hot and sticky The train journey is an hour long so I found it quite uncomfortable as I didn’t have a breeze from the open windows We only had about 30 minutes at the railway market so it was enough time to get a drink and walk the length of it but that was it You get plenty of time at the floating market including a boat trip and then 45 minutes after to walk around and grab lunch from the various food stands The day was 9am 330pm so don’t plan anything to do in the afternoon as you’ll end up missing it We would definitely recommend and our tour guides Tom and Chai were great

title: BTS is great!
review: We used the BTS transportation while in Bangkok  It is very convenient efficient and pretty safe  The map directory is self explanatory  The ticket agent will type out the amount of the ticket on the calculator so it isn't hard

title: A cheap and efficient way into town
review: An easy way from the airport into the city centre Seeing the traffic jams as we sped past made clear what the alternative was Regular departures good air conditioning and connections to other rail lines and the Metro Fare to the end of the line was 45 baht

title: easiest way into the city
review: the train from the airport stops at a few stations the last one interconnects with the BTS the trip is fairly fast and efficient

title: MRT expansion
review: While the existing MRT line connects both the Silom and Sukhumvit hotel districts with the weekend market it's nice see the line expanding under the Chaopraya and reconnecting with the BTS on the western side of the river which may ease some rush hour traffic on the skytrain

title: Perfect altenative for Taxi.... or better
review: For the first time we used this link to return to the Airport  As we were stuck in the city traffic we asked to drop us at one of the Airport Railway stations  Train was crowded but very efficient alternative for only 49 Bath

title: Nice Public Transportation
review: We took one day pass which is took aroud 140 THB With this BTS we can visit almost all of tourism destination in Bangkok

title: Entertaining with a lot of information
review: Very nice tour guide Bus in perfect condition Would have liked to have spent more time at the market Tour is very well designed Floating market seems very touristy and no longer authentic

title: Amazing Experience Railway Market and Floating Market
review: Our tour guide Sara was great We were given a schedule on what the day would consists of and Sara made sure we were on schedule She was very nice and made sure we were all taken care of She was also accommodating and helped me with my situation when I had to leave a bit early from the tour All in all great experience and I would recommend going

title: Very efficient and quick
review: Excellent way to travel fromto the airport and cheap too Carriages have air conditioning aren't overcrowded are clean and trains are on time and frequent

title: Best way to connect with BTS skytrain
review: If you are heading to downtown area touristic places or business area this is how you want to connect from the airport Is the best way to get to the BTS (that can take you to so many other places in the city)   It has a few other stops but the last one is connected to Phaya Thai BTS station Check exactly were you are going and which station is closer to your destination

title: An attraction?! Good transport though!
review: A good cheap way to get into city I hadn't been to Bangkok for three years and went to the lower level under the airport looking for buses into town They don't do them now So we got the airport link it was fast and cheap and got us within a cheap taxi ride of the hotel (which due to traffic took ages)

title: A very good transport option in Bangkok
review: Tired of Bangkok traffic congestions MRT is a very good options for moving around in the city It's easy to use runs frequent easy to orientate cheap and safe Combined with BTS skytrain your choices are even better

title: Quick and cheap
review: Get you right to the bts cheap och Quick check where your hotel is IF you stay in close to asoke get of at makkasan

title: Highly efficient, only insufficient seats.
review: Enjoy the bliss travel on the Rail Link  Love the fusion announcement on the rail  Will return again

title: Most convenient way to get into the city
review: Bangkok is famous for its rush hour traffic jams so this is really the best way to travel clean cheap and comfortable (if you are lucky enough to get a seat) Luggage seems to be no problem MRT station to change is Makkasan

title: MRT giving support to BTS
review: MRT is much more cleaner than BTS and well connected for transfers from BTS at ASOKE and SALA DAENG

title: Easy to yse
review: Beat the transport system in Melbourne Australia hands down  Announcements in both Thai and English

title: My Experience on the BTS
review: I found the BTS Skytrain to be very clean reliable and cheap  Loved traveling on it  I recommend it as a way to getting around

title: With a short ride.
review: During this part of our trip we were with a guide There is one section of the railway that is most popular with tourists and we rode that short section I think it’s worth it to ride the train before you go to the museum It’s pretty hard to believe what those men went through I would recommend  a short ride on the train

title: Perfect
review: A very easy easy system to beat the terrible Bangkok traffic Runs very regularly Clean Air conditioned First class

title: Easy way to get around
review: Easy to navigate super cheap and worth trying Hardest part is working out where to enter and exit the stations from Can get a little crowded

title: A helpful train
review: This was not first time taking this train to the Bangkok City yet I always enjoy the trip the trainsecurity check before the passengers get into was great

title: Totally nice traffic.
review: I hope that you must add one or more cars and escalators or elevators because most of all the travellers have heavy packages

title: Perfect way to travel to and from the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is a very efficient and economic way to travel to and from the airport Upon arrival we arrived we took a taxi from the airport into Bangkok The taxi was metred and we had absolutely no complaints at all with the service received When leaving Bangkok we decided to try out the Airport Rail Link We were not carrying loads of luggage and we discovered that it was not only a very pleasant and comfortable way to travel but it was also cheaper than the initial taxi trip Saving a few Baht is really neither here or there but the Rail Link gave us an opportunity to comfortably see a bit more of the outskirts of Bangkok The trip back to the airport seemed to take less time than it did in a taxi

title: Convenient
review: BTS is a convenient way to move around in Bangkok to escape from the traffic jams But if you have 2 or more pax it is actually cheaper to take a taxi for nearby locations within Bangkok city

title: Best way to travel
review: Bangkok is a busy place While taxis aren’t that expensive they get held up in the sheer wait of traffic We didn’t try the sky tram until our last day but wish we’d used it sooner Super cheap quick and fully air conditioned So much better than the London Undergound

title: Convenient and Punctual!
review: This is the very good choice to transfer to the city The train is fast clean There is a information desk nearby in case you need any assistance Would use Airport rail link again

title: Might be crowded
review: Might be crowded at times but trains are very frequent even if you miss the train you will not be waiting long to grab the next train

title: travelled as a group
review: there were 10 of us plus our guide not very much room for luggage but the bunks were comfortable except the top bunks seemed to get very cool in the early hours of the morning a good experience and would do it again but for $50 you can fly and be there in 90 minutes but if you haven't done it before its quite good fun

title: Cheap, air conditioned & quick
review: Cheap air conditioned & quick   It does get quite busy at peak times in the day and night but so worth it Better and cheaper than a taxi or bus

title: Good job!!
review: Very good service always in time Easy to use also for foreigners everything wrote on monitors

title: Good transportation
review: MRT bangkok easy to use and cheap for the fare very fast some of the MRT can connecting us to BTS line very crowded if using this MRT for busy time because local people there using MRT as the main transportation to go work you can pay the ticket at machine and it can accept not only for coin the Mrt was treated very well good job

title: Easy way of travelling in Bangkok
review: Taking the BTS is a good way to experience the daily lifestyle of the locals and it's also a good way to get around Bangkok too

title: from the aiport to the hotel.
review: infortunatelly the Sky train don't stop near the bed& breakfast so you have to stop at the last stop then take a meter taxi don't take a Tuk Tuk they will charge you and arm and a leg Also in the last stop you can go to the larges shopping centre in BKK good for electronoc and phones

title: so fun
review: We had an amazing time We made new friends and learned so much It was a great trip It was fascinating watching the train go through the market and we loved riding down the river at the floating market

title: Easy Way Around Bangkok
review: We found the BTS Skytrain to be easy and convenient The maps have English options and it was selfexplanatory to buy the tickets or tokens as needed We found the BTS Skytrain to be a great way to get around Bangkok

title: Convenient and easy
review: From Hualamphorn MRT station I took the train to Phetchaburi for 29 bahts and from Phetchaburi I alighted and walked to Makssan air rail station and took the train to Suvarnaburmi airport I paid 35 bahts for the journey The whole journey costs me only 64 bahts It is cheap and convenient The only set back is at Makassan station where I have to wait for about 15 mins for the train as there was a huge crowd and the first train that arrived was also crowded and cannot accommodate I waited for the second train which was totally empty The express train was canceled until further notice I believed it was due to the costly fare and poor response from commuters     In Singapore the train is card accessed but here in Bangkok a coin like disc is issued and used for train access I was quite worried that I have a hole in my pants' pocket resulting in the disc dropped out from my possession or accidently slipped out of my hand into the drain or gutters Nevertheless the disc is made of plastic and very light   I found it quite convenient and user friendly If you have problems with the machines just buy the tickets at the counter The counter girls are friendly and helpful

title: Best way to get to your hotel
review: Just use the Airport Rail Link for travelling from Airport to Hotel Way cheaper than Taxis Directions for the stations are well placed So you would not be lost

title: Easy way to get around. And with AIR CONDITIONING
review: Easy way to get around And with AIR CONDITIONING It is good if you are 1 or 2 but if you are more it maybe cheaper to get a taxi But at least you can miss Bangkok's traffic

title: Convenient transportation option
review: Bangkok traffic is terrible The sky train in this city is a god send Set up very nice and also cheap Can get crowded sometimes but it's not really a problem I have never had to wait for the next train to come because it was that crowded

title: Saves time and money
review: Tried BTS Skytrain on the last day of my nine day trip to BKK and realized that I saved good 1hour on roundtrip for my travel to Siam Paragon Mall from Sukhumvit and that too at almost 25% of original cost So if you are looking to save some time and money you should try BTS skytrain It covers most of the popular places and saves you from haggling with cab drivers most of whom don't want to go by meter when ferrying tourists

title: cheap, on time
review: The skytrain was at our front door and after initial trepidation was excellent You buy your ticket with cash but it took a little bit of time to workout the fare After that it was quick and cheap and exceptionally clean

title: Best day ever
review: Worth I loved it had really good time penny the Ásia lady she was very nice  Thank you penny I would definitely do it again

title: Great transport system
review: Living in London I have to endure the tube which is not the most pleasant experience Using the skytrain was a breath of fresh air literally the trains were spacious and air conditioned I don't speak any thai but found myself able to navigate perfectly as everything was simple and clear to understand  The skytrain is something I would definitely recommend as it is a fast cheap way to get around the city

title: Most convenient mode of transport
review: Silom line and sukhumvit line Do a review if ur place of visit is accessible by bts then make it the first option for local travelconvenient(not very cheap) prompt and good network

title: EZ Transport
review: Easy to find in the airport Ticketing can be a bit slow sometimes but the ground covered and the money saved are well worth a minor inconvenience or two

title: Great experience
review: Great trip to the railway market and the floating market This tour takes away the headache of finding a way to get to the market from Bangkok and also includes a boat ride through the floating market and train ride to the railway market Our tour guide was also great He gave us tips on how to bargain for souvenirs and food Would recommend this trip

title: Easy way to travel
review: An easy option for travelling around bangkok cheap and fast  Although try and avoid rush hour as it can be very cramped  Also not all stations have escalators so be prepared for many stairs

title: Convenient, efficient, inexpensive and perfect for getting around Bangkok
review: The sky train is without doubt one of the best ways for getting from A to B in and around Bangkok The trains are spotlessly clean have very efficient air con are punctual and frequent Designated areas to queue to get on thus allowing passengers to disembark The cost varies as to the distance you are travelling but staff are always on hand to help until you get used to the system A fraction of the cost of public transport in the UK What's more it's a bit of fun

title: Easy to Navigate
review: MRT was easy to navigate and inexpensive Beware It's crowded at rush hour People are friendly and helpful and with some persistence you can always find someone who speaks enough English to point you in the right direction if you don't speak Thai

title: Train great, market is a con.
review: This was an interesting tour loved half of it and the rest was a waste of time Pros Our guide was great entertaining and informative  The railway experience is fantastic and worth the tour for that only  Lunch was great and the staff couldnt be more helpful Cons the "floating" market part is a con  It wasnt a 'real' market  just a dummy one set up for tourists  Tiny and so so many boats  fumes exhausts you had to be careful you didnt get hit by large exhausts from other boats  Also all the stalsl are just selling junk and tourist stuff  which is just adding to landfill

title: Easy to navigate for English speaker
review: The maps are easy to read and understand for English speakers Trains come about every 5min so there's never a long wait  At the entry there are pay machines (easy to use) some don't take notes but the cashier will supply coins no worries  We were told you can only buy 1 journey at a time as in once you get off you need to buy another ticket & this seemed to be the case If you're making multiple stops then a day pass might be better value at 140 baht These were great for days when we were looking around town or shopping

title: Good and cheap way to avoid traffic
review: The BTS skytrain was a good and cheap way to get around parts of Bangkok The interior of the trains are somewhat like the NYC subways and at times can become extremely congested   The system to buy a ticket is a little tedious so make sure you keep coins as it makes the ticket purchase more efficient Trains ran regularly and smoothly

title: Very Convenient
review: Excellent Services though can get little crowded at times the Sky trains are at the same stations along with the Metro Airport Link trains thus making it very convenient to connect all over Bangkok at reasonable prices

title: Sky Train
review: We stayed quite a way out of the center of Bangkok near the Bang Chak station and used the skytrain every day for twelve days We bought a daily ticket every day and had full use out of it The train was always clean and they run often and it is easy to get to most areas of Bangkok Highly recommend

title: Nearest
review: The tour places are very nearest to the airport and the MTRSo its very easy to the travellers to enjoy it

title: Get Downtown without a Taxi
review: Airport Rail Link connects to MRT and BTS   Best way to get from airport BKK downtown if you don't have a lot of luggage

title: Sarah Is the best
review: Sarah Is the best guide that we ever had She Is very nice fun and skillfull We enjoyed the tour of floating market

title: Vacation trip
review: Loved it modern clean well organized  easy to read signs  No delays  Much much better than bus transit

title: Quick and efficient
review: BTS is a quick and efficient way to get around town particularly at peak hour when the roads are bumper to bumper   Gets a bit crowded but that's part of the fun (as long as you don't have to do it every day) A novelty for us tourists  Nice and clean and interesting to compare how people used to read the newspaper years ago on the train and now I did not see one person reading the paper but just about everyone had their eyes glued to their mobile phone screens and giving their thumbs a workout scrolling through content

title: easy access
review: very easily accessable well connected with city and major tourist places and shopping malls  reasonable price from 1040 baht per trip  very well organized

title: So easy
review: A convenient and easy way To travel around Bangkpk No trouble reading the maps and quite cheap Don't be frightened to try it

title: Easy, fast, clean and cheap ....
review: The Bangkok MRT combined with the Skytrain BTS are perfect tools to travel visit and explore Bangkok's most attractive sites First impression is the cleanness of the installation No graffities no trash no smell no homeless people lying around and no danger  the exact opposite to the ParisMétro For those with cars you have park and ride possibilities on the outskirt stations one of the most popular being "Lad Prao" station Not forget to validate the parking badge and get very reduced parking fee

title: The best mode of transportation
review: It's cheap and super comfortable to travel around the malls and many other attractions through bts Only problems is u cannot travel to old ie most of the temples and grand palace so get to bts saph an takin and then take the cheap Ferry to Wat arun and another one to go opposite of Wat arun walk from there to grand palaceferry is gona be less than 10baht

title: Cheap, and regular as clockwork
review: I was nervous to use at first but it was so easy so cheap and very reliable  100% better than anything the UK can offer

title: The only way to get around !
review: Easy to understand  busy but the quickest easiest way to get around The only thing we did discover is only buy a ticket you your destination  not beyond as the ticket will be taken on the turnstyle and not returned Cheap and Fast ( but a little crammed)

title: air conditioned and good infrastructure in Bangkok
review: BTS is the way to go in Bangkok Avoid the traffic and get there in air conditioned comfort It is easy to use if you can read English and connects you to the major parts of the city

title: Stunning Market Tours
review: Sara is such a treasure We have experienced one of the must stunning tours and she always had a smile and good recommendations on her hand Thank you very much

title: Freedom to move about
review: We found the BTS Skytrain an easy way to get around We purchased a day pass at the ticket window which enabled us to travel all day  Well worth it if you are moving around Bangkok  Although at times very crowded it was the most convenient way of travel for us  The ease with which you purchase your tickets and then hop on to an airconditioned carriage for your journey

title: Very convenient for tourists
review: If you are a tourist this is the way to move around the city with sight seeing and convenient locations also very cheap and avoidance of traffic it is perfect for every tourist planning to make the most out of bangkok

title: Great way to transfer from BKK!
review: If you fly into BKK airport this is a great option to get to your destination quicker and save a little money in the process  The last stop is at Pyathai station  Many get off here and then take a taxi to their destination or transfer to the BTS train  Tickets are 45 baht to get to the last stop  For any backpackers staying near Khao San Road area get off ay Phyathai and then a taxi there is about 100 baht  Just know there are a ton of stairs to get down  Not sure if there was an elevator  If you want to head to MBK mall or Siam Center for major shopping get a transfer to the BTS train after getting off at Phyathai  BTS takes you on local routes within Bangkok

title: Very comfortable
review: Great option to enter Bangkok and avoid traffic after arrival at the Suvarnabhumi Airport Monday till Friday you will have 5 connections per hour and Saturday till Sunday 4 times per hour

title: amazingly fast
review: This is the best way to see Bangkokvery reliable and inexpensiveand if you need to catch a bus to go somewhere  in Thailand go with the bts Also try to stay in a hotel in the Suvkhumvit 8 areaNice hotels towards the end of the roadand really good resturants I caught my bus at Ekami stop to Pattaya  you will have to walk to the bus station about 500 mts It was cheap and goodI also read where now it has a connection to the Airport but you may have to take a bus part way

title: clean and easy to use
review: The sky train is clean easy and very good to use to avoid the traffic  On the stations are counters and machine to issue fare tickets STEP BY STEP instructions Train are frequent and easy access and exits Puts some western tubemetro's to shame

title: When you want to get around fast
review: This is comparable with the tube in London exept that it runs above ground If you want to go places in Bangkok fast this is the travelform you should choose Quite often you will get stuck with taxis or any other motor transportation but the skytrain will get you there with low cost and high speed Easy to use and pay for Air conditioned

title: BTS is super crowded
review: Great way to get around a very congested city Good value Try to avoid during rush hour as it is so crowded it is very uncomfortable

title: Perfect way to travel in Bangkok
review: Easy and fast We have a rabbit card for years we are in Bangkok twice a year With this card travel is cheaper than with a single ticket  You have to charge the card every time with a minimum of 100 bath And most important no need to take a taxi they cheat you only and are very unfriendly Better take Uber if the skytrain can't bring you there

title: CLEAN, FAST AND EFFICIENT
review: One of the best ways to get around town Very easy to Navigate CLEAN FAST and efficient Signs in English Very inexpensive well air conditioned Another way to meet Thai people

title: Fast and comfortable
review: Since the traffic in Bangkok can be really Busy almost at every time of the day the bts is a really fast comfortable and Cheap Alternative Easy to use you can reach many of the Main attractions in Bangkok Give it a try

title: Usually great, rush hour can be challenging
review: This has revolutionized getting around Bangkok in the almost 20 years since inception  Clean simple and relatively cheap  Waits to get on trains at rush hour can be a problem sometimes having 23 trains go by that are stuffed to the gills especially at some of the main stations

title: Nicely Air Conditioned
review: Clean & efficient the trains came when they were supposed to The tickets were nice & cheap and the map was easy to follow The ticket office staff also spoke enough English to make purchasing tickets easy

title: “Amazing Asia Tours” was awesome, took  great care with us. “A” the tour guide and “Golf” the driver,safe,Knowledgeable.
review: The Company “Amazing Asia Tours” were wonderful Our tour guide“A” was very knowledgeable  He stayed with us all the time showing the history of River Kwai and Hellfire Pass The whole tour was very thought provoking One should read and watch articles of Hellfire Pass and the Japanese interment camps to get the full scope of the tour The visit to the  Don Rak War Cemetery in Kanchanaburi is a place of reflection of the sacrifices of those who were there Places you will see and experience are gently placed into the tour  that only you can make judgment of those terrible years of the war  We were cared for well fed and watered And the driver “Gulf” was very  knowledgeable of the area with safety in mind The large Van was new and very clean  Thank you again

title: Easy to navigate
review: Do yourself a favor and be sure to have bat coins most stations only have one ticket vending machine that take bills Help hint when choosing a station take note of the last stop of the line you want The last stop is how you know which direction to go

title: Great Mode of Transport
review: Cheap and very convenient mode of transfer to and from the international airport at suvarnabhumi Trains are on schedule and stops at least on stations the non stop train to and from the airport has been ceased

title: Great train system
review: Once you get your head around purchasing tickets (the chart shows a number at each stop  this is actually how much your 1way trip will cost in THB You then put your coins in the machine (coins only) and get your ticket) The train doesn't go everywhere but you can also take a bus taxi water taxi motor bike or tuk tuk for the rest of your journey

title: Really nice experience
review: We left at 6pm from Bkk to Chiang Mai 2nd class sleeping booths much more comfortable that night trains in France  The staff is helpful and comes to convert bed Restaurant is good as well you can eat a real diner in  the train Toilets are far from perfect We travelled with the kid and she loved this experience  And train arrived 15mn early )

title: Efficient Train
review: When in Bangkok BTS train system is still the best mode of transportation because of the traffic situation Thailand even with an efficient train there are still huge number of privately owned car   But the BTS is easier to use compare to that of HongKong and Japan  A rabbit card comes in handy the counter part of Octopus card of Hingkong

title: VERY CLEAN AND COOL
review: The BTS is the most economical and easy way to get around BKK   Very cool and clean  The whole station as a matter of fact is clean No drinks or food are allowed

title: Quick and cheap
review: Quick and cheap way to get around BKK Very clean and you get relief from the heat Easy to read maps and very good English over the intercom system so you don't miss anything

title: Easy Access to the city
review: When you travel light just take the airport  link to any destination in BangkokIt is faster safe and convenient You will definitely avoid the long traffic jams and cut short your travel time It closes at 11 midnight so plan your trips ahead if you plan to catch it You will be thankful

title: easy
review: i use this when i was in Bangkok it is very easy to use and helps getting around just like the BTS and the airport link if you need help the staff are very helpful and they will get you on your way

title: Awesome once u get the hang of it
review: Not for the untraveled but easy enough to work out  Fairly straight forward instructions Just make sure you have enough change and know what station you want

title: Old Lady Solo Traveller
review: MRT Bangkok Airport Rail Link  I started my first day of adventure in finding out how to reach Bangkok MRT by checking where the bus station is In short I got Bus #35 straight to Hua Lamphong and noticed it passes by the Chinatown  Upon reaching Hua Lamphong station my curiosity directed me to go to the last of the MRT station to complete its running details  In coming back I got off at Phetchaburi station where Bangkok Airport Rail Link a commuter rail line connecting Suvarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai (BTS) station via Makkasan Station  If only earlier I had the idea how to find this Bangkok Airport Rail Link I should have not spent that much and being scammed by the driver of the taxi from the airport If anyone asks me how to use the MRT and the Airport Rail Link I could save them lots of travel budget and time

title: Easy...
review: We stayed at the Chatrium and used the free shuttle to Sathorn train station where we got the Skytrainit was easy  clean  fast and air conditioned

title: Best mode of transport to beat Bangkok traffic
review: The best and the most effective way to travel within Bangkok We took day passes that costs about 140 baht per pass and that enabled us to travel across the Silom line and Sukhumvit line as many times as we could during the day  The BTS does get quite crowdes though during the peak office hours thats 7AM  9AM and 4PM  6PM   The BTS services start at 6AM and are operational until midnight

title: A peep into disappearing lanes
review: We had loads of fun at the tour Sara was very informative and helpful Though the food court did not have halal food option it did not affect the entire experience Highly recommended

title: Economical and fast way to reach the city
review: We used the rail link on arrival to Bangkok was pleasantly surprised with ease of travelling and quick it provides connectivity to the city center Only negative is its crowded to if you travel during office hours

title: Amazing! Use it and save your Money ! ❤👍🙏
review: The train located at the airport as soon as You get your bags and everything Don't get out of the building buy keep going straight (right side along the gates) then take the escalator 2 floors downstairs It's very easy to find the way and there are many signs to show you where to go 😊👍    You can go with Suitcases and large bags no problem  The train is very comfortable and airconditioned   The airport is the 1st stop so You will be able to find places to sit very easily   Don't be afraid if it's Your 1st time on the Airport train It's easy and every Thai Person and everybody who knows Bangkok use it ONLY You can use it too 🙂👍   Taxi from the Airport to Bangkok will be no less than 600700 Baht and the price at the train is only 3540 Baht for each Person to go to Nana  Siam area (Center of Bangkok)   The time from the Airport to Bangkok with the train will be around the 2030 minutes depends on what Stop You get off (With Taxi it will be around 3040 minutes and if there is a lot if traffic it can be a loooooong ride)     I recommend You to use the train and save a lot of time & money this way  If You are not sure how to go exactly to your hotel guest house ask them near what area it's located (which BTS stop)  get off at that Stop and walk if it's close or get a Taxi from the Station to Your hotel It's going to cost You 50 Baht (or a little more) in most cases All together (train and Taxi inside Bangkok) around the 100 Baht  👌😊👍

title: Rapid and efficient transit
review: The BTS and MRT undoubtedly offer the best means of transportation in the city Of course they can be quite congested at high travel times but people tend to be mindful and respectful to others They are clean airconditioned and inexpensive

title: Amazing Sarah's tour
review: So blessed to take part in Big Country Vacation tours organized by Sarah our wonderful Host  She was super kind  well organized and amazing Host   From moment we enter the Van we got smiling greeting and detailed explanation of Thailand and also the places we going   Good timing No wasting of time and give valuable info So much love and care to customer She treat as family We got water and snacks half way  She would say wht to avoid and what to buy   Good deal and happy to be part   God Lord Bless

title: excellent
review: Checked baggage in with Singapore airways at train station thought we would have to lug bags through train very handy to check bags in all the way to Adelaide from the train station Train was fast few stops and very comfortable

title: Easy Travel
review: Functional and clean Easy to use Got us where we wanted to go  easily I am amazed at how the elevated pedestrian sheltered walkway sits and functions seamlessly beside the BTS It makes the BTS less intimidating cos people have the choice of going on foot or on the BTS

title: Quick and Easy Travel!!!
review: Connects easily and convenient  I used this to connect the Airport link at Makkasan Saves me time and easily accessible

title: Easy
review: Avoid the terrible traffic and take the train only 35thb easy airconditioned and only 25 mins to town

title: Great way to travel
review: This is fun and makes travelling around Bangkok very easy   My only disappointment is that the windows are generally frosted or decorated in such a way that you cannot get a clear vision through them  Nevertheless this takes the strain out what would be some very long walks to really enjoy the city and at reasonable price but don't forget the canal system  its even cheaper and just as much fun but perhaps not as clear as where you are going

title: Very easy to use
review: Simple and easy to use not sure why when the doors open people from behind rushes forward making those people queing frustrated  Also take note of those rushing in to occupy the seats for elderly handicapped generally younger and pretend to be on their phone

title: Quick and easy
review: Don't bother with a taxi as you will end up stuck in traffic This is easy an easy and very quick mode and transport straight into the city which connects to the BTS or MTS  It is a very modern train with air con

title: Fast, cheap and hassle free way to travel
review: We always like to travel in clean air condition and efficient way to escape the notorious Bangkok traffic jam No need to sit the taxi for hours after travelling by airplane A comforting way to start our holidays

title: Easy access to many things
review: It was very easy transport but its maybe a bit limited when theres only 2 tracks

title: No step free access
review: We could not use the service as there was no step free access Everywhere there were steps to and from the train   Not disabled friendly at all

title: The most convenient way to travel around Bangkok
review: BTS is the most convenient way to travel around Bangkok Also the system from buying the ticket to the journey itself is very tourist friendlyno tourist will be confuse with this

title: Comfortable clean and fast!
review: Good transportation very clean the aircon a bit cold (for me) u can't drink or eat in in the sky train the price for ticket a bit expensive it will rise up by distance

title: Only way to travel
review: If you have a BTS station near your accommodation you have most of the problems of getting around Bangkok solved Best if you try to avoid the obvious peak travel times because locals know this is the most efficient and cool way to get around their city too Very good value and easy to combine with the river express ferries or the underground Keeps you off the streets and that has to be good Just make sure you have plenty of 5 and 10 baht coins to feed the machines to avoid the queues

title: Smelly Express (Bangkok to Chiang Mai night train)
review: Have you ever dream to travel into time and wakeup in Bulgaria in 1962 Here is your chance I know it's stupid to compare with Western standard but you should know what to expect I always try to be fair so I had picture so people would be able to judge by theself  To make a long stroly short the train in an old chinese train from the early sixties I guess and as never been clean since it's delivery Everything is falling appart and even if they provide clean sheets the matress and the floor are simply disgusting The bathroom well the odor will wake you up I travel a lot by train in Europe and northAmerica and I never experiance something like that I know the train would be late and we took it as and experience but knowing we would definitely have taken the plane for a few bucks more Up to you Better bring your breakfast  We (family of 4) had two connecting private room and a faucet the bed was to small for an adul a chldI dont understand why in those room they havent put a second bed If you are tall this will be very unconfortable I am 58 and this was limit

title: Easy and cheap.
review: The most convenient form of transport and easy to comprehend for any nationality Saves dodgy deals with tuk tuk drivers or cab drivers and gets you most of the common tourist areas

title: Great and great
review: Totally helpful for traveler its easy to use going almost everywhere in bangkok ACs are there

title: Comfortable train ride
review: The night train was surprisingly comfortable & I slept better on it than I did in many hostels I didn't order any food because it was overpriced

title: Best way to get downtown
review: If you know just a little bit about the MRT in Bangkok you will want to be sure and use this cheap efficient and fast mode of travel to downtown  But plan to pull your luggage to the transfer station

title: Efficient, Clean and Good Fun
review: We caught the hotel boat down to Saphan Taskin pier which interconnects with the BTS station of the same name When you walk up in to the ticket hall its relatively easy to work out the stations and tickets can be bought from machines or at staffed counters Tickets are bought for one way journeys (ie not returns) with the Saphan Taskin to Sian journey costing us 34 Bhat each Signs are in Thai + English and boarding very orderly Day or night you get good views of the city from the elevated tracks  If you want retail therapy head for Siam station where it is a hive of activity with a number of shopping centres plenty of places to eat and a cinema complex

title: Holiday in Bangkok
review: The best way to travel from the airport into the main station of Bangkok All the members of staff are very friendly

title: Convenient and easy.
review: Trains came about every 10 minutes to where we wanted to go Most of the signs had English translation so it was really easy to see where to go and how much to pay  Stops are really convenient to tourist destinations and it made a nice change just to pay a standard fare to get directly where you wanted to go rather than having to barter with taxi and tuktuk drivers

title: Avoid peak times
review: Fast cheap But be aware that locals use this train as well so peak times are crowded If you have a lot of luggage or hate crowds pay the 300 or so baht to catch an airconditioned taxi and save yourself the hassle of dragging your luggage through the train system Or leave early and avoid peak times Otherwise a great service  There are spaces beside each door to place luggage on the train but the locals use these as standing places so don't count on them being there in peak times

title: Very bright and cold!
review: We took the night train from Bangkok to Changmai as part of a tour  Although the bottom bunks were large enough and fairly comfortable it was freezing  I ended up walking up and down the train most of the night just to keep warm  Also I am not sure why they have to keep the harsh lights on fully for the entire night thus also preventing sleep  I far preferred the bus in Thailand having experienced that from Chumpon to Bangkok

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: Always use the BTS when getting around Bangkok Its cheap always spotless and a great way to see the city

title: Great way to get around!
review: Always use the sky train when in Bangkok Frequent and cheap beats all the traffic Could do with building a station at the airport

title: Fast and efficient
review: We used the airport rail link to get to our hotel in the city of Bangkok  It is fast efficient and easy to use  The only issue I would say is that once you get to the main metro lines if you need to change lines it can be a bit time consuming climbing stairs and escalators etc We also had to open our bags for security  For elderly people I'd say pay for a taxi If you're you g and carrying light bags give this a go

title: Great transport system.
review: As a couple and staying at the Rembrant Hotel it was a necessity to use as you can forget public transport due the traffic (you don't go anywhere fast)  It was easy to use clean and air conditioned

title: To do at least once!
review: Excursion to do if you are in Kanchanaburi The death train (in view of the thousands of prisoners of war who died under Japanese torture) is a real leap into the past Allow 100 Bahts per trip between Kanchanaburi and Nam Lok an hour delay at train departure no air conditioning and a cruising speed of around 50kmh No matter this train is an invitation to the past

title: Reasonable and time saving to travel Airport
review: The cost of travel doesnt save much while traveling to the Suvarnabhumi Airport but one would surely opt when running on a specific time schedule This is because of the unreliable possibility of Bangkok traffic especially when one travels for Friday evening flights

title: Always a great trip
review: The BTS continues to be the Best way to get anywhere in traffic clogged BangkokEven the signs to encourage people to get there faces out of their phones are a treat

title: simple and efficient
review: Covers most part of the city with frequent departures so you'll never have to wait long for the next train There are often a lot of people at the Siam station but with frequent departures you'll find it ok to wait for the next train Together with the metro this is the easiest and fastest way to get around Bangkok

title: No TRAFFIK Jams and quich and easy
review: If you are by a station or the forecast is for bad TRAFFIK to or from the BKK airport this is a great option We can catch a MTR train to Phetchaburi station then there is a walkway to Makasan Sky Train Station It is popular and depending where you get on the train and when it may mean you will have to stand but there is good space even with cases And from Makasan to the airport it is 35 Bart

title: Shopping trip in Bangkok
review: Took a few stops on the BTS skytrain and back to hotel All well and easy Most machines only accept coins which is a bit annoying Just go to the office to buy your tickets

title: Fast, cheap and easy
review: Brilliant mode of transport easy and cheap with the benefit of speed Very clearly marked in most languages  Great  train

title: Fast, clean and cheap
review: A good way to travel around Bangkok  The trains are new clean and air conditioned  It is quite cheap to travel around the city

title: a long slow day that was under pleasing
review: the fact were misrepresented  That goes from the beginning to the end  The "free hotel pickup" from my hotel which was listed on a drop down list on the tour site turned out that it didn't happen  Was sent a text message  in the afternoon prior to the date of the tour that they would not be picking me up  Instead our party of 4 was to receive a rebate of $600 total to make our way to the departure site on our own  Sadly this never happened not that it was very much  The tour was advertised as ending at the origin site  Turned out we were dropped 25 minutes by taxi away from where we started  Most of the day consisted of a several very long  (hours long) bus rides  Did have some cold water on board

title: Fast and efficient
review: A good way to travel around a busy city  You purchase tokens from a machine and use them as tickets  Easy to use quick and comfortable better than road I think and I got a seat

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Although taxis are relatively affordable the skytrain is super inexpensive and very convenient  Stayed at the Sheraton Sukhumvit and the train was right outside

title: Holiday
review: A great service Very reasonably priced and easy to Navigate on the two lines destinations cover most of the key tourist hotspots in Bangkok

title: Railway Market - a must see!!
review: Great trip Sarah was a lovely tour guide Very informative and helpful Lots to see on the tour The Railway Market in particular was amazing

title: Good commute
review: Great commute in Bangkok and at a very good price The only criticism is it doesn't extend throughout Bangkok because the traffic is a nightmare

title: Ok but
review: Gave this service a try for the first time from the airport The service was good and on time but very crowded however we were in peakhour at 530pm We were travelling onto to Banglamphu which is 6 kilns past the last stop Phaya Thai We then had to get a taxi which took about 15 mins at the rank to get one as no driver wanted such a show fare at that time In the end the whole trip to the hotel took just over an hour which is he same that in normally takes in a taxi at that time however it was a good experience that we have ticked off We won't do it again as it was difficult with bags due to the crowds however if you are out of peak hour or are only going to the inner city it may be better

title: Fast and efficient.
review: Great way to get up and down  Cheap and fast  Cutting out the nightmare Bangkok traffic down below  Essential if you want to get around at rush hour

title: Easy way to get around
review: The skytrain is an inexpensive & relatively way to get around Bangkokespecially due to the heavy vehicular traffic @ all times of the day & night  It does pretty much go everywhere a tourist will go

title: Use it!
review: It is the easiest most economical and definitely most environmentally sound way to get to the airport It is either glide over the city or sit in a taxi in traffic jams and foul air

title: Cheap and easy
review: This is the only way to travel around Bangkok  It’s cheap and easy if you have used something like this before (being from the uk I have used the underground)   Plenty of space But can get busy during peak times

title: Avoid the traffic
review: Use the train anytime you are in Bangkok stations all over the cityall instructions are in English + Thai so you wont have any issues Trains do get busy and full quickly but people wait in line to board and Thai people are friendly a simple excuse me or thank you when they move out of the way goes very far for them

title: Easy and clean
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Just ask someone to ensure your on the right platform if unsure Very clean and fast

title: Same facility with BTS
review: Their staff very helpful even they cant speak English fluently I really appreciate with their kindness

title: BTS - Bangkok Sky Train is THE way to travel across Bangkok
review: If you hate sitting in traffic even in a funky tuktuk then the BTS is the way for you to travel above Bangkok's congested streets It's not spectacular by any means but so functional and nicely air conditioned

title: Shopping BKK
review: Very efficient to avoid the traffic and much less expensive than taxi or Tuk Tuk but you need to go on sukumvit if you have to go inside some soi you have to walk

title: BTS beats the traffic any day
review: Bangkok’s BTS is currently being upgraded and delays are expected but if you want reliable public transport at a reasonable price in air conditioned comfort above the gnarling traffic then this is the only way to travel And it’s easy to buy a ticket or better still to use a Rabbit pay card that can be topped up whenever you require it  The BTS is expanding so there are more stops being added and it joins up relatively seamlessly with Bangkok’s MTR or modern underground

title: OFICIAL THEFT BY RAİLWAY STAFF
review: airport ratchapatrop 40 baht pp but the staff sells tokens ın 19th of september 2015  7 am ın the morning  took another 80 for single journey  had to pay 80 baht pp but staff took extra 80 baht  so ıt costs 160 thai baht for 2 for single journey We went police at airport but they send back to railway link office no luck to get Money back so beaware of staff who steals your money  so my advice get 100 baht give it to staff to take100 baht in  coins and use machine to get your token  machines gives change back we used machine from same station to go back airport on 27th of september 2015thats how we realized we had been cheated oficially

title: Airport link
review: It's good way to go to airport but we got stuck during travel After small waiting the train continued to move Always prepare enough extra time )

title: Rail link best way to get to city
review: Inexpensive option to get from the International airport to Bangkok as long as you don't have massive amount of luggage

title: Ease of transport
review: Puts our rail links in the UK to shameThis system is so fast and efficient and costs pennies to travel above the city to your destination or nearby Can be busy at times but that's what its all about  Make sure you have coins for the machine to get ticket as you will have to queue to get change

title: Economic and faster
review: BTS is economic and faster way to travel in Bangkok There are around six lines which connects to each other For going to wat pho you can take sky train up to Safal Taksin then boat ride from there

title: Great transportations
review: The only real way to transport you around BKK No traffic jam no nearmiss car accident just predictable and easy Very cold due to aircon  remember a shirt

title: Quick and cheap!
review: Used the airport link on both our trips to and from bangkok city Trains are very often cool and times are reliable Due to Bangkok's traffic issues this is a great option and ensured that we met our departure flight on time

title: Best out of 3
review: This mrt kinda like subway much better than bts and arport link not much people clean big space and definitly not packed

title: Pefect example of fast and efficient metro transport services
review: Although we are from the country and not overly familiar with metro transport systems we were very impressed by the skytrain in Bangkok Clean efficient organised and extremely easy to use We had a private bridge to our hotel at Sathorn which was very convenient at the end of a long busy daystepping straight from the station into the hotel Ticketing systems were very easy to use and staff very helpful

title: Effortless
review: I had downloaded a map before leaving and found it very easy to follow  Used the service several times during our stay in Bangkok  Used the service counter and machines to purchase tickets very easily

title: Hat Yai to Bangkok Train
review: At first I was disappointed when there were no cheap seats available but I was pleasantly surprised to have a city place to sleep on the 16 hour train ride  The train had fans and AC food and drink vendors bathrooms and people to convert your seats into beds

title: Convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: Rail was very clean and very well organized It was simple to follow and air conditioned Definitely recommended taking advantage of this over taxis and tuk tuks

title: Cool and quick
review: The best way to get around Bangkok inner city at the moment new routes are coming on line in the next few years  Fast and efficient airconditioned coaches to take you around the city

title: Just Horrible! Even the First Class
review: Dirty compartment cockroaches climb the wall old and worn out train…14 hours driving…NEVER AGAIN Do not recommend to anyone

title: The biggest blessing for Bangkok
review: Avoid car at all cost Use BTS its fast efficient and air con system is so efficient u may need a light cardigan or shawl  Expensive by Thai standard but the best way to get around n have nice view of all the places in Bkk

title: Best medium to travel in Bangkok City.
review: BTS Sky train is the best way to travel with in the Bangkok City It is very convenient and clean  AC  train moving across main city area The cost is not too much as compare to its service It is always better to use BTS than Taxi to avoid traffic jam The best service that BTS offer is coming to City from Suwarnbhumi Airport  Just 45 THB to reach the city center comfortably from the international Airport

title: Informative staff
review: The skytrain is very fast and clean But One great thing about the skytrain is that they have a well train team of customer services    For example if you ask about one destination you want to go they can tell you every accurate instruction to there Not only which station to switchgo down then which gate to out and also how to walk there it is very accurate and much needed infomation

title: Cheap and simple
review: If you are keeping costs down on your trip this is the answer The rail link travels from the airport to the BTS station where you can sky train to your hotel The service is always on time and has great views of outer Bangkok as you travel towards the CBD I think in all ways it is comparable to any rail link in the USA or Europe

title: Good but taxi advisable to reach airport or hotel
review: This train is relatively fast and nice to ride on but usually you will need a connection to transfer to your hotelplace of residence I advise a taxi to reach your hotel in case heavy luggage with you (only about 500 BHT to reach Bangkok center)

title: The best option
review: To reach airport from city go to Phaya Thai BTS from where you get a direct train to Suvarnabhumi airport for just 60 Baht It takes 45 mins from Phaya Thai station Tip Super Rich currency exchange (for best prices) available on same level

title: good, fast, efficient, after you get to the station
review: The skytrain is great  It takes you exactly where it should runs efficiently and has a lot of people riding it  Everyone waited patiently for people to get off the train before boarding  That being said it is not uncommon that you will not get a seat due to the large amount of people on the train  Be prepared to stand for the length of your journey  Also it appears that there is a travel card available (called the "rabbit" card)  We did not have one and waited in multiple lines to get tickets to go between stops  If I were to do it again i would have asked and grabbed a rabbit card for our family members  note  the skytrain does not go to the main tourist attractions (reclining buddhagolden palace)  I would recommend taking the skytrain all the way to Saphan Taksin and then taking the water taxi to "Tha Chang" (pier N9)

title: Top choice
review: Within its service route if you are 2 or 3 in a group in theory to take a taxi is cheaper than take the Skytrain but the Bangkok traffic makes it nearly impossible you will sit in the traffic and the meter is still running it takes longer and more money to reach your destination

title: No escalators or elevators
review: The minus of BTS I think is there is no escalator or elevator that bring us to the BTS stations Only few stations have elevatorsescalators It helps a lot for passengers especially if we bring kids or big luggages

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
