review: This is a great way to get around the city A bit daunting the first time we used it but there are plenty of staff to help you find where you want to get to After that first time we found it so easy It can be crowded but all cities are like that Very cheap

title: very convenient
review: Convenient mode of transport connects many shopping malls nightlife areas etc  However it has a silly system of obtaining coins from the counter and then using vending machines And these machines dole out one ticket at a time so even if you have to buy more than one you will have to repeat the process all over again  The process itself is intuitive and hassle free crowds are reasonable so its  a pleasant experience overall

title: fuss free and cheap
review: it's convenient and a cheaper way to beat all odds (the never ending traffic jam)it's fast and safe 40baht to most station

title: helpful way to get around
review: Bangkok is a sprawling city so mass transit is very helpful for both time and price  Taxis are not expensive but they can easily get caught in Bangkok traffic During rush hour though it can be packed and you will have to wait 34 trains to be able to squeeze in so plan accordingly  Most attractions are close to the train lines and the river taxiso you can stay at a nice but less expensive hotel and take the train and save a bundle

title: Pyathai
review: Very nice airport link form the international airport to pyathai station from here you can take the skytrain to all directions where you want to be Very good for the backpackers and the people how come often in Bangkok

title: Interesting tour to go on
review: Such a worthwhile tour to go on Tee was a knowledgable and entertaining host Spoke English well and was funny too Lots to see and buy at both markets and I can recommend the pad thai for lunch at the floats markets Take 5 cent pieces with you to the floating market cause you’ll need them to use the toilet

title: convenience on a click
review: very close to all locations and main hotelsour nearest station was asokefrom windsor hotelBEST AND MOST CONVENEINTFASTEST MODE OF TRANSPORTanytime better than taxis

title: Jam packed!
review: There were too many people on the train market was so busy and it was uncomfortable Floating markets were ok and enjoyed the experience However the tour guide dropped me off right in the middle of Bangkok instead of back at my hotel where I was picked up from Tick that box don't have to do it again

title: saves so much stress
review: The new link from airport to city is so easy and if you've been to Bangkok before and used the sky train you'll know what I'm talking about it cheap fast direct no fuss no hassle and beats sitting in a taxi The train is very well air conditioned and comfortable with plenty of room for luggage There are staff on hand at the airport station always willing to help you buy tickets and assist where they can The Thai people always smile and it spreads like an infection that by time you go you'll want to return

title: BTS is Fast, Safe and Convenient
review: If you are travelling to Bangkok traffic in this city one of challenge In order for you to manage your time more effective BTS is one of the best options for you to be familiar with BTS is fastsafe and convenient as the stations are located in all business district city center pier transportation transit eg MRT Pier Airport raillink etc Free map is provided for free at ticket box at every station  the officer also speak English at communicative level who will help you execute your journey or inquiry Ticket options are available at per pass per trip per day and per month and refill credit system You can contact the ticket box for assistance Apart from ticket box BTS also provice automatic ticket vending machines accepting both coin and note for paying  Bemindful that every Mon  Fri during 69am and 47 pm BTS will normally be crowded please repect and stay in the waiting line Food & Drink are not allowed in BTS Eldery pregnant woman or you students normally be given empty seat as priority If Buddhist stay in BTS normally lady will stay away or not stand close or next to monk  it is taboo according to buddhist precept  Last but not least every day at 8 am and 6 pm the national radio station will play Thai National anthem its spirit and culture of Thais to stand still in proper posture with respect in Thai nation till the song completed before moving forwards Good luck and enjoy the trip in Bangkok city of angles )

title: Easy travel in Bangkok
review: This has made so much difference to getting around the city quickly Everywhere is beautifully clean & it's easy to understand the routes & purchase tickets

title: Clean and efficient way to leave the airport
review: I've used the extension of the BTS system a couple of times It connects the airport with the Sukhumvit area of Bangkok via the existing BTS skytrain When I have used it it hasn't been the fastest service in he world stopping at several stations along the way and taking around 30 minutes from terminus to terminus But it is clean and comfortable and very cheap Only a few bahts So it has its uses but I still use a taxi when I arrive in Bangkok Why A taxi can take only 40 minutes to Sukhumvit on a good day out of rush hour I don't have to lug cases around and its a airport to hotel door service A taxi may cost 300B to Sukhumvit  but you can relax and just let the driver do all the hard work If you are travelling kight or backpacking where travelling between stations on foot isn't a problem then the airport link will be for you

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok without having to endure the infamous heavy traffic especially when they are building and extending BTS and MRT lines all over BKK Nice and coolno smell of food as you're not allowed to eat or drink on the trainIt can be very crowded at peak timeTo most tourists from EuropeUK USA and Australia etc the costs are very reasonable or quite cheap but to the Thais with average incomes I would imagine that it's rahter expensivetoo expensive

title: Works efficiently
review: I used it from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Ratchaprarop (Pratunam) and return back to the airport few days later too  Generally coming from the Airport is easier and less tense as there are no rush factors and more transportations are available Naturally you do not feel that stressed and you are able to enter the train and there you go to your destinations On my return trip it was 1545H Bangkok Time at Pratunam and I was supposed to check in at 1740H As it was a weekend getting a taxi or shuttle service may prove futile as the jam outside is really bad   So I went for the ARL instead I missed the one from Ratchaprarop ARL to the airport as it is too packed to accommodate even one thin fellow in the train cubicles Out of desperation I went to take to the next station Phaya Thai which is the terminal station of the entire ARL line and from there bounced back to Ratchaprarop and Suvarnabhumi airport You will be surpised that some of the trains have highrail like seats   Transportation costs are saved and prevent Taxi drivers from quoting us ridiculous prices BKK is made easier to travel with ARL BTS and MRT

title: Crowded
review: Busy during peak period though quicker than sitting in traffic Caught the BTS at 830 am and we were packed in like sardines

title: Very convenient
review: Took this link to the airport from my hotel in downtown Bangkok and it was quick easy very econonomical and an easy fast way to get to the airport

title: Great day out
review: Really great experience and our tour guide Victor was lovely very knowledgeable and friendly Definitely recommend this trip to first timers in Bangkok

title: Perfect
review: The best way to go between the airport and the city It is fast and clean Like all public trains in Bangkok it is easily accessible modern and well maintained

title: Clean and efficient
review: Trains run at an amazing frequency Every single train and station is super clean The daily unlimited pass is just 140 THB  all in all excellent value to get around most sights in BKK

title: Great way to travel
review: Easy to use cheap to use rapid service and a perfect way to see the city  Yes it gets busy late afternoon but other than that it's all good  We used it everyday while in Bangkok and it's clean comfortable and fast

title: Few days in bangkok
review: Fantastic great service very clean good value for money I use it all the time  Shame we not have a service like this in the u k  Mike

title: Train
review: It was very easy to use the BTS train It's clean and efficient but very crowded Also very inexpensive Great way to see Bangkok

title: Getting in and out of Bangkok from  Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: The Airport rail link goes directly to the BTS Skytrain and allows you pretty good access to the major areas of the city where the hotels are located I stayed in Silom area and it only took me 40 minutes to get to the airport from my downtown hotel Transfer is easy and fare very cheap

title: What a great way to travel!
review: Using the skytrain certainly beats having to haggle with TukTuk and taxi drivers Cheap clean reliable and best of allno traffic jams

title: Airport Link
review: great service if the destination you are going to is near to a train station quick and cheap otherwise  you are better off getting a taxi with a meter from the airport to your destination

title: The fastest way to go to airport and back
review: I booked a room in Baiyoke Boutique Hotel and just went by wark to go up Airport Rail Link it took about 5 minutes to go the and about 30minute to Suvanibumhi airport

title: Save your money and use the Airport Rail
review: Was able to get to the Airport with no trouble at all from the Asoke Station (Sukhumvit Line) From there are quick ride to Phaya Thai Station (34 Bhat) and then a 30m ride to Suvarnabhumi Airport (50 Bhat) Roughly $3CAD for the entire trip Quick Clean and Easy Save your money and use the rail

title: Clean, efficient, comfortable - but tickets are a pain!
review: It's ridiculous that you have to buy tickets each time you enter rather than buying a ticket for a certain amount of money and reusing it until the money is gone  And at the ticket booths they give you change to use in the automatic machines but they won't sell you an actual ticket  Lines can be very long both for change and for the ticket machines

title: Very easy to use to get from the airport to Bangkok
review: Very easy to use to get from the airport to Bangkok for only 35 Bahtif you get of at Makkasan it is quite easy to switch to the Metro

title: Convenient but too crowded even off peak
review: Gets around town quite conveniently but all too crowded even during off peak hours  def beats taxi or other means of transport

title: Sky train
review: We used the sky train several times to get around Cheap way to get around and faster than taking GRAB or Taxi Bangkok traffic can be crazy

title: Sky Train in Bangkok
review: Cheap easy to work out air conditioned Handy to our hotel

title: no elevator
review: in some station has no elevator so it's too bad for my mom no taxi stand at Punnavithi station so it's difficult to find taxi

title: Forget the Taxi
review: If you're staying in the main centre of town forget trying to get there with a Taxi and take the Airport Rail Link It's cheaper and faster I'd only ever consider not taking this if I had masses of lugage

title: Get the Stored Value Rabbit Card if you are in town for a short while
review: Great way to avoid the traffic jams and taxi drivers Just be sure to get the Rabbit card so you can avoid the horrendous lines at the ticket machines during peak hour

title: Easy
review: The Best way to get around the City Quick and Easy and its Air Conditioned Can take you to most parts of the City

title: Best way to travel
review: The best way to beat the traffic in Bangkok The skytrain travels above the traffic and quickly moves from station to station Trains are frequent  every few minutes They are airconditioned clean and comfortable  Carriages are often crowded but this is not a problem as standing is an easy option as well Be aware that you often have to walk up many steps to get to the train platform but the speed of getting to your destination is well worth this slight inconvenience (Many of the stations do have escalators) Prices are reasonable and the stations cover a wide network of the city

title: Absolutely firstrate!
review: Every large city should have one of these  Very easy to navigate Very clean safe and no long waits between trains If you don't have a card you get your ticket from the machine which only takes coins  Go to the window and give them a bill tell them the stop you are going to  They will give you change and tell you what the fare is for instance 42 and they will give you change for your bill  Then you go to the machine press the button that corresponds to your fare insert the coins and your ticket comes out Save it after you get in because you will need it to get out once you reach your destination   And very important  it is air conditioned

title: Simple
review: The sky train is simple and efficient   It services many popular hotels and the main downtown  The system is easy  Find your destination stop on the map next to the ticket machine   It will have the number of baht you must pay   Select that amount on the ticket machine and enter coins only to pay  It will give back change  Ticket pops out lower left   Insert the ticket in turnstiles arrow end first  Retrieve ticket and pass thru   You will need the ticket to exit at your destination where turnstile will keep your ticket

title: Modern and easy to access metro line
review: very modern and safe way to travel through the city more modern than in all cities I know in Europe or USA Unfortunately there are not enough lines yet

title: Efficient and Cheap Transport
review: Clean efficient and frequent mass transit system  Staff can understand and speak fluent English  It's amazing that they offer fare concession (half price) to commuters over 60 whether they are locals or foreigners

title: Fast w/a ViEW
review: I'm from San Francisco  To get from my San Francisco home to SFO airport I took public transportation  Let's just say that the Airport Rail Link is much smoother & has a better view  Very impressive

title: Transportation
review: Very good transportation facility to travel around Bangkok Try to by the Daily pass and you will save a lot of money using the ticket machine was very simple

title: A quick route to the centre of Bangkok
review: This is definitely the quickest route from Suvanabhumi airport to the centre of Bangkok You can travel non stop to Praya Thai station from where you can access all parts of Bangkok The only problem is if you have suitcases or small children all lines are very busy especially at peak times

title: Is a normal sky train, with nice view of the city
review: If you have the chance use this just to see the view of the city  The train is nothing special but is easily accessible

title: Very Convenient
review: I travelled to Bangkok in 1980 and thought that I would never go back as the traffic was horrendous My husband had never been so we visited and have visited quite a few times since then The Skytrain makes travelling in the city much easier At times it is very busy but it is airconditioned and one can get to where one desires quite easily They have continued to extend the area that is covered by the Skytrain

title: Well organised, a wonderful tour guide
review: I had such a great time on this tour Sarah was so funny and a wonderful guide The trip was interesting so many great photo opportunities and the locals really appreciate you being there in the postcovid world They need us to visit and spend money there again It's definitely a 'touristy' trip but the markets are famous for a reason I've never seen anything like them before

title: Why wouldn't you use this? !
review: Excellent transport link from airport to central bangkok Cheap also From there you can change to go where you want or get a taxi once in central

title: Airport to downtown Bangkok in 20 minutes!
review: This is simply the best option to travel tofrom Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi airport if you don't carry big or plenty of luggages as it is fast cheap and connects to Bangkok's BTS (elevated rail) and MRT (subway) systems

title: Efficient effective way to connect to MRT and BTS rail lines from Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK)
review: Located basement at Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK)  Has Baht coin  note machines or staff counter to get ticket    Expect train to be full during BKK peak hours as used by office staff commuters  I use as safer (excessive speeds on freeways) and potentially cheaper than a taxi

title: Good and fast.
review: The best way to travel in Bangkok Fast Clean cheap and friendly Taxi want Tbh 200 when fare for 2 on the BTS is Tbh 74 and no traffic jam Use all the time great way to travel in Bangkok

title: MRT
review: Like the BTS this service is tops Very clean and modern airconditioned carriages  gets quite busy at peak times  but thats to be expected

title: Great system
review: It's getting busier but also getting better  Each year goes by and every time I go to Bangkok the bts is more fluid like  The staff are getting better with directing people including the silly farang

title: Freezing cold on Hot and humid
review: The skytrain is a nice way to get around Bangkok but when you are outside in 100 degree 100 percent humidity and then you get on to this "freezing" train well  it is also a little on the expensive side compared to other cities and particularly compared to the cost of most everything else in Bangkok

title: Clean, spacious and efficient
review: If you are travelling in groups of less than 3 the BTS Skytrain is costeffective Clean spacious fast and efficient Do give it a try it is quite a pleasant experience It goes above ground so you get to see the entire city buildings below you and watch as the scenery changes You can take it from the Suvarnabhumi Airport to the main city area And from there take a taxi to your hotel

title: Fast, efficient, and they're actually nice to you!
review: Took the skytrain to get to the mall it was pretty affordable and we got there pretty fast We didn't know exactly what to do we had to get change to buy a card and then use the card to go through the turnstile Since we had to transfer we asked the train workers who were stationed on the platform Even though we had the language barrier pointing to the map helps a lot He was very helpful and explained we had to transfer at  a certain stop by pointing to the bigger map where we saw the connection No english needed Very helpful I even saw the train workers help a blind woman into the train and then radio to the next station that she was arrive so someone would be there to help her off the train The train itself was clean and had the AC blasting It was pretty fast and during rush house it's packed kinda like NYC but the people aren't rude Pretty fast and efficient I'd take it everywhere if they went everywhere

title: Very fast and effiecient
review: Made use of the airport rail link to get to the airport for our return flight home As we were staying in Sukhumvit it was extremely handy to get to the airport rail link as it was only one stop away from us on the BTS The airport rail link journey only takes 15 mins to get to the airport as its a direct nonstop service however it only runs every 3045mins so if you miss one you have to wait a while for the next However it was great as it's quicker and cheaper than taking a taxi and you're guaranteed not to be stuck in traffic which is always crazy in Bangkok  As it's an express train and costs a little more than the standard train it was practically empty which was great especially when you have your baggage with you Would definitely recommend and will be taking this mode of transport the next time I'm visiting in Bangkok

title: The coldest aircon!
review: Good aircon need change for machines Don’t push ticket back into machine by accident You’ll have to buy another on Not that busy either

title: Best way to get around
review: Used the Skytrain a few times Great way to beat the mental Bangkok traffic It is fast & efficient Good way to get to the various parks around Bangkok & of course the airport

title: excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: This is such a great service They used to have a weekly pass which was ideal for traveller's who were staying a week this time got daily passes and these were great too and cheap

title: Quick tour
review: The sky train is very comfortable and it helps u reach ur destination very quickly beating the traffic Since it was near our hotel hence we used this many times to communicate within the city

title: Personalised touch
review: This was a great personalised full day tour our guide Rudy went over and beyond to please us Gave insight into Thai culture but most importantly was well versed on the places we visited Highly recommended and thanks for the birthday cake Rudy

title: A quick way to go around Bangkok
review: The Bangkok sky train is the fastet way to move in this crowded city It is well organized clean with clear indications I found it a little bit expensive but worth the expense if you want to save time

title: Skytrain
review: The lifeline of Bangkok Away from the unpredictable traffic of Bangkok From one end to the other end in minutes and in comfort Try the Airport Link its excellent

title: Easy way to travel.
review: Easy way to travel around Bangkok  Only issues is the only maps i could see were up on the walls would have been nice as a tourist to have a paper copy linked to the MRT  Side note not allowed any food or drink on the BTS

title: Modern rail transportation
review: Clean efficient safe very affordable airconditioned public transportation in Bangkok All day pass was only a few US dollars equivalent

title: Take it. If it doesn't go there go where it does.
review: The Skytrain ( BTS) is the only thing that works in Bangkok Taxis are great but trapped in  the traffic the model for Gargantua Canal boats also work  if you're on a canal or were born in Bangkok the only ones who know the system Motorcycle taxis also work  if you're "man" enough to take them   BTW  watching a Thai lady riding pillion on a motorcycle taxi through downtown traffic "sidesaddle" should be on everyone's Bucket List  As the title says If in Bangkok and you need to get somewhere pray that the Skytrain is going your way If not change your plans

title: Wish all cities had this!
review: This is such a great connivence I was visiting some friends in BKK but instead of making them go all the way to the airport and deal with all that traffic they told me a station to get off at and were waiting for me there It was easy to find and cheap Convenient for em and the people picking me up

title: Brilliant
review: Great location directly under the airport Simple to use though you will need local currency to obtain a token for travel cost varies on distance traveled into Bangkok

title: Easy to use
review: We used the subway to get to the train station and the experience was easy modern maps were easy to read and exits were easy to read and follow

title: Good way to avoid traffic
review: Known as BTS This is the best way to avoid traffic in bangkok Available only in bangkok there are 2 BTS line You can transfer one line to other from Siam station You can check your destination from the map displays in the station all the trains announces the station name prior to stop and some displays from an internal display on top of the door  Trains are available in almost every 5  mins If you are willing to travel from BTS full day best option is to buy 1 day card from the station

title: Simply the best way to go around Bangkok
review: The title says it all Easy to use reliable clean safe relatively cheap  The only thing you need is to know is point A to point B destination and enjoy the ride  My only complain is that it is freezing cold like most of the Public areas and Shopping centers in Bangkok however it is appreciable during rush hours

title: Convenient!
review: Airport Rail Link system is a cheap hassle free and easy way to travel from Bangkok Subornabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai via transit at BTS to reach the city centre by avoiding the horrible traffic in Bangkok It has several stations and stoppages to reach the final destination and crowded also It’s convenient for you if don't have too many big bags

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Make no mistake  book your hotel near Skytrain station This will save you money and time when moving around It can be very crowded time to time so you might need to wait one train over but they run quite short gap

title: Good skyline connecting you to main points
review: The skyline is very handy and clean It is cheap and easy to obtain tickets with air conditioned carriages but gets very busy and sometimes you feel like a sardine but handy to get around town quickly and to the shopping malls as reliable and a good way to cool down in the hottest part of the day

title: Efficient
review: It's fast It's cheap It's really crowded The worst part is that it has limited range in the city It's great for downtown but even getting to the old city or Chinatownthe best it can do is come within a tucktuck ride

title: Excellent transportation in Bangkok
review: Traffic is horrible in Bangkok especially during any rush our period  If your point of origination or destination is anywhere near a BTS stop do not hesitate to use it It is affordable and easy to use and understand plus there is almost always attendants to help you

title: gr8
review: Quick and cheap way to get around in Bangkok Remember coins for the fare and avoid the rush hour is you can

title: Do you dare to travel during traffic hour?
review: Easy way to go from one side of the city to the other side and during traffic hour there is a lot to see

title: Fastestway to get around
review: The BTS and MTR are the fastest way to get around Bangkok  The trains are super clean and safe  The fares are very reasonable  The station names are called out in Thai and English so you know where you are  The trains are air conditioned so a geat place to cool off  Take the time to get a transit pass and avoid the ticket line ups  Most of the ticket machines only take coins so if you don’t have pass you need to get single tickets from the ticket booths (although this is pretty easy)    The network is still expanding so the new lines will make it even better

title: It's cold, it's regular, it's not expensive
review: Though not covering a very large area it's worth planning trips within a walk of this until you get acclimatised to the heat & humidity  Think airconditioned London Docklands trains

title: Usefull but definitely not a pleasure
review: BTS trains are usefull and needed without doubt but why people give it a good rate on tripadvisor is a miracle to me the trains are more often than not very crowded and very very cold a positive side effect of the ac is that it doesn't stink as badly as it could in the middle of all those sweaty people for me the trains are a way of escaping the bad traffic but never a pleasure since you also can't see anything

title: Great service
review: Rapid transit around Bangkok Frequent trains and very cheap to use Lots of stations and interchange with the underground Highly recommended

title: Great tour with an awesome guide
review: Sara was a wonderful and friendly guide and was kind from the first second She knew a lot about the local ThaiFood scene and was eager to share her knowledge with us It was such a great tour Thank you so much

title: Very easy to use, clean and quick
review: Highly recommend easy to use quick and reliable The counter people only change notes to cash they don't sell tickets You have to buy the ticket at the machines

title: Excellent Sky Train Service
review: An Excellent Sky Train Service & the Best Way to travel in Bangkok to beat the Traffic Snarls The Sky Train MRT & BTS Service connects most parts of Bangkok the frequency is very good & the trains are comfortably Airconditioned

title: Cool Trip with a lot of different impressions
review: The Trip was verry cool We saw more than we expected And thanks for our Guide Sara  You are the best

title: So easy to use
review: Brilliant cheap but so many people happy customers who use it daily to get around the city and air conditioning through the it brilli6

title: Always ride the SKYTRAIN!
review: Lucky enough to stay at a hotel 3 mins from Nana Station Took the Skytrain multiply times to avoid BKK traffic Helpful staff at the information booth easy to follow signage

title: Quick and Easy!
review: I take the BTS and walk most of the time when I'm in the city because the traffic is so bad It's very easy to make your way around the city as everything is in English There's always food and little shops at each station which is always interesting I recommend buying a BTS card and loading it up to save you the hassle of waiting in line to buy a ticket each time This will save you a lot of time during peak hours

title: The always dependable Skytrain!
review: The Skytrain is always the best travel option while in Metropolitan Bangkok We all know that the traffic in Bangkok can be terrible most of the time so the train is the most dependable transportation in town The BTS is also linked to the MRT (subway) in 3 different stations It usually isn't very crowded except for peak times but that's to be expected The only complaint I have is that there aren't more lines to ride I know that there are new lines being built currently but creating even more access to different areas of Bangkok would be a huge benefit to the city  Actually I have one more complaint It looks to be tricky for elderly or handicapped people to find the appropriate access to the platforms I see that there are elevators and escalators but it looks like it could take a bit of work for someone that is disabled to find convenient access points up to the platforms

title: 12 hrs Stopover
review: Had a 12 hours stopover and decided to go into the city via the train absolutely delighted on how convenient it was and how helpful the guards and staff at the train stations were Highly recommends to use this service if you are travelling solo as it really cheap and hassle free Tickets can be purchased using a vending machine 45 baht

title: Very clean & efficient
review: Love the BTS system  Very easy to use & it feels very safe  You can get to just about every major attraction  Air conditioned also a big plus

title: The only way to get around
review: If you are in Bangkok and need to get anywhere then use the Skytrain  it is the ONLY way to get around this incredibly crowded and busy city  Doesn't go everywhere you need it to go but covers the main tourist areas is very cheap (get a day pass about £2) clean and airconditioned

title: Convinient and cheap alternative into the city
review: The have stopped the DIRECT express service from Suvarnabhumi Aiport to Phaya Thai station sighting poor response So now it stops at every station from then on  Not too bad for the price that they charge I'm happy with it

title: Sarah is the best
review: Sarah is absolutely amazing And the tour in the train market is ubelievable You have to do it The floating market is different after the covid but it’s an experience to live anyway

title: Go for it
review: The fastest and cheapest way to get tofrom the Suvarnabhumi int airport 43 THB (if I recall well) only clean airconditioned but not freezing inside

title: Pretty convenient
review: BTS is efficient but dumb that it only accepts coins in the ticket machines There are attendants on duty that can break bills for you maybe next time i would get a stored value card

title: HR Manger
review: Dairy ticket BTS it is perfect Price  140 baht (45 usd) from 600 morning to 1200 evening (unlimited)

title: MRT
review: A good way to get around Bangkok fast and very reasonable with hookups to other modes of transportation through out Bangkok very clean and on time  one of the best I've used while traveling  recommended

title: Not as convenient as the BTS
review: Long cavernous empty walks to get to the stations Buying tickets for the underground MRT always seems inconvenient  long queues for the machines and coins required to buy the ticket  so often two lines are in order one to exchange notes the other to actually buy the ticket  Candidly I prefer the above ground BTS as there are views instead of feeling slightly claustrophobic  In all however this is a thoroughly modern extremely clean travel experience for a subway especially when compared to cities like Sydney and New York  And usually quicker but not always cheaper (especially when travelling with friends) than a private taxi

title: Great experience
review: A must see  A fair trip in a mini bus outside of Bangkok though  an hour and a half so be aware Really good though  We would have liked more time in the boat as this was amazing  Our guide was fantastic

title: Fast and efficient way to travel to and from airport.
review: Grea way to get to airport and back  Do not have to fight traffic or take taxi to city  Will continue to use link whenever the opportunity arises

title: the trains and stations
review: Clean and cool aircon Windows were tinted so no worries about the heat of the sun Boarding and alighting passengers seemed in order giving way to alighting passengers Some stations were not convenient for tourist with luggages as not all stations seemed to have escalators and elevators unless one doesn't mind carrying luggages up and down the stairs

title: way too packed in rush hours
review: Local people use airport link to commute from home to the city Expect a very packed during rush hours Morning  inbound from airport to city center route Evening outbound from city center to airport route  Price is reasonable 2050 bht (i do not remember exact amount) depends on your distance  If you travel with big luggages seek for elvators u and down it is surely hidden somewhere ask the staff  Connect to Phayathai BTS skytrain or to Petchburi MRT subway station Be careful of cheating taxi  Enjoy Bangkok

title: So gentle and helpful staff (Sara)
review: Sara (Big Country Vacation Bangkok) was a very nice staff  She so gentle that made this tour unforgettable  All the details she provided about the tour were interesting and several tips she gave us were so much useful during and after the tour  I really recommend her tour to anyone else

title: Convenient, safe & reasonably priced.
review: Quickest mode of travel between the airport & city avoiding the hassles of haggling price & traffic

title: I prefer using Grab Bike
review: For a solo traveler it's easier to explore the city of Bangkok with Grab Bike than using MRT  LRT Time and energy are more efficient Between the costs of using MRT  LRT and Grab are only a small difference of + THB 58

title: Fast, Cheap access to Bangkok from the Airport
review: Extremely clean well managed and cheap (transport) Only 40Baht from the Airport to Ratchaprop Station

title: The most convinient way of transport throughout Bangkok
review: You can save plenty of your time traveling BTS skytrain rather than TukTuk or Taxi in Bangkok as the traffic jam is the worst and very common phenomenon in Bangkok There are trains in every 4 minutes which ensures it as the most convenient transport of the city I've bought the travel card for the whole day at just 140 Baht which allows unlimited travel using BTS skytrain for 24 hours

title: overnight train
review: travelled  2nd class going 1st full ok would fly next time found out its just as cheap but what a experience though

title: Highly recommended
review: Fantastic day spent with Sara our Wonderful guide she was informative and fun and made the day so enjoyable Nice airconditioned bus a train ride and of course the long boat in the floating market Highly recommended

title: The Easiest Way to Navigate Around
review: The BTS Skytrain is the easiestfastest mode of transport when traveling around the Bangkok Highly recommended espially for those who only have limited time in the Thai capital

title: Just another  line now.
review: When you travel on this line today there is little to remind you of its macabre history It is now another branch line in the Thai railway network used by locals and tourists alike Foreigners pay 100 baht for each journey regardless of length The trains to the terminus at Nam Tok leave from Thonburi station on the west side of Bangkok's river passing through Kanchanaburi The most scenic spots are the Bridge over the River Kwai (yes the famous one) and the Wangpo viaduct at Kra Sae where the track winds along a cliff face above the river on a wooden trestle The railway is a cheap and relaxing way to access all these places but a bit of research beforehand would surely enhance the journey A weekend special train also makes the return journey on Saturdays and Sundays from the main Bangkok train station

title: Way to Airport
review: Airport link is well enough to travel to save time But It is only in travels some parts When you have proper map of Bangkok you can get easy pass by Well Clean and fast

title: Checkinn 99 New name for Checkinn Garden
review: Traffic and Taxi  but easy to use sky train and subways    Food through out city great and people make you feel at home

title: Cheap, efficient,  a winner!!
review: You cannot go past using the BTS to get around Bangkok   Avoid tuktuks and taxis and just use the train   Buy yourself a stored value card which saves on calculating fares    Then take the card home as a souvenir  It can get very crowded at peak hour but they run like every 7 minutes so just wait

title: Beats Taxi's
review: The trains are the best way to get around the city We always avoid taxis where we can The one problem with the train system is that when you have luggage with you it can be very difficult to get on and off at busy stations and busy times

title: The best and fastest way to travell
review: Except for the rush hours the sky train or the metro are the best and the fastest ways to travel If you buy a stored value card and load some money on it saves you queuing to get a ticket

title: Clean and fast
review: It is a good choice during the traffic peak time It is suggested to get a rabbit card first The queues for coin change and ticket are very long and crowded

title: Easy to get everywhere
review: relatively cheap & convenient way to explore BKK Everything is clearly marked you won´t get lost You choose location where you want to get and then press a number (each location has its own number) and put coins inside the machine (in case you don´t have coins don´t worry you can change paper money at the counter) If in Bangkok use Skytrain ) its also a good way to merge with the daily life in BKK

title: Simple wow!
review: Amazing sights & picture opportunities throughout  The journey is filled with sights of the countryside & interesting scenery  It is a warm train so take a drink although locals walk up & down selling all sorts of refreshments  Do leave time to get off & explore the natural cave used as an air raid shelter & the bridges which really help you see what our forefathers achieved in the harshest of conditions

title: Brilliant
review: Amazing tour with the tour guide giving lots of information  The markets are a must see in any one itinerary in their visit to Bangkok

title: Easy to use
review: I used the BTS and MRT extensively as I roamed around Bangkok  Inexpensive and efficient service that complemented my use of taxies and tuk tuk

title: Easiest and one of the best  urban train system I've been on.
review: The BTS or Skytrain covers most of Bangkok for tourists and visitors It doesn't get to the palaces or temples where the Royal family used to live   It's cheap modern and ultra clean You rarely wait more than a few minutes between trains The route map is very easy to read It links with the MRT (the underground rail system run by another company) at quite a few major intersections   While places like Sydney and Melbourne in Australia have decades of planning meetings and get nowhere Bangkok has added half a dozen stations over the last few years  It is very busy and crowded in peak or rush hours but everyone politely queues up and waits for the next train   Don't be apprehensive about asking for help This is Thailand and everyone is pleased to help   Just one word of WARNING The airport to Bangkok train is not part of the BTS and it is not very good Especially if you have heavy bags Get a taxi for  ฿600 Cheap

title: Fast mode
review: It is the fastest and smart way to commute from airport to center of cityfrom there use the sky trains  cabs or BTS One can reach most parts of city using the modes mentioned  Costly cabs can be avoided if you can over come your fears  It is safe and user friendly

title: Highly recommended
review: Sara is a first class tour guide with excellent English   The tour was great value for money and exceeded our expectations

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: With growing number of vehicles on the road traffic keeps piling up in the roads of Bangkok If you are looking for the quickest way to travel around Bangkok then BTS is probably the best way to do it It is not too cheap however the convenience is much higher in comparison You will also get to see local people and know their culture Recommended

title: Brilliant and fast
review: The most convenient way to get to the airport from city centre and look over the traffic jams building underneath on the roads

title: Fast, nice view and cheap
review: Best way from Suvarnabhumi Airport into the city It is possible to change to BTW  MRT If you need to get around Khaosan Road take a cab at Phaya Thai

title: Ok beats the traffic
review: A great way to beat the horrendous Bangkok traffic The only problem is the traffic to the Stations A mix of metro then the Airport link is the quickest

title: Sky train
review: Thank God the trafic is so bad would never leave in Bangkok far away from the BTS    very clean smooth   a must in this super city

title: A good way out of the airport and into the city of Bangkok
review: A cheap and faster alternative to taxis  It's a good system albeit a bit limited Will be better if expanded

title: Cost effective way to get into the city
review: Cost 2 off us 90 baht to get to Phreya thai from where we got onto the BTS Skytrain to our final destination This journey would have otherwise cost is 550 baht

title: Okay, but need improvement
review: We used bts from siam to saphan taksinto go to asiatique Bts system is goodbut the staffs were unfriendly And not all the system have english languageso very unconvenient for foreigners Bit pricy too if you're travelling with friends I don't recommend this

title: Convenient and easy to use
review: Loved using the BTS Skytrain  A simple straightforward system that crosses through downtown Bangkok with stops to major stops  Aircondtioned and super clean

title: skytrain
review: Easy to use and once you know the places to stop at its great Cost is easy to work out Watch out for busy times as now its getting very busy

title: Helpful and one of the best option
review: We used airport rail link from BKK to Pratunam area Its super convenient and beats the Bangkok traffic  While at the airport we got confused to find the airpot station may be we missed something All stations have easy access to elevators so you don't need to worry for luggages or wheel chair access Also you find taxi facilities at every stations

title: Smashing segregation
review: Good and comfy way to transverse exciting city Don’t forget to explore the real stuff there’s a lot going on down there

title: Enjoyable trip
review: Booked as half day trip although we were picked up early and didn’t return to hotel till 1630 so bear in mind if booking other trips for same day  Gang was our guide she was very knowledgeable and experienced guide  Enjoyable trip but very much geared for tourists markets were mainly souvenirs

title: A fast and way inexpensive to get into the centre of Bangkok
review: If you are travelling into the centre of Bangkok on vacation or business the Airport Rail Link is quick way to get the SkyTrain network that allows easy travelling Its approx £1 for a single ticket unlike the £50 the taxi's outside the airport will charge which are a total rip off I use the sky train on a regular basis

title: Easy access to shops
review: TV on board the train to watch Great access to shops Great to look at the views around You can exchange money at the station for coins as the sky train only cost couple baht to ride

title: fast easy travel
review: Easy cheap and fast  Super clean courteous and helpful Perfect way to get around the area Plenty of comfortable seating able to pass from one train to another to find seats if necessary  Each stop and announced in both Thai and English Maps at every station showing routes etc

title: First class sleeper - Bangkok to Hadyai
review: New train no 31 from Bangkok  Hadyai was very comfortable and smooth Onboard GPS screen with train location on route was informative and well presented  free wifi was available on board train was nice  The washroom was compact  very clean and also included was a shower room The train was well insulated  noise level was controlled but it was quite cold even with vent control Advisable to bring a coat or pull over as it was cold at night The trains are still very new hope they will be maintained the pristine conditions in time to come Only if the 16 hour ride can be shorten  depart 1445pm arrive 0645  be prepared for an early night's rest

title: Excellent
review: I came back from airport in just 25 mins to hotel after dropping my family at the airport Nice connection

title: great & quicker
review: great & quicker than taxi & cheaper no tolls to pay no traffic drops you straght at the airport wouldnt go any other way now

title: The Best Way To Get Around Bangkok
review: I'm very impressed with how frequently these trains run and how clean they are as well as how well the AC works even when they're super full

title: No better way to get around
review: Air conditioned Cheap Very Clean Crowded at peak times (7am9am lunch time and 5pm630) Remember do not eat on BTS

title: Works great but save 45B for airport return (no rabbit card accepted)
review: I bought a rabbit card and loaded it with 200B then reloaded a few times (conveniently at McDonalds where it is also accepted for payment) You need it to pay at the food court at MBK (they do not accept any other form of payment) However going back to the airport make sure you save a few Baht as even though you can use the card everywhere else you CAN not use it for the airport return You get a black poker chip looking token (same as on the arrival) and you 'return' it to exit the BTS gates upon arrival at the airport

title: Super convenient!!
review: Bangkok's humidity can be so cruel Thanks to this transport getting to the city from the airport is easy breezy and cheap Reminder though to future BKK travellers make sure you arrive not later than 1030pm coz last trip is at 1130 Just like the trains and subways in the city Airport rail closes at 12midnight and opens at 530am FYI

title: Fast & clean
review: Loved the rail link so new & clean It's very well run & there's information so you know when the next train will arrive The token machines are so easy to use overall a good experience

title: Efficient Service
review: We travel mostly on BTS and MRT love the fact that the service was efficient and the staff at the station were very helpful

title: Best way to beat the traffic.
review: Easy to use and inexpensive although it does not go near some of the top attractions of Bangkok  But it sure beats taking a taxi through Bangkok's horrendous traffic

title: underground travel
review: i have used this service many times and had no problems what so ever been too rama 9 several times easy to use and hand service staff all polite and is good to get around anywhere around thailand

title: Most Convinient
review: Bangkok streets are always full of cars and the best mode of transport is BTS Skytrain They have really good network all over the place and very pleasant You won't realize you reached your destination after traveling by Tuk Tuk or Taxi

title: Take it!
review: Best way to get to Bangkok if you are staying along the BTSlines Probably faster than a taxi connects well to BTS at Phaya thai station

title: Loved the experience.
review: Love the history and stories behind it all The sadness is overwhelming Would I go back to experience it again Yes definitely There is something about reliving our pasts even if it means a saddened past

title: Best Way to Avoid Bangkok's Traffic Jam!
review: I would say this is this would definitely be the best way to beat the traffic jams on the road and save time For 130 Bhat you would be able to get a day pass which allows you multiple trips on the BTS Most of the malls are within short walks of the BTS as well  Trains are clean and counter staffs are friendly should you require any directional assistance I would say the only downside of the BTS is that there are no elevators at stations and there are also no escalators going downwards There are escalators going upwards to the train platforms though So if you're with a pram it's gonna be kinda challenging This also makes it disabled unfriendly as well   Apart from these con's it's still the best way to beat the traffic jams

title: Travelling by Airport Rail Link
review: Travelling by Airport Rail Link  from Swarnabumi  Airport was easy fast and comfortable Traffic jam in Bangkok is unavoidable and taking the train takes you without any hassle It is comfortable and takes you right to the heart of Bagkok for you to transfer connect to metro line and subway line

title: Convienent Clean
review: Sky train has expanded and service cleanliness and price is excellent Easy to get around the city Used Airlink to pick up friends from the airport quick and effecicent

title: Cheap and Easy Way to Get Around
review: We did use the Skytrain once It works great Unlike other mass transit in other cities there is no transfer from skytrain to other rail service like the MRT Still it's cheap and effective given that the street traffic in Bangkok is highly congested both day and night Stay away during rush hourthere are lines waiting to board trains during the commute

title: Best Way To Get Around the City
review: We stayed at the Okura and luckly the BTS connected right to our hotel It is very easy to figure out and get around town Much faster and cheaper than cabs with all of the congestion in the city Only problem is that it doesn't connect you to everywhere so sometimes we had to get off on the closest stop and still take a cab to our destination

title: Great
review: Definitely use if you want to save money and time It will take you into Bangkok from their you can take the BTS Subway taxi or whatever The system is clean safe and efficient Just don't talk loud You will notice that the train is quiet except for foreigners Only caveat the system only runs from 6 am to midnight If you get in after 11 pm take a taxi The airport is huge with 5 levels FIND THE TAXI LEVEL If you don't you're screwed A taxi will cost between $15  $20 US A limo $65 US I screwed up last time got in at 3 am hadn't slept for 45 hours and paid the price Train or taxi not limo

title: Most convenient public transport in BKK
review: The skytrain is the fastest way getting around Bkk and beating the notorious traffic jams It's clean reliable During rush hours it get a bit crowded just like in other metropolis Day tickets for tourists are of good value if you want to explore the city They should improve on disabled access

title: Easy, cheap, comfortable
review: Easy and comfortable way to get from the airport to the city Contacts to the MRT Just follow the signs from arrivals buy a ticket from the easy to understand vending machine and your on your way Also a maned kiosk if you need it

title: Grand Palace Visit by MRT on August 2019
review: MRT Blue Line is the best tourism transportation in Bangkok Metropolitan passing Hua Lamphong Railways Station & Chinatown CBDs Chatuchak Market and Ratchada Train Night Market   Waiting for the extension to Grand Palace District at Sanamchai Station on August 2019 Avoid traffic jam and scam taxi

title: a nice and easy way to travel
review: When in bangkok trust me you wouldn't want to missed to travel around the city with BTS instead rent a car or tuktuk or using taxi Its cheap its clean the map is very easy to read and follow

title: at par with singapore and hongkong's mass transportation.
review: gets you anywhere in bangkok in minutesample english language all around making it tourist friendly

title: Great
review: This is a fast and cheap way to get to some Of the locations Ticket machines and trains are Easy to use Air conditioned and clean

title: Cheap and fast
review: Only 45baht and 30min from Suvarnabhumi to the center of Bangkok Very easy to purchase tickets from automats Be sure to keep your token with u all the way  You will need it when you exit the station

title: Best method of Travel
review: Its cheap you can stop off anywhere and everywhere and is the best way of getting around Bangkok and really exploring it We used this everyday and there are so many stations We had a station a few minutes walk from our hotel

title: The way to go is BTS Skytrain
review: BTS Skytrain is the way to travel around the heart of Bangkok In fact it is very much like the heartbeat of Bangkok taking you to every relevant place of interest in the city as well as interchanges to the other trains and ways of travel around the rest of the town My wife and I use the BTS everytime we visit Bangkok as our primary means of traveling For shopping entertainment food interchanging to the airport link etc

title: Simple to use
review: I am from NYC where the subway system can be a nightmare on the weekend but this system is far easier to use

title: Convenient
review: Good connection from the airport to the city Cheap and efficient it prevents you from spending 2hours stuck in traffic

title: Easy
review: The cheapest easiest safest and most convenient  way to get round Bangkok bar none All signs translated into English and ticketing easy to understand

title: Good and efficient
review: Having travelled to BKK and uses BTS many times this is the first time I'm writing about it  Staffs  helpful and polite Efficiency  very good Accessibilities  very good Punctuality  very good  Now for the notsogood but I know nothing can be done to change it  1 All stations should have escalators to go up to the stations and to the train platform It'll be better for oldersickpeople carrying things  2 Instead of having the trains running side by side in 2 directions they should've build 1 platform between the 2 directions just like the MRT  If I miss my stops I don't have to go down the platform and go up from the other way again

title: Great value for the money!
review: The Airport Rail Link Is a great value to the traveller especially if you use Suvarnabhumi Airport a lot   Charging at BTS rates the link can save you quite a bit on taxi fares to the airport   I would also judge that you would save some time from Phayathai Station where it begins especially during rush hour where the Bangkok traffic can tie up even the fastest cab driver    Like I said the Link is caught at the Phayathai BTS Station   Once you disembark from the BTS turn southward from the exit and look for the signs for Airport Rail Link   A connecting walkway will take you to its station where you buy the ticket from the window   You then go down an escalator to catch it on the ground floor   Of course if you're entering from the street you can walk in from there    The train comes about every halfhour so you might have a wait   The good thing about getting there early is that you get a seat (Phayathai is the terminus)   This is really helpful if you have big luggage   There is no storage rack   For this reason I recommend you take a taxi if you have more than one big piece of luggage   Also the taxi then lets you off right at Departures while the Link terminates at a station at ground floor level and then you have two or three escalators to go to get up to Departures

title: Cool , easy and fast!
review: BTS sky train makes things so easy to move around It is fast and easy access to many internal locations and passes to main junction The sky walk  avoid the traffic on road and safe  Must try

title: Amazing tour! TUM TUM was one of the best tour guides out there. I loved the experience overall. Was great overall and w
review: Amazing tour TUM TUM was one of the best tour guides out there I loved the experience overall Was great overall and would do again

title: great way to great around
review: great way to get from the airport to downtown i think it was 45 mins or so  from airport to downtown and they use to have a express train to down town many great stops all along the way train get crowded during the moring and rush hour in the evening trains are very clean and pretty fast

title: Comfortable and convenient
review: You got to give it to the Thais They know how to put these things together The convenience stems from how at every possibility the stations are connected to buildings and walkways and so on So you are protected from the elements  the mrt and bts systems are very well designed and there is much to learn from them

title: Good train system
review: BTS train was great the price was low only 20tbp for a journey   Also the station open till late around midnight and easy to use

title: Efficient, cheap way to travel into BKK
review: I have been at Thailand a few times but never taken this link From now on I will take the link Traffic in BKK is often bad and yet the airport link is very easy to use to get into BKK The airport link is also very clean and an inexpensive way to travel into or out of the city with no toll roads

title: Easy way around BKK
review: The easiest way around BKK You can either purchase a rabbit card with credit or have coins to purchase tickets  Enjoy trips all over the city on rainy days my husband and I have ridden the BTS lines from end to end just to enjoy the sights Also very refreshing with air con too

title: Clean, safe and efficiently reliable way to get around Bangkok
review: Learned from the hotel staff at the St Regis Bangkok that the BTS is easily accessible through a foot bridge in back of the hotel that makes it unnecessary to even get down to the street  This is a mindblowing tip given the notorious traffic in Bangkok and the fact that this skytrain does link 5star hotels like this one and the Four Seasons right next door to the rest of Bangkok including Siam Center a hip mall with great eateries and hip local designers the boats that will take you across Chao Phraya river to Asiatique's night dining and shopping destination and the street vendors all over the city  Most of the train stops are overseen by BTS guards or police good to see when using the train late at night and when it's crowded  Have used the New York subways for many years and experienced the London Tube and the Paris Metro and can say that I am a big fan of the Bangkok Skytrain

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: Unless you absolutely have to use a car or taxi don't The BTS Skytrain is inexpensive very easy to use and in combination with the subway can get you most anywhere in Bangkok It is also fast and reliable and certainly beats sitting in Bangkok traffic

title: Easy to figure out
review: Been to Bangkok many times but usually short stay and use a lot of taxis and tuk tuktried the skytraineasily worked it out with no fusspeak hour is not the best time to travel though

title: Fast & convenient
review: No matter the type of traveller you are this airport rail is air conditionned super clean and VERY easy to get from the airport  Forget the taxi into town  Save money traffic and CO2 emissions and jump into your first Thai experience as soon as you are off the plane

title: Clean, easy transportation
review: I was using only the MRT and BTS to move in bangkok The easiest cleanest way to go anywhere is Bangkok

title: Excellent service. Every 3 - 5 minutes.
review: Get an oyster card Saves queuing for ticket machines

title: Great System
review: I have used public transportation all over the world and this one is on par with the rest Easy to use reliable and quickand clean No different than any other place during peak time but you get from point to point with little fuss I highly recommend using the Skytrain

title: Dr.Booska
review: Very nice placenice river view a lot of history the only place that you can walk on the railway or even run if the train is cominghahaha

title: Very Useful
review: The air con alone is enough reason to catch a sky train It's not a comprehensive infrastructure like the Tube in London  there are only 2 lines (there is an underground metro in Bangkok too) We had a look at how to buy tickets on YouTube before visiting  but it really wasn't complicated The only thing that confused us a little is that we queued at a booth expecting tickets  in fact the lady just gave us enough change to buy tickets at the machine We found that both the machines in the skytrain and the metro had a button to change the language to English  so that made it much easier Although the trains are really (really) busy at peak times the people are incredibly courteous There's a place to stand to wait for people to get off and people geniunely do wait until everyone is off before gettting on What a pleasant change If the train is too full they simply wait for the next train  which in our experience was never more than a few minutes behind Inside the trains are incredibly clean (no food or drink is allowed) Apparently the Bangkokians are proud of their skytrain  and well they might be

title: Easy transport
review: Go to Bangkok and visit everywhere with BTS  Very easy to access and clean but also full with people  But its okay for me

title: Skytrain in BKK is GREAT to get around w/o cab
review: Used the skytrain all th time when back in BKK It's easy fast convenient and clean refreshing in the heat Yet somewhat very crowded at peak times so try to avoid early mornings and late afternoons   Importanz stations to travel to   National Stadium MBK shopping mall (everything) SIAM Siam Shopping Mall (more posh) Chatuchak Park Famous Market with same name  And lots more you need to discover yourself Even me who has been to BKK more than 20 times doesn't know everything in this biggest town of all

title: Great way to see BKK and move around
review: The BTS is very efficient if it goes to where you need to get to  On a warm day the excellent airconditioning is very welcome  This is a very economical way to move around and also see BKK

title: Interesting and different day trip
review: Our guide “Kiwi” was fantastic she was really enthusiastic and gave us some great information regarding Bangkok and the 2 markets we visited We took the tour on a Monday so the floating markets were a little quieter than on the weekend   The floating markets have unfortunately felt the full affect of covid19 and are waiting to get busier again However we really enjoyed our time here The little boat ride through the canals was a lot of fun and we had some delicious coconut ice cream (60 Baht) from one of the sellers Later in the afternoon we had some pad thai and fried rice for 40 Baht each which were also delicious   The railway market was a really fun and different experience We are glad that we got to experience this However the amount of time here was quite long (around 40 minutes) which we felt was too long when the markets are fresh markets selling raw meat fish etc so tourists can’t really purchase anything here  Overall the tour is worth the money for the sheer amount of driving between the sights It would take a lot longer and would be a lot more effort to try and get to these sites using public transport I would recommend going on a SatSun

title: can't find and easier way to get around the city
review: day passes are your best friend for 140 baht a person for unlimited trips it was once less thing to worry about while we explored bangkok from end to end  one reminder don't bother buying food in the terminals to take with you you will have to toss it out as there is a strict no food policy (drinks as well but water is ok)

title: Trains, boats busses in one trip
review: A chance to see two of Bangkok’s must dos in one trip It was amazing to arrive at railway market on the train and then watch as it left the station and made its way back through the market  The floating market is a unique experience be prepared for plenty of chaos on the river as paddle boats mix with motorised vessels in narrow alley ways  Plenty of opportunities to buy souvenirs  haggling expected but easy to say no or walk away  The tour bus was spotlessly clean and plenty of bottled water included The guide made the day very interesting with lots of facts along the way  The tour says half day  we left the hotel at 815 and we’re dropped off at 330  there is a lot of driving involved including an hour and a half return drive You are dropped off at the MBK centre so be prepared to make your own way back to your accommodation Right by the BTS station so easy to do  Overall excellent value for money great guide and driver  would I recommend 100%

title: A convient cheap alternative to taxi to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport.
review: I tend to avoid taxi's in Bangkok I use my own motorcycle traveling around Bangkok The MRT BTS and Airport Link are great ways to travel around town The Airport Link does not have great directions for tourists but Thai people are generally friendly & helpful I have used this train a few times I catch it at Rachadaphisek Rd  (Phetchaburi Station) and it ends inside the basement of the airport terminal

title: fastest link to city
review: fastest link to city  takes only 30 mins to reach cityand also very economicalas taxi will take 1 hour plus with 4 times fare

title: Fantastic and humbling.
review: The whole trip was fantastic and we had a superb driver and our tour guide Ken was both attentive and knowledgeable and looked after us brilliantly Although its a long day well worth the visit and very humbling

title: Very easy ride throughout Bangkok on the train!
review: We took the train several times during our stay in Bangkok Very easy Cheap way back to the airport as well

title: My favorite public transport in Bangkok.
review: The Skytrain is by far the best way to travel in Bangkok While not all station provide escalators to the trains which can be troublesome to anyone carrying a suitcase the trains themselves are clean quick and reliable

title: Wow
review: We sat on the train and it was such an amazing and poignant experience especially considering the history attached to the railway I was surprised that we were allowed to walk on the railway to take photos and explore (to your own discretion and safety of course) and it was thrilling and exciting and definitely memorable

title: Easy, cheap and air-conditioned way to get from Bangkok airport to downtown
review: Easy to buy tickets at the airport Airconditioned trains and it took only about 30 mins to reach downtown by train I had 10 hours time in Bangkok and I really do recommend to take a train to downtown instead of staying at the airport

title: The easiest way to go around bangkok
review: If you are planning to travel in Bangkok MRT (underground) is the easiest transportation to take However you may need to take BTS (sky train) or taxi when travel to some part of Bangkok

title: BTS Skytrain in Thailand
review: Very good BTS skytrain around Bangkok Its's very convinient for us and also very cheap The train in so cool and clean I like it very much

title: Great service
review: This is an evolving public transport service in Bangkok  Covers a good area of the city and reasonable priced  You can either pay a one way ticket and cost will depend on distance crossed or buy a day pass for 130 Baht Or issue a rabbit card for 109 Baht and charge it with a minimum of 100 Baht and use it as you go  Trains are clean and beautifully air conditioned Only bothering issue for me is them placing exchange offices inside and forcing you to pay 16 Bahts just to enter premises to exchange money even though you are not using BTS service Feels like a rip off if you ask me  Generally a great and cheap way to navigate the city Highly recommended

title: Great connection
review: I took this train plus metro on my arrival in bkk The traffic was terrible and the BTS brought me at destination in 20 mins I waited just 2 mins the train interior is new  clean and not overcrowded despite the peak time Fantastic

title: Clean, easy to navigate and refreshing.
review: The Bangkok train only operates on the East side of the city so anyone on the palace and Khoa San side will need to taxi tuk tuk or bus to wherever you want to  However if you do need to catch a ride or for anyone on the East side the skytrain is a very simple and easy to navigate system with reasonable fare systems (token operated) and incredibly refreshing aircon

title: PERFECT WAY IN AND OUT OF THE AIRPORT.
review: I used this four times  It is easy cheap clean on time and very very convenient You just need to know which station you will need to get off to connect to the BTS

title: Clean and efficient
review: Clean and efficient but a little small But it's cheap and works really well It covers many places and for some places you can choose to take the MRT

title: Bangkok trains are great
review: MRT train takes you from airport to city center where it can interchange with BTS train  Clean reliable  air conditioned and well priced  Use the trains as much as as possible

title: Easy to commute in Bangkok
review: Buy a day pass for 140 Baht that gives you unlimited rides a short trip costs between 20 and 43 Bath depending on the distance

title: Easy to use...
review: At first we were intimidated to use this because of the language etc However it was really easy and the announcements were in both English and Thai Give it a go

title: Great way to get around
review: Very convenient to go from place to place  saves a lot of time (and money)  Cost for one stop is about 15 bhat After reaching my station I would take a taxi  it is much cheaper this way The train is quite frequent and usually not super crowded The only drawback is that there is no escalator or lift on a number of stations and I had to climb up to 3 floors to get to the platform get a day pass if you are travelling a lot by the train one day  it will save a lot of money

title: Fastest way around town
review: This almost hardly needs to be said but BTS is by far the fastest way to get around if you are in a hurry  Always clean and air conditioned the fast and regular services makes navigating your way around BKK easy   It's a great option for an airport service if you are budget conscious and don't mind adding around an extra 30ish minutes to your journey

title: Efficient, clean, easy to navigate means to get around Bangkok
review: Staying in the heart of Bangkok at the Grand Hyatt Eriman the BTS Skytrain was the fast efficient way to visit the JJ Green Night Market and the Chatuchak Market  both definitely worth visiting  Instead of using the machines for tickets to the Skytrain i found the people in the manned booths very willing to help me get where I wanted to go (and the tickets)

title: Fabulous and easy
review: A must for travel throughout Bangkok It dont go everywhere but it will get you clode enough to where ya want to be We took the train from the airport to our hotel easy and uncomplicated for a sweaty weary traveller  We used it daily its remarkably clean compared to the uk trains

title: Take the skytrain!
review: The way to get around the city of Bangkok is to take the skytrain or the subway (MRT)  Tourists should not be afraid to try it  It is clean dependable and safe as far as I could see  And it will cost you a tiny fraction of what it would cost to take a taxi anywhere (and get you there much faster)

title: Cheap and easy
review: Super easy to take to the city from the basement of the airport 45 B for going the whole way to end station If you want to go to Khao San Road just go off at the end station and take a taxi shouldn't cost more than 100 B

title: Great, Fast and Cheap way to travel in Bangkok!
review: Hi all As a couple in Bangkok we wanted to see all the places that are recommended  Part of them were MBK Siam Central World Cat Cafe and so on We chose Hotel with a connection to the Sky train so it will be easy for us to travel  We bought a 1 day free pass for only 140 BHT and traveled with all day  The BTS is really clear on which line to take and even google maps helps you a lot with it  It gets crowded in the busy hours and all the Residents stand in line without pushing and waiting for the next train The trains come every 4 to 6 minutes so it is really convenient especially with the Heavy Bangkok traffic   Really recommend this way if travel You can see my review of the Eastin Grand Hotel and other places in Thailand   Guy Aharonin

title: lift
review: There is no lift in some station so it is not convenient if there is luggage another option is to have ramp

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: It didn't take us long to realise that the Skytrain is THE way to get around Bangkok after taking over an hour to do a 4 mile journey by taxi Cabs may be cheap but the traffic is an absolute nightmare   The Skytrain is quick and cheap (day passes were 140 baht as of April 2016 and individual journey passes start at around 15 baht) and it stops near the vast majority of attractions It also has excellent air conditioning which is a huge relief for those unaccustomed to the immense Bangkok heat One thing worth noting is that no food or drink is allowed and if you are carrying a bag you will probably get searched on the way in  this will be quick and the staff are very polite   Another useful tip for first timers you will need to use the ticket machines for individual journeys queueing at the counter will result in you getting change for your notes but no ticket which left us slightly baffled at first (in our defence we were tired after the overnight flight) The exception is if you want a day pass in which case you will need to queue at the counter  On future trips to Bangkok I will use taxis to get to the city from Suvarnabhumi airport but the Skytrain for any other trips where possible

title: Above the chaos
review: Take a sky train and travel all around the city This will allow you the opportunity to see how 8 million people live work and travel around this beautiful city

title: Great
review: very cheap and fast way to go from airport to city and reverse The express line is faster but the regular line has more frequent routes so i suggest you take the first there is available no need to wait much

title: Smart
review: a smart way to travel to and from the airport The express train is not as regular as the city line but both are convent connecting to the MRT and the BTS at PayaThai The express takes 15 minutes to PayaThai(150B) and the City Line 30 minutes to PayaThai (45B) Located on the lowest level of the Suvarnabhumi airport

title: The best. Airport> Bangkok>Airport
review: A maximum cost of 45THB (£105) if you go to the end of the line otherwise deduct 5THB for every station short of the end 30 mins maximum travel time with trains around 3 per hour Clean safe air conditioned from within the airport to the heart of Bangkok You simply cannot travel cheaper or quicker or safer  The absolute best means of travel from or to the airport

title: Visit in March
review: We visited Bangkok for 2 nights as a couple and BTS was a lifesaver for getting around the city so cheap and easy to use if your like me and have used the tube in London you will find this very easy to use

title: convenient and cheap
review: the skytrain took us from airport to every where we wanted to see in bangkok  it made us travel so many places since we were on a tight budget but its route is perfect for tourists and people who want to really explore all of bangkok in just a couple of days

title: Convenient link to Bangkok!
review: One of the most convenient form of transportation going to Bangkok No traffic and inexpensive Best for budget travelers

title: Clean
review: Sky trains as they are known as are quite efficient and are airconditioned but there are no timings displayed what so ever ant the maps are all placed at useful places to direct you and are in English The ticket office does not issue tickets but just there to change your notes and you have to use the ticket machine for your ride

title: Skytrain is great
review: Easy convenient way to get around Helpful staff at the stations Nice and cool too when it's hot outside

title: Awsome!
review: I love the Skytrain Really convenient and cheap even from the airport Way better than getting a taxi Traffic can be horrible

title: Interesting way to travel
review: We booked 2 lower and one upper berth in the 2nd class 13 train We couldn't get first class There are no door for the berth but curtains drawn provide privacy I was worried about the security of my belongings I had packed all my valuables in my smaller backpack which I kept on the shelf at the end of my berth I'm a light sleeper so I got around 45 minutes sleep for the duration but I knew this would be the case The motion and noise of the train kept me awake We got lucky with the people surrounding us they where pleasant and friendly and good fun The carriage was quiet and my friends slept no problem  Our friends did the trip in March and said it was one of the highlights They said the restaurant car was a party car and that the booze flowed to make it a real party atmosphere However due to an incident in July 2014 where a 13 year old was murdered by a temporary staff member there is an alcohol ban on all sleeper trains This dulled the party atmosphere we where expecting We brought our own alcohol and as long as we where quiet and didn't cause any trouble they didn't seem to mind  I wouldn't do it again as I am an anxious person and found it very hard to relax or sleep but the scenery on the way to chiang mai was stunning and worth seeing

title: Riding the Railway
review: Experienced every time I visit the city Efficient Cheap Punctual and Extensive It is a pleasure to utilize this mode of transport From getting  off the plane in and around the city this is the pillar of the city

title: Very efficient
review: Was fairly easy to get ticket and stops are very quick The station was very clean Can get very crowded at certain times I liked using it to move around a bit

title: Too many tourists.
review: Way more tourists than locals in both cases  The markets themselves however were interesting if you got away from the crowds  Would recommend some of the local market Crocodile Head Market for example over these

title: Excellent Mode to Reach Airport
