review: What an excellent way to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport from Bangkok City An approx 30min ride end to end It saves a lot time and you can avoid the traffic in the Bangkok Roads Plus it connects important zones in Bangkok from the Airport End to end fare is only 50Baht

title: Quick & simple way to get into the city
review: If you don't want to deal with taxi's & the fluctuating fares prices that tend to occur then the airport link is perfect It is quick and connects up with the other lines so your can reach hotelsthe airport with ease

title: Easy and economical way to get downtown
review: Best airport to downtown transit system anywhere Direct from inside the airport safe and quick Easy peasy

title: Very easy to use - cheap way to get to airport
review: If you have used the BTS Skytrain the airport rail link is pretty much the same thing The only difference being its slightly more expensive and there are only a few stations around the Central parts of Bangkok where you can catch the ARL which will take you directly to Suvarnabhumi Airport  We caught the BTS to Phayathai station in Central Bangkok (this is the most popular station to catch the airport rail link to the Airport) we then paid approx 45 baht per person for the 26 minute journey  Would highly recommend it  the carriages were clean plenty of space for luggage and empty seats from Phayathai

title: Good connectivity
review: The metro is the best way out and into the SuvarnaBhuumi airport  The last one to the airport starts around midnight

title: Perfect to reach the city centre
review: If you arrive at the airport don't even think about searching a taxi overthere just research where your hostel is in town and take the railway to the city centre Taxis are available at every stop to reach your final destination Buying a ticket is no problem  Automats are in English

title: Good but expensive
review: Good approach to all the famous attractions but it’s quite expensiveEven I had to pay 400 baht for my two years kid

title: A great way to move about the city!
review: The BTS Skytrain is beneficial in so many ways  punctual air conditioned inexpensive and near many attractions It also connects near MRT link and airport link (check stations for this) I have worked in Atlanta Washington DC & now San Francisco and am a big fan of metro travel vs personal vehicle it almost always avoids the risk of being late to your destination  I recommend purchasing a card (100 bht minimum) to facilitate speedy entrance onto the station platform   In time I'm sure the bts will expand into more locations and condo developers are building near proposed sites to capitalize on this happening  Hope this helps  Chok dee le sawasdee khrap

title: Cheap and efficient
review: Getting I to town from an airport is often expensive and a challenge BTS skytrain loads easily and tickets are cheap to get to downtown Staff are ehepful

title: Cheaper way to travel
review: Can get very busy as the city line is used by residents to commute     If you have large bags the stations and crowds may make it difficult to use the train  Cheaper and faster than other forms of transport in the city 45 Baht for a transfer from the airport to the last stop on the at Phya Thai station

title: Cheap and fast travel between city and airport
review: Fast and cheap transport between city and airport May be crowded but travel time is no more than 30 minutes Have not tried taxi but looking down at congested road from elevate walkways I think its a better option

title: Certainly a great alternative for tourists & locals alike.....
review: This is definitely a much needed great alternative mode of travel tofrom the airport to the city It is fast clean has great air con ( big relief in this terrible heat) & inexpensive   No expensive taxi fares to worry about & no horrendous daily hours long traffic jams The alighting station is linked directly to the airport terminal as well   It cost 35 Baht & took only 25 minutes to reach the airport from our stay area station However it is quite crowded even at about 4pm  Be prepared for a squeeze inside as many of the passengers are going to airport with big luggages   There are limited baggage lockers for rent at the station  For those like us who has late evening or night flights & needed a place to store big luggages to enable go elsewhere till near flight time

title: Ease to the city
review: The new Airport rail link is easy to access from the arrival hall at the airport and is incredibly cheap with brilliant air conditioning The trains run regularly and take just 20  30 mins to connect with either MRT or BTS rail networks Being Bangkok the carriages can get packed with tourists and communters

title: Get around Bangkok Easy with BTS
review: BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok Taxis and traffic are sometimes just so frustrating Hop on the BTS cheap and regular Trains going all around BKK

title: Clean, fast and cheap
review: Clean fast and cheap  also air conditioned  What is there not to like Layout is simple good ticketoptions at the stations and for those of us wo coins they provide fast and efficient change A bit like the London Underground  just clean cheap and air conditioned )

title: Fast
review: This is a very good transport system to use here to avoid the traffic jams Its easy to use and clean

title: plan more time
review: We got to the station and the express was not running that day so had to take the airport rail which stops many stops  Do give yourself more time when you travel in BKK

title: THE BEST WAY TO GET TO OR FROM THE AIRPORT
review: I already wrote this in another review but seriously the Airport Rail Link was the best way to go when going back to the airport I payed about 78 bahts from Sukhumvit instead of a 400 baht Uber ride

title: Very easy to navigate
review: This is without a doubt the best way to get around Bangkok  The prices are very reasonable the trains are clean and comfy and there is not too much you can screw up since there are only a couple main lines  We used it every day to get around and it never failed  Much better than fighting Bangkok traffic

title: Safe fast clean quick and well policed
review: Get change from the ticket office  You will need coins as the fares are so cheap  They will let you what ticket you need to purchase for your destination  025 b o15 b etc

title: Convenient & Fast
review: If you want to avoid the bad traffic during peak hours around the city centre  this will be the best & fastest mode of transport   It could be more economical to take a taxi  if you are travelling in a group of 3 or 4 people during off peak But other than that the BTS is better option both in terms of time and money   Get a better view of the city from the elevated tracks as you travel by BTS

title: Fast!
review: Its only about £8 by taxi to Central Bangkok but for a different experience try the train to airport link One train goes direct from Hakkasan station the other line stops at numerous statios Good way to see the streets of Bangkok as you travel over head Also very cheap

title: Wow 😮
review: Easy way to explore these two activities  Human adaptation at Maeklong Station and floating market  “Venice of East” Wonderful guide and driver

title: Wonderful, peaceful people moving around a huge city. World class
review: A functional mass rapid transit system that moves millions of people a day around a massive crowded city Regular convenient and apparently safe system Trains pretty clean Visible police service present on the stations which reassures foreigners (farangs) It's amazing whizzing along at a good pace and watching motor vehicles stuck in huge traffic jams along the way It's a no brainer Use the BTS sky train It connects with ferry services and underground's (as well as airport train) along the way Highly recommended

title: Best transportation in bangkok
review: U go where by bts is easy and cheap fast and modern public transportation connecting to many destination

title: Not great if you have heavy bags to the airport!
review: Great transport but not if you have heavy bags as there are no trolleys and not always escalators Had to take 2 trains from Mi Chot and took us much longer than expected We planned to check our bags into a luggage holder and then venture into Bangkok but it seemed like more of a mission in the end I think this would be great to use around the city if you were staying a few days and if you had specific things planned and knew your way around the different areas

title: Good way to avoid heavy traffic
review: The air con on the BTS is usually quite weak The fare is quite cheap and can easier access shopping area by BTS

title: Good to try
review: If you have not too much thing to carry you better try this airport link Locate at the basement of Suvarnaphumi airport It link to metro main Bangkok too If you want to avoid expensive taxi and traffic This is the best

title: Easy ride
review: Tickets are cheap train is clean and fast Easy way to go fro Different sections of town Sometimes can be crowded

title: Don't do it unless you are traveling in peak traffic hours.
review: I carefully researched all options to reach the center of Bangkok from the BKK airport for our first visit and I was very happy to have selected a normal taxi from the airport which is fixed rate at about $13 for two people with luggage and is very well organized at the airport Just follow the signs and there are police to help you if you have questions No problem The Airport Rail Link seemed complicated crowded and not any faster especially if you arrive outside of the peak traffic hours of 710AM and 58PM

title: Cheap and affordable
review: Tried to take airport rail link this time and surprisingly is fast cheap and convenient Wating time is short so much cheaper than KLIA transit )

title: Efficient way to get around
review: It maybe the second fastest way to get to the airport besides the express rail link But this is much cheaper with less than half price of the express one It also comes every 15 minutes You can connect at BTS Phayathai for Phayathai station or MRT Petchaburi for Makkasan station

title: Very clean and efficient public transport service
review: What a great example of public transport  Fast Clean and Efficient  A great way to explore Bangkok

title: Cheap and easy to your hotel.
review: Easy to find at the airportFor  45 bath only  to the city If your hotel is close to the station the fastest and cheapest way to get to your hotel avoiding traffic jam

title: Standard-functional
review: No reason to sit in traffic 1 week pass would be nice easy to navigate eastin grand has direct access to station platform

title: Wonderful must do Bangkok Experience
review: Today we had a fantastic and must do experience whilst in Bangkok The train and floating marketsWe are a family group of four adults and 3 teenagers and all equally enjoyed the experience We were also very fortunate to have Sara as our guide She was amazing from the time she picked us up from our hotel Gave fantastic comentary as we drove through the streets of BangkokShe was also very Knowledgeable and very funny Thank you Sara for a wonderful experience in Bangkok This tour is listed as a half day tour but it is more a full day experience We were picked up around 820 and dropped off 330

title: Excellent tour, this is the one!
review: I searched everywhere for a good railway AND floating market tour and they were either too expensive too long or poorly reviewed But I trusted my gut and other reviewers on this one and I'm so glad I did This tour was perfect We did the pickup option Add it was such an early startthe tour was a half day and still we did and saw so much Our guide explained some important aspects of each tour and planned a meeting time and point for the group and then allowed us to explore and shop on our own It felt very relaxed but they also made sure to help us secure a longtail boat ride down the floating market which is a must do I highly recommend

title: Its Public transport with a view
review: quick efficent & what you come to expect from this type of public transport with the added bonus of a view

title: Must-do excursion in Bangkok!
review: Excellent trip our tour guide Kay (or Kae) was very courteous friendly and took very good care of the 10 of us She carefully explained the trip to us and the history of BangkokThailand Our driver also was very courteous and took us around safely As we were early we took some side trips to a nearby Wat and also a sea salt station at Kalong  Worth to see so much history and tradition in these two places  how the local people bid their trade and livelihood through the decades both along the railway tracks and river line although the whole experience is somewhat commercialized now A mustdo trip in Bangkok for a first hand experience Ask for this tour guide 🙂

title: Best way to move in busy city
review: Doesn't matter if you are in a budget trip or not Is the best way and very easy to learn or by map

title: Convenient way to roaming around Bangkok!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a reasonable cost and convenient way to travel around Bangkok city It is found to be a very convenient way to travel around the city which goes through most of the main shopping areas It is also safe and very quick too   Although it is efficient however sometimes it’s get crowded mainly during the peak hours we always choose to stay at hotels close to a BTS Skytrain station because of its excellent service Purchasing tickets is very simple just follow the instructions written in English or you can get help from the counters or even other passengers It’s highly recommended to roaming around the city by the Skytrain and one can see a lot of the modern architectures around the city

title: The only reliable option during rush hour traffic
review: Can be a bit crowded during rush hour but way better than getting stuck in the unpredictable traffic Aircondition a bit on the cold side but usually a pleasant change from the hot and humid air outside

title: Easy to get around
review: Bangkok was our first stop in Thailand and in Asia ever The BTS Skytrain was really easy to navigate and get around It was a little more expensive than I thought it would be but still relatively cheap compared to other modes of nice transportation

title: No cards or notes
review: You can't use credit cards or Notes you have to get change from the office then get your ticket out the machine Apart from that a good travel system

title: Great way to move around in BKK
review: Fast cheap easy and air conditioned Can get very busy during rush hour and Friday evenings so make sure you buy travel car in advance alsomake sure you have exact change as lines are also big for money changing

title: Clean. Fast. Reliable.
review: Used this service twice while in Bangers and it doesn't dissapoint If you want to get from the airport to the city it is the only way to travel Air conditioned Can get crowded but travellers are polite and respectful

title: Rail buddy
review: Using the BTS is the best way to get around Bangkok  Where I stayed the station was within walking distance  Travelling to places like MBK or the night market on the rail system makes it easy and inexpensive

title: Get a Rabbit Card
review: If you wish to avoid the queues getting change then again queuing for a ticket buy a plastic rabbit card and keep it topped up for those busy times Stay in hotels close to BTS stations this makes like in Bangkok easier unless you enjoy sitting for hours in taxis

title: Cheap, Safe and Effective
review: A great way to get around Bangkok we used the BTS Skytrain for a week and found it safe clean cheap (although no discount for children) and effective  The raised walkways that are part of the system allowing you to enter malls is a great way to get off the hustle and bustle of Bangkok streets  As a tourist you can buy single tickets very easily from a vending machine Alternatively if staying a week or longer travel cards can be purchased allowing for easy tapon and off entry and exit  Any not used funds are redeemable at the end of your trip by handing the card back

title: Clean and convenient
review: Very clean and convenient Crowd is very well mannered There's drink stall at the station Overall it was a good experience

title: too crowded
review: We are glad to try it but it is too crowded and for 2 people it's economical to go by taxi But if there is a lot of traffic then it is better to go by this rail link

title: Easy to use and get around
review: You'll need coin to buy the tickets but once you've figured out the map this thing is an absolute breeze to use

title: Good way to travel
review: Good and easy way to travel quite cheap as well after a couple of times it is easy to understand the system as well

title: OK
review: easy to use and the ticket machines are in english and Thai  It is cheaper and easier than using taxis  taxi drivers ib Bangkok do not usually speak much english but a few do

title: I love the BTS!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a good way to go around hasslefree It's spacious easy and fast Used it to reach different locations such as Terminal 21 Chatuchak Market etc

title: Amazing markets
review: Sara was a really good guide ready to answer every question During the car journey there was also a brief Thai lesson amazing

title: Excellent, efficient, frequent and super cheap
review: The airport rail link is an excellent efficient frequent and super cheap way of getting from Bangkok International Airport to the centre of town Ticket from airport to Phrya Thai (centre of Bangkok) is only 45 Bhat (US$ 136) and takes approx 25 mins  Trains are clean and with excellent signage  Various stops connect to the other Bangkok MRT  LRT lines making this an excellent way of getting around Bangkok  Not only an absolute steal but a great way to avoid the notorious Bangkok traffic jams

title: Fantastic service and fast commutes
review: We never had to wait long for a train to come past and commuting between points was very easy We purchased rabbit cards and loaded about 400 bhat on it and that was enough for a whole week of use sometimes more than once a day in a specific direction Security is also decent and people are generally very courteous to one another on the train

title: Easy to use
review: Easy and straight forward to use only down side from my own point of view is it would have been even better if it went further West as we spent alot of our time sight seeing so we had to get taxis back in the evenings and that wasn't easy

title: Now even better
review: Always a good way to get around Bangkok Best to avoid peak times if you can as it gets frantically busy then Cheap quick and safe in airconditioned space plus wifi also works Now better as the line is open to Kehla which opens up the area of Samut Prakan for exploration Cheap by comparison to any European train system obviously distance dependent but it is usually less than €1

title: The rail link is too crowded
review: The Airport Rail Link is extremely crowded and busy during peak hours I traveled from Sukhumvit 21 to Suarnabhumi But the rail link was so crowded that I had to skip 3 trains to get onto Also each train arrives with a gap of 1112 minutes which makes it more tiring Travel with enough time in hand to avoid rushing for your flights

title: Gloriously Air Conditioned!
review: After a long hot day of sightseeing among the chaos that is Bangkok what a pleasure it is to step aboard the BTS Skytrain which is clean modern and gloriously air conditioned  I wanted to ride past my stop just to soak it up some more  Just as nice is the price which at 40 baht (about $130 USD) it was a bargain to get from our hotel in Sathorn to the main station at Phaya Thai  And the cross platform transfer at Siam was quick and smooth  I've been on elevated trains and subways in most major cities around the world and the BTS skytrain in Bangkok is one of the best

title: Easy to get around
review: Simple to use  People are clean and the train is safe

title: Convenient, but very cold
review: The aircon is killing when you come from 30 degrees Centigrate ticketing system is easy you can get coins from change manager for the amount you precisely ned

title: Fast, Efficient, Affordable .... and Bizarre!!
review: What a strange bizarre experience it is to take the Express Airport Rail Link from Makkasan Station to Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport  First of all there is no easy way to get to Makkasan Station  I was told to take the MRT to Phetchaburi Station and then walk over to Makkasan  Sounded easy enough except that there is a total lack of signage pointing you in the right direction and no exit from the MRT that takes you directly to the rail link station  The exit takes you to a busy sidewalk where I had to gaze around until I spotted the overhead railroad a few hundred meters distant  The I had to drag my suitcase and carry my packpack a good half a kilometer to reach the station having to cross a busy sidestreet in the process    Once in Makkasan Station it gets really spooky  This place is HUGE Its terminal is bigger then most small airports and everything is clean and shiny  The only problem is that it is completely devoid of people  Noone uses is likely because noone knows where it is  Your steps echo hollowly on the tiled floors as you follow signs directing you to the train  Staff are few and far between but there was a helpful lady who told me where to buy my ticket and where to wait for the train    Once on the train it was lovely with comfy highbacked seats  The trip is amazing shoooting by the scenery nonstop at highspeed reaching BKK's main terminal in just 15 minutes  All for just 90 baht  I sat on an empty train however with all the seats around me empty at 2pm   Why is this service not being used by everybody  Well when I returned the same way to Makkasan on my return trip there were no taxis to be found at Makkasan so there I was dragging my suitcase over to the MRT again  On a second occasion I tried to take a taxi from my hotel to Makkasan and the driver had no idea where it was and ended up dropping me off at the regular slower rail terminal of Ratchaprarop  I said "No I wanted Makkasan" but he said "This Makkasan"   So a world class facility sits idle because of the difficulty in connecting with it  It should be the busiest transportation hub in Bangkok but because of poor planning it sits like a multimillion dollar ghost town  I direct link between the MRT Station of Phetchaburi likely by an underground access tunnel is absolutely essential to make this a meaningful addition to Bangkok's worldclass transportation system

title: So convenient!
review: we saved all our taxi fare very cheap and convenient You dont have to waste time in the traffic Goes to all shopping destinations

title: Excellent easy way into the city from the airport
review: Everything easy  might be tricky if you have lots of luggage We had one small suitcase and a backpack each  no problem The announcements are made in English as well so although crowded it’s very quick and simple We had booked a hotel within walking distance of a stop otherwise a taxi or tuktuk ride at the other end

title: clean, fast and save way to cross the city
review: Easy cheap fast way to cross the city Is connected with the other subway make sure you got your 10baht coins

title: Nice but not a tourist attraction!?
review: Again like the airport line not a tourist attraction but it's a nice transport system similar to Hong Kong's MTR but not quite as nice slick or modern but better than the MRT found in Bangkok This is airconditioned at least

title: Easy-cheasy
review: I think it's the fastest way to go to the city centry  the closest metro station from the BKK airport Cheap and efficient

title: Efficient mode of transportation
review: While in most cities public transportation is cheap and efficient  However I think the prices are rather high for the BTS  You pay by where you are going  You simply use the self check out machine  very easy  You need your ticket to enter and exit so keep your ticket  Given the terrible traffic in Bangkok it is far quicker to use the BTS and cheaper than a cab if there are 1 or 2 people but once you get 3 or 4 people a cab is cheaper

title: Love it!
review: Its very easy to use and I love it Surprisingly I was able to navigate my way with no difficulty We used skytrain going to almost all places we went to even at the airport We wanted to avoid the traffic and its a success Cheap too

title: Just a ride. For fun
review: Took the airport rail link from the front  ( next to hotel ) to the airport and back just for a outing was bored in hotel waiting for friends to arrive the next day The trip was quick and good Not that crowded  however the return trip was a little bit more fuller And I was glad to " debark" at my station Next to my hotel I happen to sit In a large tour group carriage from an other Asian  country who just landed from their county and where on the way to their hotel (Darn ) my hotel too A really noisemakers group  with luggage all over the show But the trip was pleasant with the fact that I was seated next to the door and could watch the expression on people's faces as they entered and change carriages At the next opportunity  but total The trip was not that expensive and a must for all who are in bkk and need to get to the airport fast and safely Oh I drive a car But meeting my friends the next day at 7 am at the airport  where did my car stay  And what did I travel by Back to the hotel by train and off to the next place by car

title: Skytrain
review: Great service easy to use for getting round Bangkok at  reasonable price bets getting stunk in the traffic

title: Value for money
review: If you want to save time & money then travelling by the BTS skytrain is just the thing to do For a tourist Bangkok is best divided into 2 areas main city with it’s night life restaurants shops and the Skytrain and there is the other side of the city with the river the Grand Palace and Khao San RoadThe Express Line from the Suvarnabhumi airport takes you directly  to the Phraya Thai Skytrain Station right in the centre of the city Please remember that trains stop at midnight

title: A tourist life saver!
review: Quite simply the fastest and cheapest way to get around Bangkok I'd recommend googling your route before travelling to know where you are going It makes purchasing your tickets very easy The ticket machines couldn't be easier to use The trains are always on time Sometimes they are busy but of course they will be I wish every big city had something this easy to use

title: Use This Service
review: a great way to hit the city and allow your self to get into the vibe of bangkok Cheap and easy a great way to see some of the less likely tourist areas of Bangkok

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: Great system for seeing Bangkok Cheap to use and wonderfully air conditioned on hot days One point is to try and use out of peak times otherwise it's crowded and you'll be standing the entire tme Other than that it's great

title: Great way to get around
review: Great and reasonable way to get around the city One doesn't have to take taxi's that will overcharge you if they can You can buy your tickets right before getting on the trainWe enjoyed it

title: Fast and convenient
review: Best way to get around in Bangkok a long with the BTS Unlike the subway it is less crowded and you can enjoy the city from above

title: Convenient
review: Considering the heavy terrafic of Bangkok sky train is the most convenient transportation in Bangkok We even took a train at the airport which is connected to sky train and we could reach our hotel easily

title: Easy transportation
review: You cannot get lost on the bts even with connection It stops at most Malls snd places of interest Mo Chit is the stop for Thailand largest flea market  chatuchak and must see Stations are all strictly guarded safe very clean and inexpensive train rides

title: Would be great to have this in my town
review: As already many times said and writen clean temperature controled eficiant and cheap transport in BKK

title: easy to use
review: very easy to use clean cheap city center  great transportation very well kept fast great for tourist and locals

title: highly efficient with amazing air conditioning!
review: way more efficient than road transport if you plan to travel around bangkok The trains are modern and highly efficient The air conditioning was amazing for the hotter seasons

title: Cheap, efficient and air conditioned
review: Since the introduction of the bts it is now easier to navigate Bangkok in a stress free environment It now connects with the airport link Soooo much better than taxis or tuk tuk

title: I recommend the railway market
review: The first part was very good I went from one stop by train to the destination  the railway market It was interesting to see and ride the local train I was very disappointed with the floating market everywhere they offered us goods that are available at every corner We expected their local products and food and such The sellers were pulling our boat towards them with a stick and were constantly imposing something on us It was an unpleasant commercial event

title: Great way to commute in Bangkok
review: Trains are easy to use clean and cool and very cheap  Tickets vary from 2450 Bat (approx $70150 USD per ride)

title: Realty enjoyed
review: I took the sky train the first time in Bangkok it was funny I like it so much There are many people there The price is cheap

title: Effective and Efficient, and yet Economical!
review: The ARL not only gives tourists an economical mode of transport to and fro Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport it is a way to escape from the traffic congestion Moreover it does stop at connecting points that bring tourists to the usual shopping belts in Bangkok

title: Best mode of transport from Suvarnabhumi
review: 45thb who dares to complain Heading to airport it lands u direct inside it Heading away from airport right up to Phaya Thai its dirt cheap faster than by road away from cutthroat cheating taxis

title: Good transportation between airport and city
review: For Bangkok Useing Airport rail link is the best way and save money and tme for going to heart of city Suggestion is staying near airport rail link station as Pratunam because from here you can walk from station walking around varieties of shopping centre and local restaurant or take many bus to famous places of bangkok  Important is there are many level hotel from budget to top

title: What.an.experience!
review: We (wife Claudia and me) highly recommend this experience They drove us to each place we got on the train and then we experienced the train passing less than a meter from us The floating market was incredible but the food we ate at the food court was sincerely out of this world We are very happy with this tour and highly recommend it but ask for SARA Sara is the best guide EVER   She was corteus knowledgeable and funny

title: ease of travel
review: once you figure out the map and ask lots questions you are flying around the city with ease never found the cars too fulltrains are running all the time Very clean trains and stations

title: Super convenient
review: Very convenient for travelling to various loactions within BKK Safe and easy to use the BTS is airconditoned and fast A Super convenient way to bypass the city traffic that Bangkok is famously known for these days

title: Choose 2nd class with bed
review: We travel in 3rd class with my wife and it was really really exhausting lol  15h the night train is quite slow and impossible to sleep well  It's cheap 7€ for 800km lol  If you have time it's a good deal

title: May be better than taxi
review: When we arrived to Bangkok we took a taxi On the wat back we used Airport Rail Link  And it is fast (no traffic jams) cheap (45 bhat + bts price to interchange station) and definetly comfortable way to get tofrom Airport

title: excellent mode of transport
review: get to major locations in bangkok with the BTS skytrain skip the traffic jam and scams  get the rabbit card if you're traveling to many spots within the dayweek

title: Good service
review: As far as possible use ARL in Bangkok The last option must be travel by road To go to many places you can also use boat service Very cheap and fast

title: Easy transport from the BKK International Airport
review: I have never seen such convenience at any airport in any country I have visited You can literally not step out of the airport terminal catch this link and transfer to a BTS in the blink of an eye It's clean  convenient and cheap

title: Nice Way To Get Around Bangkok
review: The Bangkok underground MRT system is a great and convenient way to get around Bangkok given Bangkok’s notorious traffic during peak hours It’s fast economical and reliable  Upon entrance to the stations there’s an electronic scanner and security personnel would manually check bags and other suspicious items  We bought a 3 day pass for 230 bahts and it’s very convenient to go to other places in the city We took the MRT from Sukhumvit to Hua Lamphong station then a short 15 minutes stroll to Chinatown in Yaorawat We also took the MRT to Kamphaeng Phet and upon emerging from the station viola… it’s the Chatuchak Weekend Market  Really a nice efficient and economical way to travel around Bangkok

title: smooth and efficient
review: Love love this airport rail the fastest way to Bangkok city without the hassle of bad traffic and grabbing a cab This airport rail is linked to Phaya Thai BTS which took us directly to our hotels Perfect

title: Fast & efficient!
review: The BTS Sky Train is the only way to go if you have somewhere to go nearby We used it a few times as the station was just a few minutes walk from out hotel Loved travelling this way

title: Useful way to get around
review: Easy way to get around Bangkok routes easy to understand passes easy to use  Only hard part was going up and down the stairs

title: Great way to get around
review: This is very easy to use You do need to get change first and then use the change in the ticket machine It cost us 35Baht each way

title: Easy and inexpensive way to get to Bangkok.
review: We took the sky train from the Airport without any difficulty You simply take the Rail Link to the end and transfer to the BTS system to get to the centre of the city If you don't have a lot of luggage to carry around it's really simple and cheap and probably faster than taking a cab particularly during rush hour

title: Cheap and fast
review: We took the Airport rail link to the Suvarnabhumi International Airport from the  Makkasan City Interchange Station The station was walking distance from our hotel in Bangkok There were signboards indicating the way to take the rail link Personnels at the station can also assist in getting tickets (tokens) and answer enquiries A cheap and fast way to the airport We do not have to worry of getting caught in traffic jams and missing our flight or getting fleeced by the taxi drivers This interchange station was also connected to the MRT and the BTS Sky train A very convenient mode of transport to use when travelling in Bangkok

title: Take the train
review: It is very inexpensive and convenient to take the train in Bangkok It was clean quiet and people did not bother us We found it very convenient to use the Airport Rail Link from the airport to the part of the city our hotel was in from there we took a free shuttle boat right to the entrance of our hotel I recommend you look into both sources and if they are going towards your hotel or other places in your plans It will save you a lot of money on transportation

title: Worthwhile
review: Lots of tourists was a downer but you come to expect that otherwise a fabulous day with fantastic guide very knowledgeable and helpful

title: Must Do
review: After visiting Hellfire Pass we continued with a ride on death Railway  Great views as you travel but not so great when you thinkof the men who died building it but hopefully this keeps their memory alive

title: Its good
review: Its a lovely way to travel d city watching traffic jams below with a great viewn cheap alsoi travelled from Pratunam to the suvarnabhumi airport in flat 25 minsthat's cool

title: Big shopping day
review: Utilised to sky train to shops and Kings duty free very cheap and promt all aircon carriages  we got taxi from Sathorn to MBK center and trained home then short walk

title: Very easy transport
review: The skytrain is very convenient and gets you to a number of attractions At times it was confusing but people were so helpful We got a day ticket for 120 or 140 baht i think which was very handy The train is clean and announcements are made both in English and Thai and a great map which lights up and show the progression of your journey

title: Good connector around Bangkok!
review: The BTS is a convenient and affordable connector to commute around Bangkok You can buy the "rabbit" stored value tap card if you using it for multiple trips for convenience

title: MRT - learn to use it
review: By far the cheapest and easiest way to get around Bangkok is to use the MRT Get a map and learn how to use it Even if the place you want is not next to an MRT stop you can then catch a taxi to where you want to go  quicker and cheaper The trains are airconditioned and the system is fairly easy to learn  most signs are in English and Thai and many staff speak a little English

title: Easy to figure out and cheap
review: Thank heavens for the Skytrain so we didn't have to take cabs everywhere  The trains come often they're air conditioned they're super clean

title: It's just a train
review: Ya it's sky train and all that but end of day it is a vehicle which helps you go from point A to point B but not without some pain In Thailand the underground train and the sky train have different cards making it very painful to maintain two cards and you will have to maintain two because there are certain places you can only reach using one of them so good luck with that Apart from that the trains open directly into the mall (whenever and wherever they can) so that is a relief from the blazing sun and humid weather

title: Quick and easy
review: A great way to get around fast clean and not expensive Stations are within walking distance to major malls and markets

title: Cheap, Efficient and Quick.
review: The airport rail link is absolutely amazing It is the quickest the most efficient and cheapest way to travel Especially if you're traveling with limited time in Bangkok from the airport and wanna ignore the lousy traffic airport link is an amazing choice

title: fast and cheap!
review: Cheap and fast way to get tofrom the airport to downtown The only downfall is if you have lots of luggage it is difficult when you have to interchange from the Airport Rail Link to the BTS SkyTrain at Phaya Thai Station

title: Great new train!
review: Took train 10 from chiang mai to bangkok first class and it really was great  Complete new train  first class compartment single use and I had a great trip Book as soon as you can because it's sold out quick I booked by 12goasia and this went very well and easy

title: Worth visit
review: Good for history buffs Built by prisoners of war Just imagine without any machinery in olden times  It's a wooden bridge Also I travelled in the train for 100 B to see the still remaining original wooden part of the bridge Every penny is worth the picturesque scenery on the way

title: Travelling from Surat Thani to bkk by train
review: Hi  I was travelling with my family from Koh Samui to bkk and we had decided to take the train from Surat Thani railway station to bkk which is a 10 hour journey  It was exciting as I love train Travel and do it every country I travel too  I was travelling With my daughter aged 4 and parents aged 72 and 66 so decided to take the second classAC coach as the first class was sold out    The train was scheduled for 12 am and was on time  As we stepped in  I was suprised Bu the cleanliness and the response of the attendants to our requirements  The place was super comfortable and really nice  The beds were made and were comfortable  If it is a over night journey  it is better to take a train for your destination in my opinion  I would recommend any one travelling from koh samui to bkk to take the train from Surat Thani  The boat experience  the road journey and the train journey is simply amazing and a lot of fun   The only thing you need to keep in mind is you need to pick up your tickets from the ticket agent  office which is 2 minutes away from the Surat Thani station if you have booked the tickets online   Over all the experience of the train journey was good and would recommend people to try it if time is not a constraint

title: best way to travel bkk
review: so many people during opening and closing of office hours try to avoid that if you can

title: excelletn
review: Worth every penny it was a great day my husband did not want to go on this trip so I booked through trip advisor and it was amazing  I felt very safe with the other people in the group a wonderful day

title: No traffic in the sky, but get change first
review: Make sure to exchange your bills for coins at the window before buying ticket from the machine The attendant at the window won't sell you a ticket so you must use the machine Train's air conditioning is a life saver

title: An interesting day
review: An enjoyable tour to see floating market again after 35 years I met nice people and the trip was nice Seeing the train a bit anticlimactic but certainly different

title: Easy to use, clean and safe transportation!
review: A very clean and modern train (this is comparing to SFO's BART NYC and DC subways) Easy to buy a ticket that has English translation Cheapest and coolest way to get around town

title: Intimidating but Efficient!
review: At first I was somewhat confused on everything to do with the skytrain but after a bit of research and scouting I adventured my way to the first meeting point of a tour It was definitely a mission but once I talked to some friendly locals and discovered the two parts of the railway intersect it became much easier to navigate the city and became my main mode of travel Highly recommended for any traveler whether attempting to be frugal or not

title: Easiest Way To Travel
review: Bangkok is one of the busiest cities I've ever visitedroad transport is ridiculous Traffic madnessthe skytrainis by far the best way to Tavel Bangkok

title: Neat and nice
review: It is neat and nice Just about good the frequency of travelling couches in an hour which adjusts to the passenger volume

title: Fast and efficient
review: Best way to get from the airport to town Boom 20 minutes the taxi can't beat that 45 bath and then once in the centre you can take a taxi or continue with BTS Tips travel light and as a local The era of heavy luggage sitting in hourly long traffic is over

title: Easy...
review: BTS is most easy way out transportation in BKK CBD Personally I prefer to stay at Asok area where having the interchange BTS  Know which  area you would like to go & ready the coin purchase a day use card

title: Perfect way to get around, cheap and easy!
review: I believe that this is one of the best things in Bangkok it saves you a lot of time it is fast and cheap You should check first where you are and if there is a station close to you It is extremely easy to use it and the tickets could be bought from any station You can buy the day ticket (150 baht) or the single trip one which depends on how many stations you want to pass (from 22 to 44 bahttrip) You can take the ticket from a machine if you have coins or from the people standing there in the offices   I highly recommend to travel with Skytrain if it is possible and suitable for you

title: In a hurry
review: Sky train so easy to access and it just takes you away from all the hassle of the street traffic and the stops are do convenient

title: Fast and quick
review: We loved the Skytrain Its the fastest way to travel in Bangkok There is AC inside and the price is reasonable

title: Fast and efficient
review: I caught the underground train a few times during my stay in Bangkok Sukhumvit If you don't mind not having views to look at then this is the mode of transportation around Bangkok Trains are on time fast and efficient

title: Good
review: The staff would guide you if you do not know how to get somewhere Clean polite andcool P However the price was more expensive than the others )

title: Went to MBK centre via this train had to walk down a km, but excellent services.
review: Its cheaper and time saving to travel by train Taxi & tuk tul all take you on a money ride  Avoid them

title: Efficient!
review: Super clean efficient and cheap It’s very convenient to get from one place to another This is my most recommended mode of transportation in Bangkok

title: Great experience half day with Mr Alex
review: If you are luck enough to have Alex Star as your guide rest assured you will have a wonderful day He is very knowledgeable creative and funny When I come back I will definitely look for his other trips

title: kindle people, fast and easy to use
review: Even when I came  the first time from the airport (with google maps) I find easy to use fast (5 time cheaper and fasterthan a taxi) to arrive to the hotel  Clean secure (everywhere police)

title: Swarming with colors, sounds and fragrance.
review: The railroad and canal markets were swarming with colors and sounds and fragrances Very unique experience Lovely and friendly guide

title: Travelling on the BTS
review: This is the cheapest and most efficient way of travelling in air conditioned comfort to the most popular destinations in Bangkok The trains run on timeThe route is marked on the walls and ceilingEnglish  and Thai is spoken Get a rail pass which can be used for buses also

title: Efficient and easy to use
review: Same as MRT in fact not a monorail or so High capacity good aircon You can buy single trip cards at the machines all rather easy and self explanatory

title: SO CLEAN!
review: It is so clean and affordable Any traveler should take this if they don't want to deal with the headache of bangkok traffic

title: Simples!
review: Super efficient simple to use and cheap   I was very worried about getting around Bangkok given the crazy roads but the Skytrain was great Its eve worth a ride anyway even if you arent headed anywhere particular Its about 50p The simple diagrams show you the zones and where you are going and the english touch screens make booking so easy Easier than the London Underground )

title: Efficent as always
review: Best way to get about cheap regular airconditioned clean cheap friendly staff gets you to the main areas

title: Easy
review: We went nearly everywhere by skytrain because our hotel was connected directly to a station its easy but there are still some areas of Bangkok not covered by the network

title: Modern infrastructure
review: Quite expensive (not quite like the London underground for example) but clean fast and coooold The the price depends on the distance (we gave 42 bht for 7 stations)

title: Very clean and easy transport system
review: The Skytrain is an excellent way to get aroubd Bangkok Easy to buy a ticket and easy to navigate the system You will always be able to work out which platform to be on and what train to catch Very well set out The stations are clean and safe passengers are orderly and everyone is helpful and polite Definitely better than taxis and tuktuks Catch the Skytrain to and from the airport Easier quicker and much cheaper than a taxi

title: Modern and convenience form of transportation
review: An excellent mode of transportation connecting places in the city with comfort and reasonable price

title: Easy to Navigate
review: Clean organized and easy to use  Everyone can at least understand English and help you navigate in case you don't know where you need to go Super easy to get coins from the counter and use the automated service Much cheaper than a Tuk Tuk

title: Bangkok Suvarnabhumi airport to city by train at last
review: It's fast easy cheap (THB 45) efficient and comfortable But it only goes as far as Phaya Thai and then you have to transfer to the skytrain or metro  which is a different system with a different ticket What a pity it doesn't link up with the river ferry stop which would get you to other parts of the city while avoiding all the road traffic However this is a welcome development in Bangkok because it is so much easier to get into downtown Bangkok this way than by taxi or minibus

title: Quick and efficient.
review: exploring Bangkok by public transport we found this train to be quick and efficient and easy to navigate

title: Excellent
review: What an airport rail service should be Easy access Lowest level at BKK easy to choose buy pay quick service to city center whether express or local

title: Convenient for reaching central Bangkok
review: I travel this line frequently and find it good value and efficient for getting from Bangkok airport to central Bangkok The trains run every 15 mins from level B1 of the airport to many stations Get off at Makkasan to change to the MRT lines and Phyathai for the BTS Quicker (avoid traffic) cleaner cheaper and safer than other forms of transport to central BKK

title: Better than other transportsystems in BKK
review: I thought it'd be cheaper but whatever Further it was quite full at all times i used it Would be nice if the rest of the city would be opened up as well Still its much more efficient than buses or taxis at rush hour times

title: Fast, efficient and clean
review: The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok it is a great way to beat the traffic and is clean (as you are not allowed to eat or drink at all on the trains) Can get very crowded during peak times but middle of the day is good to travel with children Price can add up for a family if traveling longer distances (more than 78 stations) so sould be cheaper to take a taxi

title: Great way to get around most times less busy than the sky train
review: If possible I prefer to use MRT  it can be less packed than the Skytrain ( except at peak times ) very easy to use machines have English language  just buy a token and go

title: Clinical n Clean
review: cheaper than taxi  puttputt  yes they get crowded  but that's part of the fun  seeing how locals deal with tourists and they helped us

title: Costly but Conveninet
review: BTS Skytrain has covered almost all the important areas of Bangkok We used it a couple of times to reach  Siam Square while coming from Don Mueang airport You can also use it if you want to go places like Emerald Palace Chatuchak Market  Tickets are bit costly but considering the quality of train and timeliness they are providing is totally worth it

title: Very eay transit system
review: I'm a dummy lol but my friend and I were able to easily navigate the system The cleanliness will make you proud

title: Cheap, fast transit to most of the city
review: AC that will chill you very well (because you'll likely be sweating profusely)    Easy access points above the bustling streets  Every 10 minutes or so another train comes  Don't try to get them after midnightthey shut down  Yeah I know right  BKK is a nightlife city and the best transit in the city shuts down so that cab drivers can make all the money

title: Flying above traffic jam
review: I really don't know why people still travel by cartaxi on the main traffic artery  all day not only on rush hours Convenient and secure  if you travel long distance (crossing the city) usewear long shirt or jumper coz it is much too cold AC should be at least 2 degrees less  even if it is full or they should change temperature between half empty and more then half full )

title: Air-conditioned and fast
review: Its a good public service But taxi ended up being cheaper and easier for 2 people So we ended up usong it once only

title: User friendly, fast and efficient
review: Such a pleasure using the BTS skytrain as it is a quick and easy way to get around  across Bkk especially since the traffic is sooo bad and tuk tuk  taxis occasionally try to rip tourists foreigners off   All you need to know is where you plan on traveling to via BTS skytrain then go to the person at the kiosk  self service machine and purchase a ticket for your destination   Just be sure to know that if you get off the sky train  and exit the station before your actual destination know that you will lose your ticket and will need to purchase a new one when reentering the station again   One can buy a day pass  week etc and I advise this if you know you will be using the train multiple times in the day or week coming

title: Only got half way
review: This line gets really packed after the airport I felt bad our suitcases were taking up room The train started to smell like burning halfway through the trip so we were all offloaded had to wait for other trains to take us which were all full so we dragged our luggage down to the street to get a taxi I could see it would be a great service if we made it though

title: Very convenient and super easy to use, lots of English directions
review: We had an MRT station 2 min from our hotel and used it to get everywhere It's very easy convenient and cheap as you only pay for as far as you go just pick you direction and stop Ticket machines offer English and some terminals have tellers

title: Excellent service
review: This airport link is so easy to use so quick to get to the major airport of Bangkok Runs every 15 minutes or so and value for money

title: Not really to be recommended as a Airport shuttle train
review: People of western states very often make the big mistake to consider that train shuttle as as part of a commuter system on big airports in Europe or other big cities It is run by State Railway of Thailand (SRT) and is that company has no connection to MRT (Mass Rapid Transport) or the BTS skytrain company If you still into saving money after your arrival please take the fast red train which terminates at Makhasan Station From there you have to go 10 minutes to find the Metro Station Petchaburi And this is definitely no fun after a long flight and the tropical heat gives you a hard time So you better take the blue Cityline which I think has 8 to 10 stops until it terminates at Phaya Thai Station From there walk down all the steps and after 10 meters walk up all the steps of Phaya Thai BTS Skytrain station Buy a new ticket and then good luck to get access to the train with all your luggage and find almost all trains packed with people Rather often the blue city line can get stuck on the tracks near Ramkamhaeng Station because of the very weak Ramkamhaeng power Station During March a morning train got stuck on the tracks for 1 hour The doors were not be opened and the air condition went out of power too People collapsed and some had serious problems because of that So please think twice before you do are confronted with rather big transportation problems after your arrival in Bangkok airport

title: Very comfortable and cheap
review: This is the best way to get into the downtown Without traffic jam comfortable and cheap I like this transportation method

title: Easy to use
review: Bangkok's most expensive public transport but easy to use and takes you to the markets and the river cruise boats very easily

title: `Other cities should take Bangkok as an example!
review: London and NYC take note  this is how a transport system should be  Fast efficient AIR CONDITIONED and really really cheap the Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok  Would love to see how London commuters would react when confronted with the very simple queueing system (which works)  Buy a Rabbit card and it's charged by the distance you travel  well worth it

title: Good transportation
review: Clean an air Conditioning Tickets are cheap as well The signage where to go is really good Can't really go into the wrong train

title: Amazingly cheap transfer to the city
review: Catch the train from the lowest floor level It costs 44baht The ticket is a scannable disc which you can buy just before the entryThe machines here take notes unlike on the Skytrain where you need exact money  Takes approximately 40mins to Phaya Thai

title: Best way to get around
review: BTS is the quickest way to get around Bangkok The trains are air conditioned clean and frequent Only they are not available all over Bangkok and the ticket machines need change for which you need to que up at the station That's the reason I have given it 4 stars and not 5 But really the best way to get around where available

title: Best way into Bangkok
review: Clean efficient and reliable  Only 30 mins and 45 Baht from Phaya Thai Station from where you can transfer to the BTS  Puts the London Airport Express trains to shame  I have engaged with the Bangkok taxi transfer (with the mental traffic jams) for the last time

title: Easy!
review: If every public transit system were this easy to navigate the world would be a better place Skytrain can be crowded but it's not a problem Do note that boarding is by orderly lines Find the shortest one and cue up Also it's wise to buy a day pass multiday pass or reloadable card rather than purchase individual trips each time you travel even if it costs a bit more to do so During rush hours and especially on weekends the lines to purchase tickets get long Individual rides are purchased at machines using coins All other passes are purchased from a station agent Cash only

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: This is an excellent way of getting around and connects to the ferries on the river This allows you to visut all the attractions along the river hopping on and off as you choise  Both cheap clean frequent and connected to the Eastin Hotel

title: Bangkok bts
review: It was wonderful experience travelling in bts train Bangkoksuper neat and on timepeople r helpful to new passengers Was bit confusing while interchanging stationsbought a 140 baht day passunlimited travel only on bts not mrt Skywalks r very planned and most of them lead directly to big mallsthere r 2 lines running always check on maps at station or ask security ppl to travel correctly People r very disciplined

title: Extremely crowded, great value
review: Extremely crowded you need to be comfortable with people well into your personal space VERY efficient tho

title: Cost less, convenience for traveling
review: It is a great metro system of Bangkok which offer a convenient travel for all traverlers We used it for visiting across Bangkok city with very low cost if comparing to the cap there

title: BANGKOK MEETS 21ST CENTURY
review: What can I say Fast frequent air conditioned and easy to get around on The Skytrain made going around Bangkok a breeze

title: Well worth the ride!
review: This is a good and unstressful way of seeing the contrasts of this city

title: Fastest way to go from point A to B in BKK
review: Although it can too be packed at times during rush hours but it’s still travel way faster than using Grab or driving

title: Very efficient service.
review: We can not speak highly enough of this system   Very well sign posted throughout the airport   Easy ticket facilities to use   Very frequent service   Clean tidy and not too busy even at rush hour   A security check was made every time it arrived at the airport which made you feel safe  Only 45 baht each from airport to the last stop Amazing value

title: easy to use
review: try to learn to use BTS in Bangkok to escape from heavy traffic in Bangkok it joins to MRT in some where

title: Easy to use
review: Its easy to use such  a blessing in this chaotic city  its clean and cheap comparatively Its quick  it will take you to the airport without any hassle at all

title: Speedy, frequent , airconditoned  and easily navigated by non Thai speakers
review: Easy to navigate security staff at each staition are very helpful in pointing you to correct platforms Trains are regular ( we on lt travelled during daylight hours) Very clean and super airconditioned ( wonderful in the 76+ humidity today)  I particularly enjoyed the TV screens trying to figure out what was being advertised Next stations are announced ( inEnglish as well as Thai) and also printed at the base of the screens Excellent value we used a day pass each day as we were  only here 2 days

title: Excellent public Transport.
review: The only public transport you will find in Bangkok where you dont feel your safety is at risk by taking So obviously not as "interesting" as taking a tuktuk it's highly conveninent and brilliant for getting to one end of the city

title: Fast Transportation
review: BTS is cheap and easy to use public transport in Bangkok on some stops you can change bts train to mrt underground

title: Cheap fun way to get around
review: Easy to buy tickets and use train Automated ticket machines take coin or notes When waiting wait on the arrows pointing in leaving room for peploe getting out Cool fun

title: Easy way to travel the city.
review: I use this a lot when staying in Bangkok I really recommend anyone staying in the city to book a hotel close to the track so you wont have to worry about getting a taxi all of the time A day pass costs 140 B ($4 US) Trains run about every 5 minutes from the stops and interchange with Subway The trains have AC and are really only full 89AM and 46 pm its crowded but just squeeze in Don't forget to grab a station map

title: Quick and Easy Train to/from Airport
review: Easy access to the train from both airport and city terminals  Good connectivity with the mass transit system (BTS) in Bangkok  Can be crowded on the commuter service as the ticket is cheap

title: Very efficient
review: The sky train is fast efficient air conditioned and speedily moves you across Bangkok travelling above the congested roads Occasionally crowded as is any city metro system the sky train nevertheless provides great service combined with cleanliness

title: Modern system!
review: The best part for us was the AC on each train also modern and easy to figure it out It can be busy during pick times but people are so respectful and easy going that it makes it pleasant

title: Best transportation in Bangkok
review: The BTS sky train lines here in Bangkok are fantastic and take you all over the city to all the major sites You will enjoy not having to deal with the hassle of taxis and noise pollution

title: aircond heaven
review: After walking to the BTS once inside the train the airconditioning was a welcome relief from the hot wind and very hot day

title: A great idea poorly executed
review: The airport link in bangkok was initially a great idea due to heavy traffic congestion but the fact that access with luggage is challenging that link to the sky train are not easy and that taxi access is a nightmare I would not recommend anyone with more than mobile hand luggage to use this

title: Jam and pack during peak hour
review: Very easy to get around but it can be very pack during peak hour  Prefer to take grab if with small children and non peak hours  Bts is not link directly with the mrt thus need to travel a distance as well Up and down the stairs case It can be very tiring for older or with baby

title: Brilliant Metro system
review: This is the best way to travel in Bangkok It is underground and is not impacted by the notorious traffic jams in the streets It is very cheap and there are machines with instructions in English to buy tickets (also ticket offices are available) It is not as extensive as in other cities but it is very efficient Very clean air conditioned and very easy to use

title: Very handy
review: Makes getting around BK very easy although be prepared to be squashed in with a lot of other travellers

title: Shortcomings but useful
review: I took a ride on the busy sector Ekkamai to Chidlom and reached my destination swiftly avoiding the bad Sukhumvit traffic jam  Waiting time for train was also minimal However the BTS can be improved  I had to climb many stairs as there are very few escalators ( difficult for elderly and people with mobility problems)  the train was crowded  even at nonpeak hour  the payment amount was in unusual amount ( eg 34 baht on my trip payable with coins)

title: Excellent way to get to city center from airport
review: Only cost about 1USD to get to either the BTS (elevated trains) or MRT (subway)additional minimal cost Good to use if you do NOT have much luggageotherwise cumbersome Hours are limited till about 11PM

title: Some positive some negatives!
review: I went first class  Positives Security Guard is great Makes your bed for you and is all round lovely Train ride is what you would expect very shakey But that's the thrill of it Would be cramped with two people but one was very enjoyable  Negatives the staff are very very naggy and pushy If you don't buy their already peeled fruit that is 80% unsafe and not fresh then they will give you terrible looks be rude to you be even more pushy Okay so the most ridiculous about this is that the restaurant carriage is in the middle which is surrounded by the carriages that ONLY women and children can be in after 7pm Go figure They will not let you through nor will they escort you so best you bring your own snacks and drinks  All up it was definitely a great experience something to tick off the list

title: Great way of getting to and from, but avoid peak times if travelling with luggage
review: When I arrived in Bangkok I thought I would try this route rather than use a taxi plus I was on my own so I had no one to split the fare with Well the system is good although I did have a large bag with me  which wasn't very good when I had to get off after several stops where lots of people got on This must of been about 730 in the morning just as people would be heading in to the city I did get on at the airport and there wasn't that many passengers on although by the time we made a few stops on the way to Bangkok it got very full The fare was great value about 35 baht if I recall correctly which equates to about 70 pence  I was sat near the door but it was still a squeeze to get off  Personally I wouldn't use this method again when carrying luggage otherwise it would be fine Maybe I should of just parted with 500600 baht for a taxi )

title: Excellent
review: Very easy to navigate don't be afraid to try it out  You can get all around the city in no time at all

title: Convenient and highly necessary given heavy jams
review: The MRT doesn't take you everywhere in Bangkok there are still a few interesting spots that have to be reached by boattaxituktukwalking but it takes to most of the central areas near several malls touristic spots and places to hangout dine drink party  Given how horrible traffic jams can get in Bangkok take MRT as much as you can

title: BETTER THAN TAXIS.
review: Clean and efficient  Driverless trains every few minutes Just wish there were more areas covered hopefully this will happen soon

title: Love it!
review: Find the AirPort link on the Blevel and yuo'll arrive very fast in the center of Bangkok It connects with the MRT in Makkasan and the BTS in Paya Thay Station No hassle with traffic jams

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Sky train is a convenient way to travel around the city No traffic jams depending on the time the trains can be a little crowded

title: Great alternative to traffic congestion in a taxi.
review: Quick easy and cheap A really rapid way to get around BangkokIf you are staying near the river or across from the city centre it takes no time at all to get to the main shopping areas

title: Beat the traffic!
review: beat the traffic on Sukhumvit road use the sky train Good connection with the BTS to take you around the major markets around the city and the ferry on Chao Phraya

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: I used this train when traveling from my hotel in Sukhumvit to the weekend market Chatuchak Well maintained cheap and the best way to get around Bangkok in case the line reach your destination Highly recommended

title: Very clean
review: Very clean  its always so comfortable to get into the BTS Skytrain Price is very good and it is easy to read the map

title: Very efficient, clean and reliable
review: This is a great train service  cheap well air conditioned and reliable The trains are also very regular

title: Excellent.
review: Very well organized & easy to negotiate Tix are cheap About 130B day pass we found this easier than buying short trip tix at every stop which is probably cheaper Signs & maps everywhere in English & Thai Very clean & the AC rocks

title: EASY!!!!
review: Simple and easy cheap no direct queues The perfect travel way in the big city Taxi super cheap but difficult in rush hour traffic

title: Convenient and fast
review: Bangkok famous for her food  massage and notorious on her bad traffic  The ARL which helped me to have a new image on bkk  Last time been there was 2007 which the traffic jam almost costed me missed my flight  This time my time is well managed and will come here soon

title: Best way to the city
review: The rail was easy to use and a good way into the city At times Bangkok traffic is very bad so the rail is a good option

title: EXCELLENT SYSTEM
review: BTS system is set so nicely that you can reach to your destination quick clean cool Once you learn how to get the ticket or get a multi pass card it is easy and quick

title: Wednesday night market
review: The Cha'am wednesday night market is well worth a visit but as by the title it only opperates on Wednesday night near the Chaam railway station The market has a combination of new and old items but be sure to barter to get the best price The local food is worth a try some tasty dish and not so tasty ones Happy marketing

title: Sky train Rocks
review: I had my two grown up daughters over for a visit and took them by taxi to the airport to travel home normally I would use my car but as I planned to go into town to see some friends and have a beer or three it was not on Having said goodbye to my girls I had a little difficulty in locating the station maybe me I have a card to travel the Skytrain so I do not know the price but as I looked out of the window as the traffic built up the closer we got to Bangkok it is a no brainer if you do not have luggage it is also a no brainer if you are on a budget or pressed for time great ride

title: Easy to use for the foreign traveller
review: Easy to use for the foreign traveller All announcements in Thai and English Good network and connections with other public transport in Bangkok make getting around very easy and hassle free

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: A great way to get around Bangkok easy to use and very cheap also gets you away from the manic road traffic

title: Price is right.
review: easy to buy tickets safe to ride better than an untrustworthy cab driver Remember to hang onto the plastic disc you get as you need to put it in the exit gate when you leave the Rail Link Station

title: Will Save You Time & Money!!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a HUGE time saver to avoid the Bangkok traffic which can be a virtual parking lot between 7 am and 9pm  When combined with the MRT (subway) can get you 'just about' any where you may want to visit  There are occasions when you may need to complete your outing with a short taxi ride but go with a Tuk Tuk  more fun and a good Thailand experience

title: 2019 What I did
review: I went to klook and bought the BTS rabbit card I stayed for 7 days and was able to use the full amount There was 7Baht left on my card which I couldnt use ( and I couldnt refund You can only top up 100 200 and 300 amounts You can also use the rabbit card to pay for some food stalls in the food court of MBK and Paragon The last day I needed to pay for a point to point ticket since I did not want to top up This was a big hassle because the line was long and there was just 2 windows (i was in Siam Station) The ticket machines for BTS only used coins which I didnt have If I was to come back I'd bay the card again Note BTS and MRT cards are 2 separate cards

title: nice service direct from base floor
review: express line service to downtown bangkok but very dull air con in this airport rail link should be done this better

title: Seamless Travel
review: We took the train from Chatuchak park until Ratchathewi Right from ticketing to the entry was effortless The people on the station as well were helpful in letting us know the line to be taken A lovely experience For all travellers on budget or otherwise I would suggest to take the buses or the skytrains they are 10x better than the taxis or tuktuks

title: BT's skytrain
review: Really easy and quick to use Very clean Air conditioning and good information so you don't miss your station

title: Excellent way to explore Bangkok
review: The system is so easy to use and affordable Using BTS together with the hoponhopoff boats you can visit almost all the major attractions  Trains were clean and on time The staff were always friendly and helpful

title: great way to get around Bangkok
review: Very good and reliable way to get around Bangkok The traffic jams are crazy in this city so the sky train is a fab way to get around can be crowded at times but to be expected in a city like this )

title: clean and fast...
review: this is what you should use to wonder around bangkok you save time and it is very reliable and clean

title: Favorite station Nana
review: I love the wat they make announcements of the station arriving Especially the Nana station in Thai accent The railways are clean and well managed with proper security and helping staff for commuters It's like the lifeline of Bangkok several people use bts for day to day travel It has a direct airport connect Pretty convenient to tourist's

title: Quick and Easy Airport Connection
review: in Feb 16 the cost was 45 Baht per person to the city BTS station  It is a faster way to get into and out of the city especially on MF

title: Best way to get around
review: There are good descriptions online about how to do this With traffic so bad this is the best way in from the airport for sure We planned our hotel and meals around the stops It doesn’t go to the Palace however Take a boat

title: bangkoks easy travel
review: reasonable cost and fast travel though it is tooo crowdy it doesnt matter because it is the easiest cheapest and fastest way to travel

title: Fastest and easiest way to/from Airport
review: Airport rail link is best way to and from the airport if you dont have big luggage The frequency is good If you are single traveler and your hotel near BTS please consider taking the Airport Rail save your money and aviod traffic jam You can go to Money Exchange shop  Super Rich (Best exchange rate at the Airport Rail Link Station)

title: Very convinient mode of transport
review: Very easy and convenient mode of transport in highly traffic of bangkok city Good connectivity to many malls and markets

title: Fast
review: I rode MRT at night on my way to BKK airport It was not crowded Very safe It is very easy to buy ticket

title: Easy, clean, air conditioned Skytrain
review: Don't be shy about taking the Skytrain it's a really pleasant way to get around Bangkok You can't buy tickets at the ticket window but you can get change (which is how you pay the machines for your ticket) It's a good place to change large bills too Once on your train the stops are listed on the screen inside your car

title: Vacation
review: Best way to get around in Bangkok If you must go in a different direction then take the subway train Everything of interest is nearby these transit trains and if you need to go further the taxis are abundant

title: best way
review: Easy clean and simple Dont take a tuktuk but go everywhere withe the skytrain in bangkok

title: Traumatic experience.
review: Before considering taking this from the airport I strongly suggest you make sure the place you are going to is on the same line Because if it's not and you have to change it is a hellish experience that you certainly don't want after any kind of flight   There are no elevators so you have to carry your baggage down steps  The train is often full with non airport travellers as it stops at a few places meaning it's often standing room only  if you do have to change lines the ticket people speak poor English and cannot help you Plus the maps are confusing as are the signs to where you have to go  All in all as such even though myself and a friend did this with a Thai national  the grief involved made me wish I had just sat in a Taxi and accepted the traffic  Very very unlikely to do again and then only if hand luggage only

title: Quick and easy way to get from airport to city
review: The bus is certainly cheaper but nothing beats how quick this train is to get in close to the city The train stops at 'Phaya Thai' where there is also a connecting BTS train which will get you to almost anywhere in Bangkok If you are staying in Khao San Road however this train might not be a good option because none of the BTS trains are close enough to walk and will require an extra bus But still a taxi or tuk tuk will be cheaper from any of the closer BTS stations than from the airport

title: Handy and inexpensive
review: I would recommend this instead of a taxi Cheap and easy to use Easy access to the BTS The ticketing agents will tell you what stop you should get off at to change over to the BTS

title: Get the Rabbit Card
review: 100 Baht for the Card and you can top up and travel around It’s a lot cheaper than Grab and will save you from the heavy traffic Also please don’t order from Klook or any other websites as it’s already overpriced It’s better to walk into any Bts station with your passport to get a rabbit card

title: Easiest way to travel
review: The skytrain is the probably the easiest and most comfortable way to travel around some parts of Bangkok Make sure you're prepared for travel during peak times when it can easily get more than just chaotic

title: Clean and fast
review: Good way to get around Easy to buy and use tickets I did the one use tickets and not a pass Single use can only be used on the day purchased just FYI

title: best travel type in entire Bangkok
review: Great time to travel in the BTS SKY TRAIN there air condition is too good if you are wearing sleevless or half paints you need to carry some more cloths to cover your self There staff is good and help to find the correct BTS

title: The BTS is brilliant!
review: sometimes frenetic never dull always convenient the BTS is a superb way to see BKK Get yourself a day pass (or week if you are staying longer)  this works our considerably more cost effective than buying tickets piece meal

title: Best way to commute in Bangkok
review: If you are in Bangkok always look for BTS connectivity hiring a taxi is not only expensive it will take a lot of time to move around due to congestion on the roads

title: Crowded but efficient.
review: Crowded both on train and ticketing area Ticket machines accept coins only long queues to purchase tickets Best buy a Rabbit stored card to avoid these hassles

title: The Death Railway - an experience
