review: The BurmaSiam Railway also known as the Death Railway stretches from Myanmar (Thanbyuzayat) to Thailand (Ban Pong) A short train ride along a section of this line between Nam Tok and Thakilen stations and across some of the wooden bridges is well worth the experience

title: Amazing experience on the train
review: It’s my second time in Bangkok with a bunch of friends I visited the railway market last time but this time it’s a totally different experience since we are able to board the train Our tour guide Dui is a nice gentleman who took care of all the people in the tour and also taught us how to bargain Awesome

title: BTS Skytrain GF
review: See around downtown good service and Bangkok life  @@ Feel good  @@ Go to Stadium  @@ go to Samrn  Thanks

title: Easy and Save your time!
review: When you take a sky train you can be sure that no traffic at all The many train station connected to the shopping mall  It's made my life more easy

title: Relatively  easy to navigate.
review: Luckily we had a BTS station near our hotel We used it a couple of times during our stay in Bangkok and it was relatively aim free to use Carriages a station nice and clean and staff relatively helpful

title: The best way to get around the City
review: A fast clean and very regular service that gets you around the city without any issues Just a couple of stations could do with escalators but most are ok Go to MBK it is a great shopping spot

title: Saves time!
review: If you go by yourself or 12 persons then its not only faster but cheaper then a Taxi It stops at the Skytrain station in Bangkok so if you are staying near the BTS this is the best way to go

title: An experience
review: Well organised travel to each destination knowledgeable travel guide Only downside short time spent at each location due to travel

title: Clean, safe, fast and efficient
review: I took the MRT back into the city after I was done shopping at Chatuchak market It is also very conveniently located it's within a few steps from the market   The train was on time clean and very fast It took me about 17 minutes to get back to Bangkok from the market The taxi charged me 400 baht which I think is overpriced and the MRT costs 51 baht depending on the zone you're traveling to  Very practical

title: Very effective way of transportation in Bangkok
review: I like it a lot much more efficient in traffic than the taxis despite how cheap they are It gets crowded though and it may not be for everyone but the system is easy to understand Highly recommended

title: Not an attraction really!?
review: Not an attraction really but very clean and very efficient There is no faster way in to Bangkok when the traffic is busy Make sure you stand behind the yellow lines and wait for the security guards to check the carriages before you board at the airport They do take this quite seriously

title: Not to be forgotten
review: We had an early start at Hell fire pass luckily it was virtually empty allowing us peace to to honour those who worked these trails We then hiked approx 4 kms to the other side of the 3 level bridge and back stunning scenery

title: good transportation
review: excellent service a bit crowded but fast and reliable the train is clean and the time schedule is good

title: Very enjoyable
review: We really enjoyed going by Train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai  was beautiful my family were very happy with it they slept good on the Train we came back from Chiang Mai to Bangkok by Train and you  should try

title: Only way to go
review: From the airport into the city there is no other way to go unless very early am when the train stop and a taxi is required

title: The Skytrain is the best way to get around BKK
review: I lived in BKK when they were first building the Skytrain system  Getting across town was difficult due to the incessant traffic jams  Quick efficient air conditioned the BTS Skytrain is now the perfect way to get around BKK  As with any public transport you may wish to avoid peak travel hours  Otherwise the system is user friendly and you'll have no problems finding your way around

title: BTS your way
review: BTS makes traveling around Bangkok fast It is interconnected to most MRT AR lines which makes it essential  When you purchase a BTS card 100baht is nonrefundable but I was told will not expire Also BTS card is solely for BTS (unlike in Taiwan or HK where you can use the cards even in buses) so one needs a separate MRT card (where lines get really long during peak hours including the vending machine queue and they don’t have specialtyelderly queue) BTS stations are filled with food and drink stalls as well as various ATMs  You can topup using credit card (300 baht minimum) There is no unlimited dailymultiday pass

title: Efficient
review: Bangkok traffic is a nightmare  Use the skytrain and subway to get around the city efficiently  Otherwise pay for a car and drive on a daily basis if you want to get around the city in comfort

title: BTS
review: the BTS is by far the best way to get around  Its regular quick clean and airconditioned and cheaper than taxis and TukTuks

title: Comfortable and convenient
review: If you travel alone and need to catch plane on time you can make use of this rail line It is comfortable and reliable Moreover you can avoid heavy traffic and save a lot From the central Bangkok to the airport costs you just a dollar That is very reasonable isn't it Try this rail line and you certainly love travelling by this rail

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: One of my favorite transportation method in Bangkok Have several connections with the MRT system Could be quite packed during afteroffice hours And also the queue is not as good as in Singapore But train is well maintained and stations are clean

title: Fast & reasonably priced
review: Our first time in BBK took the ARL efficient & clean with lots of space Got off at the end of the line & hop on the Sukhumvit  BTS line to our hotel We paid a fraction of the cost of a taxi If it’s your first time there don’t hesitate to ask the staff for directions It’s not easy to figure out where you have to go

title: very good service
review: Unlike many underground trains this one is a great way of transportation in Bangkok and it stands out by being very clean and esthetic

title: Too limited
review: Getting around Bangkok is a nuisance The BTS is the best way to get around some parts but with only two lines (one underground line and one separated bus lane route) you need to get a taxi to most places

title: Carrying bags down stairs is not fun
review: We just used this for the first time  Can be a little difficult when the escalators aren't working  It's a good system fairly cheap But the wife is convinced we won't be doing that again  If you are traveling alone and lite I would for sure

title: BTS skytrain
review: We used the system whilst in Bangkokit is very clean and modern  The system is also very efficient and saved us a lot of time

title: The only way to get around bangkok
review: I always use the skytrain from suvarnabumi airport  straight to where im staying at the  hotel  weather it be sukhumvit area siam   onnut or silom the skytrain  will get you there  hassle free   of course depending on where you go     need to change at various stations  for different lines or mrt   its the cheapest way to get round   no haggling with taxi drivers who think because your a tourist  its their pay day

title: Clean, quick and cheap
review: A must do to get around Bangkok and avoid the road traffic The numbers on the station is the price to get there from the station you are at and the ticket machine only takes coins for now

title: Convenient and fast way to get around
review: The BTS Skytrain and the underground MRT network is very well organised It is a convenient comfortable and fast way to travel around in Bangkok

title: Awesome metro, fast and clean!
review: I took the metro from Suvarnabhumi to Ramkhamhaeng and return Its spacious less crowded and very fast I had no problems getting on and off with 2 luggages

title: Train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai
review: We caught the #14 train and travelled in 2nd class AC lower bunk sleepers The configuration was a little odd  my boyfriend and I were seated in separate berths But no matter its pretty safe as there was a train conductor patrolling the corridors Tickets are checked at the start of the trip and the conductors wake you up 10 minutes before reaching your destination   Actual train ride was fine minimal stops and not too bumpy We both managed a few hours of decent sleep The corridor light is kept on overnight but each bunk comes with a curtain to block the light out AC not ice cold but cool enough to be comfortable There is power point available as well to charge your electronics The toilets were cleaner than expected and there was toilet paper available There was ample space for our luggage on our actual seat as well as a hook on the wall for smaller bags   We had dinner and breakfast on the train A lady comes to you with a menu and you can order what you like and it will be delivered to you when you want it   We booked our tickets through a travel agent who bought our train tickets for us and then delivered to tickets and had them delivered to our accommodation in Chiang Mai for a small fee Hassle free

title: Cheap way into the main areas
review: Just 45 baht per person into downtown BKK Takes about 45 minutes from the airport Especially valuable during peak travel times

title: Busy, fast, inexpensive.
review: We used this train in both directions and found it very convenient  A taxi would be more comfortable as the train is packed but it would take much longer and certainly be a lot more expensive  There is now only one train as the express service no longer operates

title: The best way to get around!
review: We used the sky train a lot in the 8 days we were in Bangkok  It is a great way to get around the city and we had a Rabbit card (similar to a debit card) to use for fares  Our hotel was near National Stadium station so we were able to catch the skytrain to other stations and change lines at Siam  The skytrains were very clean and well run  If you missed one skytrain it didn't take long for another one to come along

title: Clean Station and Train
review: Travel with BTS is fun and clearly more efficient than travel by taxy or Uber because of bangkoks heavy traffic And its integrated with River transportation such as Saphan Taksin station BTS surely great for traveling

title: BTS sky train - Ease of travel
review: It's the most convenient and quick means of travel in downtown Bangkok It is very economical and all the shopping malls are well connected We always use it when we are in Bangkok

title: Quick and reliable
review: Probably the most reliable of transport that runs until late at night It can get crowded however nothing like the traffic and therefore is the most reliable form of transport taking you to some of the major shopping market areas

title: Fast and cold
review: fast and cheap way to go everywhere in Bangkok easy interchange to Metro MRT or BTS Just keep your eyes in your belongings sometimes is so crowded and there are some pick pockets like any big city in the world

title: Robyn k Australia
review: What a place to visit Absolutely amazing to see what the pow built Very moving and emotional A must to see

title: Quick, Easy and Cheap
review: This mass transportation system is reliable to deal with Bangkok traffic jam It connected to lots of tourist attraction quick easy and cheap

title: Fast way to travel and avoid traffic
review: Will take u  near ur destination in no time with zero traffic Best way to travel across BKK if you know where u r heading

title: Sara is absolutely awesome!
review: Sara was a really amazing tour guide and informative great tour Great food and overall a great experience that I got to have

title: BTS
review: BTS is basically the sky train in Bangkok city same as the one in Vancouver BC Canada It's convenient to move around in the city but if you're in a group of 4 or maybe five you're better off taking a taxi By the time you buy five BTS ticket your taxi would have cost you about the same and taxi drop you off right at the door step With BTS there's quite a walk depending where you are going  I love the fruit carts on the street side they are reasonably inexpensive and taste fantastic and healthy too Oh Forgot to mention the biker taxi are a good way to move around the traffic they are reasonably too but you have to know the price or they will charge you more Bike taxi mostly travel short distances There are other fun things to do at night too I will leave that for you guys to find out for yourself 🤐😇 Have fun

title: Fast and cheap way to get around
review: Fast and cheap way to get around the city though keep in mind it's still a bit limited Doesn't cover a lot of area with it's connections It is however air conditioned so nice escape of the heat Just keep in mind that the Thai tend to have the airco at arctic setting p  For some areas you're better off getting a longtail boat or perhaps a taxi   With taxis be prepared to negotiate for meter or price They tended to ask me 6x the fare with meter so i ended up waiting a while till i found an honest dricer

title: Easy to use and reasonable
review: We used the BTS several times during our stay including after we took the airport train into the city It is amazing fast clean and reasonable You buy tickets at wicket at the station the fare is based on how far you are travelling You are issued a plastic card which you tap on the way in to get through  the turnstiles then you insert the card into the turnstile to exit What a great system Everything is recycled and ensures honesty

title: Fast, cheap and reliable
review: I used the ARL both ways to and from the airport and did not wait more than 5 minutes on both occasions Relatively spacious and on elevated track which allows for excellent views along the route both sides of the carriage Just 45 baht

title: Good way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain only covers a limited part of Bangkok but can be very convenient if it serves the area you want to travel in Given how bad the road traffic is in the city the Skytrain is a much quicker way to get around It is cheap by European standards but can get quite busy The signage on the station platforms is not great so it is sometimes difficult to know where you are  you need to be careful to listen to the announcements on the trains that are made in Thai and English

title: fantastic tour guide Sara !
review: An amazing trip with a wonderful guide thanks so very much  we had a great day at maekong market followed by a visit to the floating market Sara was a wonderful guide and always steered us in the right direction with good advice on prices and where to go thanks very much

title: Good public transit
review: Convenient subway  Connecting the erstwhile unconnected areas and Bangkok suburbs  Will be good when entire network is operational

title: Best and quickest way from airport
review: At only 45bht a ticket you can't beat the price as an airport transfer I would bet to say it's the quickest way in to town as well skipping traffic

title: Very convenient way to travel to and from Airport with stops along the way
review: I have used the Airport Rail Link as part of my daily travels around Bangkok  The Airport Link connects with the subway and also the Sky Train  No eating or drinking on the trains  Security checks of bags are carried out and you need to walk through a scanner before boarding the train  Very clean and modern facilities

title: Art
review: Clean and professional  easy access from airport The workers was knowledgeable about moving around the transit system They made Bangkok a must visit again

title: Great!
review: So easy to get around Bangkok Cheap very clean  air conditioned why wouldn't you use it Well done Bangkok

title: Best way to commute in Bangkok
review: Don't waste money in renting taxisall the attractions are almost around major BTS stations One has to hire a taxi for sight seeing of Temples Safari Tour & Ayuthaya tour onlyrest can easily be done with BTS  If you are planning to commute frequently within a day then go for one day pass which costs you 140 Baht and you can travel anywhere for the whole day But if you are planning to travel only one spot a day then  take direct point to point tickets from the vending machine If one is planning to stay for a longer duration such as more than a week and is expecting to visit bangkok in future then go for rabbit cards

title: An experience not to be missed
review: From pickup to drop off the day was like no other We had a private tour guide named Jill who you must must must ask for Her knowledge is vast The journey took a few hours to arrive however she taught us interesting facts about Thailand pointed out all kinds of land marks & gave us a full day experience that totally fulfilled our wishes We went to an example of what the prison camp would have looked like which was filled with paintings and drawings by the POW  from there  We were able to spend quality time at the bridge & were pointed out where the bridge had been bombed took photos etc We then took the train on what is called the death railway Jill had organised a windows seat Our journey took us to The Kasae Cave where the Japanese Officers stayed during the war From there we had a buffet lunch with a view to the railway river cave & hinterland From there we went by car to Hellfire Pass The Australian government have done a great job to maintain the area with dignity stairs down to the pass or a road Hellfire Pass was very sobering eerie but also beautiful It's hard to put into words knowing the thousands of men who died at this very spot The terrain would have been brutal We walked back to the museum where you could listen to pow survivors via big screen videos  tell their stories of mateship and the hell that they lived through there were photos and poems it was very emotional We also got to see the tin cans as the prisoners called them  that they were jammed into daily taking them back and forth working 18 hour days From there we went to the POW cemetery where thousands of headstones lay with names rank and age What a sobering day full of emotion & knowledge I fully recommend Jill as a tour guide she made this already wonderful day one to remember

title: Escape Traffic Jam
review: Efficient way to travel inside the city TaxisTukTuk are always trying to loot tourists We can get 1 day pass in BTS and 3 day pass in MRT

title: It works!
review: I loved the sky train super fast from our hotel to everywhere once you get used to the names of the stations everything will work so smoothly

title: Easy to get around
review: I downloaded the Bangkok TH app which works like the London tube map ap If you are searching for it it's a green and white train picture with the word Bangkok With the aid of the app we were able to travel around easily without any issues The sky trains are also well air conditioned Yes it is busy but has a very polite queuing system The one thing we couldn't work out ourselves was which ticket to buy Just go to the counter and tell them your destinations and they will give you coins for the machine and will tell you which ticket you need These are one way and he numbers are simply how much the journey costs Generally a one ticket cost us a very cheap 2045TBTs which is equivalent to 4090 pence GBP

title: Best transportation veichle in thailand
review: You should use ıt especially when you are going to the international airport It is cheap and fast It us also clean and so safe You can reach city center in 35 min

title: Handy
review: Relatively new  the Airport Rail Link is a good connecting point to the Metro I was asked to take Well maintained and cheap Ideal for tourists

title: Fast & Convenient to/from Airport
review: This is the best way to beat Bangkok city traffic Economical and fast it reaches most areas of the city with easy connections  Located on the lower level of the new airport it saves a lot of time in traffic and much cheaper than a taxi  Get off closest station to your desired area or hotel and then if necessary take a short cab ride from there

title: Best way to get around
review: If you can use the BTS do it because it is the fastest and most convenient way to get around Bangkok I really wish it would build a line to the old city as there is nothing to get there

title: Would not recommend the sights as there was nothing authentic about them.
review: The tour operator Kiwi was fabulous and so enthusiastic Unfortunately I would not recommend the sights themselves Pulling into the train station and the floating markets it was us as tourists taking photos of other tourists Nothing authentic about it Would not recommend

title: Fastes way to move in BKK
review: Loved the BTS Skytrain Its coverage is limited Used the nearest BTS station to my hoteldestination and then walked took taxi

title: Made our trip easy
review: Was a 5 minute walk from our hotel and I would highly recommend this as the way to get about  Safe air conditioned and goes all over Easy to crack the lines and connections Was about 180bht for a day pass  Don't mess about with taxis etc just jump on this Make sure you take it to the river and jump on the hop onoff ferry

title: Overcrowded and inconvenient!
review: The airport link is a great idea but it is mostly totally overcrowded Especially with luggage it's not a good option to travel from and to town Sometimes you need to wait a long time at the ticket vending machines and to connect to other Sky Train Networks you need to buy a different ticket with more long queues Why doesn't they make it seamless using the rabbit card Also the train stops at every station An express link would be a good idea I wish they would fix those problems then the Airport Link would be a good alternative

title: good
review: The train from airport to the city is similar to the London's express airport train  but it is better  There is no better way to get to the centre of city quickly in comfort  Costs in also much cheaper than London train  The issue is having to switch to another mode of transport once you get there  It is pretty useless if you want to go to the eastern new territories  Tsing Yi first stop is underutilized

title: It Does What It Needs To Do
review: It’s 45 baht from BKK airport to the end of the line at Phaya Thai where you can connect to the BTS and reach anywhere on Sukhimvit where a great many hotels are located  Including the BTS it’s under 100 baht (less than $3 US) per person  If you’re traveling with just carryon luggage it’s a great way to go to beat the stress of waiting in the taxi queue and paying three to four times the cost and likely taking longer to get to your destination  Be aware however that some BRS stations don’t have down escalators so you have to carry your luggage from the station level to the street

title: Best airport transfer
review: This is by far the fastest and cheapest way to travel from the airport Missing all the traffic and connecting you onto the bts sky train in Bankok

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok!
review: We use it daily and it is always clean cool and on time Get the rabbit card if you are here for at least 2 weeks and save a little per trip

title: Predictive price, predictive travel time
review: For a group of 3 or more persons Skytrain may no longer be cheaper than taxi but its main advantage over taxi you can be sure about travel time and price  we experienced taxis get stuck in traffic and majority of drivers still refuse to use the meter  If you are in town for more than 1 day get the travel card with 100THB preloaded value Machines selling individual tickets only accept coins  very inconvenient with tickets priced at 16 33 and ~44THB   For reaching  locations in the old town where Skytrain does not reach like the Grand Palace Wat Arun China Town use the Chao Phraya River Express Boat Orange line will usually be the best choice Ticket costs 15THB SkyTrain and Express Boat interconnect at Sathorn Pier station in the South

title: Excellent means of getting around
review: I used the Skytrain over 2 days and found it a very efficient means of travel which certainly avoided the heavy traffic found in the centre It was also good to get into the air conditioned carriages on a hot day The transport would benefit from better English instructions as to how to use it if travelling for the first time

title: Clean and easy to use
review: Very clean and easy to use  we weren't sure how to by tickets but all counters were staffed and able to provide us with change in order to use the machines Note costs vary based on where you're traveling Trains come frequently (our experience was every 14 minutes

title: Clean and Efficient
review: We used the sky train just a few times for shopping on our last two days in Bangkok  Clean and very airconditioned  Easy to use for English speakers  Make sure you have coins as in some stations the ticket machines only take coins not bills

title: Clean
review: Th BTS Skytrain was very clean and easy to use Nice was to get where you want to go from the airport

title: A must-see for history buffs
review: It's the Wandering Yank here As both a film buff and a World War 2 buff this was a mustsee for me And it didn't disappoint Mrs Yank and I took a day tour out of Bangkok which included a stop at the Kanchanaburi cemetery and JEATH museum plus a train ride on the Death Railway across the famous bridge The entire experience was very rewarding If you plan to go I suggest you first read a bit of the history if you're not familiar with it  Be sure to walk across the bridge 2 thumbs up

title: Clean and Fast
review: Access to around the city Needs to add more Ticket dispensing machine because lines are always long

title: Great fun!
review: I took the night train between Bangkok and Chiang Mai  I had a lovely time  I splurged and booked first class  For an extra $16 I was able to get the entire room to myself  I was able to turn off both the air conditioner and the lights  It was still cool but not at all uncomfortable  A gentleman came and took my dinner order  He delivered it quickly for a 60 cent delivery fee  I tipped him more than that  Another gentleman came in and made up my bed for me  I chose the bottom bunk  He used pads and clean spotless sheets  It was very comfy for the night  As far as bathrooms there was a squat toilet on the main row with all the room doors  I resigned myself to trying it but no need  There was a western toilet at the end of the row kind of hidden around a corner  It even had a shower  I believe there are both types on every car but again the western bathroom was hard to find  I slept well and I’d take the night train again anytime

title: Best way to get around in BKK
review: This is the absolutely best way to move around in BKK Clean affordable and good value for price Consider combining with the MRT to cover most of BKK

title: No worth to ride
review: If you are alone and have only backpack it's ok to ride  You are 2 or more have suit caese I don't recommend because taxi cost not much different fro 2 person train charge You can reach to your hotel easily without carrying big suit case   From the air port to down town main station you can reach fast But you have to transfer or pick taxi up You Have to move with big suit case

title: cheap way to get out of airport
review: excellent way to get out of the airport to the city you can choose express trains where it gets you to the end station (phaya thai) with minimal stops

title: Super functional!
review: Each time we visit Bangkok we travel a lot on the BTS It is assuredly very convenient and it goes to almost everywhere in Bangkok Shall I inform that new stations of BTS and also MRT are on the way So in a short term Bangkok inhabitants and visitors will be even more satisfied with the new stations  BTS crosses the heart of Bangkok and it stops at all hotels' areas so it is very convenient when you arrivingleaving the city Price is really goodfrom 16 bath it will depend of course on the distance but the price is always pretty much under the budget BTS is ALWAYS very clean (like all transports inThailand)

title: Floating market and railway market - Thailand
review: Sarah was very nice and answered all questions and made sure everyone was safe and happy Great trip to see the countryside and get to experience different modes of transportation

title: Couple trip - Dec 2022
review: This was an amazing trip thanks to Sara and our driver The trip was so much more than what we anticipated it to be We were picked up at the hotel on time safely driven to the first stop of the railway  so we got the train into the railway market we then watched the train leave the station and headed to the floating market The floating market was lovely and we spent about 30 mins and had some lovely street food as Sara advised We were then dropped off at the central station to head back to the hotel   Overall I would rate this trip 1110 and would strongly advise people to do it   Sara was fab couldn’t of asked for anyone better

title: Clean, quick and air conditioned
review: We used this to get to the Erawan museum and found it easy to use and efficient There are security guards and the air conditioning is very welcome

title: Fast transportation
review: Fast transportation in tha main areas More expensive than taxi but way faster The is no fixed minute schedule but i never experienced waiting for more than a few minutes Be aware the the BTS closes between 0000 and 0600 so being out after midnight only leaves taxi as transportation

title: Open and hot
review: The station is too open that we have to cross over the railway without proper bridge or safety measures The waiting area is hot While waiting at the boarding area the rain makes my cloth wet and so hot at the same time with mosquitoes disturbing me

title: Great for getting around Bangkok
review: Be sure to buy roundtrip tickets or a pass We probably overpaid because we didn't plan accordingly and kept purchasing single one way tickets Also pay attention to where you enterexit the terminals Lines can be long to purchase fare cards and to get change Of course there is no eating or drinking on the trains Most tickets agents were helpful Last if you have a backpack security will check it

title: Convenient!
review: Like the subway the skytrain is very convenient in use Trains drive very frequently Make sure you have cash to buy ticket at the machines

title: Very convenient
review: airport rail link is really convenient and saves a lot of time and money It takes you to the heart of the city in a matter of 20 mints At bht 45 (as Nov 14) from connecting stations you may use metro lines to reach your destination Very good commuting way during rash hours

title: So easy.
review: This was our 3rd & 4th trip to Bangkok and always stay near On Nut station and just love how easy and efficient the BTS is to get around the city

title: Good rail system
review: It's connected to everywhere you want to go   It may be confusing at first since you're not used to it But you will find travelling by train could be much better than taking a taxi

title: wow time
review: Best way to get around get a ALL DAY TICKET 140thb and just station hop you can't eat drink or smoke on this train so very clean if you have children avoid rush times

title: Most convenient transportation to avoid BKK bad traffic jams!
review: Convenient reliable air conditioned and definitely gets one to most places on time in Bangkok Perfect transportation to take around Bangkok to avoid the very bad traffic jams

title: Very convenient
review: Although it gets over crowded at times it is the most convenient transport in Bangkok especially with the kind of traffic jams that happens in Bangkok Very easy to get tickets and more so convenient if you take cards which entails you for multiple trips You can make it faster to any part of the city with convenient interchange and map directions

title: fast and easy
review: skytrain helped us skip the hassle of the Bangkok traffic altogether Helped us get some exposure to the daily urban lifestyle of the Bangkok natives super clean and well maintained

title: Easy and comfortable
review: If you in budget holidays  didn't want  spend so much money with taxi from airport to central I can recommend use airport rail link you will save your limited time and pay with low price ticket only 45 phat This train will reach to  central 35 min with out traffic jam phat airport rain link will from suvarnabhumi airport around 8 stop arrived praya Thai (BTS line) reach to central then you can take BTS line you need to go  I would like to inform those Ppl can't walk or with heavy luggage better just took with taxi because you need to walk some distant

title: Very convenient and cheap
review: These trains are very moderately priced and convenient as an added bonus many of the stations coenside with the BTS system making getting to many places a breeze and is a far cheaper option than a taxi

title: Cheap, clean and reliable transport!
review: We used the BTS everyday in Bangkok It is easy to figure out where you have to go as the maps are in English It can get crowded but they are air conditioned so never uncomfortable A safe and easy way to travel around Bangkok

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: This is way better than trying to barter with a cab or get a Grab in the city It only costs 140 baht for a day pass and you can explore a lot of the city It connects to both Ari and Thong Lo two very cool neighborhoods worth exploring as well as the malls near the victory monument

title: Airconditioned and timely
review: The trains arrived on time and were airconditioned  There was no problem accessing their maps The lines covered the main central city areas but unfortunately do not go straight to Don Mueang airport so taxis and buses had to be used

title: Cheap easy way to get around
review: Very easy to use clean good price no hassles Can go to chutacuck market all around Bangkok Also can go out to the airport too

title: good thing we are near the station........
review: This is very efficient way to move around BKK Friendly to use since area where you will go already indicates how much the fare will be

title: Unless you're traveling solo, overpriced!
review: Since our hotel is located just behind Chit Lom BTS we thought it would be worth a try  But unless your destination is located next to a BTS station (which would still mean walking out in the balmy weather) hail a taxi instead  gets you from point to point for a coupla baht more And that's just calculated for one couple If you are an even bigger group it's a complete nobrainer

title: Fast, cheap and safe
review: I use BTS (Metro Underground) as often as possible The reason is simple You don´t need to think about the bad Bangkoktraffic where Taxi is no help However it might be a bit confusing in the beginning to understand how to get the correct ticket Ask Any thai will try to help you but if you still are confused  ask someone who look western

title: Clean and busy
review: Trains are air conditioned for comfort and clean as no food and drinks allowed Gets busy and difficult to get a seat when your not catching the train from the first stop

title: Better than a tuk-tuk when you have to get across town
review: The best way to get across townfaster than a tuk tuk  Clean and easy to use Cheap too As long as you need to go where it goes

title: Probably the fastest way to get around BKK
review: It does not cover some part of the city especially at the west area of Bangkok They are still extending the stations and some new station (hopefully) will finish by next year  Tips Buy a Rabbit card You will save a lot of time having to queue to buy the ticket for each ride You can also use this card at various restaurants such as McDonald and get a discount too Some station provide a lift for handicapped people Some don't Avoid the rush hour It could be HEAVILY packed during that time

title: Easy and efficient
review: Trains are clean cold and efficient There are automated ticketing system as well as ticket counter Very easy

title: Affordable way to go to the city
review: Easy to navigate and connect to bits to travel to many parts of Bangkok No rack to store suitcases

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use save and very cheap We used it as much as possible instead of taxis tuk tuks I definitely recommend it

title: Effective, efficient and cheap.
review: An excellent way of travelling round the city As it is elevated you also get views Cheap and easy connections

title: Fast and cheap way to the city centre.
review: Stopping every station to Paya Thai yhen you may change to other stations Our hotel just 2 stops away from PhayaThai which is very convinient We stayed at Vic3Hotel Bangkok Swimming pool fitness centre and near BTS

title: Airport to town
review: We took this on the way back from our flight from koh samui Very clean sooth ride from Airport to town only issue is it has several stops  before you reach to the main BTS station in down town Total travel time from airport to down town is about 45min still better then taking taxi during rush hour which takes longer and more money

title: EASY TO NAVIGATE
review: Airconditioned clean and easy to use It would be nice to have this kind of userinterface and coverage in the subway at home in Toronto

title: The most convenient way to and from Airport
review: We took taxi when we arrived and it put us in traffic jam We left Bangkok with this train and we arrived in the Airport for 40 minutes only

title: BEST WAY INTO BKK
review: When I come to BKK & leave  I always use the airport link Its easy to find at the lower level of the airport its cheap easy to use & fastest into town (about 25 minutes max) I get off at Makasan Asoke & get a taxi to the hotel I am using The trains are always clean tidy Sometimes have to stand but most times get a seat

title: Convenient and easy
review: The MRT is pretty easy to navigate There are people working there that are helpful if you need to ask questions If you planning on going or taking the mrt during rush hours at night time be prepared to wake for couple of trains before you can get in It is packed with folks going home from work

title: Good Service
review: Airport rail link is ideal for people travelling light about 20 minutes to the interchange compared to anything from an hour in Bangkok traffic  It is easy access from the airport side but not so much at Phaya Thai where you have to change for the BTS   There is a lift but it’s not always easy to find as the station is always very crowded

title: 7 minutes to nearest BTS
review: Quite near to BTS station Just walk to the main road which is probably about 2 mins and  about 5 mins from main road you can reach the BTS station Not that hard because it's also clear if you using the google map for direction from the hostel

title: Best way to move around Bangkok!
review: If you are staying in Bangkok this is the best and cheaper way move around Use it always It has a great air conditioning system for a fresh and cool ride It connects at some points with other train lines so you can move to other areas of Bangkok Excellent

title: Minimise Heavy traffic use Skytrain
review: Traffic is now becoming a big problem in Bangkok and using this sky train make journey more quicker and cleaner air Easy to go out and about with this form of transport And good reasonable price

title: worst airport link in Asia, if not the planet
review: get on in the middle of nowhere haul your luggage up many stairs trains frequently delayed due to being broken down cant count on a schedule A messbut no doubt someone made huge benefits

title: Clean and comfortable
review: train and station is clean and comfortable for tourist But not integrated with BTS station sometime need to across street to reach BTS station

title: Convenient and fast
review: Faster than getting taxi's or tuk tuks clean cheap and convenient We found it cheaper to just to buy single journey tickets rather than the day pass

title: Awesome travell when we were in need
review: Awesome experience Me and my hubby was exhausted after roaming around in Central world and we just took BTS to NANA to reach Indian restaurants

title: Barely slept, but an experience!
review: We booked a 'first class' cabin on the train which I think was roughly the same as standard sleeping arrangement but with   our own cabin Its a sofa that converts into bunkbeds  The journey is from about 630pm to 700am I am a very light sleeper so every stop and start (which was a lot) I woke up This is because it's not a particularly smooth action Even so I still give this 4 stars as it was an experience  My girlfriend slept right through without stirring once

title: effective but crowded
review: the skytrain is a smart way of avoiding the street traffic but it sorely lacks in being stroller andor wheelchair friendly Lack of lifts and even escalators

title: Very Convenient to Move Around Bangkok
review: There are 3 kinds of the express way to move around Bangkok by the city train such as BTS (Sky Train) MRT (Subway or Underground) and Airport Link   If you are the good planner you can use those kinds of train to travel around Bangkok like HUB of your trip for example your hotel in Sukhumvit Road you can take BTS to Taksin Station and transfer to the Chao Phaya Express Boat to the Grand Palance and Flower Market  The cost totally not over 100 baht instead of pay for the City Tour in the bigger amount  BTS Siam Square Interchange Station is the most shopping paradise There are many shops and department store for top (Luxury) to down (Street Items) for your preferences shopping as well as the good various restaurants for your choosing (from 40 to 500 baht per dish) depends your budget  The BTS Sky Train also connected with MRT and Airport Link in some stations such as Phaya Thai Station or Asoke Station but most of all are very fast safe time to your tourist attraction like 45 to 2 hours if you take the public bus or Taxi     Tips Please avoid the trip during 700 to 900 am and 500 to 700 pm the Rush Hour because all routes are crowded by the local who go out to work or back home

title: Save time when travelling with Airport Link to the central of Bangkok from the Airport
review: If you're the first time to Bangkok the capital city of Thailand I recommend to travel from the Airport to the central of Bangkok (30 km from the central of Bangkok) This transportation will take you only less than 40 minutes in travelling It's very cheap for less than 2 US dollars

title: the skytrain
review: the skytrain is definitely a plus for Bangkok  It is extremely clean and the aircon works so well  People are still courteous the passengers still offer their seat to a young mother with a child You are able to travel to many of the tourist spots around without the cost of a taxi or a tuktuk The cost is ridiculously low compared to a New York Train ride  I say 5 stars to Bangkok for their skytrain

title: Beware the overpriced meals and drinks!
review: Like others here we also booked through 12Go Asia  painless enough and the ticket purchasing process was straight forward As per their instructions we arrived at the station and picked up the tickets again no stress  We rode in a 2nd class AC carriage which I think is sufficient if travelling as a couple taking an upper and lower berth When you first get on the train the seats are in seat mode and very spacious and good to chill Storage is available overhead and under the seats which we were able to get medium suitcases under no problem When you're ready you can ask the attendant to change the seats into bed mode and get ready to settle in for the night  The toilets are at the end of the carriage and there is usually 1 western toilet on 1 side and then a 'local' toilet on the other Easy enough for a chap bit more difficult for a woman I guess  Beware the orange juice that they come around with when you first get on will cost you even if they indicate otherwise Also they come around and ask you to choose meals directly you to certain sets well that's just a rouse to make you think it's all included Not the case It would also turn out that the prices you vaguely recall seeing on the menu aren't even close to what you get charged We ended up getting stung just over 1000 THB or roughly £20 Left a bit of a sour taste in my mouth from what was an otherwise good journey I wish I had reminded myself to check the reviews before getting on Oh well next time

title: Convenient, minus the view.
review: Just like the BTS skytrain the MRT is a smart and convenient means to travel around central BKK The MRT is essentially a subway so you wont see anything interesting But it is nonetheless clean reliable

title: Get around Bangkok
review: For us coming from Canada we found the system easy to navigate right from the start Best if you can first get on a newer train that has the stops and trains progress marked by lights Great link up to the airport (BKK) for virtually stress free travels

title: Recommended
review: Very impressive tour with a very good host Lucky who was both entertaining and full of knowledge We did the Damnoen Saduk Floating Market and the Maeklong Railway Market both very interesting and quite an experience  Up early and collected in Bangkok we took a small mini bus a group of about 10 and the journey was about one hour and a half both ways  Arrived at a small station where we got on the train that leads to Maeklong From there we got to see how the train goes through the market and how quick the sellers react   From here we went to the floating market and we were straight onto a boat going down the riverpast all the sellers and their wares  Both trips were very good and well worth doingand best of all the tour organized was very affordable from memory it was between 30 to 50 dollars great price for a days adventure  Recommended

title: A rail trip of historical meaning
review: A significant railway line given it was made by PoWs many of whom lost their lives during the construction  The day we traveled the carriage was empty apart from our group  Good view from the window and the viaduct crossing  creaked a lot as we went over the wood structure was interesting if not slightly poignant   We went as part of a tour group but you can get the train from Bangkok it takes about 5hrs one way

title: Unique way to travel
review: My husband and i recently took one of the new first class sleeper train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai  The cabin was small but comfortable with good air conditioning and adequate bedding My only complaint being the matress wasn't padded enough and i woke with sore hips I also had trouble sleeping due to the noise of the train but thats just me  The first class carriage includes 2 x airline style flush toilets and a shower which is handy after a long sticky day of touring  There is a restaurant car on board and room service is also available   Great way to get from A to B and lovely views of the rainforest in the morning

title: Excellent Sky Train
review: During my stay I take this train every day to the shopping mall Very convient and fast as Bangkok trafic is very bad I recommend every one to use it Its safe and low cost and faster than the Taxi

title: Thai rail second class night train.
review: This was as a new experience in Thai railways after going with the special express and first class witch both have been really nice experiences  Now by an booking mistake of my wife i went by second class I had a bunk in a group sleeping car The light was on all night and once in a wile there where people making a lot noise talking but the biggest problem was that i am ruffly 18 meter and the punk was for Thais i thing about 175 witch was to small for me

title: Journey on Death Railway
review: We took the train on Death Railway following our visit to Hellfire Pass  The train is quite rickety with hard wooden seats but the open windows ensure that there’s a bit of a breeze  Over 100000 men died in appalling conditions building this railway the journey was the chance to pay our respects

title: Fun Way to Explore
review: Go to the window to get change for the machine Then pick where you want to get off on the ticket machine You need your ticket to get into the station and out If your ticket doesn’t work on the way out just take it to one of the windows and pay the difference of what you owe

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: Very easy to use and helps you avoid the crazy traffic congestion in downtown Bangkok The ticket vending machines are very user friendly

title: Convenience
review: Easy to travel with airport rail link but to change to BTS at Phaya Thai to get to your respective hotel The station staff is helpful

title: Speedy get away
review: There's only 8 stations for services From Phaya Thai BTS station 1 BTS station away from Victory monument to Suvarnabhumi Airport Cost around 15USD and 30 Mins

title: Only way to travel
review: Although with a family it can be more expensive than taxi's it gets you around the main city very easily and in relative comfort From your destination BTS station it is easy to pick a taxi for the last km or so for 3560 Baht Saves being stuck in traffic

title: Clean, quick, air-conditioned, fantastic.
review: Can be crowded but Thai residents very polite and friendly  Fastest way to travel as traffic is out of control and a trip that takes an hour by car is ten minutes on the train  I tried it

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use and get around If you are unsure Thai people are very helpful and there is always someone who can speak a little English to help you Cheap quick and convenient

title: Like Chicago El or Miami Metrorail
review: This modern elevated train system with six major lines is like Chicago’s El or Miami’s Metrorail Although the lines are colorcoded there are two Green Lines one pale green the other a shade darker It’s necessary to know the number of the line not the color codes When ascending the platforms keep in mind that since cars drive on the left the trains follow that direction Left is right I found it incredibly easy to get about Bangkok but learning to use the ticket kiosk caused confusion My first journey required I take the train two stops and change lines No problem there but I went in the wrong direction as I had to be on the train to know in which direction the end station was Initial confusion aside the 20minute combined trek cost only US$142 Trains arrive at each station every five minutes and each car was crowded at 1100AM that Tuesday   SkyTrain is a superior system offers phenomenal views of this burgeoning city and keeps a gazillion people off the crowded and polluted streets clogged with tuktuks and motorcycles many of which avoid traffic jams by riding on sidewalks SkyTrain is also experiencing massive expansion with a main line to the international airport It is a fabulous arterial system that makes Bangkok a modern metropolis Unfortunately riders must eventually become pedestrians where unsafe streets are a disappointment after the sophisticated SkyTrain experience

title: Amazing and beautifully decorated nice service you can visit any time  to get train.
review: Amazing and beautifully decorated nice service you can visit any time  to get train  Would like to give 5 star ratimg

title: When you're in Bangkok you HAVE to take the skytrain! At least once!
review: Cheap and easy way of transportation The fare is ok The system is very easy to understand so just it as a way of getting around in Bangkok

title: very fast
review: Very fast to bring us to our destinations The AC is cold so bring a sweater Sometimes it can be crowded inside during peak hours Clean reliable skytrain

title: Travel like the locals
review: Clean efficient and to the second like Swiss rail only way to travel around Bangkok air condition comfort and very economical

title: Not "Express" if you must wait an hour
review: The last time I tried taking the Express Train I was told that it would be an hour until the next train was leaving and this was around 1130 am on a weekday I walked over to the city line and saw that it would be a 20 minute wait for that train so I ended up taking a taxi to the airport  Now I will only use the train from the airport not to the airport When arriving at the airport in Bangkok there are so many taxi drivers that try to cheat you so I will take the train instead If you go downstairs to the official taxi line there is a good chance you will get a taxi with a turbo meter After the third time this happened I stopped using the taxi line and will only take a taxi from the arrivals area that I see dropping off a passenger   If you do take a taxi from the arrivals area be sure not to take one of the taxis that's already sitting there Those drivers are part of the taxi mafia and have paid off the police in order to park there and they will then rip you off But if you see a driver dropping off a passenger you should take that taxi Those drivers are usually very happy to have a customer for their drive back to the city and shouldn't try to rip you off  When in Bangkok you will never want to take a taxi that is parked They are always the ones that will rip you off Always flag down a moving taxi and you will have much better luck

title: Not quite as good as SkyTrain
review: The lines for token machines in busy stations here are often way too long They need to fix this The easiest way would be to create a single storedvalue card that can be used on this service AND SkyTrain (right now they're not compatible) Also seems to run with less frequency than SkyTrain

title: A must for managing Bangkok
review: Always fast clean and reliable It's really the only way to manage Bangkok Even if you have a driver the BTS can be much faster It is worth getting comfortable using BTS  Save the taxi for when you do not want to sweat

title: The best transit system!
review: I love the BTS and wish New York City would adapt their rules  It is clean people are polite no food or drink is allowed everything is clearly marked and trains run every 3 minutes  I took it everywhere even at night and I am a woman traveling alone

title: Efficient
review: Our flight was delayed for close to 3 hours  When we landed in BKK it was close to 8 pm  Taxi Q was very long  So we decided to take the airport rail instead  Though it is not much savings if we had taken a cab as there were 3 of us  but we would think that the time to q for cab is saved   The train was clean and fast

title: Best way to travel on Sukhumvit road.
review: Very easy to get around Bangkok on these sky trains Fast and on time There are a few shopping malls that are directly connected to the sky train stations If you go shopping most  Big shopping malls are right at the stations

title: Cheap way to travel to/from the airport
review: Cheap clean and convienient alternative to a taxi to travel tofrom the airport  Connection to other public transport

title: the way to travel in Bangkok
review: I love this skytrain Very safe and very efficient Air condition and clean I even did some shopping walking through the terminals of the stations

title: Efficient BTS
review: Bangkok BTS is the most efficient Skytrain I Have discovered in BKK The signs are well indicated & placed and simple enough for any visitors who doesn't speak the language to understand And the local whom could speak English  I Have discovered are so friendly & helpful if you get lost or miss the wrong train

title: fast and cheap
review: i usually take Airport Rail Link whenever i go BKK i do not like to take taxi as i will sure be caught in the bad traffic no matter what time you take taxi the traffic is really bad Airport Rail link is fast and cheap i paid only 40baht to get to town area the station is only 10min walk away from my hotel it took me around 35min from airport to my hotel if take taxi it will be more than double the time

title: Clean and simple
review: The BTS is a great way of getting around Bangkok for a cheap price It's quick it's convenient it's air conditioned and the entire system is easy to figure out There are only two lines with on transfer point at Siam which is also where some of the major malls (like Paragon) are located  Went to Tokyo right after Bangkok and was shocked by how complicated the Tokyo system is in comparison to the BTS

title: Absolutely horrendous
review: We boarded the train 735pm 7december2014 and without any warning we waited an hour All the time the first class carriage that has no ventilation what so ever apart from air con gradually filled up with fumes Me and my wife's eyes where running and all we could do was use tissues to try and stop some of the fumes we both felt very ill and had no choice than to stay putAll our clothes and backpack smelt horrendous we had all our clothes washed here on arrivalWe where in car 12 the last one number 5 and 6 roomThe floor wallsceiling is filthy dirty with years of grime I spat on a tissue and wiped the grey looking walls the tissue was black And I mean filthythe staff offered an orange juice we accepted but where cheekily asked for 60 baht for it and then waited for a tipwe ordered dinner and breakfast both which where cold and really not nice We where given a free bowl of fruit with clingfilm on it very nice until my wife spotted a bug crawling around inside The bed was made up for you but using a very old thin fold up mattress and a pillow which I assume neither had been cleaned for years The pillow case and top sheet was newly cleaned I put my hand luggage on the floor and then put it on the bed leaving a dirty black stain The trip was slow uncomfortable with the train stopping every few hours for unexplained reasons and then jolted you like a car accident back and forth  The trip was ment to be 12 hours ours was 17 horrendous hours without a doubt my worst ever experience Did I mention the disgusting first class toilets with a door that wouldn't open no flush and before we got going it smelt like a sewer everything dirty again no attempt of cleaning I have spent 3 days here in chang mai trying to recover from the experience I have caught the flu and have had my chang mai experience ruined You have to be a lunatic to go on this train and even believe its first class it'd rather sleep on the London Underground  no kidding  Please please please guys don't put your wife or your family through this for a few pounds more get on a plane instead If you offered me £1000 to go back to bangkok on it I'd refuse keep your money

title: The REAL Thailand!
review: Bit of a journey by minibus from downtown Bangkok to reach the railway station but worth every minute to then ride on  a train that then passes within inches of the market stallholders at the floating market This was then followed by a boat ride right into the heart of the floating market  the whole experience really brought home the fact that I was in an environment so different from anything I have ever experienced before Definitely to be recommended if you get the chance

title: Fast transport between the Suvarnabumi airport and Bangkok
review: This was a very cheap and efficient way to get from the airport to the city and back  The train is very clean and comfortable with enough room to take your luggage  It takes about 3540 minutes between the airport and Phaya Thai station where you can take the BTS to other parts of the city I stayed at a hotel in SIlom and getting there cost me BHT45 on the Skytrain and BHT31 on the BTS to Chong Nonsi which is a lot cheaper than when I took the taxi the last time which cost more than BHT400 The travel time was less than one hour which was shorter than the taxi ride which was about 1 12 hours This is definitely a fast and efficient way to travel between the airport and the city

title: transportation
review: the best way to travel from airport to city center  getting there in just 30 minutes and few stops in a nicely AC train and at around 1 Euro or 2 max depending on your travel destination

title: awesome service from airport
review: its an awesome train service from airport easy to get tickets and use rather than getting stuck in traffic you can use this also reducing traffic on the roads

title: Comfy and cheap
review: Comfortable if you catch it at off peak times Much better and quicker than the hectic roads and not hot and stuffy Only 40 baht from the airport to Phaya Thai

title: Extremely convinientand cheap!
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok Easy to use and very cheap People are Very clean but  crowded Higly recommended

title: Easy to use
review: If you are familiar with mass transit BTS is easy to use cheap and gets you out of BKK traffic No issues

title: Fast-track ride to and from the city
review: It was a huge convenience for travellers to have the airport rail link We only paid about THB 45 each from Suvarnabhumi station to Phaya Thai (Siam) We tried to take a taxi on other ocassions and we had to pay THB 400 to reach Siam including toll fees

title: More maps would be useful!
review: Fares are reasonably cheap which is a bonus however can be a little confusing to use Don't bother trying to use the ticket window to buy your ticket as they can't help you (with a ticket anyway) They'll change the money you do give them if you handover a note into coin so you can then go and line up at the machine to buy your ticket Ergo if you already have coin just head straight to the machine  Doesn't matter what time of the day you seem to travel on this but it always seemed to be absolutely rammed At least it has a little bit of aircon and BO from people's armpits as they hold onto the rails  Some more maps at station level would be useful too so that you don't find out only when you get to the platform that you're on the wrong side

title: clean train, a bit cold but convenient
review: BTS is one of the most convenient way to get around downtown Bangkok You can take a BTS to many areas and connect with other modes of transport like buses boats or the subway It's generally clean and it is not allowed for food or drink

title: Fast, clean and inexpensive
review: The last time we were in Bangkok the BTS had just opened and we were interested to see how it had changed I am pleased to say that while it is still very efficient and clean it benefits from additional stations Our nearest station was also a Metro station so moving about the city was a breeze My only complaint was that the ticket machines that accepted notes were limited

title: Cheapest way from airport to downtown
review: Take the blue line for 35baht per head only from airport to Makkasan then you can interchange to MRT which is very convenient

title: So easy!
review: Cheap and fast way to get to Bangkokeven with your luggage Keep in mind trafic in Bangkok is very congested specially in high peak times We could see bumper to bumper cars on the highway while we were zooming down on the airport rail link

title: Fast and efficient
review: First time in Bangkok and on the way to the hotel by car figured out quickly public transport was the go Took the BTS  metro for all business where I could Could not fault the trains or the transport system at all

title: Useful to get around
review: The sky train is great to get around and the people at the stations are really helpful It can get really busy and quite cramped in there but still gets you to where you need to be

title: everything fine, NOT THE FOOD!!!
review: I know is a train and I should rate the train service that by the way was very good right on time of departure and arrival comfortable beds nice experience but if you are going to travel for 12 hours you need to eat They offer a menu with little options my partner and me got 2 different options and both were DISGUSTING traveling in South Asia makes you try different food all around and we'd never never tried something so horrible The photos in the menu is not the same that you get French fries were potato snacks and orange juice is an artificial juice impossible to drink The fruits were warm and with bad conditions My sweet and sour chicken totally cold they never bother to re heat it and it also came some kind of  pork curry that taste like fish and it look not healthy at all My boyfriend sandwich was very small and the ham was brownishso he pulled out in case of intoxication And the prices of the food are very expensive  So my advice for the future travellers is to get your own food for all those hours of journey and don't bother to spend any money in there you will feel angry like us

title: A great way to get around
review: I rarely use public transport at home but when in Bangkok I used the skytrain  It is easy and cheap and I felt quite safe The roads around the city centre are so congested that it is much quicker and cheaper to take the skytrain

title: Skytrain
review: Bangkok skytrain is quick and easyIt's Convenient and safe and cheap Recommended for budget travellers

title: Great transport
review: Very efficient way of getting around the city As well as this it wasn't too expensive and would drop you where you needed to be

title: Great way to get around and see a different angle of Bangkok
review: Very easy to use and buy tickets good value for money  Plenty of stations along the way  We used it to get to the market

title: bangkok skytrain
review: Just returned from Thailand and this was by far the best way to get around central Bangkok  Tickets are cheap train is airconditioned and there is always someone on the platforms to help you if you are having trouble

title: best way to travel
review: The BTS skytrain is easy and cheap great way to get around bangkok and see the sights Wish we had something similar in my hometown

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Great way to get around Wasn't there 27 years ago when I last went but a great addition A little tricky to understand how to buy a ticket if you go at rush hour as crazy So make your first visit at a quiet time to get assistance easily Currently being extended to cover more if Bangkok Nice to get cool whilst on there

title: Beat the traffic
review: This is the fastest & convenient way to move on Sukhumvit & to get to the shopping malls as the stations are not too far apart  it also has connections to the other rail lines The 'rabbit' card is available for more than one day travel and can be topped up at any of the station  the catch is that there is a retainer fee  There are escalators for the way up to the rail but you will have to walk down

title: Awesome
review: Easy to navigate  friendly staff and tourist police to help you  makes travelling through Bangkok a breeze  and it's cheap as chips and spotless

title: Super Easy To Use
review: The sky train is super easy to use and very cost friendly Everything is clearly marked and as a tourist you shouldn't have any problem navigating your way around Bangkok  The trains are clean and well maintained as are the stations but like transit in any large metropolis can be very busy during rush hours

title: So easy and cheap
review: If you happen to book a hotel or appartment near a skytrain station consider yourselves Lucky It is so easy and cheap to get around in Bangkok Clean fast and cheap

title: Gets you around Bangkok
review: Efficient means of transportation in order to avoid never ending traffic jam in Bangkok Trains are professionally operated on time cooling system is excellent as well as announcement both in local language and English Ticket machines are easy to operate

title: Easy to use
review: It is easy to buy tickets and use the rail People are nice and let you exit before boarding It is clean and spacious and felt safe at all times

title: Good for solo travellers
review: When I was planning our trip to Thailand I did not consider the fact that train fares change according to distance so our budget for transportation exploded Haha But that's okay since it was very convenient to go to and from places in Bangkok using the skytrain I was surprised to see that there was an option in the ticket machine with a fare of zero Baht When I checked the fare matrix there was a note that said trips from Onnut Station to Bearing Station are free Nice  There were times when it was really crowded and times when we were able to sit In the morning they were even giving away newspapers in the station (though it was all written in there language) The time interval for waiting was short which is good   But if there are 4 people travelling I would recommend you take a taxi (35 Baht flag down) instead since the fare is almost the same The train fare for the nearest station would cost 15 Baht and an additional 5 Baht for the next station after So if the 4 people would need to go to a place which is 4 stations away the train would cost a total of 100 Baht But if they took a taxi it would have costed them around 6070 Baht

title: Convenient and a lot more economical than taking a taxi.
review: Sometimes the train gets too crowded and this will be a problem if you're traveling with largeheavy luggage

title: Fast. Efficient. Cheap
review: A great mode of transportation that connects you to MRT and BTS stations  If you took a taxi from BKK airport you paid too much  This train can occassionally be crowded but they have ways to manage these crowds

title: One night in Bangkok
review: On the way back from visiting my wife's familly we stayed in Bangkok The BTS Sky train is a fantastic way of getting around the city It is cheap frequent and reliable and when not rush hour it is quite comfortable

title: Sometimes it is your best option
review: If you're heading to or from the airport on rush hour or on Fridays when it is always rush hour you might want to consider this Simply because there are firm and regular arrival times as opposed to sitting in traffic for an hour Also clean easy and always reliable

title: Fast, Cold and Clean
review: Due to the heavy congestion in Bangkok the Skytrain is an easy option to get around Don't assume its cheaper than a taxi because its not but it has great air conditioning the train is fast and stops at most of the areas where you would visit The cleanliness is amazing there is not a scrap of paper or graffiti anywhere

title: Avoid traffic jams and jump on the BTS
review: The BTS is a cheap effective clean safe and overly airconditioned (it can be cold especially if you on the train for 5 or more stops) mode of urban transportation

title: An interesting experience
review: We paid a little extra and got a private 2 person cabin My sleep was fairly terrible as I has the upper berth and it rocked around a fair bit My partner who had the lower berth seemed to have a better sleep The toilets are gross The western toilet has the shower in it so sometimes when you went to the toilet it was just flooding in water The dinner and breakfast was better then we expected Even though we wouldn't do it again I would oddly still recommend others to experience it at least once

title: Convenient way to get around the city
review: Fussfree and cheap way to get around town better than getting stuck in traffic Feel free to approach the ticketing counter for small change or to purchase your tickettokens just tell them the station you'd like to go to

title: Death Railway
review: You can experience the thaiburma railway on a short part of the track still used today Travel on the train and walk of the site where the track was built on the cliffs above the river It is included on most day trips around Kanchanburi or those booked elsewhere Part of an excellent tour around Kanchanburi

title: Simple way to get from airport to the city!
review: I get the Airport Rail Link every time I visit Bangkok Its really simple to navigate has AC is really clean and comfortable and doesn't take longunlike a taxi Also its cheap what more could you want

title: Fast, Easy & Convenient
review: Every country should adapt similar service as BTS It's reasonable price fast convenient and clean Services run on time and pretty often

title: Lovely, Clean, Easy to Use
review: We used the Airport Link several times on our last stay as we were staying at the BKK Airport Novotel We found it inexpensive clean modern and quite easy to make connections anywhere where the SkyTrain runs in Bangkok Make sure you do some research on your stops before you use the system  it can get EXTREMELY congested and difficult to look at maps in the stations Otherwise  awesome and easy to get around

title: Good Frequency
review: The service is good it just need a signboard telling tourist which platform to catch as it was confusing  The train frequency is good Should hop on to avoid the crazy traffic congestion in Bangkok

title: Efficient , tho maps should be displayed at all stations like other countries
review: Used the BTS between Asok and Siam during peak hour efficient clean and reliable   However they need to display maps at every level at the stops like Singapore and UK eases the stress of finding out or carrying the map   Mukarram Tyabji mtyabji@gmailcom

title: Cheap & Fast Ride to City Area
review: Waiting time was reasonable and train was rather spacious Aircon was also sufficient for the hot weather Before I knew it reached city centre )

title: Easiest way to get around
review: BTS gives you the chance to get through the city of Bangkok avoiding big traffic on the streets Train schedule is frequent enough and against the outside temperature of around 32 degrees the AC on train gives you a rest and refreshing trip During rush hours the BTS might be pretty packed but never mind to take the next train a few minutes later Most places worthful visiting are reachable on BTS Some places might cause a further short walk or taxi ride to get there after leaving BTS station

title: Excellent and inexpensive way to get from airport to downtown
review: Signage is pretty clear ticket machines are easy to understand but you need cash Trains are clean but get crowded during rush hour with nonairport travelers Trains avoid traffic jams and are faster and cheaper than taxi

title: Very convenient and cheap
review: The Cheapest and fastest mode of transport between downtown Bangkok and the Suvarnabhumi International Airport THB 45 for 30 mins ride with 6 stops either way The express route of THB 150 which covered the same distance in 15 mins has been suspended indefinitely when i visited in April 2016  Comparisions ( other modes between Suvarnabhumi International Airport and Downtown Bangkok)   Uber THB 575 to 600 Grab Taxi  THB 500 to 600 Normal Taxi  THB 400 to 500 Buses and minivans  THB 100 to 200  If you are landing or flying out of Bangkok via Suvarnabhumi airport during its operating hours ( Morning 6 AM to Midnight 12 ) then it is the best and cheapest and fastest way  Starts at Paya Thai BTS and ends at Suvarnabhumi International airport

title: Not really worth it I’m afraid
review: We weren’t told what time we would be picked up from our hotel or even if we would be picked up so we got up really early for no reason  The drive to the market was very long  1 hour 40 minutes  The train market is basically something that is purely for tourists The train isn’t a normal service route so you basically have a bunch of tourists on the train photographing a bunch of tourists in the market I found the market overcrowded and chaotic  The water market was interesting but again it didn’t feel authentic  Given food is so cheap In Thailand lunch could have been provided

title: simple and easy!
review: simple train lines and easy to travel through the travel spot and shopping mall it is good to use for first time of bkk

title: Nice but not spectacular
review: Today took the train from khanchanaburi to nam tok Took the last train but still busy It is nice but not spectacular The only spectacular view is when you cross the wooden bridge This takes 2 minutes on a 2 hour trip If you take this trip start at the main station The train gets crowded with tourists on the next stop just in front of the bridge

title: Another choice than Taxi
review: In case of traveling from Suvarnabhumi International airport Airport rail link is a fair choice Friendly for travelers with huge luggages even on peak hours You can take from the basement floor of the airport to the heart of city with 2 price types rapid and normal But you have to take very long walk to transit to MRT or BTS

title: High in the sky travelling in Bangkok
review: This is the best way to travel in the city of Bangkok_it is very safe and very fast_all the key locations are served by the BTS Skytrain_a good advise by making reservation for a hotel see if there is an access point to the BTS_the pricing is also reasonable

title: 10-Oct
review: We had such a nice time going on the train to visit Maeklong Railway Market Sara bought got some local food and it was  delicious The floating market was an incredible experience as well Absolutely recommendable Sara was awesome 1010

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: Great for cutting through the the trafficuse ahead of taxis and Tuk Tuks unless you like sitting in traffic jams

title: Why pay for a taxi or Grab when the Airport Rail Link exists
review: Don't be afraid to use it We took a limo when we arrived but for 1  10th of the price we will use the Rail Link to leave  It's clean safe cheap (45 Baht) and fast (20 minutes to reach the BTS station at Phraya Thai) All well explained

title: Easy!
review: We got lost but fortunately the staff was really helpful and we got to the right train in no time It's great to avoid traffic

title: Fantastic - outside peak hours!
review: Very efficient service but try and avoid peak hour or you are like sardines  If you must travel in busy times try and avoid carrying bulky back packs or bags or it will be nearly impossible to squash on

title: One of the great railway journeys of the world
review: I've travelled along this line many times and it never fails to evoke a range of emotions My uncle who I never met died during the building of the railway and is buried in Kanchanaburi  As a foreigner I have to pay a premium over the ticket cost for the rest of my family who have both Thai and UK passports I don't mind as the  journey is a classic with plenty of interest all the way You get drinks and snacks and a colour souvenir certificate in English included in the cost of the fare  So in summary a bittersweet journey for those who lost family during the construction of the line however the scenery is worth seeing

title: Bangkok 2016
review: Very handy and beats the terrible traffic jams Not expensive Several stations enroute and handy for attractions

title: great to get  fast transport.
review: Avoid the horrendous traffic with this s great service and very cheap and easy to negotiate And very clean

title: Advantages of a modern metro
review: This brand new metro system makes the London Underground look positively archaic notwithstanding the recent improvements It is clean efficient and simple to navigate New lines are in the pipeline (pun intended)

title: cheap and easy
