review: Easy to get to from the sky train and a short journey to the airport I suggest this to anyone thinking about getting a taxi this will save time and money not to mention the 2 toll fees you have to pay on top of your taxi fare From the centre of Bangkok I paid a total of 70 Thai Baht and the taxi cost me nearly 400 Baht

title: BTS
review: Great mode of transportation up and down the sukhumvit corridor Clean safe convenient  and inexpensive The only thing that really bothers me is the young selfish self centered kids who won't offer their seat to the elderly people standing

title: Good to get way to get around
review: Great way to get around town Quite cheap and fast Very easy to use and gets you over the traffic  a fast and easy way to get around

title: Useful train
review: I bought a one day pass it costs 120 Baht I used this train from Chatchuk to Si Lom 2 round trips because my hotel locates in Si lom and I went see JJ market on Sunday

title: good! fast and smooth
review: easy to use although only small notes are accepted to the payment machines figuring out a map at first caused a bit of confusion though

title: Absolute must for getting around.
review: Going to Bangkok for a couple days Or even one If the places you're going are anywhere close to a train station then one of the train systems is the best way to get around It's fast and does not get caught in any traffic And that's the thing about Bangkok  a traffic jam will pop up out of nowhere The trains are comfortable and easy to use     There's the BTS Skytrain the MRT underground and the Airport Link All are great And with BTS and Airport link you get to see a little more of the city     I lived in Bangkok for over a year and ended up getting the train cards that you just recharge with money and then slide over the reader on the top of the gate If you're going to be here for a couple weeks and traveling a lot get the train card Though you have to get the cards for each system     And I would suggest trying the Khlong at least once That's the river taxi It's fun to see Bangkok from the river     Hope you have a great trip

title: Cheaper to travel by taxi
review: Not that great and no cheaper than using a taxi especially if there are more than 2 of you  Plus you need to walk at the other end still

title: Do it...
review: The best option to get into the city  Don't give those rip off taxi drivers your coin Its clean quick and cheap

title: A characterful, historic railway station that works well
review: We visited the station to catch a night train to Nong Khai This proved to be very straightforward with no hassles as we had prebooked our train online The waiting room is reasonably comfortable well ventilated and clean There is a good electronic indicator board giving train info I last visited this station in 1985 and was delighted to see that it still retains is old historic character

title: Clean and Air Conditioned!
review: Prompt and on time trains  Fare is cheap Moderately crowded trains at times  No food allowed inside the turnstiles or on the train Worth taking if you have a map and want to avoid traffic jams

title: Quickest way to airport
review: Best way to get into the city and back to the airport  we took a taxi when we arrived and were 15 hours in traffic jam On the way back we took the airport rail link  easy and fast

title: Scary at first, but it got better
review: We prebooked our tickets online with 12Go who were excellent  We booked a first class cabin and we're warned that our trip was on one of the 'older' trains so my comments reflect that and not the newer ones   First impressions were very poor The train arrived and the electricity had failed in our carriage and we could see broken curtains hanging down inside the windows They fixed the electric  Inside our cabin was tired and dated but functional There was air con (though we couldn't control it) a sink and an electric socket   A member of the crew fetched us food from the buffet carriage at mealtimes (we did say we'd go ourselves for a change of scenery but she suggested we couldn't) The food was basic and expensive and she was good at upselling I'm sure we ended up with  and paying for  far more than we'd intended   Our carriage was pretty empty so we moved our cases (we had 4 all in all) into an empty adjoining compartment  but were told this wasn't permitted This felt really mean spirited as we were so cramped and the guard  ticket guy was really shouty about it He earned himself the nickname of the 'officious official' between us due to his aggression  He even went to the trouble of then locking all the empty compartments so as we nor any other travellers could make use of the free spaces either  The beds were then made up at a time to suit the officious official which meant us eating on the bed under the top bunk which wasn't ideal   The carriage had a toilet but no shower No wifi obviously  The compartment started off boiling hot then by halfway through the journey was feeezing cold I was wearing a heavy jumper by the end  I slept surprisingly well but was disturbed by loud station announcements we stopped throughout the night  By the morning I'd quite warmed to it though the scenery was nice and it was the fun and authentic travelling experience I'd wanted to experience  If you get the chance walk to the very back of the train and look out of the window of the back door I got a lovely shot of the countryside and the tracks and it's an angle you don't often get to enjoy on a train  Despite my gripes I'd do it again you've just gotta go into it with the right mind frame

title: Bridge over River Kwae visit
review: The tour took us to the war cemetery Jeath War Museum and a ride on the train over the infamous bridge  We had plenty of time for photos and it was on our bucket list as a must see  The tour was fantastic with an English speaking guide that really looked after our group  Highly recommend to spend the $300baht and get the front carriage where you get a certificate for riding the train plus food and nonalcoholic drinks

title: Transportation
review: We used the sky train to get around Bangkok partially because we wanted to try it out and secondly because we grew tired of haggling with the taxi and Tuk Tuk drivers Most of the taxi drivers do not want to turn on their meter and want to charge you exorbitant prices for short rides  The Tuk Tuk drivers do the same but there are so many you can haggle and get the price down The Sky train is clean and the ticket agents are very informative There is NO eating or drinking allowed on the train and they have air conditioning which was a relief from the sweltering heat Try to avoid the rush hour times as they get really packed with students and people going and coming from work The stops are well documented and the Public announcements are made in English and Thai so its helpful for tourists Best thing is that it's really cheap When you go to the ticket agent you tell them where you want to go and they give you a credit card type of pass You scan it upon entering the turnstile and then when you get off at your stop you enter it at the turnstile and you are done   Good experience

title: Good public transport
review: Use the Bangkok sky train whenever possible it’s quick and eat to use and very cheap  and avoids some of Bangkok’s horrific traffic congestion

title: Good way into city but express line is closed
review: During rush hour this can be quickest way into city but it is slower now that express line is closed

title: Stress free travel in Bangkok
review: After  2 bad experience with the local public taxis taking the BTS to MBK and Platinum mall was a breeze Clear instructions The ticket machines only accept coins So make sure you have enough or you could change them at the counter

title: New Rules for Rabbit Card Holders
review: I am highly annoyed regarding the new announcement I received with my top up receipt of my Sky train ticket yesterday A few years ago BTS obviously decided it would be lucrative for them to participate in this scheme So we all had to surrender our old BTS skytrain tickets in exchange for a Rabbit card which included a fee So I top this up regularly Yesterday I got a notice to say from 1st April we can no longer top this up using a credit or debit card unless your booking "trips" only which means using within one month As an expat living here that is no use to me ideal for tourists maybe Furthermore I don't carry much cash around with me and normally top up 1000 baht per time with my debit card I called BTS hotline to find out more It turns out as this Rabbit card is now used by hundreds of outlets they can no longer cover the costs of this  Oh so the customers that use it for BTS only get penalized  So I recommend you go back to you previous system and make a card for BTS skytrain users only  And also encourage others to voice their opinion also

title: Smooth and Pleasant Ride
review: I was in Bangkok Thailand for a business trip from 5 to 8 December 2018  I heard about the airport rail link from a colleague and thought to try it myself  I took the nearest BTS (Siam Station) to Phaya Thai BTS Station and got out from Exit 5  There are many signage around to direct you to the airport rail link  After exiting from Phaya Thai station I just had to turn left to walk up a bridge to take the escalator up that will lead me to the ticketing platform  There are about 3 ticketing machines that you can buy your train ticket (Baht$45)  The carriage is spacious and there are areas where you can place your luggage (but there are not luggage rack)  This train will go through about 6 to 7 stations before reaching Suvarnabhumi Airport  The train will arrive at the basement and you have a choice of taking the lift or the escalators to 4th floor  If you are travelling with young children andor older adults with some mobility challenge I would suggest to take the lift  though it can be quite a wait  The entire experience is pleasant and I was able to maneuver around easily with my luggage and handcarry bag  Most of all it is a fast mode of transport especially if your flight times coincide with peak hour traffic this train will definitely help you beat all bad traffics woes  Overall I would recommend taking this train service again when I am next back to Bangkok Thailand

title: Convenient , faster and cheap as compared to using a taxi

title: Excellent option for commute
review: The Thailand government has done an excellent job with the Skytrain for commuters We were visiting Bangkok from outside Thailand and were very pleased by the entire experience People follow the rules to make sure that boarding and exiting the Skytrain is an easy experience The Skytrain is the best way to travel if you are staying in the heart of the city and need to travel as it eliminates the traffic congestion which you face traveling by cabs or tuktuk's The route maps directions pricing all are very well laid out and explained at the stations (in English) The counters and attendants will guide you if you are not aware of the system The government has created a great infrastructure which is very friendly to international tourists It saved us both a lot of money and time

title: Very convenient and tourist friendly.
review: Great connectivity to the major parts of bangkok Its really easy to get around on day passes and you will save a lot on tuk tuk or cab fare The stations are Sparkling clean they have escalators at all stations and there's a train almost every five minutes Easy interchange with other lines Great for traveling around bangkok

title: Great experience and tour guide
review: We really enjoyed the tour It is a must if you’re in Bangkok Pen was our guide and she was lovely

title: Stellar! I wish more airports had this in the USA!
review: Easy to get downtown Bangkok and switch to the BTS Highly recommend if you are traveling to Bangkok and want to catch a hotel away from the airport

title: Holiday
review: BTS sky train is simple to use press the number on the map where you want to go that's then the price you pay to change to the silcom line from the sukhumvit line you have to go to the Siam cen to do this

title: Best way to travel from the airport
review: This is the best way to travel from Bangkok airport  easy  quick  cheap  Only 25 min and you at Bangkok city center  The price is 45 baht

title: Nice train, great views!
review: The BTS Skytrain is not really any different from elevated rail lines in other major cities However Bangkok offers a unique skyline and the city is very green which makes the ride all the more enjoyable I would recommend taking the Skytrain or the Airport Rail Link (also elevated) to anyone visiting Bangkok

title: Convenient way of travelling
review: This system is amazing and a convenient way of travelling for many sites The ticket cab be purchased using 5baht coins and takes you to Siam paragon Chattuchak market and central world as many of the tourist attractions are easily accessible using the sky train

title: Easy
review: Simple to use very cheap at the kiosk you state your desired destination and they give you small black discs that you scan on the barrier and when you've reached your destination pop the disc in the machine to take back This form of transportation is a must in Bangkok in the rush hour this or the taxi scooters

title: Nice transport for shopping lover
review: Clean and very cold air con But beware of rush hour time You need to buy token at the machine or queue for the counter if you don’t get a transport card ready

title: Great Way to get Around Bangkok
review: I've used BTS Skytrain off and on for a couple of decades  It's gotten a lot busier but it remains a great way to get around Bangkok's terrible traffic

title: Easy way to Airport
review: A fast and convenient way to reach the Airport in Bangkok  Advantages 1 Avoids traffic snarls 2 Clean airconditionedsecure and cheap 3 About 35 mins one way to Airport or back 4 City terminal station Payathai connected to the BTS network Disadvantages 1 Difficult with heavy luggage as sometimes need to climb or descend on normal stairs 2 Does not operate for 24 hours 3 Late night and early morning service not there 4 Only goes to one city centre in Payathai Areas like Silom Sathorn etc need to be communicated separately further with taxis

title: Easy and quick
review: Easy to use and quick for traveling to any of the stops around town  Cheap and easy Highly recommend to use

title: Clean
review: Clean and Quiet Its goes everywhere and buying the ticket is a breeze It is very easy to go to and from the Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: An easy way going around Bangkok
review: The easiest way traveling around Bangkok  Takes you from A to B and back easily  Very good value for money and its saving you time  Use it while in BKK

title: Quickest way there and back again
review: I was pleasantly surprised to learn that Bangkok airport (Suvarnabhumi) now has this link  I had to take taxis in the past which with Bangkok's notorious traffic take a long time  It cost only 45 Bhat or about US$150 each way to get to the downtown core  The only drawback is that it is not completely integrated with the BTS Skytrain although they do share stations you have to exit the airport train zone and purchase another ticket for the skytrain and not all skytrain stations have escalators  something to consider if you are carrying luggage

title: No show
review: They never picked us up Even after receiving email saying they would pick us up in the lobby of our hotel Then after calling to find out where they were I was told to drive 15hr away to catch the group Very disappointed  This the 2nd tour where  we weren't picked up as promised  The other one almost cost us our flight Plus it costed us double to find another ride last min I use viator and trip advisor for all my activities and events I will seek other companies now Positive side They reimbursed me for 1

title: Take a Rabbit card and enjoy!
review: This is the best way to move across Bangkok you should be aware of rush hour and rabbit card is easy to use and is accepted in tourist locations like MBK food court

title: Super Safe and Clean
review: So easy to ride around the city on this system It is impeccable and so easy to follow along on the map I took this to go to the weekend market I also took it while getting around the city it was such a good alternative to the traffic and great AC

title: Easy!!!
review: Very easy and practical way better than discuss for hours with Taxi drivers to put the meter and take you to town

title: Fantastic and easy
review: Despite being more crowded than the SkyTrain (really) this is just as good Aircon  and easy to follow maps on every train It would be nice if you could use the same ticket for both but it's simple to get a one time use coin Go to the machine or a worker at the counter   Note the train has to be inspected at the end of the line for us Chinatown before boarding Despite everywhere else being civil  people were really crowding in to be the first on the train I think these were probably more tourists than locals though

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: Trains regular and air conditioned Busy at rush hours but in general offers great links to explore Tip buy a rabbit card for multiple journeys during your stay

title: Fast safe and easy
review: Great to get around Bangkok it has air con and is so easy and practical to use  Never feels over crowded and it is really in expensive to travel on it

title: Great way to get to and from the airport
review: Firstly its cost  its cheaper than the flag fall on a Bangkok taxi and mostly times its far quicker to get into Bangkok or out to the airport at peak hour But it does have its drawbacks especially if you are carrying luggage Get a taxi when you get off

title: Train ride
review: Good to ride on weekend Easy and convenience to travel no hassle from the traffic jamLocal employee will guide to the location we visited and low cost of care Clean train station and the train itself

title: Super efficient
review: The ticketing stations maps and indicators are fairly easy to follow Takes a few minutes to become acquainted with the system and use it to commute

title: Fast travel in town
review: The skytrain is great for avoiding the bangkok jam However not all stations accept notes to buy the tickets Especially the very busy Siam station and Mo Chit (Chaktuchak) station It was very ridiculous to q so long to change coins to buy tickets when some other stations like Phaya Thai has ticketing machines that accepts notes to buy the tickets This should be implemented to ALL stations especially Siam and Mo Chit where it attracts plenty of visitors

title: Markets with a difference
review: Absolutely interesting experience and needs to be seen to believe So very good must be seen Well worth a visit

title: Great way to get to Chiang Mai!
review: Was unsure initially about a 13 hour train trip but it was a good experience all up for us and covered a nights accommodation  We took the #1 train overnighter left 6pm arrived 7am All ran to time too   Met some great travel buddies and ended up hanging out for the next week in Chiang Mai which was unreal  Tips  1 Book it yourself  A few days before our planned trip we went to the Bangok train station and the helpful tourist staff and counter staff helped us book and pay and get tickets They were great actually We could choose any seats etc on the spot as we were a few days ahead  2 Allow time for Bangkok traffic  The traffic to the station at that time was heavy so leave a bit early We made it with 10min to spare after ditching from a local bus that was at a standstill and getting a Tuk Tuk  3 Choose seats wisely yourself  Go the 2nd class sleeper with ACnot the fan option  Lower bunks are wider and screened more from the overhead lights which stay on  Front of carriage is near toilets and doors Noisier but warmer   Back of carriage where we were is near doors so noisier but warmer as doors open a lot  Centre of carriage has less noise but colder  4 Be realistic and be prepared  Lights are on all night so bring a sleep mask  AC gets cold so being something warm  Trains are loud so bring earplugs  Food is available to buy and we thought it was good and OK prices but bring your own food drinks and snacks if you like   No alcohol on board rule so don't bother Guards patrol occasionally  Beds are setup for you at 9pm (time to sleep) and packed up about 6ish (time to wake up)  There are toilets A squatter in our carriage but we found a second one which was a western one Worth looking for Bring toilet paper  5 Enjoy the experience  Talk to people You are all in the same boattrain We made great friends with our two Kiwi Upper Bunkers and hung out together in Chiang Mai which was great fun  It's an experience so treat it that way Have fun We enjoyed it a lot

title: Avoid traffic congestion, accessibility tips.
review: A wonderful cheap way to avoid the traffic in the main touristexpat areas of Bangkok as it travels above Sukhumvit road and some of the other most congested roads a hotel close to the BTS is a good choice Tickets can be bought at coin operated machines built into the walls at the stations (they look a little like posters but they are the machines) or at the booths at the stations too  where they will change any denomination of note for you For those with accessibility issues you will want to note that unless you get on at the first few stops you are likely to be standing for your trip and you will want a hand free to hold on  Most BTS stations have at least one escalator from the road but sometimes it can be tough to find it so a good bet is to find a major department store or mall along the route as most have a walkway to connect you to the BTS and escalators and lifts to get you up to it Be ready to join the crowd exiting shuffle toward the door before the train stops don't wait till it comes to a halt or you will be pushed back in by those getting in

title: Love the train
review: Airport to Makkasan 25 minutes not a single red light along the way Drops you off at the MRT (Tube) where you can hail a cab for the last part of the journey or jump on the tube Cheap as chips and always on time You cannot say that about an airport taxi who will regularly drop you off ‘near’ to your destination – as much as two hours later and with you now lost because when he tells you its near he means he has no idea

title: How easy is that?!
review: In the airport basement  40 baht whisks you as far as praya thai then you can transfer to other lines (separate charge)  perfect for the exhausted and quick  it is public transport so packed getting busier and busier as it gets into town  lovely intro to bangkok and easy (did I say that already)

title: Very Moving
review: We went to Hellfire Pass for the dawn service on Anzac Day Also we went up the day before for a quiet walk  It is a very moving place It is good to catch up on some history before you go there and the museum there is very good I really recommend it if you are in Thailand

title: Nothing interesting
review: Yes this is the easiest way of transport in Bangkok but BTS Skytrain is similar like city trains in another cities over the world Nothing interesting Nobody can speak english there

title: What a great experience
review: We have visited two night markets in HuaHin and we made it to the Cha Am Wednesday night market This is a very big market lots of seafood street food cheap knockoff clothes and some amazing desserts Difficult to find a place to sit down and eat Very friendly people Nice crowd of locals Must do if you are in the area

title: To airport
review: This is the easiest way to get to the airport from Bangkok I use this service often and will keep using it Besides being convenient it is time efficient

title: Excellent, cool transportation
review: Even though the BTS doesn't take you anywhere you wanna go in Bangkok it's still an excellent way to get from A to B The BTS can get really crowded and the station guards are obsessed with keeping you on the right side of the lines The BTS works perfectly and is a cheap way to take you to your goal without haggling over the price The air conditioning is a welcome blessing on a hot day

title: HELPFUL TRANSPORT
review: Like the BTS this was also a time saver We took the MRT on our way to and back from the Siam Niramit show It was much faster than by road during traffic peak hours

title: Works Well. Cheap & removes risk of Taxi ripping you off
review: The traintube from the airport to the centre works really well and it’s easy As soon as you step out of the declaration zone you can see on the overhead signs the standard exit taxi and train logos Follow the train ones round the corner and down some stairs and turn left down a small slipper Bus your ticket from the self service or the counter for about 35Thai dollars (depends how far you go into the centre) You get a black plastic coin which you scan on the barrier in (and drop into the coin hole on the barrier out) There’s glass wall all along the platform and people line up in front of the sliding doors Tubes come probably about every 1520 mins but I didn’t see anything big saying how long till the next on Reasonably new trains but very full Work out which stop you’ll need to get it at beforehand using the map attached for tube stops and google maps for where you want to end up  You’ll very often get ripped off by the taxi so it’s a no brainier for this

title: Good service
review: Much cheaper than a taxi if there's just one or two of you  very easy to use  straight into the centre of town  I recommend it for your return flight  takes away the uncertainty and beats all the traffic

title: Super convenient
review: The only stressfree way to travel in Bangkok is the BTS Did travel  to MBT and nana  the price is ok ok

title: Fabulous transport
review: A great way to get around in Bangkok and cheap this and the river were our favourite modes of transport for sightseeing

title: Eccellente visita al mercato galleggiante
review: Sara is a fantastic guide she immediately made us feel at ease During the trip he told us about some curiosities of Thailand he took us to a company where they produce natural products and he accompanied us to the floating market giving us valuable advice on how to best enjoy the experience if you come to Bangkok Sara is a valuable guide absolutely recommended

title: Great service
review: I used the sky train from my hotel on my free day I got a day ticket which was cheap and a great way to access the entire city The stations are clean instructions are easy to follow and carriages are clean and air conditioned It was easy to link with the river taxis and I will use it from the airport when I next go to Thailand A great way to avoid the traffic of Bangkok

title: Best to avoid Bangkok traffic
review: BTS is the best way to avoid traffic and save money with time  BTS is connected to every area of Bangkok and also connects you to some of the best shopping malls of Bangkok like Siam Centre MBK Central etc   Do travel from BTS its best way to travel in Bangkok

title: convenient way to get into Bangkok city center
review: If you fly into Suvannaphum airport and don't want to get a taxi into town airport link is a very good choice Airport link starts from the airport Blevel (signs are shown clearly) and stops at the terminal station Phya Thai  Along the way there are many stops BTW this is the city line  At Phya Thai station there is elevator for those with luggage or senior people with leg problems From Phya Thai station one can walk to BTS skytrain that can take you to many other locations

title: Interesting historical attraction
review: The area is very beautiful and it is interesting to learn about the history even if it's not exactly cheerful  There is a good museum and parts of the track are kept on good condition

title: Skytrain efficent and safe
review: We only used the skytrain once whist in Bangkok and we were fortunate to have our guide Angela Bangkok Tour Guru with us So she explained how to use the system

title: Convenient with A/C in a warm day
review: Convenient with AC in a warm day cheaper than taking a taxi and timesaving due to much traffic in the city

title: So convenient
review: This is so much better than a taxi   I will always plan my accommodation to be near the rail link so I can use it   No traffic delays  no taxi driver fights  no high prices     It’s clean  efficient and smooth

title: Best way to and from Airport
review: What it says clean fast and on time  Best to avoid the traffic on the road if it's near where you're going to

title: Great way to get around
review: The sky train is an easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok very simple to use The carriages are nice and cool which is a relief from the outside  Heat The only downside is it can get really crowded at certain times of the day

title: Surprisingly easy to navigate!
review: I was very surprised on how easy it was to ride the sky train and purchase tickets We rode the sky train twice with getting off on the closest stop to our hotel and then taking a cab from there My only complaint is I which it covered more of the city because it was the cheapest and easiest mode of transportation Average ticket price is about a dollar per person

title: Once understood, easy way to get around
review: Finding out the ticket options is the most important We went for point to point tickets cheap but needs coins obtainable from the ticket desk Once mastered this is the best and only way to get around Bangkok

title: Easiest way of transport as a tourist :)
review: Get around the city the cheapest and easiest way as a tourist Keep in mind having small bills and coins when purchasing tickets in the machines Keep google maps nearby to check which direction you are going and everything will be fine The train departures every 5 min so you don’t need to keep track of any schedule

title: Convenience and safety
review: I travel from Suvarnabhumi Airport Flights to Bangkok city center by train is traveling at speed And very convenient for my trip Each station that I can go shopping easily I spent the day visiting Bangkok By using the train to travel But I would suggest that those who travel by train Beware secure resources assets worth bringing Beware of pickpockets on the car thief But I think the choice of rail travel is safer than regular taxi

title: Easy
review: Was wary about getting this from the airport due to some of the reviews but glad we decided to take the plunge It is clean efficient very easy to use due to the announcements and flashing journey maps  Even though we had suitcases and travelled in rush hour the guards with the whistles and the general courteousness of the Thai people meant this was fine I have had a lot worse experiences in the UK with luggage Only thing to consider is that you need change in coins to buy tickets from the machine each time No problem at all  save yourself some holiday cash rather than use taxis

title: Best way to get places.
review: Economical clean and efficient Great views of the city Make sure to pick up a system map the first time into a station It shows the closest stations to the most popular tourist attractions

title: Best way for a light solo traveller to get into bkk
review: If you have a few people or too much luggage a taxi might be a better deal For a light solo person the train is the way to go Just a small learning curve and you can get around BKK easily and cheaply for the rest of your visit The rail link merges with the subway which merges with skytrain It sounds complicated but in reality isn't that bad Use it you won't regret it

title: Fast, Convenient & Cheap - 快、方便又便宜
review: It is fast & easy to drive you to the downtown & easy access to city subway system to go everywhere Its price is very cheap It has a lot trains & make it convenient for all purpose It is clean & passengers are polite  這個系統很快的就載妳到市區，馬上連結到市區地鐵系統，讓你到哪裡都很方便；價錢很便宜，班次很多所以做什麼事都很方便，很乾淨、乘客都很有禮貌。

title: Great way to get around
review: We were visiting just as Rama V died sadly so they busy streets of Bangkok were even busier Thank goodness for trains we used them daily Easy to navigate and staff at each station most helpfultheir main function us providing change for machines Easy to use machines require justca touch of the station you are traveling to and it displays the cost then you feed the coins requiredand ticket delivered Super efficient and easy to follow You get the opportunity to select the language you want the instructions for use in   Brilliant service

title: Loved it!
review: This is by far the best and cleanest train system I have ever taken Fast and efficient people at the stations are helpful when you are trying to figure out how to pay

title: Excellent and efficient
review: Use tokens for single use travel or purshase a stored valued card ticket office is open at most stations until late Card is 180baht with 100 baht of travel Top up each 100 baht When you finish with the card  redeem to get 50baht back plus your unused fare money very good time saver

title: Fantastic
review: Very useful or getting about and cheap went right up to the weekend market very rerasonably priced

title: Very quick and efficient for commuting within Bangkok
review: I took a car on rent during my stay at Bangkok and Koh Chang However for commenting within Bangkok BTS is much quicker Though having your own car for traveling inter city or at distant locations within Bangkok (such as safari) is pretty convenient Do select a hotel close to BTS station and use it for more congested locations while using your car for far distances

title: Fantastic. Worth the effort to learn your way around.
review: Fast Hassle free No fear of getting taken for a ride Simple to use once you have a hang of the vending machines for tickets Carry a lot of 10bhat coins With this mode of transport the city is yours to explore

title: What an experience
review: So much history and an amazing experience to ride the this train We did really enjoy watching the scenery go by

title: Tourist friendly
review: BTS is the best way for tourist to roam around the city and visit most of the places in Bangkok Frequency is very good

title: Similar to most train in big cities
review: It is similar to most MTR or MRT or any other trains in big cities in Asia easy to access cheap fee

title: Great System
review: This is an awesome addition to the Bangkok infrastructure It is cleaner and seemingly better run than many US trains Certainly the easiest way to get from the airport to down town with out booking a car in advance

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Very nice experience Although the train was full of passengers on a summer day the temperature inside was very cold

title: the best travel solution around bangkok
review: the bts skytrain is a boon for residents and visitors especially with the constant gridlock that bangkok faces on a daily basis the bts system is clean efficient and a joy to use fares are dirt cheap and nations could learn a great deal from them

title: Easy access
review: Easy transport and brings you in no time to any shoppingmall Dayticket for 180 bath or buy single tickets for around 40 bath Often very crowded Only daytime untill around 1930

title: Prompt and clean.
review: We planned our trips and did our best to avoid  rush hour Excellent  service  It is clearly  marked where one should wait to board this not only makes it easier for those getting off but safer and quicker to get on

title: Brilliant way to travel
review: We used the MRT to travel from Hua Lamphong (chinatown) to the Saturday market on the other side of the city The trip of 15 stops cost a very small amount of THB and took about 30 minutes so it's also a very efficient way to travel We also liked the experience  compared to the London underground it was a very calm trip with people giving space to others talking in hushed tones and sharing friendly smiles The system operates on tokens that you buy and place in the turnstiles when you reach your destination due to this you can't buy a return 'ticket' but it's really not a hassle

title: Super cool
review: Very convenience and super cool  especially during the hot summer in Bangkok

title: Easy, cheap but not going everywhere
review: Maps and tickets are easily available in English Trains are fast and clean but the lines don't go everywhere so cannot do all travel around Bangkok by skytrain  unfortunately as you'd do by trains in other major cities

title: Convenient mode
review: Was very convenient to avoid the notorious bangkok traffic and had many entry points in the city

title: Very convenient, easy to understand the map and easy access
review: I find travelling by skytrain was easy and convenient Navigating using the machine is also easy to understand and the signage is also easily understandable

title: Nervous about a train in unknown territory
review: The train was very easy to use and staff were willing to help  We don't have a train of this size in Houston and I was nervous about taking this train for the first time given the congestion and confusion   I was put at ease when the staff was happy to help me (I only speak English) and even drew out a map for me Passengers were kind too  When the doors open you better be ready to exit because there's only a 10 second entranceexit period which can seem over bearing when traveling on the BTS for your first time

title: Easy to Access
review: Airport link is the cheapest and fastest way of transportation for Suvarnabhumi Airport I wish there is something like that for Don Mueang as well

title: Great tour and excellent guide
review: We had a great time visiting the railway and floating market The van was right on time to pick us up at our hotel to take us to the train station to arrive to the railway market on the train and then watch it leave through all the little stores Our guide Sara gave us great information about the country and the different places we were passing by and was always checking on us She even bought fruits and local treats for the whole group to try Totally recommend it if you can ask for Sara

title: easy access and cheap
review: This is a great form of transport and quick and cheap In Bangkok the biggest problem is traffic so using the BTS you fly over it

title: Transportation
review: Get you to some major attractions or close to it so I guess good Best thing about the Sky train is no hassle in negotiation of prices like all the other forms of transport in Thailand

title: Excellent
review: This is one of the best ways of getting around Bangkok it is also cheap we use it every time we go it is better than using the taxis because the traffic is absolutely terrible it is always congested so its easier to go by the sky train

title: Easy as can be
review: A fast easy efficient way to get to your hotel if it's located in the eastern part of the city  Traffic is unpredictable in Bangkok so this is a good reliable way to get into and out of the city  My hotel was close to the BTS Nana station I grabbed the Airport Rail Link and took it to the last stop  It took about 30 minutes  I forget what it cost but it was super cheap like 45 baht (about $150 US)  Then I easily transferred to the BTS system and took it to the Nana station  Again another 30 minutes  Cost was maybe 30 baht ($1 US)  Cheap simple predictable

title: Floating Market
review: Our tour guy Alex and the driver were great but unfortunately our car had some issues so we had to wait hours before getting picked up from the floating market The tour company should have sent a different driver knowing the car was in the shop for repair Because of the time wasted on waiting for the car to be repaired it ruined our plans for the last evening in Bangkok

title: Fast, Cheap and Air Conditioned
review: Great way to get around Bangkok (and avoid all of the traffic) Was impressed that the Skytrain is airconditioned which is much appreciated after a long busy day exploring Bangkok in 35C temperatures It's also really cheap and really easy to navigate so would definitely recommend this mode of transport

title: Skytrain Bangkok
review: Modern easy to understand You can buy a card for 100 or 200 baht at all station locations and reload as needed better than buying single ticket unless that's all you might requireFor tourists business people in the Sukumvit hotel area it's perfect to access the  bts system for stops at world famous shopping at Siam Paragon Central World among many and on to Silom business and shopping restaurantentertainment district and the many tours available to enjoy on the Chao Phraya river You can reach all these areas while cruising above the congested traffic in air conditioning in less than 15 minutes avoid rush hour if possible if not there are plenty of trains all for around 40 baht Sukumvit to Silom hours are 6 am to 12 midnight everyday I love it

title: Nice mode of transportation within the shopping area and museums
review: This mode of transportation gives you ease in moving from one place to another in Bangkok Traffic in Bangkok is sometimes heavy during peak hours It takes us more than 1 hour by bus from airport to downtown area much more within the downtown area

title: favorite way to travel in Bangkok
review: We like MRT better than BTS as it is less crowded and way more organized The price is also not expensive compared to BTS But MRT is closed earlier than BTS though

title: Very convenient.
review: We found this a very convenient way to travel around the city Goes through most of the main shopping areas and safe too

title: Fast
review: The best way to travel from the airport to the city Quick and quiet Well marked Easy on and off Clean

title: Fun experience
review: The railway market is a fun experience really worth doing Time spent there is short but still you get to feel part of it all   The floating market is an add on  on this tour you eat at the food court but you can actually buy food drink from the floating boats Lots of gifts and souvenirs can be bought here   Overall it’s a little outside of Bangkok but if you have time in your itinerary worth doing You leave approx 8am and return 330pm   Tour guide is excellent and fun

title: Most convienent way to go into BKK
review: I always us the Airport Rail Link as there is no faster easier way to go to airport or the other way around For a distance you will need an hour with a car you can sit relaxed and enjoy the view over the city And the price is unbeatable  So enjoy easy fast transfer

title: way better than the taxi crooks
review: Simple and efficient and lets you avoid the impossibly annoying crooks in the cabs and tuktuks who are constantly trying to 'take you for a ride' or screw you into private longtail boat rides or the like or simply refusing to take you where you want

title: The Best Way to Commute
review: BTS Skytrain is a blessing in disguise for all the tourists as well as locals The Connection is great & really very helpful The taxis and tuk tuks really can charge you alot so rather use the Skytrain instead

title: Best way to travel
review: Used it to travel from Pathumwan to Chatuchak simple easy and fast Only 2 lines so you really can’t get lost Only issues we had was the crowds getting in and out of the Mo Chit station for Chatuchak market and that the fare machines there only took coins so there were long lines of tourists who had only notes to buy tickets from station control
